hebrew_text: בֵּיצָה שֶׁנּוֹלְדָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: תֵּאָכֵל, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: לֹא תֵּאָכֵל. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שְׂאוֹר בְּכַזַּיִת וְחָמֵץ בְּכַכּוֹתֶבֶת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: זֶה וְזֶה בְּכַזַּיִת.
human_translation: an egg that was laid on a Festival Beit Shammai say: It may be eaten and Beit Hillel say: It may not be eaten, Beit Shammai say: Leaven, of an olive-bulk. leavened bread of a large date-bulk. And Beit Hillel say: this and that, of an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: Egg that was laid on a festival, Beit Shammai says: it shall be eaten, and Beit Hillel says: it shall not be eaten. Beit Shammai says: leaven in a k'zayit and vinegar in a k'kotevet, and Beit Hillel says: both in a k'zayit.

hebrew_text: הַשּׁוֹחֵט חַיָּה וָעוֹף בְּיוֹם טוֹב, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: יַחְפּוֹר בַּדָּקָר וִיכַסֶּה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יִשְׁחוֹט אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיָה לוֹ עָפָר מוּכָן מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם. וּמוֹדִים שֶׁאִם שָׁחַט, שֶׁיַּחְפּוֹר בַּדָּקָר וִיכַסֶּה — שֶׁאֵפֶר כִּירָה מוּכָן הוּא.
human_translation: one who slaughters an undomesticated animal or a bird on a Festival Beit Shammai say: He digs with a shovel and covers And Beit Hillel say: He may not slaughter unless he had earth prepared while it was still day. But concede that if one slaughtered then he should dig with a shovel and cover that the ashes of a stove are prepared
llm_translation: The one slaughtering a wild animal or bird on a festival, Beit Shammai says: he should dig a hole and cover it, and Beit Hillel says: he should not slaughter unless he had prepared earth from the day before. And they agree that if he slaughtered, he should dig a hole and cover it - for it is considered like prepared ash.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּתַרְנְגוֹלֶת הָעוֹמֶדֶת לַאֲכִילָה, מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּבֵית הִלֵּל? אוּכְלָא דְּאִפְּרַת הוּא!
human_translation: With what are we dealing If we say to a chicken that is designated for eating, what is the reason that Beit Hillel It is food that has been separated [ de’ifrat ].
llm_translation: We are dealing with what? Perhaps with a standing rooster for eating, what is the reasoning of the House of Hillel? It is the calf of Ephraim!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, בְּתַרְנְגוֹלֶת הָעוֹמֶדֶת לְגַדֵּל בֵּיצִים.
human_translation: Rather, of a chicken designated for laying eggs.
llm_translation: Rather, in the case of a hen that stands to lay eggs.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי? מוּקְצֶה הִיא! וּמַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּלְמָא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לֵית לְהוּ מוּקְצֶה!
human_translation: what is the reason of Beit Shammai it is muktze . And what is the difficulty? Perhaps Beit Shammai do not hold muktze ?
llm_translation: What is the reason of Beit Shammai? It is a decree! And what is the question? Perhaps Beit Shammai does not have a decree!

hebrew_text: קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתִּין: אֲפִלּוּ מַאן דְּשָׁרֵי בְּמוּקְצֶה, בְּנוֹלָד אָסַר. מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי?
human_translation: It enters our mind even one who permits set aside prohibits with came into being [ nolad ] What, is the reason of Beit Shammai?
llm_translation: The text states: "It has been raised as a question: Even one who permits in a case of muktzeh, in the case of a newborn he prohibits. What is the reasoning of Beit Shammai?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: לְעוֹלָם בְּתַרְנְגוֹלֶת הָעוֹמֶדֶת לְגַדֵּל בֵּיצִים, וּדְאִית לֵיהּ מוּקְצֶה — אִית לֵיהּ נוֹלָד, וּדְלֵית לֵיהּ מוּקְצֶה — לֵית לֵיהּ נוֹלָד. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וּבֵית הִלֵּל כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: Actually, to a chicken designated for laying eggs. who holds muktze holds came into being, who does not hold muktze does not hold came into being Beit Shammai in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, and Beit Hillel in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Always with a hen that stands to incubate eggs, and if it has a muktzeh — it has a born one, and if it does not have a muktzeh — it does not have a born one. Beit Shammai is like Rabbi Shimon, and Beit Hillel is like Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן הָכִי? וְהָתְנַן: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מַגְבִּיהִין מֵעַל הַשֻּׁלְחָן עֲצָמוֹת וּקְלִיפִּין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מְסַלֵּק אֶת הַטַּבְלָא כּוּלָּהּ וּמְנַעֲרָהּ.
human_translation: And did Rav Naḥman say that But didn’t we learn Beit Shammai say: One remove bones and shells from the table, And Beit Hillel say: one remove the entire board [ tavla ] and shake it
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who said it thus? And it was taught: Beit Shammai say: One may lift up bones and shells from the table, and Beit Hillel say: One should remove the entire tablecloth and shake it out.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אָנוּ אֵין לָנוּ אֶלָּא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן!
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said: we nothing other Beit Shammai in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, Beit Hillel in accordance with Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: And said Rav Nachman: We have only Beit Shammai like Rabbi Yehuda, and Beit Hillel like Rabbi Shimon!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב נַחְמָן: גַּבֵּי שַׁבָּת, דִּסְתַם לַן תְּנָא כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דִּתְנַן: מְחַתְּכִין אֶת הַדִּלּוּעִין לִפְנֵי הַבְּהֵמָה, וְאֶת הַנְּבֵלָה לִפְנֵי הַכְּלָבִים —
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to you With regard to Shabbat, where tanna taught us an unattributed in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, as we learned One cut pumpkins before an animal and an animal carcass before dogs,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said to you: Regarding Shabbat, the Mishnah teaches us like Rabbi Shimon, as we learned: One may chop up the gourds in front of the animal, and the carcass in front of the dogs —

hebrew_text: מוֹקֵים לָהּ לְבֵית הִלֵּל כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. אֲבָל
human_translation: establishes that Beit Hillel in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, However,
llm_translation: Establish for her like the House of Hillel as Rabbi Shimon. But

hebrew_text: גַּבֵּי יוֹם טוֹב, דִּסְתַם לַן תַּנָּא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דִּתְנַן: אֵין מְבַקְּעִין עֵצִים מִן הַקּוֹרוֹת וְלֹא מִן הַקּוֹרָה שֶׁנִּשְׁבְּרָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב — מוֹקֵים לָהּ לְבֵית הִלֵּל כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: with regard to a Festival, tanna taught us an unattributed in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda as we learned One not chop wood from beams nor from a beam that broke on a Festival. establishes of Beit Hillel in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: Regarding a festival, a Mishnah was taught to us like Rabbi Yehudah, as we learned: One may not split wood from beams nor from a beam that broke on a festival day - Beit Hillel establishes it like Rabbi Yehudah.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי, מַאן סַתְמַיהּ לְמַתְנִיתִין — רַבִּי. מַאי שְׁנָא בְּשַׁבָּת דִּסְתַם לַן כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וּמַאי שְׁנָא בְּיוֹם טוֹב דִּסְתַם לַן כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה?
human_translation: Now since, Who is the one who the unattributed mishnayot ? Rabbi What is different to Shabbat, that stated the unattributed opinion for us in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, and what is different to a Festival, that stated the unattributed opinion for us in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda?
llm_translation: From where, who is the anonymous Mishnaic authority? — Rabbi. What is the difference on Shabbat that we rule like Rabbi Shimon, and what is the difference on Yom Tov that we rule like Rabbi Yehuda?

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: שַׁבָּת דַּחֲמִירָא, וְלָא אָתֵי לְזַלְזוֹלֵי בַּהּ — סָתֵם לַן כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּמֵיקֵל, יוֹם טוֹב דְּקִיל, וְאָתֵי לְזַלְזוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ — סָתֵם לַן כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּמַחְמִיר.
human_translation: They say: Shabbat, which is stringent and will not come to treat it with contempt, taught us the unattributed in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who rules leniently. a Festival, which is lenient, and will come to treat it with contempt, stated the unattributed opinion for us in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who rules stringently.
llm_translation: They said: Shabbat of strictness, and does not come to be lenient with it - we hold like Rabbi Shimon who is lenient, a festival that is light, and comes to be lenient with it - we hold like Rabbi Yehuda who is strict.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי אוֹקֵימְתָּא — בְּתַרְנְגוֹלֶת הָעוֹמֶדֶת לְגַדֵּל בֵּיצִים, וּמִשּׁוּם מוּקְצֶה. אִי הָכִי, אַדְּמִפַּלְגִי בְּבֵיצָה, לִפַּלְגוּ בְּתַרְנְגוֹלֶת?
human_translation: In what did you establish to a chicken designated for laying eggs, and due to muktze . If so, rather than disputing with regard to an egg let them dispute with regard to chicken
llm_translation: In what is it established? - In a standing hen for the purpose of laying eggs, and due to the prohibition of muktzeh. If so, if one splits an egg, should one split the hen?

hebrew_text: לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחָן דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי, דִּבְנוֹלָד שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: to convey the far-reaching nature of Beit Shammai. that in the case of came into being, permit
llm_translation: To inform you the strength of the House of Shammai, for they were born free.

hebrew_text: וְלִפְלוּגי בְּתַרְנְגוֹלֶת, לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחָן דְּבֵית הִלֵּל, דִּבְמוּקְצֶה אָסְרִי! וְכִי תֵּימָא כֹּחַ דְּהֶתֵּירָא עֲדִיף — וְנִפְלוֹג בְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ:
human_translation: And let them disagree with regard to a chicken, to convey the far-reaching nature of Beit Hillel, who prohibit even of muktze . And if you say the strength of leniency is preferable And let them disagree with regard to both of
llm_translation: In the case of Plugi in the henhouse, to inform you of the power of the House of Hillel, for in the extreme they prohibited! And if you say that the power of permitting is preferable - and they both disputed.

hebrew_text: תַּרְנְגוֹלֶת הָעוֹמֶדֶת לְגַדֵּל בֵּיצִים, הִיא וּבֵיצָתָהּ, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: תֵּאָכֵל, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: לֹא תֵּאָכֵל.
human_translation: a chicken designated for laying eggs, it and its eggs, Beit Shammai say: It may be eaten, and Beit Hillel say: It may not be eaten.
llm_translation: The hen that stands to hatch eggs, she and her egg, Beit Shammai say: it shall be eaten, and Beit Hillel say: it shall not be eaten.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אָמַר רַבָּה: לְעוֹלָם בְּתַרְנְגוֹלֶת הָעוֹמֶדֶת לַאֲכִילָה, וּבְיוֹם טוֹב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת עָסְקִינַן, וּמִשּׁוּם הֲכָנָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rabba said: Actually, We are dealing with a chicken designated for food and we are dealing with on a Festival that occurs after Shabbat, And due to preparation
llm_translation: Rather, Rabah said: Always with a rooster standing for eating, and on a festival that falls after Shabbat we are dealing, and because of preparation.

hebrew_text: וְקָסָבַר רַבָּה, כֹּל בֵּיצָה דְּמִתְיַלְדָא הָאִידָּנָא — מֵאֶתְמוֹל גָּמְרָה לָהּ.
human_translation: And Rabba holds any egg laid now was fully developed yesterday,
llm_translation: And Rabah holds, any egg that was laid yesterday - it has completed its formation.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּה לְטַעְמֵיהּ. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַשִּׁשִּׁי וְהֵכִינוּ אֶת אֲשֶׁר יָבִיאוּ״ — חוֹל מֵכִין לְשַׁבָּת, וְחוֹל מֵכִין לְיוֹם טוֹב, וְאֵין יוֹם טוֹב מֵכִין לְשַׁבָּת, וְאֵין שַׁבָּת מְכִינָה לְיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: And Rabba, to his reasoning. As Rabba said: What is which is written “And it shall come to pass on the sixth day, that they shall prepare that which they bring in” weekday, one prepare for Shabbat, and weekday one prepare for a Festival. a Festival one may not prepare for Shabbat, and on Shabbat one may not prepare for a Festival.
llm_translation: And Rabbah according to his reasoning. For Rabbah said, what is the meaning of what is written: "And it shall be on the sixth day, that they shall prepare that which they bring in" — one prepares on a weekday for Shabbat, and one prepares on a weekday for a festival, but a festival does not prepare for Shabbat, and Shabbat does not prepare for a festival.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, יוֹם טוֹב בְּעָלְמָא תִּשְׁתְּרֵי! גְּזֵרָה מִשּׁוּם יוֹם טוֹב אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת. שַׁבָּת דְּעָלְמָא תִּשְׁתְּרֵי! גְּזֵרָה מִשּׁוּם שַׁבָּת אַחַר יוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: Abaye said to However, if so, let a regular Festival, be permitted. decree, due to a Festival after Shabbat. a regular Shabbat, let be permitted a decree due to a Shabbat after a Festival.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Rather, from now on, a festival in the world will be abolished! A decree due to a festival following the Sabbath. The Sabbath in the world will be abolished! A decree due to a Sabbath following a festival.

hebrew_text: וּמִי גָּזְרִינַן? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: הַשּׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַתַּרְנְגוֹלֶת וּמָצָא בָּהּ בֵּיצִים גְּמוּרוֹת — מוּתָּרוֹת לְאָכְלָן בְּיוֹם טוֹב. וְאִם אִיתָא — לִיגְזַר מִשּׁוּם הָנָךְ דְּמִתְיַלְּדָן בְּיוֹמֵיהֶן!
human_translation: And do we issue a decree But isn’t it taught one who slaughters a chicken and finds inside it fully developed eggs it is permitted to eat them on the Festival. And if it is so, let him issue a decree due to those that are laid on that day.
llm_translation: And who decreed this? But it was taught: One who slaughters a hen and finds in it fully formed eggs - they are permitted to be eaten on a festival. And if it comes - it is decreed due to the concern that they will be born on their own days!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בֵּיצִים גְּמוּרוֹת בִּמְעֵי אִמָּן — מִילְּתָא דְלָא שְׁכִיחָא הִיא, וּמִילְּתָא דְלָא שְׁכִיחָא לָא גְּזַרוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: said to him: fully developed eggs inside their mother is an uncommon matter, and an uncommon matter the Sages did not issue a decree
llm_translation: He said to him: "Fully formed eggs in the womb of their mother - it is a matter that is not common, and a matter that is not common, the Rabbis did not decree upon it."

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: גְּזֵרָה מִשּׁוּם פֵּרוֹת הַנּוֹשְׁרִין.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: a decree due to fruits that fall
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: A decree due to forbidden fruits.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: פֵּרוֹת הַנּוֹשְׁרִין טַעְמָא מַאי —
human_translation: Abaye said to fruits that fall, what is the reason
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Fruits that are peeled, what is the taste —

hebrew_text: גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יַעֲלֶה וְיִתְלוֹשׁ. הִיא גּוּפַהּ גְּזֵרָה, וַאֲנַן נֵיקוּם וְנִגְזוֹר גְּזֵרָה לִגְזֵרָה? כּוּלָּהּ חֲדָא גְּזֵרָה הִיא.
human_translation: a decree lest climb and pick is itself a decree. And will we arise and issue a decree to decree? all are one decree.
llm_translation: Decree lest he ascend and be lost. It itself decree, and we should establish and decree a decree for a decree? It is one decree in its entirety.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר: גְּזֵרָה מִשּׁוּם מַשְׁקִין שֶׁזָּבוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said a decree due to liquids that seeped
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: A decree due to liquids that flowed.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מַשְׁקִין שֶׁזָּבוּ טַעְמָא מַאי — גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יִסְחוֹט, הִיא גּוּפַהּ גְּזֵרָה, וַאֲנַן נֵיקוּם וְנִגְזוֹר גְּזֵרָה לִגְזֵרָה? כּוּלַּהּ חֲדָא גְּזֵרָה הִיא.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: liquid that seeped what is the reason a decree lest one squeeze is itself decree. And will we arise and issue a decree to decree? All are one decree.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: "Liquids that have absorbed flavor, what is the ruling?" - It is a decree lest one wring it out, it is a decree in itself, and shall we establish and decree a decree upon a decree? It is all one decree.

hebrew_text: כּוּלְּהוּ כְּרַב נַחְמָן לָא אָמְרִי — כִּי קוּשְׁיַין. כְּרַבָּה נָמֵי לָא אָמְרִי — הֲכָנָה לֵית לְהוּ.
human_translation: All of them, did not state in accordance with Rav Naḥman, as our objection also did not state in accordance with Rabba, do not preparation
llm_translation: All of them like Rav Nachman did not say - for they are difficult. Like Rabbah said - there is no preparation for them.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַב יוֹסֵף מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק? אָמַר לָךְ: בֵּיצָה אוּכְלָא, וּפֵירוֹת אוּכְלָא. לְאַפּוֹקֵי מַשְׁקִין — דְּלָאו אוּכְלָא.
human_translation: However, Rav Yosef what is the reason did not state in accordance with Rabbi Yitzḥak? said to you: An egg is food, and fruit is food, to exclude juice, which is not food
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef, what is the reason he did not say like Rabbi Yitzchak? He said to you: An egg is food, and fruits are food. To exclude liquids - for they are not food.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַב יוֹסֵף? אָמַר לָךְ: בֵּיצָה בְּלוּעָה, וּמַשְׁקִין בְּלוּעִין. לְאַפּוֹקֵי פֵּירוֹת — דְּמִגַּלּוּ וְקָיְימוּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak, what is the reason did not state in accordance with Rav Yosef? said to you An egg is enclosed juice is enclosed to exclude fruits which are standing exposed
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak: What is the reason he did not say like Rav Yosef? He said to you: An egg that is swallowed, and liquids that are swallowed. To bring out fruits - for they are revealed and established.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סָבַר גְּזֵרָה מִשּׁוּם מַשְׁקִין שֶׁזָּבוּ. דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן רָמֵי דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וּמְשַׁנֵּי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan also holds a decree due to liquid that seeped as Rabbi Yoḥanan raised a contradiction of Rabbi Yehuda of Rabbi Yehuda, and he resolved
llm_translation: And even Rabbi Yochanan holds that it is a decree because of liquids that have flowed. For Rabbi Yochanan raises an objection to Rabbi Yehuda from Rabbi Yehuda, and he repeats it.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: אֵין סוֹחֲטִין אֶת הַפֵּירוֹת לְהוֹצִיא מֵהֶן מַשְׁקִין, וְאִם יָצְאוּ מֵעַצְמָן — אֲסוּרִין. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם לָאוֹכָלִין — הַיּוֹצֵא מֵהֶן מוּתָּר, וְאִם לְמַשְׁקִין — הַיּוֹצֵא מֵהֶן אָסוּר.
human_translation: We learned One may not squeeze fruits to extract liquids from them and if seeped out on their own, it is prohibited Rabbi Yehuda says: If for eating, that seeps from them is permitted. And if for liquids, that seeps from them is prohibited.
llm_translation: We learned: One may not squeeze fruits to extract their juices, and if the juices came out by themselves - they are forbidden. Rabbi Yehuda says: If they are intended for eating - the juices that come out are permitted, but if they are intended for drinking - the juices that come out are forbidden.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא כָּל אוֹכָלִין לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — אוּכְלָא דְאִפְּרַת הוּא.
human_translation: apparently, all food is food that was separated, according to Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: The food of Rabbi Yehuda is the food of Ephraim.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ, וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַתְנֶה אָדָם עַל כַּלְכָּלָה שֶׁל פֵּירוֹת בְּיוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן,
human_translation: And raises a contradiction And Rabbi Yehuda said further, A person may stipulate a condition with regard to a basket of fruit on the first day of a Festival,
llm_translation: And they asked him, and furthermore Rabbi Yehuda said: A person may make a condition regarding the consumption of fruits on the first day of a festival,

hebrew_text: וְאוֹכְלָהּ בַּשֵּׁנִי. וְכֵן בֵּיצָה שֶׁנּוֹלְדָה בָּרִאשׁוֹן, תֵּאָכֵל בַּשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: And he eat on second And similarly, an egg laid on first be eaten on second
llm_translation: And she shall eat it on the second day. And so too an egg that was laid on the first day, shall be eaten on the second day.

hebrew_text: בַּשֵּׁנִי אִין, בָּרִאשׁוֹן לָא! וּמְשַׁנֵּי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוּחְלֶפֶת הַשִּׁיטָה.
human_translation: on the second yes, on the first no, And Rabbi Yoḥanan resolves The opinions is reversed
llm_translation: In the second year, yes; in the first year, no! And the sages taught: "Mukhlephet HaShita."

hebrew_text: וּמִדְּקָא מַרְמֵי לְהוּ אַהֲדָדֵי, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ חַד טַעְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: Since raised a contradiction between conclude from this that it is the same reason
llm_translation: And from the fact that they would deceive each other, learn from it that it is one reason.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְדִבְרֵיהֶם דְּרַבָּנַן קָאָמַר לְהוּ:
human_translation: Ravina said Actually, do not reverse Rabbi Yehuda spoke to them in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Ravina said: Always do not overturn, and Rabbi Yehuda according to their words of the Sages is saying to them:

hebrew_text: לְדִידִי אֲפִילּוּ בָּרִאשׁוֹן נָמֵי שַׁרְיָא, דְּאוּכְלָא דְאִפְּרַת הוּא. אֶלָּא לְדִידְכוּ — אוֹדוֹ לִי מִיהַת דְּבַשֵּׁנִי שַׁרְיָא, דִּשְׁתֵּי קְדוּשּׁוֹת הֵן. וְאָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: לָא, קְדוּשָּׁה אַחַת הִיא.
human_translation: In my even on the first also permitted, as it is food that was separated. However, according to your at least agree with me that it is permitted on the second as they are two sanctities. And the Rabbis said to him: No, are one sanctity,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: According to my opinion, even if it is a firstling, it is permitted, for it is the calf of Ephraim. But according to your opinion - "Give me some of that honeycomb, for it is the second portion," for they are two holy things. And the Sages said to him: No, it is one holy thing.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב עוּלָּא אָמַר: הָכָא בְּתַרְנְגוֹלֶת הָעוֹמֶדֶת לְגַדֵּל בֵּיצִים, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאִית לֵיהּ מוּקְצֶה.
human_translation: Ravina, son of Rav Ulla, said: Here, to a chicken designated for laying eggs, and Rabbi Yehuda to his reasoning, as he holds muktze .
llm_translation: Ravinah son of Rav Ulla said: Here in the case of a hen standing to lay eggs, and Rabbi Yehuda according to his reasoning, because it has a designated purpose.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אֶחָד בֵּיצָה שֶׁנּוֹלְדָה בְּשַׁבָּת וְאֶחָד בֵּיצָה שֶׁנּוֹלְדָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב — אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין אוֹתָהּ, לֹא לְכַסּוֹת בָּהּ אֶת הַכְּלִי, וְלֹא לִסְמוֹךְ בָּהּ כַּרְעֵי הַמִּטָּה.
human_translation: raises an objection Both an egg that was laid on Shabbat and an egg that was laid on a Festival one may not move Not to cover a vessel with it, nor to support the legs of a bed with it.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Meitivi: echad beitza shenoldah beshabbat ve'echad beitza shenoldah beyom tov - ein metaltelin otah, lo lechasot bah et hakeli, velo lismoch bah kar'ei hamitta. English translation: It was raised as an objection: One egg that was laid on Shabbat and one egg that was laid on a festival - one may not move it, neither to cover a vessel with it, nor to support the legs of a bed with it.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל כּוֹפֶה עָלֶיהָ אֶת הַכְּלִי בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁלֹּא תִּשָּׁבֵר. וּסְפֵיקָא אֲסוּרָה, וְאִם נִתְעָרְבָה בְּאֶלֶף — כּוּלָּן אֲסוּרוֹת.
human_translation: However, cover with a vessel, so that it does not break And uncertainty is prohibited And, if it became intermingled with a thousand all prohibited.
llm_translation: But he may cover it with a vessel so that it will not break. And a doubt is forbidden, and if it became mixed with a thousand - all of them are forbidden.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבָּה, דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם הֲכָנָה, הָוֵי סְפֵיקָא דְאוֹרָיְיתָא — וְכׇל סְפֵיקָא דְאוֹרָיְיתָא לְחוּמְרָא.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabba, who said due to preparation, an uncertainty by Torah law; and any an uncertainty by Torah law, is stringent.
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbah, who said in the name of preparation, it is a doubt of biblical law - and every doubt of biblical law is to be treated stringently.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַב יוֹסֵף וּלְרַבִּי יִצְחָק, דְּאָמְרִי מִשּׁוּם גְּזֵרָה, סְפֵיקָא דְרַבָּנַן הִיא — וְכׇל סְפֵיקָא דְרַבָּנַן לְקוּלָּא!
human_translation: However, according to Rav Yosef and Rabbi Yitzḥak, who say due to a decree, an uncertainty by rabbinic law, and any an uncertainty by rabbinic law, is lenient.
llm_translation: To Rav Yosef and to Rabbi Yitzchak, for they say in the name of a decree, it is a doubt of the Rabbis - and every doubt of the Rabbis is lenient!

hebrew_text: (אֲמַר לֵיהּ:) סֵיפָא אֲתָאן לִסְפֵק טְרֵפָה.
human_translation: the latter clause we have arrived at uncertainty an animal with a condition that will cause it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ],
llm_translation: He said to him: "The latter part comes to teach about a case of doubt regarding a treifah."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: נִתְעָרְבָה בְּאֶלֶף — כּוּלָּן אֲסוּרוֹת. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא סָפֵק יוֹם טוֹב סָפֵק חוֹל, הָוֵי דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין — אֲפִילּוּ בְּאֶלֶף לֹא בָּטֵיל.
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause became intermingled with a thousand all prohibited. Granted, if you say uncertainty a Festival uncertainty a weekday, it is an object whose prohibition is temporary, Any object whose prohibition is temporary is not nullified, even by a thousand
llm_translation: If so, say the latter part: If it is mixed with a thousand — all of them are forbidden. If you say, "In the case of doubt whether it is a festival day or a weekday, it is a matter that has those who permit it," and any matter that has those who permit it — even if it is mixed with a thousand, it is not nullified.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ סְפֵק טְרֵפָה, דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מַתִּירִין הִיא, וְתִבְטַל בְּרוּבָּא!
human_translation: However, if you say an uncertain tereifa , it is an object whose prohibition is not temporary, and it should be nullified by majority.
llm_translation: Rather, if you say it is a doubt of a treifah, a matter that does not have any leniencies, and it will be nullified in the majority!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא בֵּיצָה חֲשׁוּבָה וְלֹא בָּטְלָה, הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: כׇּל שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ לִימָּנוֹת שָׁנִינוּ.
human_translation: And if you say an egg is significant and is not nullified, that well according to the one who said we learned: Any whose manner is to be counted,
llm_translation: And if you will say: a fertilized egg is considered significant and has not been annulled, it is left for the one who said: "All that is accustomed to be counted, we repeat."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: אֶת שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ לִימָּנוֹת שָׁנִינוּ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר!
human_translation: However, according to the one who said we learned: That whose manner is to be counted, what can be said?
llm_translation: Instead, according to the one who said: "Those who are accustomed to turn to the right," what can be said?

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ חֲבִילֵי תִּלְתָּן שֶׁל כִּלְאֵי הַכֶּרֶם — יִדְלְקוּ. נִתְעָרְבוּ בַּאֲחֵרוֹת, וַאֲחֵרוֹת בַּאֲחֵרוֹת — כּוּלָּן יִדָּלְקוּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יַעֲלוּ בְּאַחַת וּמָאתַיִם.
human_translation: As we learned one who had bundles of clover, diverse kinds in a vineyard, must be burned. were intermingled with others, and others with others, they must all be burned. the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: They may be nullified by one two hundred
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: One who had three bundles of grapevines' shoots - they should be burned. If they got mixed with others, and others with others - all should be burned, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: They should be brought up all at once, two hundred.

hebrew_text: שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אֶת שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ לִמָּנוֹת — מְקַדֵּשׁ; וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ מְקַדֵּשׁ אֶלָּא שִׁשָּׁה דְּבָרִים בִּלְבַד; רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: שִׁבְעָה. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: אֱגוֹזֵי פֶּרֶךְ, וְרִמּוֹנֵי בָּאדָן, וְחָבִיּוֹת סְתוּמוֹת, וְחִלְפֵי תְרָדִין, וְקִלְחֵי כְרוּב, וְדַלַּעַת יְוָנִית. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מוֹסִיף אַף כִּכָּרוֹת שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: as Rabbi Meir would say: That whose manner is to be counted, renders forbidden, And the Rabbis say: Only six items render forbidden. Rabbi Akiva says: seven. And they are: nuts Perekh, and pomegranates Badan, and sealed barrels and branches of spinach, and cabbage stalks, and Greek pumpkin. Rabbi Akiva adds: Even loaves of a homeowner.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Rabbi Meir used to say: One who counts his way is sanctified; and the Sages say: He only sanctifies if he counts six things alone; Rabbi Akiva says: Seven. And these are: nut shells, pomegranate peels, closed barrels, sardine scales, carob peels, and Greek squash. Rabbi Akiva adds also the bread crusts of the homeowner.

hebrew_text: הָרָאוּי לְעׇרְלָה — עׇרְלָה. הָרָאוּי לְכִלְאֵי הַכֶּרֶם — כִּלְאֵי הַכֶּרֶם. וְאִתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֶת שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ לִמָּנוֹת שָׁנִינוּ. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אָמַר: כׇּל שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ לִמָּנוֹת שָׁנִינוּ.
human_translation: That which is fit to orla , orla . That which is fit to diverse kinds in a vineyard diverse kinds in a vineyard And it was stated about Rabbi Yoḥanan said we learned: that whose manner is to be counted And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said we learned: Any whose manner is to be counted,
llm_translation: Fit for uncircumcision - uncircumcision. Fit for the prohibitions of the vineyard - the prohibitions of the vineyard. And it was stated: Rabbi Yochanan said: One who is accustomed to count, let him count years. And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Anyone who is accustomed to count, let him count years.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן — מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: well according to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, but according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, what can be said?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "He left it for Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, rather for Rabbi Yochanan - what can be said?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הַאי תַּנָּא — תַּנָּא דְּלִיטְרָא קְצִיעוֹת הוּא, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁבְּמִנְיָן, אֲפִילּוּ בִּדְרַבָּנַן לֹא בָּטֵיל, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: this tanna , is tanna of a litra of dried figs, who, said: Any item that is counted, even by rabbinic law, cannot be nullified, and all the more so by Torah law,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: This Mishnah is a Mishnah of Litra, for he said: Any matter that is part of a count, even according to the Rabbis, is not nullified, and certainly so in matters of Torah law.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: לִיטְרָא קְצִיעוֹת שֶׁדְּרָסָהּ עַל פִּי עִגּוּל, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזֶה עִגּוּל דְּרָסָהּ, עַל פִּי חָבִית, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזוֹ חָבִית דְּרָסָהּ, עַל פִּי כַּוֶּרֶת, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזוֹ כַּוֶּרֶת דְּרָסָהּ. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר
human_translation: As we learned a litra dried figs, he pressed onto the mouth circular and does not know into which circular he pressed it; on the mouth of a barrel, but does not know in which barrel he pressed it, on the mouth of a receptacle, but does not know in which receptacle he pressed it, Rabbi Meir says Rabbi Eliezer
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: If one cuts beets that he crushed on the mouth of a barrel, and he does not know in which barrel he crushed them, or on the mouth of a vat, and he does not know in which vat he crushed them, or on the mouth of a winepress, and he does not know in which winepress he crushed them. Rabbi Meir says, Rabbi Eliezer...

hebrew_text: אוֹמֵר: רוֹאִין אֶת הָעֶלְיוֹנוֹת כָּאֵלּוּ הֵן פְּרוּדוֹת, וְהַתַּחְתּוֹנוֹת מַעֲלוֹת אֶת הָעֶלְיוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: says: One considers the upper as though they are separate And the lower ones, nullify the upper ones,
llm_translation: He says: "We see the upper ones as if they are separated, and the lower ones elevate the upper ones."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אִם יֵשׁ שָׁם מֵאָה פּוּמִּין — יַעֲלוּ, וְאִם לָאו — הַפּוּמִּין אֲסוּרִין, וְהַשּׁוּלַיִם מוּתָּרִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: If there are one hundred mouths there, is nullified And if not, the mouths are prohibited, And the insides are permitted,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: If there are there one hundred cubits - they ascend, and if not - the cubits are forbidden, and the Shulayim are permitted.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אִם יֵשׁ שָׁם מֵאָה פּוּמִּין — יַעֲלוּ, וְאִם לָאו — הַפּוּמִּין אֲסוּרִין, וְהַשּׁוּלַיִם מוּתָּרִין. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ יֵשׁ שָׁם שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת פּוּמִּין — לֹא יַעֲלוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says Rabbi Eliezer says: If there are one hundred mouths there, it is nullified And if not, the mouths are prohibited and the bottom are permitted. Rabbi Yehoshua says: Even there are three hundred mouths there, they are not nullified,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says, Rabbi Eliezer says: If there are there one hundred cubits - they ascend, and if not - the cubits are forbidden, and the shulayim are permitted. Rabbi Yehoshua says: Even if there are there three hundred cubits - they shall not ascend.

hebrew_text: דְּרָסָהּ בְּעִגּוּל וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזֶה עִגּוּל דְּרָסָהּ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל יַעֲלוּ. דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל?! הַיְינוּ פְּלוּגְתַּיְיהוּ!
human_translation: one pressed into a circular but he does not know into which circular he pressed it, everyone agrees are nullified. Everyone agrees? This is their dispute,
llm_translation: She trampled it in a circle and does not know in which circle she trampled it - the words of everyone will ascend. The words of everyone?! That is their dispute!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: דְּרָסָהּ בְּעִגּוּל, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזֶה מְקוֹם עִגּוּל דְּרָסָהּ, אִי לִצְפוֹנָהּ אִי לִדְרוֹמָהּ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל יַעֲלוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: This is what said, One pressed it onto a circular does not know onto which place, circular he pressed it, whether on its north or on its south everyone agrees it is nullified.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, thus he said: If one trampled it in a circle, and does not know in which place of the circle he trampled it, whether to its north or to its south - the words of all will be valid.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם סָפֵק יוֹם טוֹב סָפֵק חוֹל הָוֵי דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין — אֲפִילּוּ בִּדְרַבָּנַן לֹא בָּטֵיל.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Actually, uncertainty a Festival or a weekday. it is an object whose prohibition is temporary. And any object whose prohibition is temporary, even rabbinic cannot be nullified.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Always a doubt of a festival or a doubt of a weekday is a matter that has leniencies, and any matter that has leniencies—even according to the Rabbis—is not nullified.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: בֵּיצָה — תֵּאָכֵל הִיא וְאִמָּהּ. בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּתַרְנְגוֹלֶת הָעוֹמֶדֶת לַאֲכִילָה — פְּשִׁיטָה דְּהִיא וְאִמָּהּ שַׁרְיָא! אֶלָּא בְּתַרְנְגוֹלֶת הָעוֹמֶדֶת לְגַדֵּל בֵּיצִים — הִיא וְאִמָּהּ אֲסוּרָה! אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: תֵּאָכֵל אַגַּב אִמָּהּ.
human_translation: is taught Aḥerim say in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: an egg it and its mother may be eaten. With what are we dealing? If we say with a chicken designated for food, obvious it and its mother are permitted. Rather, with a chicken designated for laying eggs, it and its mother are prohibited. Rabbi Zeira said be eaten on account of its mother;
llm_translation: It was taught: Others say in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: An egg - it and its mother shall be eaten. With what are we dealing? If you say with a hen standing for consumption - it is obvious that it and its mother are permitted! Rather, with a hen standing to produce eggs - it and its mother are forbidden! Rabbi Zeira said: It shall be eaten because of its mother.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּגוֹן שֶׁלְּקָחָהּ סְתָם, נִשְׁחֲטָה — הוּבְרְרָה דְּלַאֲכִילָה עוֹמֶדֶת. לֹא נִשְׁחֲטָה — הוּבְרְרָה דִּלְגַדֵּל בֵּיצִים עוֹמֶדֶת.
human_translation: What are the circumstances? Abaye said: where bought without specifying was slaughtered it has been clarified that intended for food, not slaughtered, it has been clarified that it intended for laying eggs,
llm_translation: "How are the laws of its value? Abaye said: For example, if it was taken casually and slaughtered, it is clarified that it stands for non-consumption. If it was not slaughtered, it is clarified that it stands for growing eggs."

hebrew_text: רַב מָרִי אָמַר: גּוּזְמָא קָתָנֵי. דְּתַנְיָא, אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: בֵּיצָה תֵּאָכֵל הִיא וְאִמָּהּ, וְאֶפְרוֹחַ וּקְלִיפָּתוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Mari said is teaching an exaggeration [ guzma ], as it is taught Aḥerim say in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: An egg be eaten, it and its mother, and a chick and its shell.
llm_translation: Rav Mari said: Guzma is a small fish. As it was taught: Others say in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: The egg should be eaten with its mother, and the placenta and shell.

hebrew_text: מַאי קְלִיפָּתוֹ? אִילֵּימָא קְלִיפָּה מַמָּשׁ, קְלִיפָּה בַּת אֲכִילָה הִיא? אֶלָּא אֶפְרוֹחַ בִּקְלִיפָּתוֹ. עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב, אֶלָּא הֵיכָא דְּיָצָא לַאֲוִיר הָעוֹלָם. אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלֹא יָצָא לַאֲוִיר הָעוֹלָם — לָא פְּלִיגִי.
human_translation: What is Its shell? If we say an actual shell, a shell edible? Rather, a chick in its shell. the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov only when it has entered the world. However, when it has not entered the world, they do not disagree.
llm_translation: What is its peel? If you say it is the actual peel, is the peel of a fruit edible? Rather, it is the husk of its peel. Up to this point, the Rabbis do not argue with regard to it in the manner of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. Rather, where it has gone out into the atmosphere of the world. But where it has not gone out into the atmosphere of the world - they do not argue.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא ״אֶפְרוֹחַ וּקְלִיפָּתוֹ״ — גּוּזְמָא, הָכָא נָמֵי ״תֵּאָכֵל הִיא וְאִמָּהּ״ — גּוּזְמָא.
human_translation: Rather, A chick and its shell, an exaggeration. Here, too, It and its mother may be eaten, an exaggeration.
llm_translation: Rather, "its offspring and its shell" - this is a decree, here it is stated "it shall be eaten, it and its mother" - this is a decree.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר, שַׁבָּת וְיוֹם טוֹב, רַב אָמַר: נוֹלְדָה בָּזֶה — אֲסוּרָה בָּזֶה, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: נוֹלְדָה בָּזֶה — מוּתֶּרֶת בָּזֶה. נֵימָא קָסָבַר רַב: קְדוּשָּׁה אַחַת הִיא?
human_translation: It was stated Shabbat and a Festival Rav said: laid on this one is prohibited on that one, and Rabbi Yoḥanan said: laid on this one is permitted on that one. Let us say Rav holds it is one sanctity,
llm_translation: It was stated: regarding Shabbat and Yom Tov, Rav said: if it was born on this day — it is prohibited on this day, and Rabbi Yochanan said: if it was born on this day — it is permitted on this day. It was stated: perhaps Rav holds: is it one sanctity?

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּאַרְבָּעָה זְקֵנִים וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאָמַר: שְׁתֵּי קְדוּשּׁוֹת הֵן.
human_translation: But didn’t Rav say: The halakha is in accordance with four elders, in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, who said: they are two sanctities
llm_translation: And he said, Rav: The halacha is like four elders. And in the school of Rabbi Eliezer, for he said: They are two sanctities.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָכָא בַּהֲכָנָה דְרַבָּהּ קָמִיפַּלְגִי: רַב אִית לֵיהּ הֲכָנָה דְרַבָּה, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לֵית לֵיהּ הֲכָנָה דְרַבָּה.
human_translation: Rather, here they disagree with regard to Rabba’s preparation, Rav holds Rabba’s preparation Rabbi Yoḥanan does not hold Rabba’s preparation
llm_translation: Rather, here in the case of the preparation of Rabah, they disagree: Rav holds that Rabah has the preparation, and Rabbi Yochanan holds that Rabah does not have the preparation.

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי: נוֹלְדָה בְּשַׁבָּת — תֵּאָכֵל בְּיוֹם טוֹב, בְּיוֹם טוֹב — תֵּאָכֵל בְּשַׁבָּת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: עֲדַיִין הִיא מַחֲלוֹקֶת, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: תֵּאָכֵל, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: לֹא תֵּאָכֵל.
human_translation: like tanna’im : laid on Shabbat may be eaten on a Festival; on a Festival, it may be eaten on Shabbat. Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: it is still a dispute, as Beit Shammai say it may be eaten, and Beit Hillel say it may not be eaten,
llm_translation: Tannaim: If she was born on Shabbat — she may be eaten on Yom Tov, on Yom Tov — she may be eaten on Shabbat. Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: It is still a dispute, for Beit Shammai says: she may be eaten, and Beit Hillel says: she may not be eaten.

hebrew_text: אוּשְׁפִּיזְכָּנֵיהּ דְּרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה הֲווֹ לֵיהּ הָנָךְ בֵּיצִים מִיּוֹם טוֹב לְשַׁבָּת. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי לְאַטְווֹיִנְהוּ הָאִידָּנָא וְנֵיכְלִינְהוּ לִמְחַר?
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava’s host [ ushpizikhnei ] had these eggs from Festival for Shabbat. He came before said to him: What to roasting now, and let us eat them tomorrow,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "His household members, the children of Rav Adda bar Ahava, would prepare for him eggs from Friday to Shabbat. He came before him, and said to him: 'Why do you prepare them now, and eat them tomorrow?'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ, רַב וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לָא קָא שָׁרֵי אֶלָּא לְגוֹמְעָהּ לְמָחָר, אֲבָל בְּיוֹמֵיהּ לָא.
human_translation: said to him: What is your opinion Rav and Rabbi Yoḥanan, the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan, even Rabbi Yoḥanan permitted to swallow it only on the next day, but on the same day not
llm_translation: He said to him: What is your opinion, Rav and Rabbi Yochanan? The halacha follows Rabbi Yochanan. Even Rabbi Yochanan only permits it for the following day, but not on the same day.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: אַחַת בֵּיצָה שֶׁנּוֹלְדָה בְּשַׁבָּת וְאַחַת בֵּיצָה שֶׁנּוֹלְדָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב — אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין אוֹתָהּ, לֹא לְכַסּוֹת בָּהּ אֶת הַכְּלִי, וְלֹא לִסְמוֹךְ בָּהּ כַּרְעֵי הַמִּטָּה.
human_translation: And it is taught both an egg that was laid on Shabbat and an egg that was laid on a Festival, one may not move it, neither to cover a vessel with it nor to support the legs of a bed with it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: One egg that was laid on Shabbat and one egg that was laid on Yom Tov - one may not move it, neither to cover a vessel with it, nor to support the legs of a bed with it.

hebrew_text: אוּשְׁפִּיזְכָּנֵיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא. הֲווֹ לֵיהּ הָנָךְ בֵּיצִים מִשַּׁבָּת לְיוֹם טוֹב. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַהוּ לְמֵכְלִינְהוּ לִמְחַר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל הָאִידָּנָא וּתָא לִמְחַר, דְּרַב לָא מוֹקֵי אָמוֹרָא עִלָּוֵיהּ מִיּוֹמָא טָבָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם שִׁכְרוּת.
human_translation: Rav Pappa’s host, and some say a certain man who came before Rav Pappa, had these eggs a Shabbat that a Festival. He came before him said to him: What is to eat tomorrow, said to him: Go now, and come tomorrow. Rav not place a disseminator before him from one Festival until other, due to drunkenness.
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: "His servants of Rav Papa, and they said to him, that man who came before Rav Papa. They would give him eggs from Shabbat to Yom Tov. He came before him, he said to him: Can we eat them tomorrow? He said to him: Go and come tomorrow, for Rav does not establish a matter for his colleagues from one day to the next due to drunkenness."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא לִמְחַר, אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: When came on the following day, said to him:
llm_translation: When he came the next day, he said to him:

hebrew_text: אֵיכוּ הַשְׁתָּא, אִשְׁתְּלַאי וַאֲמַרִי לְךָ: רַב וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. הָא אָמַר רָבָא: הִלְכְתָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב בְּהָנֵי תְּלָת, בֵּין לְקוּלָּא בֵּין לְחוּמְרָא.
human_translation: Had then, I would have forgotten and I would have said to you, Rav and Rabbi Yoḥanan, the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan, Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with Rav with regard to these three whether lenient, or whether stringent.
llm_translation: Currently, it happened, I asked and said to you: Rav and Rabbi Yochanan - the halacha is like Rabbi Yochanan. This is what Rava said: The halacha follows the opinion of Rav in matters of leniency or stringency.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עֵצִים שֶׁנָּשְׁרוּ מִן הַדֶּקֶל בְּשַׁבָּת — אָסוּר לְהַסִּיקָן בְּיוֹם טוֹב. וְאַל תְּשִׁיבֵנִי בֵּיצָה, מַאי טַעְמָא? בֵּיצָה מִשּׁוּם דִּבְיוֹמָא נָמֵי חַזְיָא לְגוֹמְעָהּ וְלָא קָא שָׁרֵי לַהּ עַד לִמְחַר — מִידָּע יְדִיעַ דְּבַת יוֹמָא אַסְרוּהָ. עֵצִים דְּלָא חָזוּ לְיוֹמַיְיהוּ, אִי שָׁרֵי לְהוּ לִמְחַר — אָתֵי לְמֵימַר: בְּיוֹמַיְיהוּ נָמֵי שְׁרוּ, וְאֶתְמוֹל מִשּׁוּם שַׁבָּת הוּא דְּלָא חָזוּ לְהַסָּקָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: branches that fell from a palm tree on Shabbat, it is prohibited to kindle them on a Festival And do not reply to me an egg What is the reason an egg, because on day itself it is also fit to be swallowed and it is permitted only the following day, one knows is prohibited on the day branches, which are not fit on day if you permit them the following day they will come to say on day they they are also permitted. And yesterday it was due to Shabbat, as they were not fit for kindling
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Wood that was detached from a palm tree on Shabbat — it is forbidden to arrange it on a festival. And do not answer me with an egg, what is the reason? An egg, because during the day it appears as if it is being gathered, and it is not permitted to her until tomorrow — immediately, the knowledge that on the day itself they forbade it. Wood that they did not see for their days, if it is permitted to them for tomorrow — it comes to say: for their days it appears as if they were detached, and yesterday, because of Shabbat, it is that they did not see it for arranging.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: עֵצִים שֶׁנָּשְׁרוּ מִן הַדֶּקֶל לְתוֹךְ הַתַּנּוּר בְּיוֹם טוֹב — מַרְבֶּה עֲלֵיהֶם עֵצִים מוּכָנִים, וּמַסִּיקָן: וְהָא קָא מְהַפֵּךְ בְּאִיסּוּרָא! כֵּיוָן דְּרוּבָּא דְּהֶיתֵּרָא נִינְהוּ, כִּי קָא מְהַפֵּךְ — בְּהֶיתֵּרָא קָא מְהַפֵּךְ.
human_translation: Rav Mattana said: branches that fell from a palm tree into an oven on a Festival, one add to wood prepared and kindle them But doesn’t he turn over the prohibited Since most is permitted, when he turns over, he turns over permitted
llm_translation: Rav Matna said: Wood that was removed from the palm tree into the oven on a festival - one may add prepared wood to them, and one may stoke them. And this is what he meant to say: Since they were permitted initially, when one stokes them - he is stoking them with what is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָא מְבַטֵּל אִיסּוּרָא לְכַתְּחִלָּה, וּתְנַן: אֵין מְבַטְּלִין אָסוּר לְכַתְּחִלָּה! הָנֵי מִילֵּי בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא, אֲבָל בִּדְרַבָּנַן מְבַטְּלִין.
human_translation: But doesn’t he nullify a prohibited ab initio , And we learned One may not nullify a prohibited ab initio . That applies only to by Torah law; but with regard to by rabbinic law, one nullify
llm_translation: And this, it is nullifying a prohibition at the outset, and we learned: One does not nullify a prohibition at the outset! These matters are in the realm of Torah law, but in matters of rabbinic law, one may nullify.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב אָשֵׁי דְּאָמַר: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין אֲפִילּוּ בִּדְרַבָּנַן לֹא בָּטֵיל, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּאִיתֵיהּ לְאִיסּוּרָא בְּעֵינֵיהּ, הָכָא — מִקְלָא קָלִי אִיסּוּרָא.
human_translation: And according to Rav Ashi, who said: Any object whose prohibition is temporary, even by rabbinic law, cannot be nullified, what is there to say? That applies only where the prohibited remains intact; here, the prohibited is burned,
llm_translation: To Rav Ashei who said: Anything that has a leniency, even according to the Rabbis, is not nullified. What can be said about this? These are matters where the prohibition is apparent to him, here - a light prohibition.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: שְׁנֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים שֶׁל גָּלִיּוֹת, רַב אָמַר: נוֹלְדָה בָּזֶה — מוּתֶּרֶת בָּזֶה, וְרַב אַסִּי אָמַר: נוֹלְדָה בָּזֶה — אֲסוּרָה בָּזֶה.
human_translation: It was stated two Festival days in Diaspora. Rav said: was laid on this is permitted on that and Rav Asi said: was laid on this is prohibited on that
llm_translation: It was stated: Two good days of Galyot, Rav said: If it was born on this one — permitted on this one, and Rav Assi said: If it was born on this one — forbidden on this one.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא קָא סָבַר רַב אַסִּי קְדוּשָּׁה אַחַת הִיא? וְהָא רַב אַסִּי מַבְדֵּיל מִיּוֹמָא טָבָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ!
human_translation: Let us say that Rav Asi holds are one sanctity. But didn’t Rav Asi recite havdala , from Festival to the other?
llm_translation: Let us say, did Rav Assi think that there is only one sanctity? But Rav Assi distinguishes a better day for his colleagues!

hebrew_text: רַב אַסִּי סַפּוֹקֵי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ, וְעָבֵיד הָכָא לְחוּמְרָא וְהָכָא לְחוּמְרָא.
human_translation: Rav Asi was uncertain And he acted stringently here, And stringently here,
llm_translation: Rav Assi is in doubt, he doubts it, and he does it here for stringency here for stringency.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב אַסִּי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּהָאִידָּנָא יָדְעִינַן בִּקְבִיעָא דְיַרְחָא, וְקָא עָבְדִינַן תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: reasonable in accordance with Rav Asi as today we know the determination of the month and we observe two days
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: The measure of Rav Assi is estimated, for we know the fixed cycle of the month, and we have observed two days.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דִּתְנַן: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, הָיוּ מַשִּׂיאִין מַשּׂוּאוֹת. מִשֶּׁקִּלְקְלוּ הַכּוּתִים, הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ שְׁלוּחִין יוֹצְאִין.
human_translation: Abaye said: reasonable in accordance with Rav as we learned Initially, they would light torches After the Samaritans Kutim disrupted instituted that messengers should depart
llm_translation: Abaye said: It seems to be in accordance with the opinion of Rav, as we learned: Initially, they would lift the heave-offerings. Once the Samaritans interfered, they instituted that they should be sent out.

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ בָּטְלוּ כּוּתִים — עָבְדִינַן חַד יוֹמָא, וְהֵיכָא דְּמָטוּ שְׁלוּחִין — עָבְדִינַן חַד יוֹמָא.
human_translation: And if Samaritans had desisted we would observe one day. And, where messengers arrived we observe one day.
llm_translation: And if the Kutim nullified the wine, we require one day, and in a place where they send messengers, we require one day.

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּיָדְעִינַן בִּקְבִיעָא דְיַרְחָא, מַאי טַעְמָא עָבְדִינַן תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי? מִשּׁוּם דִּשְׁלַחוּ מִתָּם: הִזָּהֲרוּ בְּמִנְהַג אֲבוֹתֵיכֶם בִּידֵיכֶם, זִמְנִין דְּגָזְרוּ הַמַּלְכוּת גְּזֵרָה וְאָתֵי לְאִקַּלְקוּלֵי.
human_translation: And now that we know the determination of the month, what is the reason we observe two days Because they sent from there, be careful to the custom of your fathers you received, at times the monarchy issue decrees And come to be disrupted
llm_translation: At this time when we know the fixed time of the month, why do we observe two days? Because they sent from there: "Be cautious with the custom of your forefathers in your hands," at times when the kingdom decreed a decree and it leads to leniency.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר, שְׁנֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים שֶׁל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה. רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: נוֹלְדָה בָּזֶה — אֲסוּרָה בָּזֶה, דִּתְנַן: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ מְקַבְּלִין עֵדוּת הַחֹדֶשׁ כׇּל הַיּוֹם (כּוּלּוֹ). פַּעַם אַחַת נִשְׁתַּהוּ הָעֵדִים לָבֹא,
human_translation: It was stated two Festival days of Rosh HaShana. Rav and Shmuel both said: laid on this is prohibited on that one, As we learned Initially, would accept testimony of the month. the entire day Once, the witnesses tarried to arrive
llm_translation: It was stated: Two good days of Rosh Hashanah. Rav and Shmuel both said: If she was born on this day, she is forbidden on this day, as we learned: In the first place, they would accept testimony of the new moon all day (the entire day). Once, the witnesses were delayed in coming,

hebrew_text: וְנִתְקַלְקְלוּ הַלְוִיִּם בַּשִּׁיר. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ מְקַבְּלִים אֶת הָעֵדִים אֶלָּא עַד הַמִּנְחָה.
human_translation: and the Levites erred in the song. instituted that they would accept witnesses only up to minḥa
llm_translation: The Levites were corrupted in song. They established that witnesses should not be accepted except until the Mincha offering.

hebrew_text: וְאִם בָּאוּ עֵדִים מִן הַמִּנְחָה וּלְמַעְלָה, נוֹהֲגִין אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם קֹדֶשׁ, וּלְמָחָר קֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: And if witnesses came from minḥa onward, observe that day sacred, and the following day sacred.
llm_translation: "And if witnesses came from the meal offering and above, we treat that day as holy, and the next day as holy."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: מִתַּקָּנַת רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי וְאֵילָךְ, בֵּיצָה — מוּתֶּרֶת. דִּתְנַן: מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, הִתְקִין רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי שֶׁיְּהוּ מְקַבְּלִין עֵדוּת הַחֹדֶשׁ כׇּל הַיּוֹם.
human_translation: Rabba said: From the ordinance of Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai onward, an egg is permitted As we learned After the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai instituted that should accept testimony the month all day.
llm_translation: Rabba said: From the time that Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai instituted it and onwards, a boiled egg is permitted. As we learned in a Mishnah: When the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai ordained that the testimony regarding the new moon should be accepted throughout the entire day.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי, וְהָא רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: בֵּיצָה אֲסוּרָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אָמֵינָא לָךְ אֲנָא רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ לִי רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל?!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: But didn’t Rav and Shmuel both say an egg is prohibited? said to him: I say to you Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai, and you say to me Rav and Shmuel?
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye, and behold Rav and Shmuel both said: an egg is forbidden! He said to him: I believe you, I am Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai, and you are telling me Rav and Shmuel?!

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל קַשְׁיָא מַתְנִיתִין! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא לַן, וְהָא לְהוּ.
human_translation: And according to Rav and Shmuel, the mishna is difficult, not difficult: This is for us, that is for them,
llm_translation: And for Rav and Shmuel, the Mishnah is difficult! It is not difficult: this for us, and this for them.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: אַף מִתַּקָּנַת רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי וְאֵילָךְ — בֵּיצָה אֲסוּרָה. מַאי טַעְמָא: הָוֵי דָּבָר שֶׁבְּמִנְיָן, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁבְּמִנְיָן — צָרִיךְ מִנְיָן אַחֵר לְהַתִּירוֹ.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef said: Even from the ordinance of Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai onward, an egg prohibited. What is the reason is a matter that by a vote and any matter that by a vote requires another vote to permit it.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Even with the rectification of Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai and onwards - a fertilized egg is prohibited. What is the reason? It is a matter of calculation, and anything that is a matter of calculation requires another calculation to permit it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֵךְ אֱמוֹר לָהֶם שׁוּבוּ לָכֶם לְאׇהֳלֵיכֶם״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״בִּמְשֹׁךְ הַיֹּבֵל הֵמָּה יַעֲלוּ בָהָר״.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: From where do I say As it is written, “Go, say to them: Return to your tents” And it says, “When the ram’s horn sounds long, they may come up to the mount”
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: From where do I say this to her, as it is written: "Go say to them, return to your tents," and it says: "When the ram's horn is sounded, they shall ascend the mountain."

hebrew_text: (וְתַנְיָא:) כֶּרֶם רְבָעִי הָיָה עוֹלֶה לִירוּשָׁלַיִם מַהֲלַךְ יוֹם אֶחָד לְכׇל צַד. וְזוֹ הִיא תְּחוּמָהּ: (עֵלַת) מִן (הַצָּפוֹן), וְעַקְרַבַּת מִן (הַדָּרוֹם), לוֹד מִן הַמַּעֲרָב, וְיַרְדֵּן מִן הַמִּזְרָח.
human_translation: And was taught fourth-year grapevine would ascend to Jerusalem a day’s walk in each direction. And this is its boundary: Eilat to the north; Akrabat to the south; Lod to the west; and the Jordan to the east.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (ve-tan'ya:) kerem reva'i hayah oleh li'Yerushalayim mahalakh yom ekhad le'khol tzad. ve-zo hi teḥumah: (e'lat) min (ha-tzafon), ve-aqravat min (ha-darom), Lod min ha-ma'arav, ve-Yarden min ha-mizrakh. English translation: (And it was taught:) A vineyard of a quarter of a Beitha was ascending to Jerusalem a distance of one day's journey in every direction. And this is its boundary: (Elath) from the north, and Akrabbah from the south, Lod from the west, and the Jordan River from the east.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר עוּלָּא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מָה טַעַם — כְּדֵי לְעַטֵּר שׁוּקֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם בְּפֵירוֹת.
human_translation: And Ulla said, and some say Rabba bar bar Ḥana Rabbi Yoḥanan said: what reason In order to adorn the markets of Jerusalem with fruit,
llm_translation: And Ula said, and it was stated: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: What is the reason? — In order to adorn the markets of Jerusalem with fruits.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: כֶּרֶם רְבָעִי הָיָה לוֹ לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּמִזְרַח לוֹד בְּצַד כְּפַר טָבִי,
human_translation: And it was taught Rabbi Eliezer had a fourth-year grapevine to the east Lod alongside the village of Tavi.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer had a vineyard of a quarter of a Beitha in the east of Lod, beside the village of Tavi.

hebrew_text: וּבִקֵּשׁ לְהַפְקִירוֹ לַעֲנִיִּים. אָמְרוּ לוֹ תַּלְמִידָיו: רַבִּי, כְּבָר נִמְנוּ עָלֶיךָ חֲבֵרֶיךָ וְהִתִּירוּהוּ. מַאן חֲבֵרֶיךָ — רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי.
human_translation: and he sought to render ownerless of the poor, His students said to him: Rabbi, your colleagues have already voted you and permitted it. Who are: Your colleagues? Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai.
llm_translation: And he sought to declare it ownerless to the poor. His disciples said to him: Rabbi, your colleagues have already counted against you and permitted it. Who are your colleagues? Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּנִמְנוּ. הָא לָא נִמְנוּ — לֹא.
human_translation: The reason is that they voted they had not voted, not
llm_translation: Reason for which they were counted. Here, if they were not counted - no.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְאוֹמֵר״? הָכִי קָאָמַר, מִכְּדֵי כְּתִיב ״הֱיוּ נְכוֹנִים לִשְׁלֹשֶׁת יָמִים אַל תִּגְּשׁוּ אֶל אִשָּׁה״, ״לֵךְ אֱמוֹר לָהֶם שׁוּבוּ לָכֶם לְאׇהֳלֵיכֶם״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁבְּמִנְיָן — צָרִיךְ מִנְיָן אַחֵר לְהַתִּירוֹ.
human_translation: What is And it says? this is is saying. Now since it is written: “Be ready for the third day, do not come near a woman” why do I “Go, say to them: Return to your tents” Conclude from this any matter a vote requires another vote to permit it.
llm_translation: "What is the meaning of 'and he shall say'? This is what he is saying: Since it is written, 'Be ready for the third day; do not go near a woman,' 'Go, say to them, return to your tents,' why do I need it? Learn from it that anything that is dependent on a count requires a different count to permit it."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: לְמִצְוַת עוֹנָה הוּא דַּאֲתָא. תָּא שְׁמַע: ״בִּמְשֹׁךְ הַיֹּבֵל הֵמָּה יַעֲלוּ בָהָר״.
human_translation: And if you say it came to the mitzva of conjugal rights, Come hear “When the ram’s horn sounds long, they may come up to the mount”
llm_translation: And if you will say: It is for the commandment of the omer that he came. Come and hear: "When the ram's horn is sounded, they shall ascend the mountain."

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי כְּתִיב: ״גַּם הַצֹּאן וְהַבָּקָר אַל יִרְעוּ אֶל מוּל הָהָר הַהוּא״, ״בִּמְשֹׁךְ הַיֹבֵל״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: דָּבָר שֶׁבְּמִנְיָן — צָרִיךְ מִנְיָן אַחֵר לְהַתִּירוֹ.
human_translation: Now since it is written: “Neither shall the flocks nor the herds feed before that mount” why do I “When the ram’s horn sounds long”? Conclude from this any matter a vote requires another vote to permit it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "From where is it derived that it is written: 'Even the flocks and the herds shall not graze facing that mountain,' 'when the Jubilee horn is sounded'? Why do I need it? Learn from it: a matter that is dependent on a count — requires another count to permit it."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא, אֲבָל בִּדְרַבָּנַן לָא — תָּא שְׁמַע כֶּרֶם רְבָעִי, וְהָא כֶּרֶם רְבָעִי דְּרַבָּנַן, וְקָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: כְּבָר נִמְנוּ עָלֶיךָ חֲבֵרֶיךָ וְהִתִּירוּהוּ.
human_translation: And if you say: That applies to by Torah law, but by rabbinic law, no, come hear a fourth-year grapevine. a fourth-year grapevine by rabbinic law, and they said Your colleagues have already voted you and permitted it.
llm_translation: And if you will say, these matters are in the Torah, but not in the Rabbinic teachings — come and hear: "A vineyard of a fourth part" which is a Rabbinic vineyard, and they say to him: "Your companions have already counted you and permitted it."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: בֵּיצָה נָמֵי, אִמְּנוֹ עֲלַהּ רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי וְשַׁרְיוּהָ. כִּי אִמְּנוֹ — אַעֵדוּת, אַבֵּיצָה לָא אִמְּנוֹ.
human_translation: And if you say: an egg also, Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai took a vote on it and permitted it; When they took a vote, to testimony they did not take a vote to an egg.
llm_translation: And if you will say: "The egg also, did Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai establish it and permit it?" When he established it - it is a testimony, an egg he did not establish.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אַטּוּ בֵּיצָה בְּמִנְיָן מִי הֲוַאי? בֵּיצָה בְּעֵדוּת תַּלְיָא מִלְּתָא. אִתְּסַר עֵדוּת — אִתְּסַר בֵּיצָה, אִשְׁתְּרַי עֵדוּת — אִשְׁתְּרַי בֵּיצָה.
human_translation: Abaye said to Is that to say an egg was by a vote? an egg dependent on testimony? testimony was prohibited, an egg was prohibited testimony was permitted, an egg was permitted.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Now, with regard to an egg, by what count is it? An egg is dependent on testimony regarding the matter. If the testimony is invalidated, the egg is invalidated; if the testimony is established, the egg is established.

hebrew_text: רַב אַדָּא וְרַב שַׁלְמָן, תַּרְוַיְיהוּ מִבֵּי כְלוֹחִית, אָמְרִי: אַף מִתַּקָּנַת רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי וְאֵילָךְ בֵּיצָה אֲסוּרָה. מַאי טַעְמָא — מְהֵרָה יִבָּנֶה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, וְיֹאמְרוּ: אֶשְׁתָּקַד מִי לֹא אָכַלְנוּ בֵּיצָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֵׁנִי? הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי נֵיכוֹל. וְלָא יָדְעִי דְּאֶשְׁתָּקַד שְׁתֵּי קְדוּשּׁוֹת הֵן, וְהַשְׁתָּא קְדוּשָּׁה אַחַת הִיא.
human_translation: Rav Adda and Rav Shalman, both from Bei Keloḥit, said: Even from the ordinance of Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai and onward, an egg prohibited. What is the reason? May the Temple speedily be built, and will say: Last year, didn’t we eat an egg on the second Festival of Now, too, we will eat And they will not know last year two sanctities, and now they are one sanctity.
llm_translation: Rav Adda and Rav Shalman, both from the house of Keluchit, said: Even with the enactment of Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai, from here and onwards an egg is prohibited. What is the reason? - The Temple will be rebuilt quickly, and they will say: Who did not eat an egg on the second day of a festival? Now we can refrain. And they did not know that two sanctities are involved, and now only one sanctity remains.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, עֵדוּת נָמֵי לֹא נְקַבֵּל, מַאי טַעְמָא — מְהֵרָה יִבָּנֶה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, וְיֹאמְרוּ: אֶשְׁתָּקַד מִי לֹא קִבַּלְנוּ עֵדוּת הַחֹדֶשׁ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ, הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי נְקַבֵּל!
human_translation: If so, we also should not accept testimony What is the reason? May the Temple speedily be built, and will say: Last year, didn’t we accept testimony the month all day? Now, too, we will accept
llm_translation: If so, the testimony of Nami we do not accept, what is the reason? - The Temple will be rebuilt quickly, and they will say: Let who did not accept the testimony of the new moon all day long, now accept it!

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא! הָתָם עֵדוּת מְסוּרָה לְבֵית דִּין. בֵּיצָה לַכֹּל מְסוּרָה.
human_translation: How can be compared? There, testimony is entrusted to the court, An egg, entrusted to all,
llm_translation: So it is! There, testimony is given to the court. An egg is considered valid for everyone.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אַף מִתַּקָּנַת רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי וְאֵילָךְ בֵּיצָה אֲסוּרָה. מִי לֹא מוֹדֶה רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי שֶׁאִם בָּאוּ עֵדִים מִן הַמִּנְחָה וּלְמַעְלָה, שֶׁנּוֹהֲגִין אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם קֹדֶשׁ וּלְמָחָר קֹדֶשׁ?
human_translation: Rava said: Even from the ordinance of Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai and onward, an egg prohibited. Doesn’t Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai concede that if witnesses came from minḥa and onward, then one observes that day holy and the following day holy
llm_translation: Rava said: Also from the rectification of Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai and onwards, an egg is prohibited. Who does not agree with Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai that if witnesses came from the Mincha offering and above, which is customary to treat as holy today and tomorrow?

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הִלְכְתָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב בְּהָנֵי תְּלָת, בֵּין לְקוּלָּא בֵּין לְחוּמְרָא.
human_translation: And Rava said The halakha is in accordance with Rav in these three whether lenient, or whether stringent.
llm_translation: And Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with the opinion of Rav in matters of three, whether for leniency or for stringency.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מֵת בְּיוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן — יִתְעַסְּקוּ בּוֹ עֲמָמִים. מֵת בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֵׁנִי — יִתְעַסְּקוּ בּוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁנֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים שֶׁל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה. מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בְּבֵיצָה.
human_translation: Rava said: died on the first day of a Festival, gentiles should attend to his died on the second day of a Festival, Jews should attend to his And even with regard to the two Festival days of Rosh HaShana, that is not so with regard to an egg
llm_translation: Rava said: If one dies on the first day of a festival, idolaters should be occupied with his burial. If one dies on the second day of a festival, Jews should be occupied with his burial, even on the two good days of Rosh Hashanah. This is not the case with an egg.

hebrew_text: נְהַרְדָּעֵי אָמְרִי: אַף בְּבֵיצָה. דְּמָה דַּעְתָּיךְ, דִּלְמָא מְעַבְּרִי לֵיהּ לֶאֱלוּל, הָא אָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר כָּהֲנָא אָמַר רַב: מִימוֹת עֶזְרָא וְאֵילָךְ לֹא מָצִינוּ אֱלוּל מְעוּבָּר.
human_translation: Neharde’a say: Even with regard to an egg, As what do you think perhaps will proclaim Elul full, Didn’t Rav Ḥinnana bar Kahana say Rav said From the days of Ezra and onward we have not found Elul full,
llm_translation: The scholars of Nehardea said: Even in an egg. What is your opinion, perhaps it is referring to the month of Elul? But Rav Hinana bar Kahana said in the name of Rav: From the days of Ezra and onwards, we have not found Elul to be a leap month.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: לָא אֲמַרַן, אֶלָּא דְּאִשְׁתַּהִי. אֲבָל לָא אִשְׁתַּהִי — מַשְׁהִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Mar Zutra said: We said only when has been delayed However, has not been delayed, we delay it
llm_translation: Master Zutra said: We did not say, but it happened. But if it did not happen - we support it.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא אִשְׁתַּהִי, נָמֵי לָא מַשְׁהִינַן לֵיהּ. מַאי טַעְמָא, יוֹם טוֹב שֵׁנִי לְגַבֵּי מֵת — כְּחוֹל שַׁוְּיוּהּ רַבָּנַן, אֲפִילּוּ לְמֵיגַז לֵיהּ גְּלִימָא, וּלְמֵיגַז לֵיהּ אָסָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even though was not delayed, we still do not delay What is the reason With regard to the dead, the Sages equated the second Festival day with a weekday. even to cut a cloak for And to cut myrtles for
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even though she did not drink, we also do not give it to her. What is the reason? The second day of a festival in relation to a deceased person - the Sages compared it to a sandal that is fitting, even to cut a hem for it, and to cut a strap for it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: וְהָאִידָּנָא דְּאִיכָּא חַבָּרֵי — חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: Ravina said: And nowadays, when there are ḥabarei , we are concerned
llm_translation: Ravina said: And the witness that there are colleagues - we are concerned.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא הֲוָה יָתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב (אַסִּי) בִּשְׁנֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים שֶׁל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, חַזְיֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה עֲצִיב, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי עֲצִיב מָר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּלָא אוֹתִיבִי עֵירוּבֵי תַּבְשִׁילִין.
human_translation: Ravina sat before Rav Ashi on the two Festival days of Rosh HaShana, observed that was sad. He said to him: Why is the Master sad? He said to him: I did not prepare a joining of cooked foods,
llm_translation: Ravina was sitting before Rav (Assi) for two good days of Rosh Hashanah, he saw that he was sad, he said to him: Why is my master sad? He said to him: Because I did not establish the Eruv of cooked foods.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלוֹתֵיב מָר הָאִידָּנָא? מִי לָא אָמַר רָבָא: מַנִּיחַ אָדָם עֵירוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין מִיּוֹם טוֹב לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וּמַתְנֶה!
human_translation: said to him: And let the Master prepare a joining of cooked foods now, Didn’t Rava say: A person may prepare a joining of cooked foods from Festival day to another, by stipulating
llm_translation: He said to him: And does Master hold like the Idana? Did not Rava say: One may place his Eruv of cooked dishes from one festival day to another, and it is effective!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵימַר דְּאָמַר רָבָא בִּשְׁנֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים שֶׁל גָּלִיּוֹת. בִּשְׁנֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים שֶׁל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה מִי אָמַר?
human_translation: said to him: say that Rava stated two Festival days of the Diaspora; did he say so with regard to the two Festival days of Rosh HaShana?
llm_translation: He said to him: Say that which Rava said regarding the two good days of the festivals. Regarding the two good days of Rosh Hashanah, who said it?

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמְרִי נְהַרְדָּעֵי: אַף בֵּיצָה מוּתֶּרֶת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מָרְדֳּכַי: בְּפֵירוּשׁ אֲמַר לִי מָר דְּלָא סָבַר לְהָא דִּנְהַרְדָּעֵי.
human_translation: Didn’t Neharde’a say even an egg is permitted Rav Mordekhai said to the Master, explicitly said to me that he does not hold with this Neharde’a.
llm_translation: The Gemara says: Even with a treif egg. Rav Mordechai said to him: In explanation, Mar said to me that he does not hold like the opinion of the Nehardeans.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: אֶפְרוֹחַ שֶׁנּוֹלַד בְּיוֹם טוֹב, רַב אָמַר: אָסוּר. וּשְׁמוּאֵל, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מוּתָּר. רַב אָמַר: אָסוּר — מוּקְצֶה הוּא. וּשְׁמוּאֵל, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מוּתָּר — הוֹאִיל וּמַתִּיר עַצְמוֹ בִּשְׁחִיטָה.
human_translation: It was stated a chick that hatched on a Festival, Rav said: It is prohibited. And Shmuel, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan, said: It is permitted. Rav said: It is prohibited it is muktze . And Shmuel, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is permitted, since it itself is rendered permitted through slaughter.
llm_translation: It was stated: A calf born on a festival, Rav said: It is prohibited. And Shmuel, and some say Rabbi Yohanan said: It is permitted. Rav said: It is prohibited - because it is muktzeh. And Shmuel, and some say Rabbi Yohanan said: It is permitted - since it permits itself through its slaughter.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא וְרַב אַסִּי לְרַב: וְכִי מָה בֵּין זֶה לְעֵגֶל שֶׁנּוֹלַד בְּיוֹם טוֹב? אֲמַר לְהוּ: הוֹאִיל וּמוּכָן אַגַּב אִמּוֹ בִּשְׁחִיטָה.
human_translation: Rav Kahana and Rav Asi said to Rav: And what is the difference between this and a calf born on a Festival, He said to them: Since prepared on account of its mother, by slaughter,
llm_translation: They said to him, Rav Kahana and Rav Assi to Rav: And what is the difference between this and a calf born on a festival? He said to them: Since it is prepared due to its mother for slaughter.

hebrew_text: וּמָה בֵּין זֶה לְעֵגֶל שֶׁנּוֹלַד מִן הַטְּרֵפָה! שְׁתֵיק רַב.
human_translation: And what is the difference between this and a tereifa ? Rav was silent
llm_translation: And what is the difference between this and a calf born from a treifah! Rav remained silent.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר רַבָּה וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאי טַעְמָא שְׁתֵיק רַב? לֵימָא לְהוּ: הוֹאִיל וּמוּכָן אַגַּב אִמּוֹ לִכְלָבִים!
human_translation: Rabba said, and some say Rav Yosef: What is the reason Rav was silent? Let him say to them: since it is prepared on account of its mother to dogs.
llm_translation: Rabba and some say Rav Yosef said: What is the reason that Rav remained silent? Let us say to him: Since it is prepared for his mother, it is permissible for dogs!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי:
human_translation: Abaye said to him:
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye:

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא מוּכָן לְאָדָם לָא הָוֵי מוּכָן לִכְלָבִים, דִּתְנַן: מְחַתְּכִין אֶת הַדִּלּוּעִין לִפְנֵי הַבְּהֵמָה, וְאֶת הַנְּבֵלָה לִפְנֵי הַכְּלָבִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם לֹא הָיְתָה נְבֵלָה מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — אֲסוּרָה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָהּ מִן הַמּוּכָן; מוּכָן לִכְלָבִים הָוֵי מוּכָן לְאָדָם?!
human_translation: Now, prepared, for human is not prepared for dogs, as we learned One may cut pumpkins before an animal and animal carcass, before dogs. Rabbi Yehuda says: If was not a carcass, prior to Shabbat, it is prohibited, because it is not in the prepared prepared for dogs prepared for humans?
llm_translation: The matter is prepared for a person, it is not prepared for dogs, as we learned: One may cut the entrails before the animal, and the carcass before the dogs. Rabbi Yehuda says: If the carcass was not there from before Shabbat, it is forbidden, because it is not prepared; if it is prepared for dogs, is it prepared for a person?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, מוּכָן לְאָדָם — לָא הָוֵי מוּכָן לִכְלָבִים, דְּמַאי דַּחֲזֵי לֵיהּ לְאִינִישׁ לָא שָׁדֵי לֵיהּ לִכְלָבִים. מוּכָן לִכְלָבִים — הָוֵי מוּכָן לְאָדָם, דְּדַעְתֵּיהּ דְּאִינִישׁ אַכׇּל מִידֵּי דַּחֲזֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: He said to him: Yes. prepared for humans is not prepared for dogs, as that which is fit for a person, one does not throw it to dogs, that is prepared for dogs prepared for humans, as a person’s mind is on anything fit to him.
llm_translation: He said to him: If one is not prepared, he is not prepared for dogs, for whatever a person sees, he does not throw to the dogs. If one is prepared for dogs, he is prepared for people, for his knowledge that a person eats from what he sees.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב, תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with Rav; and it is taught in accordance with Shmuel, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rav, it was taught in accordance with the opinion of Shmuel, and some say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב: עֵגֶל שֶׁנּוֹלַד בְּיוֹם טוֹב — מוּתָּר, אֶפְרוֹחַ שֶׁנּוֹלַד בְּיוֹם טוֹב — אָסוּר, וּמָה הֶפְרֵשׁ בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה? זֶה מוּכָן אַגַּב אִמּוֹ בִּשְׁחִיטָה, וְזֶה אֵינוֹ מוּכָן אַגַּב אִמּוֹ.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with Rav: A calf born on a Festival is permitted; a chick born on a Festival is prohibited. And what is the difference between this and that one? This one, is prepared on account of its mother by slaughter; and that one, is not prepared on account of its mother.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav: A calf born on a festival — permitted, a foal born on a festival — forbidden. And what is the distinction between this and that? This one is prepared due to its mother for slaughter, and this one is not prepared due to its mother.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עֵגֶל שֶׁנּוֹלַד בְּיוֹם טוֹב — מוּתָּר, וְאֶפְרוֹחַ שֶׁנּוֹלַד בְּיוֹם טוֹב — מוּתָּר, מַאי טַעְמָא: זֶה מוּכָן אַגַּב אִמּוֹ, וְזֶה מַתִּיר עַצְמוֹ בִּשְׁחִיטָה.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with Shmuel, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan: A calf born on a Festival is permitted, and a chick born on a Festival is permitted. What is the reason? This one, is prepared on account of its mother; and that one, is itself rendered permitted through slaughter.
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Shmuel, and some say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A calf born on a festival — is permitted, and a chick born on a festival — is permitted. What is the reason? This one is prepared due to its mother, and this one permits itself through its slaughter.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֶפְרוֹחַ שֶׁנּוֹלַד בְּיוֹם טוֹב — אָסוּר. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: אַף בַּחוֹל אָסוּר, לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא נִתְפַּתְּחוּ עֵינָיו.
human_translation: The Sages taught A chick born on a Festival is prohibited. Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: Even on a weekday, is prohibited because its eyes have not opened.
llm_translation: The sages taught: A calf born on a festival day - it is forbidden. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: Even on a weekday it is forbidden, because its eyes have not opened.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: ״לְכׇל הַשֶּׁרֶץ הַשֹּׁרֵץ עַל הָאָרֶץ״, לְרַבּוֹת אֶפְרוֹחִים שֶׁלֹּא נִתְפַּתְּחוּ עֵינֵיהֶם. כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which is taught: “Even all creeping animals that creep upon the earth, to include chicks that have not opened their eyes. In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov.
llm_translation: As to where did he go? This is like what is taught: "To every swarming thing that swarms upon the earth," to include chicks whose eyes have not yet opened. As to where - like Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: בֵּיצָה, עִם יְצִיאָתָהּ נִגְמְרָה. מַאי ״עִם יְצִיאָתָהּ נִגְמְרָה״? אִילֵּימָא, עִם יְצִיאָתָהּ נִגְמְרָה וּמוּתֶּרֶת לְאׇכְלָה בְּחָלָב — הָא בִּמְעֵי אִמָּהּ אֲסוּרָה לְאׇכְלָה בְּחָלָב? וְהָתַנְיָא: הַשּׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַתַּרְנְגוֹלֶת וּמָצָא בָּהּ בֵּיצִים גְּמוּרוֹת — מוּתָּרוֹת לְאָכְלָן בְּחָלָב!
human_translation: Rav Huna said Rav said: An egg is fully upon its emergence; What is is fully formed upon its emergence? If we say is fully formed upon its emergence, and it is permitted to eat it with milk, inside its mother, prohibited to eat it with milk. But isn’t it taught one who slaughters a chicken and finds fully eggs inside it, it is permitted to eat them with milk?
llm_translation: Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: With an egg, its hatching completes it. What does "with its hatching completes it" mean? If you say, with its hatching completes it and it is permitted to eat it with milk - but isn't it forbidden to eat the egg found in the innards of its mother with milk? And it was taught: If one slaughters a hen and finds fully formed eggs in it - they are permitted to be eaten with milk!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: עִם יְצִיאָתָהּ נִגְמְרָה — וּמוּתֶּרֶת לְאוֹכְלָהּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב. הָא בִּמְעֵי אִמָּהּ אֲסוּרָה לְאׇכְלָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: הַשּׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַתַּרְנְגוֹלֶת וּמָצָא בָּהּ בֵּיצִים גְּמוּרוֹת — מוּתָּרוֹת לְאָכְלָן בְּיוֹם טוֹב!
human_translation: Rather, is fully formed upon its emergence permitted to eat it on a Festival inside its mother, it is prohibited to eat it on a Festival. But isn’t it taught: one who slaughters a chicken and finds fully eggs inside it, it is permitted to eat them on a Festival?
