llm_translation: Rather: with its departure it is finished — and permitted for its consumption on a festival. But is it forbidden to eat the fetus of its mother on a festival? And it was taught: one who slaughters a hen and finds in it fully formed eggs — they are permitted to be eaten on a festival!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן בְּבָרַיְיתָא מַאי דְּלָא אַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּמַתְנִיתִין, הָא נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: בֵּיצָה שֶׁנּוֹלְדָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: תֵּאָכֵל, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: לֹא תֵּאָכֵל. וְעַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל אֶלָּא בְּנוֹלְדָה, אֲבָל בִּמְעֵי אִמָּן — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל שַׁרְיָין.
human_translation: And if you say: The baraita teaches us that which the mishna did not teach us, this we learned an egg laid on a Festival, Beit Shammai say it may be eaten, and Beit Hillel say it may not be eaten. And Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel disagree only with regard to laid, but inside their mothers, all agree are permitted.
llm_translation: And if you will say: We learn in a baraita, what is it that we do not hear in the mishnah, behold, we also learn: An egg that was laid on a festival, Beit Shammai says: it may be eaten, and Beit Hillel says: it may not be eaten. And up to this point, Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel do not disagree except regarding that which is laid, but regarding that which is in the womb of its mother — everyone agrees that it is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא בֵּית הִלֵּל אֲפִילּוּ בִּמְעֵי אִמָּן נָמֵי אָסְרִי, וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי ״נוֹלְדָה״ — לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחָן דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי דַּאֲפִילּוּ נוֹלְדָה נָמֵי שָׁרוּ, אֶלָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: הַשּׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַתַּרְנְגוֹלֶת וּמָצָא בָּהּ בֵּיצִים גְּמוּרוֹת — מוּתָּרוֹת לְאָכְלָן בְּיוֹם טוֹב, מַנִּי? לָא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וְלָא בֵּית הִלֵּל!
human_translation: And if you say Beit Hillel also prohibit inside their mothers, and that teaches: Laid, to convey the far-reaching nature of Beit Shammai, they permit even was laid. However, that which is taught one who slaughters a chicken and finds inside it fully formed eggs, it is permitted to eat them on a Festival. whose neither Beit Shammai nor Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: And if you will say, Beit Hillel even in the womb of its mother they are forbidden, and this that it teaches "it was born" - to inform you the power of Beit Shammai that even if it was born they permit, rather this that it teaches: one who slaughters a hen and finds in it fully formed eggs - they are permitted to eat them on a festival, is it so? Not Beit Shammai and not Beit Hillel!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: עִם יְצִיאָתָהּ, נִגְמְרָה — וּמְגַדֶּלֶת אֶפְרוֹחִים, בִּמְעֵי אִמָּהּ — אֵינָהּ מְגַדֶּלֶת אֶפְרוֹחִים. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְמִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר. כִּי הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: בֵּיעֵי
human_translation: Rather, is fully formed upon its emergence, and it produces chicks, inside its mother cannot produce chicks. What is the practical difference for buying and selling. like a certain who say to Eggs
llm_translation: Rather: with her going out, she is finished - and raising chicks in her mother's womb - she does not raise chicks. What is derived from this? For buying and selling. As that one said to them: in the valleys.

hebrew_text: דְפָחֲיָא לְמַאן? יְהַבוּ לֵיהּ בֵּיעֵי דִשְׁחוּטָה. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, אֲמַר לְהוּ: מִקָּח טָעוּת הוּא, וְהָדַר.
human_translation: of a live who has? They gave him eggs of a slaughtered He came before Rabbi Ami, said to is a mistaken transaction, and it is rescinded;
llm_translation: "D'pachaya l'man? Yehavu leih be'ei dishchutah. Ata l'kamei d'Rabbi Amei, amar lehu: Mikach ta'ut hu, vehadar." Translation: "Why did they smear it? They gave it in the vessels of slaughter. He came before Rabbi Amei, he said to them: It is an erroneous acquisition, and it is nullified."

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הַאי לַאֲכִילָה קָא בָּעֵי לְהוּ, וְהַאי דְּקָאָמַר דְּפָחֲיָא — מִשּׁוּם דִּצְרִיבָן, לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ — לְמִיתְּבָא לֵיהּ בֵּינֵי בֵּינֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious lest you say this wants them for food and that which he said, of a live because they are hard-shelled, What is the practical difference, to refund him the difference between the two teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! What might you say: this one seeks for eating, and this one that says "a coal" — because they are burning, what comes out of it — it should be placed between them, it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: בֵּיעֵי דְּדִכְרָא לְמַאן! בֵּיעֵי דְּדִכְרָא לְמַאן! יְהַבוּ לֵיהּ בֵּיעֵי דְּסָפְנָא מֵאַרְעָא. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, אֲמַר לְהוּ: מִקָּח טָעוּת הוּא, וַהֲדַר.
human_translation: A certain person said to anyone eggs of a rooster? anyone eggs of a rooster? They gave him eggs absorbed from the ground, He came before Rabbi Ami said to them: is a mistaken transaction, and it is rescinded.
llm_translation: That one who said to them: "With whose permission are you here! With whose permission are you here!" They gave him permission with the permission of the owner of the ship. He came before Rabbi Ammi, he said to them: It is an erroneous acquisition, and it is nullified.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הַאי לַאֲכִילָה קָא בָּעֵי לְהוּ, וְהַאי דְּקָאָמַר דְּדִכְרָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּשַׁמִּינָן טְפֵי, לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ — לְמִיתְּבָא לֵיהּ בֵּינֵי בֵּינֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious lest you say this wants for food, and that which he said, of a rooster, because they are fatter. What is the practical difference; that they should refund him the difference between the two teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! What might you say: this one seeks for eating, and this one that says of memory — because we hear a little, what comes out from it — to sit between, it is heard to us.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: מַאי עִם יְצִיאָתָהּ נִגְמְרָה — עִם יְצִיאַת רוּבָּהּ נִגְמְרָה, וְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בֵּיצָה שֶׁיָּצְאָה רוּבָּהּ מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב וְחָזְרָה — מוּתֶּרֶת לְאׇכְלָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: And if you wish, say What is An egg is fully formed upon its emergence? it is fully formed with the emergence of most of it, in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan. As Rabbi Yoḥanan said: an egg, most of which emerged on a Festival eve, and returned is permitted to eat on the Festival.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: What is meant by "with its emergence it is completed"? - With the majority of its emergence it is completed, as Rabbi Yochanan said: A egg that emerged the majority of it on Erev Yom Tov and then returned - it is permitted to eat it on Yom Tov.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמַר: מַאי עִם יְצִיאָתָהּ נִגְמְרָה — עִם יְצִיאַת כּוּלָּהּ נִגְמְרָה. עִם יְצִיאַת כּוּלָּהּ — אִין, אֲבָל רוּבָּהּ — לָא. וּלְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: And some say What is Fully formed upon its emergence? it is fully formed upon the emergence of all of it. Upon the emergence of all of it, yes, however, most of it no, And to exclude of Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: And there are those who say: What is meant by "with her complete emergence she is finished" - with her complete emergence she is finished. With her complete emergence - no, but with the majority of her - yes. And to go out according to Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: הַשּׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַתַּרְנְגוֹלֶת וּמָצָא בָּהּ בֵּיצִים גְּמוּרוֹת — מוּתָּרוֹת לְאָכְלָן בְּחָלָב. רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיוּ מְעוֹרוֹת בְּגִידִין — אֲסוּרוֹת.
human_translation: the itself: one who slaughters a chicken and finds inside it fully formed eggs, it is permitted to eat with milk. Rabbi Ya’akov says: If were attached by sinews, it is prohibited
llm_translation: Body: One who slaughters a hen and finds fully formed eggs in it - they are permitted to be eaten with milk. Rabbi Yaakov says: If there were membranes on the sinews - they are prohibited.

hebrew_text: מַאן תְּנָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָאוֹכֵל מִנִּבְלַת עוֹף טָהוֹר, מִן הַשְּׁלָל שֶׁל בֵּיצִים, מִן הָעֲצָמוֹת, וּמִן הַגִּידִין, וּמִן הַבָּשָׂר שֶׁנִּתְלַשׁ מִן הַחַי — טָהוֹר.
human_translation: Who is the tanna taught this that the Sages taught One who eats of the unslaughtered carcass of a kosher bird: From a cluster of eggs from bones, or from the sinews, or from meat that has been detached from a live ritually pure
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna that taught this that the Rabbis taught: One who eats from the carcass of a kosher bird, from the spoils of eggs, from the bones, and from the sinews, and from the flesh that was detached from the living animal — is pure.

hebrew_text: מִן הָאֶשְׁכּוֹל שֶׁל בֵּיצִים, מִן הַקּוּרְקְבָן וּבְנֵי מֵעַיִין, אוֹ שֶׁהִמְחָה אֶת הַחֵלֶב וּגְמָעוֹ — טָמֵא.
human_translation: from the ovary of eggs, of the craw or the intestines, or if he melted the fat and swallowed it, ritually impure
llm_translation: From the eggshell of eggs, from the membrane and the offspring of the eye, or if one rubbed the fat and its juice - it is impure.

hebrew_text: מַאן תַּנָּא מִן הַשְּׁלָל שֶׁל בֵּיצִים טָהוֹר? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב. דְּאִי כְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב, הָאָמַר: אִם הָיוּ מְעוֹרוֹת בְּגִידִין — אֲסוּרוֹת!
human_translation: Who is the tanna taught from a cluster of eggs he is pure, Rav Yosef said: not in accordance with Rabbi Ya’akov. For if in accordance with Rabbi Ya’akov, didn’t he say: If were attached by sinews prohibited
llm_translation: Who taught from the spoils of eggs is pure? Rav Yosef said: Not like Rabbi Yaakov. For if it were like Rabbi Yaakov, who said: If there were membranes on the sinews - they are forbidden!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב הָתָם אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן אִסּוּרָא, אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן טוּמְאָה — לָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to From where Perhaps Rabbi Ya’akov stated only there, with regard to prohibition however, with regard to ritual impurity not
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: From where? Perhaps until here Rabbi Yaakov did not say, but only for the matter of prohibition, but for the matter of impurity - no.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא לְעִנְיַן טוּמְאָה נָמֵי נִגְזוֹר — אַפּוֹשֵׁי טוּמְאָה הוּא, וְאַפּוֹשֵׁי טוּמְאָה מִדְּרַבָּנַן לָא מַפְּשִׁינַן.
human_translation: And if you say with regard to impurity let us also issue a decree this proliferate impurity, and we do not proliferate impurity by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: And if you were to say regarding the matter of impurity, "it is a decree" — it is a severe impurity, and we do not lessen severe impurity from the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: מַאן תַּנָּא מִן הָאֶשְׁכּוֹל שֶׁל בֵּיצִים טָמֵא? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אִם הָיוּ מְעוֹרוֹת בְּגִידִין אֲסוּרוֹת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִמַּאי דְּאֶשְׁכּוֹל, מֵהָנָךְ דְּתַלְיָא בְּאֶשְׁכּוֹל? דִּלְמָא אֶשְׁכּוֹל גּוּפֵיהּ.
human_translation: And some say Who is the tanna taught from the ovary of eggs he is ritually impure? Rav Yosef said: It is Rabbi Ya’akov, who said: If were attached by sinews, they are prohibited. Abaye said to him: From where that ovary From these that are hanging from the ovary; perhaps ovary itself,
llm_translation: And there are those who say: Who is the Tanna that holds that the stalk of an egg is impure? Rav Yosef said: It is Rabbi Yaakov, who said: If there were sinews on the eggs, they would be forbidden. Abaye said to him: From where is it derived that it is dependent on the stalk? Perhaps the stalk itself.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: אֶשְׁכּוֹל גּוּפֵיהּ מַאי לְמֵימְרָא! מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַקּוּרְקְבָן וּבְנֵי מֵעַיִין, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּבָשָׂר נִינְהוּ, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא אִינָשֵׁי דְּלָא אָכְלִי — אִיצְטְרִיךְ לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן, הָכָא נָמֵי: כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא אִינָשֵׁי דְּלָא אָכְלִי — אִיצְטְרִיךְ לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן.
human_translation: And if you say: the ovary itself, what of stating Just as it is in the craw and the intestines, that even though they are meat since there are people who do not eat it was necessary to teach us here, too, since there are people who do not eat it was necessary to teach us
llm_translation: And if you will say: What is the case of the cluster itself to say! Since it is a locust and the sons of Ma'ayan, who are also considered as meat, once there are people who do not eat - it is necessary for us to hear, here too: once there are people who do not eat - it is necessary for us to hear.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֹּל שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בַּיּוֹם — נוֹלָד בַּיּוֹם. כֹּל שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בַּלַּיְלָה — נוֹלָד בַּלַּיְלָה. כֹּל שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בֵּין בַּיּוֹם וּבֵין בַּלַּיְלָה — נוֹלָד בֵּין בַּיּוֹם וּבֵין בַּלַּיְלָה. כֹּל שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בַּיּוֹם נוֹלָד בַּיּוֹם — זוֹ תַּרְנְגוֹלֶת. כֹּל שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בַּלַּיְלָה נוֹלָד בַּלַּיְלָה — זוֹ עֲטַלֵּף. כֹּל שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בֵּין בַּיּוֹם וּבֵין בַּלַּיְלָה — אָדָם וְכׇל דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught Any whose intercourse in the day born by day; any whose intercourse occurs at night is born by night; any whose intercourse occurs either by day or by night is born either by day or by night. Any whose intercourse occurs by day is born by day, this a chicken. Any whose intercourse occurs by night is born by night, this is a bat. Any whose intercourse occurs either by day or by night, a human and all that are similar to him.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Anyone whose usage is during the day - is born during the day. Anyone whose usage is during the night - is born during the night. Anyone whose usage is both during the day and during the night - is born both during the day and during the night. Anyone whose usage is during the day is born during the day - this is a rooster. Anyone whose usage is during the night is born during the night - this is a bat. Anyone whose usage is both during the day and during the night - is a human and all similar to it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: כֹּל שֶׁתַּשְׁמִישׁוֹ בַּיּוֹם נוֹלָד בַּיּוֹם — זוֹ תַּרְנְגוֹלֶת. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְכִדְרַב מָרִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב מָרִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא: בָּדַק בְּקִנָּה שֶׁל תַּרְנְגוֹלִין מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב וְלֹא מָצָא בָּהּ בֵּיצָה, וּלְמָחָר הִשְׁכִּים וּמָצָא בָהּ בֵּיצָה — מוּתֶּרֶת.
human_translation: The Master said: Any whose intercourse occurs by day is born by day, this is a chicken. What practical difference to that which Rav Mari, son of Rav Kahana as Rav Mari, son of Rav Kahana said: examined a chicken’s nest on a Festival eve and did not find an egg in it, and the following day, he rose early and found an egg in it, permitted,
llm_translation: Master said: All that its use in the day it was born in the day - this is a hen. For what case does it come out? According to the statement of Mar, son of Kahana. For Mar, son of Kahana said: He checked the hen's nest from the eve of a festival and did not find an egg in it, and the next day he got up early and found an egg in it - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא בָּדַק! אֵימַר לֹא בָּדַק יָפֶה יָפֶה. וַאֲפִילּוּ בָּדַק יָפֶה, אֵימַר: יָצְתָה רוּבָּהּ וְחָזְרָה הֲוַאי, וְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: But didn’t he examine Say he did not examine very carefully. And even he did examine carefully, say most of emerged and returned in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: And did he not check! Say he did not check very well. And even if he checked very well, say: most of it came out and returned, as Rabbi Yochanan said.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן שָׁאוּל אָמַר רַב: בָּדַק בְּקִנָּה שֶׁל תַּרְנְגוֹלֶת מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב וְלֹא מָצָא בָּהּ בֵּיצָה, וּלְמָחָר הִשְׁכִּים וּמָצָא בָהּ בֵּיצָה — אֲסוּרָה! הָתָם בִּדְסָפְנָא מֵאַרְעָא.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rabbi Yosei ben Shaul say Rav said: one examined a chicken’s nest on a Festival eve and did not find an egg in it, and the following day he rose early and found an egg in it, it is prohibited? There to that absorbed from the earth,
llm_translation: I? But didn't Rabbi Yosei ben Sha'ul say in the name of Rav: If one checks a hen's nest on Erev Yom Tov and does not find an egg in it, and then the next day he checks and finds an egg in it - it is prohibited! There, it is due to suspicion of the marketplace.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי דְּרַב מָרִי נָמֵי אֵימָא מֵאַרְעָא סָפְנָא? בִּדְאִיכָּא זָכָר בַּהֲדַהּ. בִּדְאִיכָּא זָכָר נָמֵי, אֵימָא מֵאַרְעָא סָפְנָא! אָמַר רָבִינָא, גְּמִירִי: כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא זָכָר — לָא סָפְנָא מֵאַרְעָא.
human_translation: If so, Rav Mari’s too, say that absorbed from the earth to where there is a male with it. where there is a male with it, also say that it absorbed from the earth Ravina said: learned anywhere that a male is present, does not absorb from the earth.
llm_translation: So, if that's the case, according to Rav Mari, should we say that a ship is male? In a place where there is a male, it is referred to in the feminine. In a place where there is a male, should we say that a ship is male? Ravina said: It is a tradition: wherever there is a male - it is not referred to in the feminine.

hebrew_text: וְעַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַב גַּמָּדָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: כֹּל הֵיכָא
human_translation: Until where Rav Gamda said in the name of Rav: any place
llm_translation: And until when? Rav Gamdara said in the name of Rav: Everywhere.

hebrew_text: דְּשָׁמְעָה קָלֵיהּ בִּימָמָא.
human_translation: where hear its voice by day,
llm_translation: He heard his voice in the daytime.

hebrew_text: עֲבַד רַב מָרִי עוֹבָדָא עַד שִׁתִּין בָּתֵּי.
human_translation: Rav Mari took action up to sixty houses
llm_translation: Servant Rav Mari performed a deed until sixty houses.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִיכָּא נַהֲרָא — לָא עָבְרָא. וְאִי אִיכָּא מַבָּרָא — עָבְרָא. וְאִי אִיכָּא מִיצְרָא — לָא עָבְרָא. הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא, וְעָבְרָא אַמִּיצְרָא.
human_translation: And if a river does not cross but if there is a bridge, crosses And if there is a rope bridge not cross an incident crossed over on a rope bridge.
llm_translation: If there is a river - it did not pass. And if there is a swamp - it passed. And if there is a narrow passage - it did not pass. There was a case, and it passed through the narrow passage.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי אוֹקֵימְתָּא — בִּדְסָפְנָא מֵאַרְעָא, מַאי אִירְיָא בָּדַק? כִּי לָא בָּדַק נָמֵי!
human_translation: In what did you establish in absorbed from the earth. why specifically one examined even when one did not examine
llm_translation: In what is it established? - In a ship from the land. What is the meaning of "badak"? For it is not established!

hebrew_text: כִּי לָא בָּדַק, אֵימָא מֵאֶתְמוֹל הֲוַאי. אִי הָכִי כִּי בָּדַק נָמֵי, אֵימָא: יָצְתָה רוּבָּהּ וְחָזְרָה הִיא, וְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן! דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לָא שְׁכִיחַ.
human_translation: where he did not examine say was yesterday, If so, when he examined as well, say: is most of emerged and returned, and in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan? by Rabbi Yoḥanan, is uncommon,
llm_translation: When he did not check, say perhaps it was from yesterday. If so, when he did check indeed, say: the majority of it went out and came back, like Rabbi Yochanan! For Rabbi Yochanan is not common.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן שָׁאוּל אָמַר רַב: הַאי תּוּמָא שְׁחִיקָא, סַכַּנְתָּא לְגִלּוּיָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei ben Shaul said Rav said: This crushed garlic danger of exposure.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yosei ben Sha'ul said in the name of Rav: This innocent one who is torn, it is a danger for revealing.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שְׂאוֹר בְּכַזַּיִת.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: leaven an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: Beit Shammai say: "Leaven in olive oil."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי? אִם כֵּן, לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא חָמֵץ, וְלָא בָּעֵי שְׂאוֹר, וַאֲנָא אָמֵינָא: וּמָה חָמֵץ שֶׁאֵין חִמּוּצוֹ קָשֶׁה — בִּכְזַיִת, שְׂאוֹר שֶׁחִמּוּצוֹ קָשֶׁה — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן. שְׂאוֹר דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי? לוֹמַר לְךָ: שִׁיעוּרוֹ שֶׁל זֶה לֹא כְּשִׁיעוּרוֹ שֶׁל זֶה.
human_translation: What is the reason of Beit Shammai? If so let the Merciful One write leavened bread, and it would not be necessary leaven, and I would say If leavened bread, whose leavening is not extensive, an olive-bulk, leaven, whose leavening is extensive, all the more so why do I leaven that the Merciful One wrote to tell you the measure of this, is not equal to the measure of that,
llm_translation: What is the reason of Beit Shammai? If so, let the Merciful One write "chametz" and not require "sour dough." And I say: If the chametz whose leavening is not difficult is like an olive's size, then the sour dough whose leavening is difficult is certainly not required. Why did the Merciful One write "sour dough"? To tell you: Its measure is not like the measure of this chametz.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל: צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא שְׂאוֹר, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מִשּׁוּם דְּחִמּוּצוֹ קָשֶׁה, אֲבָל חָמֵץ, דְּאֵין חִמּוּצוֹ קָשֶׁה — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel are necessary. As if the Merciful One had written leaven, I would have said because its leavening is extensive. However, leavened bread, leavening is not extensive, say no, necessary
llm_translation: House of Hillel: It is necessary, for if the Merciful One wrote "leaven," I would say: because its sourness is severe, but leaven, whose sourness is not severe — I would say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא חָמֵץ, מִשּׁוּם דְּרָאוּי לַאֲכִילָה. אֲבָל שְׂאוֹר, שֶׁאֵין רָאוּי לַאֲכִילָה — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written leavened bread, because it is fit for consumption however, leaven, which is not fit for consumption say no, necessary
llm_translation: If the Merciful One wrote "chametz," because it is fit for consumption. But "se'or," which is not fit for consumption - I might say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי לֵית לְהוּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: פְּתַח הַכָּתוּב בִּשְׂאוֹר וְסִיֵּים בְּחָמֵץ, לוֹמַר לְךָ: זֶהוּ שְׂאוֹר זֶהוּ חָמֵץ!
human_translation: And Beit Shammai, don’t they hold Rabbi Zeira’s As Rabbi Zeira said, The verse begins with leaven and ends with leavened bread to say to you leaven is equivalent to leavened bread.
llm_translation: House of Shammai does not have a response to Rabbi Zeira, as Rabbi Zeira said: The Scripture begins with leaven and concludes with sourdough, to tell you: This is leaven, this is sourdough!

hebrew_text: לְעִנְיַן אֲכִילָה כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְלִיגִי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי לְעִנְיַן בִּיעוּר. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: לָא יָלְפִינַן בִּיעוּר מֵאֲכִילָה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: יָלְפִינַן בִּיעוּר מֵאֲכִילָה.
human_translation: with regard to eating, everyone agrees When they disagree with regard to removal Beit Shammai hold we do not derive removal from eating. And Beit Hillel hold we derive removal from eating.
llm_translation: Regarding the matter of eating, everyone agrees. When they disagree, it is regarding the matter of separating. Beit Shammai hold: one may not separate from eating, and Beit Hillel hold: one may separate from eating.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: מַחְלוֹקֶת לְעִנְיַן בִּיעוּר, אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן אֲכִילָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל זֶה וְזֶה בִּכְזַיִת.
human_translation: was also stated Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: dispute with regard to removal with regard to eating, everyone agrees this and that an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: It was stated: Naḥmei said, Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: Disagreement regarding the matter of selection, but regarding the matter of eating - the words of all are in agreement.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״וְלֹא יֵרָאֶה לְךָ (שְׂאוֹר) וְלֹא יֵרָאֶה לְךָ (חָמֵץ)״. זֶהוּ מַחְלוֹקֶת שֶׁבֵּין בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל. שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שְׂאוֹר בִּכְזַיִת וְחָמֵץ בִּכְכוֹתֶבֶת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: זֶה וְזֶה בִּכְזַיִת.
human_translation: That is also taught “And no leavened bread shall be seen with you, and no leaven shall be found in all your borders” This is a dispute between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel, as Beit Shammai say: leaven an olive-bulk, and a large date-bulk, and Beit Hillel say: both this and that an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: "And leaven shall not be seen with you, and no leaven shall be seen with you." This is the dispute between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel. Beit Shammai say: leaven in a visible form and sourdough in a written form, and Beit Hillel say: both in a visible form.

hebrew_text: הַשּׁוֹחֵט חַיָּה וָעוֹף בְּיוֹם טוֹב וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: one who slaughters an undomesticated animal or a bird on a Festival,
llm_translation: The one slaughtering a wild animal and bird on a festival and so on.

hebrew_text: הַשּׁוֹחֵט, דִּיעֲבַד אִין, לְכַתְּחִלָּה לָא? אֵימָא סֵיפָא: וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יִשְׁחוֹט. מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר יִשְׁחוֹט!
human_translation: One who slaughters after the fact, yes, ab initio , no, Say the latter clause And Beit Hillel say may not slaughter by inference that the first tanna , holds may slaughter
llm_translation: The one who slaughters, if it was done, initially not? Say the latter part: And Beit Hillel say: He should not slaughter. From the inference that the first Tanna holds that he should slaughter!

hebrew_text: הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: לֹא יִשְׁחוֹט וִיכַסֶּה קָאָמַר.
human_translation: This not difficult, said One may not slaughter and cover
llm_translation: This is not difficult: "One should not slaughter and cover" is what he said.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: וּמוֹדִים שֶׁאִם שָׁחַט, שֶׁיַּחְפּוֹר בַּדֶּקֶר וִיכַסֶּה. מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא לָאו דִּיעֲבַד הוּא!
human_translation: Say the latter clause And concede that if he slaughtered, then he may dig with a shovel and cover by inference that first clause is not after the fact,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: u'modim she'im shachat, sheyachpor badeker viyachseh. Miklal d'reisha lav di'avad hu!" English translation: "Say the latter clause: and they agree that if one slaughtered, he should dig a hole and cover. From the general principle of the first clause, it is not so!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה, הָכִי קָאָמַר: הַשּׁוֹחֵט שֶׁבָּא לִימָּלֵךְ — כֵּיצַד אוֹמֵר לוֹ? בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים, אוֹמֵר לוֹ: שְׁחוֹט, חֲפוֹר וְכַסֵּה. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יִשְׁחוֹט אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיָה לוֹ עָפָר מוּכָן מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם.
human_translation: Rabba said this is what is saying. one who slaughters who comes to consult what say to him? Beit Shammai say says to him: Slaughter dig, and cover And Beit Hillel say: He may slaughter only if he had earth prepared while it was still day.
llm_translation: Rabah said, thus he said: One who slaughters that comes to circumcise - how does he say to him? Beit Shammai say, he says to him: slaughter, dig, and cover. And Beit Hillel say: he should not slaughter unless he had prepared dust from the day before.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר, הָכִי קָאָמַר: הַשּׁוֹחֵט שֶׁבָּא לְהִמָּלֵךְ, כֵּיצַד אוֹמֵר לוֹ? בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים, אוֹמֵר לוֹ: לֵךְ חֲפוֹר, שְׁחוֹט וְכַסֵּה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יִשְׁחוֹט אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיָה לוֹ עָפָר מוּכָן מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said this is what is saying: one who slaughters animals who comes to consult, what does say to him? Beit Shammai say he says to him: Go dig, slaughter and cover And Beit Hillel say: He may slaughter only if he had earth prepared while it was still day.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said, thus he said: The one who slaughters that comes to be anointed, how does he say to him? Beit Shammai say, he says to him: Go dig, slaughter, and cover. And Beit Hillel say: He should not slaughter unless he had prepared dust from the day before.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: לֵימָא מָר וְרַבָּה בִּדְרַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב קָא מִפַּלְגִיתוּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב: הַשּׁוֹחֵט, צָרִיךְ שֶׁיִּתֵּן עָפָר לְמַטָּה וְעָפָר לְמַעְלָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשָׁפַךְ אֶת דָּמוֹ וְכִסָּהוּ בֶּעָפָר״. ״עָפָר״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״בֶּעָפָר״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהַשּׁוֹחֵט צָרִיךְ שֶׁיִּתֵּן עָפָר לְמַטָּה וְעָפָר לְמַעְלָה.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: Let us say the Master, and Rabba dispute that Rabbi Zeira Rav said, as Rabbi Zeira said Rav said: One who slaughters he must place earth beneath and earth above  as it is stated: “And he shall pour out its blood and cover it in earth” is not stated: earth, but “in earth,” teaches that one who slaughters must place earth beneath and earth above
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Yosef: Let us say, Master, and Rabba in the name of Rabbi Zeira said Rav is from his division, as Rabbi Zeira said Rav said: One who slaughters, needs to place dust below and dust above, as it is stated: "And pour out his blood and cover it with dust." "Dust" was not stated, rather "with dust" — this teaches that the one who slaughters needs to place dust below and dust above.

hebrew_text: דְּמָר אִית לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא, וְרַבָּה לֵית לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא?
human_translation: that the Master is of of Rabbi Zeira, and Rabba is of not of Rabbi Zeira.
llm_translation: There is a Master who has the name Rabbi Zeira, and there is not a Master who has the name Rabbi Zeira?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בֵּין לְדִידִי בֵּין לְרַבָּה אִית לַן דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא. וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָא מִפַּלְגִינַן, רַבָּה סָבַר: אִי אִיכָּא עָפָר לְמַטָּה — אִין, אִי לָא — לָא. חָיְישִׁינַן דִּלְמָא מִמְּלִיךְ וְלָא שָׁחֵיט. וּלְדִידִי (אַדְּרַבָּה) הָא עֲדִיפָא, דְּאִי לָא שָׁרֵית לֵיהּ — אָתֵי לְאִמְּנוֹעֵי מִשִּׂמְחַת יוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: said to both to me and to Rabba we are of Rabbi Zeira, and here we disagree with regard to this Rabba holds if there is earth beneath, yes, if there is no no, We are concerned perhaps one will reconsider and not slaughter And according to my on the contrary: This is preferable, since if you do not permit him he will refrain from rejoicing on the Festival.
llm_translation: He said to him: Whether according to my opinion or according to Rabba's opinion, we have the teaching of Rabbi Zeira. And here in this case we are in disagreement, for Rabba holds: If there is dust below - no, if not - yes. We are concerned lest it was salted but not properly slaughtered. And according to my opinion (in contrast to Rabba), this is preferable, for if you did not permit it - it would come to be used for the joy of a festival.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדִים שֶׁאִם שָׁחַט — שֶׁיַּחְפּוֹר בַּדָּקָר וִיכַסֶּה. אָמַר רַבִּי זְרִיקָא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: וְהוּא שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ דָּקָר נָעוּץ מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם. וְהָא קָא עָבֵיד כְּתִישָׁה! אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב:
human_translation: And concede that if one slaughtered an then he digs with a shovel and covers Rabbi Zerika said Rav Yehuda said: And that is when one has a shovel embedded while it was still day, But doesn’t he perform crushing, Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Rav said:
llm_translation: And they agree that if he slaughtered - he should dig in the ground and cover. Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav Yehudah: And this is when he has a sharp stake from the previous day. But isn't he performing a grinding action! Rav Chiya bar Ashe said in the name of Rav:

hebrew_text: בְּעָפָר תִּיחוּחַ.
human_translation: to loose earth
llm_translation: In the dust you shall grind.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָא עָבֵיד גּוּמָּא! כִּדְרַבִּי אַבָּא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: הַחוֹפֵר גּוּמָּא בְּשַׁבָּת, וְאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ אֶלָּא לַעֲפָרָהּ — פָּטוּר עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: But one makes a hole in accordance with Rabbi Abba, as Rabbi Abba said: One who digs a hole on Shabbat, needs only its earth is exempt for
llm_translation: And this is what he is doing a complete act! Like Rabbi Abba. For Rabbi Abba said: One who digs a complete pit on Shabbat, and he only needs it for its dirt - he is exempt for it.

hebrew_text: שֶׁאֵפֶר כִּירָה מוּכָן הוּא. אֵפֶר כִּירָה מַאן דְּכַר שְׁמֵיהּ? אָמַר רַבָּה, הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְאֵפֶר כִּירָה מוּכָן הוּא.
human_translation: That the ashes of a stove are prepared. The ashes of a stove, who mentioned anything about it? Rabba said: This is what said: And the ashes of a stove are prepared.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "She'efer kira mukhan hu. Efer kira man dekhar shemeih? Amar Rabah, hachi ka'amar: Ve'efer kira mukhan hu." English translation: "Ashes of a stove are prepared. Who is the one who remembered his name? Rabah said, this is what he meant: And ashes of a stove are prepared."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁהוּסַּק מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב, אֲבָל הוּסַּק בְּיוֹם טוֹב — אָסוּר. וְאִם רָאוּי לִצְלוֹת בּוֹ בֵּיצָה — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: They only taught was ignited on the Festival eve, However, it was ignited on the Festival prohibited. And if fit to roast an egg in them, permitted
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: They only taught that it is permitted if it was prepared from Erev Yom Tov, but if it was prepared on Yom Tov itself — it is prohibited. And if it is fit to be roasted with it an egg — it is permitted.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: כְּשֶׁאָמְרוּ אֵפֶר כִּירָה מוּכָן הוּא — לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁהוּסַּק מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב, אֲבָל הוּסַּק בְּיוֹם טוֹב — אָסוּר. וְאִם רָאוּי לִצְלוֹת בּוֹ בֵּיצָה — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: That is also taught When they said the ashes of a stove are prepared, they said only when it was ignited on the Festival eve; however, it was ignited on the Festival, prohibited. And if fit to roast an egg in them, permitted.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita in the name of the school of Hillel: When they said that ashes of a furnace are prepared – they only said this when it was removed from before the Sabbath, but if it was removed on the Sabbath – it is prohibited. And if it is fit to roast an egg in it – it is permitted.

hebrew_text: הִכְנִיס עָפָר לְגִנָּתוֹ וּלְחוּרְבָּתוֹ — מוּתָּר לְכַסּוֹת בּוֹ. וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מַכְנִיס אָדָם מְלֹא קוּפָּתוֹ עָפָר וְעוֹשֶׂה בָּהּ כׇּל צָרְכּוֹ.
human_translation: one brought earth into his garden or his ruin it is permitted to cover with it. And Rav Yehuda said: A person may bring in a basketful of earth and use for all his needs
llm_translation: He brought in dust to his garden and to his ruin — permissible to cover with it. And Rav Yehudah said: A person brings in a full handful of dust and makes with it all his needs.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ מָר זוּטְרָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּמָר זוּטְרָא רַבָּה: וְהוּא שֶׁיִּיחֵד לוֹ קֶרֶן זָוִית.
human_translation: Mar Zutra taught in the name of Mar Zutra the Great And that is if one designated a corner for this
llm_translation: Mar Zutra expounded in the name of Mar Zutra the Great: And he is the one who connected for him a corner horn.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כּוֹי, אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין אוֹתוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְאִם שְׁחָטוֹ — אֵין מְכַסִּין אֶת דָּמוֹ. וְאִי אִיתָא, לְכַסְּיֵיהּ כִּדְרַב יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: raises an objection a koy , one may not slaughter it on a Festival, And if one did slaughter it, he may not cover its blood. And if it is so, let him cover it, in accordance with Rav Yehuda.
llm_translation: Challenger: Koi, ein shochtin oto b'yom tov, v'im shachatoh - ein mekhasin et damo. V'ei ita, l'khasseiyeh kid'Rav Yehudah!

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ: לְכַסְּיֵיהּ בָּאֵפֶר כִּירָה, אוֹ בְּדָקָר נָעוּץ! אֶלָּא — דְּלֵית לֵיהּ, הָכָא נָמֵי — דְּלֵית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, Let him cover with ashes of a stove or with an embedded shovel. Rather, where one does not have here too, that he does not have
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning: to cover it with ashes of a furnace, or to pierce it with a thorn! Rather - that it does not have, here too - that it does not have.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי מַאי אִירְיָא סָפֵק, אֲפִילּוּ וַדַּאי נָמֵי לָא!
human_translation: If so, why specifically uncertainty Even certainly also not
llm_translation: "If so, what is the status of a doubt? Even if it is certainly not!"

hebrew_text: לָא מִבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִבַּעְיָא וַדַּאי דְּלָא לִשְׁחוֹט, אֲבָל סָפֵק — אֵימָא מִשּׁוּם שִׂמְחַת יוֹם טוֹב לִשְׁחוֹט וְלָא לְכַסְּיֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: is speaking It is not necessary, It is not necessary definite that not to slaughter however, an uncertainty, say: Due to the joy of the Festival let one slaughter and not cover uncertainty teaches us
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: "He is not saying 'he does not need,' but certainly if he does not need to slaughter, but in a case of doubt — say it is due to the joy of a festival to slaughter and not to cover it, this is implied to us."

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: וְאִם שְׁחָטוֹ — אֵין מְכַסִּין אֶת דָּמוֹ, מִכְּלָל (דְּרֵישָׁא) בִּדְאִית לֵיהּ עָסְקִינַן!
human_translation: From that the latter clause teaches: And if he slaughtered it one may not cover its blood, it may be inferred that in the first clause we are dealing with where he does have
llm_translation: And this is what we learned in the latter part: "And if one slaughtered it - they do not cover its blood," from the inference in the first part, do we not deal with it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבָּה: אֵפֶר כִּירָה — מוּכָן לְוַדַּאי וְאֵין מוּכָן לְסָפֵק.
human_translation: Rather, Rabba said the ashes of a stove, prepared for a definite are not prepared for uncertainty.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabah said: "Ashes of a stove - prepared for certain ritual impurity and not prepared for doubt."

hebrew_text: לְסָפֵק מַאי טַעְמָא לָא — דְּקָא עָבֵיד גּוּמָּא, וַדַּאי נָמֵי קָא עָבֵיד גּוּמָּא! אֶלָּא כִּדְרַבִּי אַבָּא, הָכָא נָמֵי כִּדְרַבִּי אַבָּא!
human_translation: of uncertainty, what is the reason that one makes a hole a definite he also makes a hole. Rather, in accordance with Rabbi Abba, here too, in accordance with Rabbi Abba.
llm_translation: To doubt what reason? No - for he is doing an act, and surely he is doing an act! Rather, like Rabbi Abba, here he is doing an act like Rabbi Abba!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: סָפֵק מַאי טַעְמָא — דִּלְמָא עָבֵיד כְּתִישָׁה. וַדַּאי נָמֵי נִגְזוֹר מִשּׁוּם כְּתִישָׁה! וַדַּאי, כִּי קָא עָבֵיד כְּתִישָׁה — אָתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְדָחֵי אֶת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Rather, uncertainty, what is the reason perhaps one perform crushing we should also decree a definite because crush a definite if he performs crushing, positive comes and overrides prohibition
llm_translation: Rather: doubt what reason — perhaps does like grinding. And certainly also deduced from reason like grinding! And certainly, when doing like grinding — comes positive and pushes away negative.

hebrew_text: אֵימַר דְּאָמְרִינַן אָתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְדָחֵי אֶת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה כְּגוֹן מִילָה בְּצָרַעַת, אִי נָמֵי סָדִין בְּצִיצִית.
human_translation: Say that we said A positive comes and overrides a prohibition such as circumcision of leprosy. Alternatively, cloak on ritual fringes
llm_translation: Statement: If we say that a positive commandment overrides a negative commandment, such as circumcision in the case of tzara'at, or indeed wearing a linen garment with tzitzit.

hebrew_text: דִּבְעִידָּנָא דְּקָא מִעֲקַר לָאו — קָא מוֹקֵים לַעֲשֵׂה. הָכָא, בְּעִידָּנָא דְּקָא מִעֲקַר לָאו — לָא מוֹקֵים עֲשֵׂה! הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, דְּבַהֲדֵי דְּכָתֵישׁ קָא מִכַּסֵּי.
human_translation: at time that one uproots prohibition, fulfills positive here, at the time that one uproots prohibition, does not fulfill positive This not difficult, that when one crushes he covers
llm_translation: In the case where the negative commandment is being uprooted - it establishes the positive commandment. Here, in the case where the negative commandment is being uprooted - it does not establish the positive commandment! This is not difficult, for while one is being uprooted, the other is being covered.

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף, יוֹם טוֹב עֲשֵׂה וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה הוּא — וְאֵין עֲשֵׂה דּוֹחֶה אֶת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה וַעֲשֵׂה!
human_translation: Ultimately, a Festival is positive and prohibition and a positive does not override a prohibition and a positive
llm_translation: At the end, a good day do and not do it - and positive commandment overrides negative commandment and do!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: אֵפֶר כִּירָה דַּעְתּוֹ לְוַדַּאי, וְאֵין דַּעְתּוֹ לְסָפֵק.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: intention the ashes of a stove for definite, and he does not have intention for uncertainty.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: The ash of a stove is definitely his intent, and his intent is not for uncertainty.

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא רָבָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: הִכְנִיס עָפָר לְכַסּוֹת בּוֹ צוֹאָה — מוּתָּר לְכַסּוֹת בּוֹ דַּם צִפּוֹר. דַּם צִפּוֹר — אָסוּר לְכַסּוֹת בּוֹ צוֹאָה.
human_translation: And Rava follows his reasoning as Rava said: brought in earth to cover excrement with it it is permitted to cover with it the blood of bird. the blood of a bird, it is prohibited to cover excrement with it,
llm_translation: And Rava went according to his reasoning, for Rava said: If one brought dust to cover excrement with it - it is permitted to cover bird blood with it. Bird blood - it is forbidden to cover excrement with it.

hebrew_text: נְהַרְבְּלָאֵי אָמְרִי: אֲפִילּוּ הִכְנִיס עָפָר לְכַסּוֹת בּוֹ דַּם צִפּוֹר — מוּתָּר לְכַסּוֹת בּוֹ צוֹאָה.
human_translation: of Neharbela said: Even one brought in earth to cover the blood of a bird with it, it is permitted to cover excrement with it,
llm_translation: The scholars of Nehardea say: Even if one brought dirt to cover bird blood with it - it is permitted to cover excrement with it.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חָמָא וְרַבִּי זֵירָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רָבָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף בַּר חָמָא וְרַבִּי זֵירָא. חַד אָמַר: כּוֹי, הֲרֵי הוּא כְּצוֹאָה. וְחַד אָמַר: כּוֹי אֵינוֹ כְּצוֹאָה.
human_translation: They say in the West, Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥama and Rabbi Zeira disagree with regard to and some say Rava, son of Rav Yosef bar Ḥama, and Rabbi Zeira. One said a koy is similar to excrement And one said: A koy is not similar to excrement.
llm_translation: They said in the West: Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥama and Rabbi Zeira disagree about it, and some say it was Rava, son of Rav Yosef bar Ḥama, and Rabbi Zeira who said it. One said: "Koi," it is like a spit. And one said: "Koi" is not like a spit.

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיַּים דְּרָבָא הוּא דְּאָמַר כּוֹי הֲרֵי הוּא כְּצוֹאָה, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: הִכְנִיס עָפָר לְכַסּוֹת בּוֹ צוֹאָה — מוּתָּר לְכַסּוֹת בּוֹ דַּם צִפּוֹר, דַּם צִפּוֹר — אָסוּר לְכַסּוֹת בּוֹ צוֹאָה. תִּסְתַּיַּים.
human_translation: Conclude that Rava is the one who said a koy is similar to excrement, as Rava said: brought in earth to cover excrement with it, it is permitted to cover the blood of a bird with it; the blood of a bird, it is prohibited to cover excrement with it. conclude
llm_translation: The conclusion of Rava, who said: "If one intended to cover with it (a certain object) dung, it is like a covering of earth." For Rava said: "If one brought in dust to cover dung with it, it is permitted to cover with it the blood of a bird; the blood of a bird, however, it is forbidden to cover with it dung." The conclusion is: "The matter is settled."

hebrew_text: רָמֵי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יֵיבָא אָמַר: כּוֹי הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּלָא מְכַסֵּינַן, גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם הַתָּרַת חֶלְבּוֹ.
human_translation: Rami, son of Rav Yeiva, said a koy , this is the reasoning that one may not cover it is decree due to the permission of its fat.
llm_translation: Ramei, son of Rav Yeiva, said: "This is the reason we do not cover it, a decree due to the permission of its fat."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ בְּחוֹל נָמֵי! בַּחוֹל אָמְרִי לְנַקֵּר חֲצֵרוֹ הוּא צָרִיךְ.
human_translation: If so, even on a weekday as well, On a weekday, say he needs to clean his courtyard,
llm_translation: If so, even on a weekday! On a weekday, they say one must dig his courtyard.

hebrew_text: שָׁחַט בְּאַשְׁפָּה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? בָּא לִימָּלֵךְ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: he slaughtered in a dunghill, what is there to say? he comes to consult what is there to say?
llm_translation: He slaughtered in the refuse, what is there to say? He came to salt, what is there to say?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: בְּחוֹל [אִי נָמֵי] מִסְּפֵקָא, אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: זִיל טְרַח וְכַסִּי. בְּיוֹם טוֹב אִי מִסְּפֵקָא — מִי אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן זִיל טְרַח וְכַסִּי?
human_translation: Rather, On a weekday, even if is uncertain, the Sages say to him: Go take the trouble and cover On a Festival, if uncertainty, would the Sages say to him: Go take the trouble and cover
llm_translation: Rather: on a weekday specifically, due to doubt, the Rabbis say to him: Go and exert yourself. On a festival, if it is due to doubt — who said to him, the Rabbis, go and exert yourself?

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַבִּי זֵירָא: לֹא כּוֹי בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ שָׁחַט בְּהֵמָה, חַיָּה וָעוֹף וְנִתְעָרְבוּ דָּמָן זֶה בָּזֶה — אָסוּר לְכַסּוֹתוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira teaches Not only did say a koy but even if one slaughtered a domesticated animal, an undomesticated animal or a fowl, and their bloods became mingled together, prohibited to cover on a Festival.
llm_translation: It was taught by Rabbi Zeira: Not only with a knife alone did they say, but even if one slaughtered a beast, a wild animal, or a bird, and their bloods mingled with one another - it is forbidden to cover it on a festival day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יָאסִינִיאָה: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין יָכוֹל לְכַסּוֹתוֹ בִּדְקִירָה אַחַת, אֲבָל יָכוֹל לְכַסּוֹתוֹ בִּדְקִירָה אַחַת — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Yasinia said: They taught only where one cannot cover by one thrust However, he can cover it with one thrust, it is permitted.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Yasinia said: They only taught that one cannot cover it with one piercing, but one can cover it with one piercing - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: נִגְזַר דְּקִירָה אַחַת אַטּוּ שְׁתֵּי דְקִירוֹת, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious lest you say we should decree one thrust, due to two thrusts. Rabbi Yosei bar Yasinia teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! What might you say: if one stabbing was decreed, yet two stabbings, it implies to us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: שָׁחַט צִפּוֹר מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב, אֵין מְכַסִּין אוֹתוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: Rabba said: slaughtered a bird on the eve of a Festival, one may not cover on the Festival
llm_translation: Rabba said: One who slaughters a bird on Erev Yom Tov, we do not cover it on Yom Tov.

hebrew_text: גִּלְגֵּל עִיסָּה מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — מַפְרִישׁ מִמֶּנָּה חַלָּתָהּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב. אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ גִּלְגֵּל עִיסָּה מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — אֵין מַפְרִישׁ מִמֶּנָּה חַלָּתָהּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: one kneaded dough on a Festival eve, he may separate its ḥalla on the Festival. Shmuel’s father said: Even one kneaded dough on a Festival eve, he may not separate its ḥalla on the Festival,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gilgel eisah me'erev yom tov - mafri'sh mimenna challatah be'yom tov. Abuh dishmu'el amar: afilu gilgel eisah me'erev yom tov - ein mafri'sh mimenna challatah be'yom tov." English translation: "A dough kneaded from the eve of a festival - one separates its challah on the festival day. Abuh the son of Shmuel said: even if a dough kneaded from the eve of a festival - one does not separate its challah on the festival day."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא פְּלִיגָא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל אַדַּאֲבוּהּ (דִּשְׁמוּאֵל). דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חַלַּת חוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, אוֹכֵל וְהוֹלֵךְ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַפְרִישׁ!
human_translation: Let us say that Shmuel disagrees with his father, as Shmuel said: to ḥalla from outside of Eretz one may proceed to eat and afterward separate
llm_translation: Let us say the dispute of Shmuel the father (of Shmuel). For Shmuel said: A loaf outside the land, one may eat and walk, and afterwards separate!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִי לֹא מוֹדֶה שְׁמוּאֵל שֶׁאִם קָרָא עָלֶיהָ שֵׁם שֶׁאֲסוּרָה לְזָרִים?
human_translation: Rava said: Doesn’t Shmuel concede that if one designated as it is prohibited to non-priests?
llm_translation: Rava said: Who does not agree with Shmuel that if one recites upon it a name that is forbidden to strangers?

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מוֹלִיכִין אֶת הַסּוּלָּם מִשּׁוֹבָךְ לְשׁוֹבָךְ, אֲבָל מַטֵּהוּ מֵחַלּוֹן לְחַלּוֹן. וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: One may not carry a ladder, from one dovecote to another. However, he tilts it from one window to another And Beit Hillel permit
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Beit Shammai say: One may not carry a ladder from one window to another, but one may tilt it from one window to another. Beit Hillel permit it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר אַמֵּי: מַחְלוֹקֶת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: הָרוֹאֶה אוֹמֵר לְהָטִיחַ גַּגּוֹ הוּא צָרִיךְ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: שׁוֹבָכוֹ מוֹכִיחַ עָלָיו. אֲבָל בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanan bar Ami said: dispute in the public domain, as Beit Shammai hold one who sees say He need to plaster his roof, And Beit Hillel hold his dovecote proves about him However, in the private domain, everyone agrees it is permitted.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Hanan bar Ammi said: Dispute in a public domain, Beit Shammai hold: One who sees says to plaster his roof, and Beit Hillel hold: His neighbor rebukes him. But in a private domain — all agree it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאָסְרוּ חֲכָמִים מִפְּנֵי מַרְאִית הָעַיִן, אֲפִילּוּ בְּחַדְרֵי חֲדָרִים אָסוּר! תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: שׁוֹטְחָן בַּחַמָּה, אֲבָל לֹא כְּנֶגֶד הָעָם. רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר) וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹסְרִין.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rav Yehuda say Rav said: Wherever the Sages prohibited due to the appearance even in innermost chamber, prohibited. is tanna’im , as it is taught may spread them out in the sun, but he may not opposite the masses, Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon prohibit
llm_translation: I am not? But didn't Rav Yehudah say in the name of Rav: Any place where the sages prohibited due to the appearance of impropriety, even in innermost chambers it is prohibited! It is a teaching of the Tannaim: As long as they are warming themselves by the sun, but not opposite the people. Rabbi (Eliezer) and Rabbi Shimon prohibit.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר אַמֵּי: מַחְלוֹקֶת בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד, דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי אִית לְהוּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, וּבֵית הִלֵּל לֵית לְהוּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, אֲבָל בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אָסוּר.
human_translation: Some say Rav Ḥanan bar Ami said: dispute to the private domain, as Beit Shammai are of Rav Yehuda Rav said, And Beit Hillel, are of not Rav Yehuda Rav said. However, in the public domain, everyone agrees prohibited
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rav Hanan bar Ammi said: The dispute is in private domain, for Beit Shammai have Rav Yehudah who said in the name of Rav, and Beit Hillel do not have Rav Yehudah who said in the name of Rav, but in public domain — everyone agrees it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רַב דְּאָמַר כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי?
human_translation: Should we say stated in accordance with Beit Shammai?
llm_translation: Let us say, Rav said, like Beit Shammai?

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: שׁוֹטְחָן בַּחַמָּה, אֲבָל לֹא כְּנֶגֶד הָעָם. רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר) וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹסְרִין.
human_translation: it is tanna’im , as it is taught one may spread them out in the sun but not opposite the masses. Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon prohibit
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: One may smear oil in the sun, but not in front of the people. Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon prohibit doing so.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: מוֹדִים בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל שֶׁמּוֹלִיכִין אֶת הַסּוּלָּם מִשּׁוֹבָךְ לְשׁוֹבָךְ. לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא לְהַחְזִיר, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מַחְזִירִין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אַף מַחְזִירִין.
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel agree that one may carry a ladder from one dovecote to another they disagree only to replace as Beit Shammai say: One may not replace and Beit Hillel say: One may even replace
llm_translation: Mishnah: that not like this Tanna, as it was taught, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel agree that one may lead the ladder from one window to another. They only disagreed in order to return it. Beit Shammai says: One may not return it, and Beit Hillel says: One may return it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּסוּלָּם שֶׁל שׁוֹבָךְ, אֲבָל בְּסוּלָּם שֶׁל עֲלִיָּה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אָסוּר. רַבִּי דּוֹסָא אוֹמֵר: מַטֵּהוּ מֵחַלּוֹן לְחַלּוֹן. אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי דּוֹסָא: אַף מְדַדִּין בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: In what is this statement said? With regard to a dovecote ladder, However, of an attic ladder, everyone agrees prohibited, Rabbi Dosa says: One may tilt it from one window to another Aḥerim say in the name of Rabbi Dosa: One may even shift
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: In what case are these words spoken? In the ladder of a window, but in the ladder of a roof — everyone agrees that it is forbidden. Rabbi Dosa says: One may move it from window to window. Others say in the name of Rabbi Dosa: They even measure it.

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא נְפוּק לְקִרְיָיתָא. כִּי אֲתוֹ, אֲמַר לְהוּ אֲבוּהוֹן: כְּלוּם מַעֲשֶׂה בָּא לְיֶדְכֶם? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: סוּלָּם בָּא לְיָדֵינוּ, וְהִתַּרְנוּהוּ. אָמַר לָהֶם: צְאוּ וְאִסְרוּ מַה שֶּׁהִתַּרְתֶּם.
human_translation: The sons of Rabbi Ḥiyya went out to the villages When they came their father said to them: Did any incident come to your They said to him: ladder came to our and we permitted it. said to them: Go out and prohibit that which you permitted.
llm_translation: Sons of Rabbi Chiya went out to the village. When they came, their father said to them: Has anything come into your possession? They said to him: A ladder came into our possession, and we removed it. He said to them: Go out and prohibit what you have permitted.

hebrew_text: אִינְהוּ סְבוּר: מִדְּקָא אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּסוּלָּם שֶׁל עֲלִיָּה לָא פְּלִיגִי, מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר פְּלִיגִי. וְלָא הִיא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה טַעְמֵיהּ דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא קָא מְפָרֵשׁ.
human_translation: thought from that Rabbi Yehuda said do not disagree with regard to an attic ladder, by inference that first tanna holds they disagree. But that is not so, Rabbi Yehuda he explains reason of the first tanna .
llm_translation: They thought: Since Rabbi Yehuda said regarding the ladder of Aliyah they do not disagree, from the fact that the first Tanna holds they do disagree. And it is not so, Rabbi Yehuda's reasoning is explained by the first Tanna.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי, מִדְּקָתָנֵי: מוֹלִיכִין אֶת הַסּוּלָּם מִשּׁוֹבָךְ לְשׁוֹבָךְ, וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בְּסוּלָּם שֶׁל עֲלִיָּה פְּלִיגִי, הַאי ״מוֹלִיכִין אֶת הַסּוּלָּם מִשּׁוֹבָךְ לְשׁוֹבָךְ״, ״מוֹלִיכִין אֶת הַסּוּלָּם לְשׁוֹבָךְ״ מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ. אֶלָּא לָאו הָכִי קָאָמַר: שֶׁל שׁוֹבָךְ — אִין, שֶׁל עֲלִיָּה — לָא.
human_translation: From where From that teaches: One may carry a ladder from one dovecote to another. And if it enters your mind disagree with regard to an attic ladder, this One may carry a ladder from one dovecote to another, should One may carry a ladder to a dovecote. Rather, isn’t this what said: a dovecote yes, an attic no,
llm_translation: From what is it derived, from what is it taught: "They bring the ladder from your lower level to your higher level, and if your intention is regarding the ladder of ascent, the following question arises: this statement 'they bring the ladder from your lower level to your higher level,' 'they bring the ladder to your higher level' - what does he require to teach? Rather, is this not what he is saying: regarding your lower level - yes, regarding the ladder of ascent - no.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: מִי קָתָנֵי ״סוּלָּם שֶׁל שׁוֹבָךְ״? ״מִשּׁוֹבָךְ לְשׁוֹבָךְ״ קָתָנֵי, וַאֲפִילּוּ לְכַמָּה שׁוֹבָכִין.
human_translation: And the others, Is it taught A dovecote ladder? teaches: From one dovecote to another, and even to several dovecotes.
llm_translation: And the other opinion: Who is the one who teaches "ladder of Shovakh"? It teaches "from Shovakh to Shovakh," and even to how many Shovakhim.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: הִטּוּי סוּלָּם שֶׁל עֲלִיָּה בָּא לְיָדֵינוּ וְהִתַּרְנוּהוּ. אָמַר לָהֶם: צְאוּ וְאִסְרוּ מַה שֶּׁהִתַּרְתֶּם. אִינְהוּ סְבוּר: מַאי דְּקָא אָסַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא, קָא שָׁרֵי רַבִּי דּוֹסָא. וְלָא הִיא, מַאי דְּקָא שָׁרֵי תַּנָּא קַמָּא, קָא אָסַר רַבִּי דּוֹסָא.
human_translation: Some say said to him: The tilting of an attic ladder came to our and we permitted it. said to them: Go out and prohibit that which you permitted. they thought: That which the first tanna prohibits, Rabbi Dosa permits, And that is not so. that which the first tanna permits, Rabbi Dosa prohibits.
llm_translation: There is one who says, they said to him: a twisted ladder of ascent has come into our hands and we have untied it. He said to them: Go out and forbid that which you have permitted. They thought: what he forbade, the first Tanna permitted, Rabbi Dosa permitted. And it is not so, what the first Tanna permitted, Rabbi Dosa forbade.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מַטֵּהוּ מֵחַלּוֹן לְחַלּוֹן וְכוּ׳. אַלְמָא, גַּבֵּי שִׂמְחַת יוֹם טוֹב בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְחוּמְרָא וּבֵית הִלֵּל לְקוּלָּא.
human_translation: However, one may tilt from one window to another Apparently, with regard to rejoicing on the Festival, Beit Shammai is stringent, and Beit Hillel is lenient.
llm_translation: But his staff from window to window, etc. This implies that regarding the joy of a festival, Beit Shammai is stringent and Beit Hillel is lenient.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: הַשּׁוֹחֵט חַיָּה וָעוֹף בְּיוֹם טוֹב, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: יַחְפּוֹר בַּדָּקָר וִיכַסֶּה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יִשְׁחוֹט אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיָה לוֹ עָפָר מוּכָן מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction one who slaughters an undomesticated animal or a fowl on a Festival, Beit Shammai say: He may dig with a shovel and cover and Beit Hillel say: He may not slaughter unless he had earth prepared while it was still day.
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: One who slaughters a wild animal or bird on a festival, Beit Shammai say: He should dig a pit and cover it, and Beit Hillel say: He should not slaughter unless he had prepared dust from the day before.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוּחְלֶפֶת הַשִּׁיטָה. מִמַּאי: דִּלְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הָתָם, אֶלָּא הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא דָּקָר נָעוּץ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא דָּקָר נָעוּץ — לָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The opinions is reversed. From where Perhaps Beit Shammai say only there, where there is a shovel embedded However, where there is no embedded shovel, not
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The halachah follows the opinion of Beit Hillel. From where? Perhaps they only said this there, where there is a thick beam, but here, where there is no thick beam - no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי נָמֵי: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי בֵּית הִלֵּל הָכָא, אֶלָּא דְּשׁוֹבָכוֹ מוֹכִיחַ עָלָיו, אֲבָל הָתָם — לָא.
human_translation: Alternatively, Beit Hillel say only here, where his dovecote, proves to him but there, not
llm_translation: And if you will say: Until here, Beit Hillel did not say this, but rather Shovakho is proving against him, but there — no.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִי קַשְׁיָא — הָא קַשְׁיָא: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יִטּוֹל אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נִעְנַע מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: עוֹמֵד וְאוֹמֵר זֶה וְזֶה אֲנִי נוֹטֵל.
human_translation: Rather, If is difficult, this is difficult: Beit Shammai say: One may not take unless he shook while it was still day. And Beit Hillel say: stands and says: I take this and that
llm_translation: Rather, if it is difficult - here is the difficulty: Beit Shammai says: One may only take the Lulav if it has been shaken during the day, and Beit Hillel says: One stands and says, "I take both this one and that one."

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא, גַּבֵּי שִׂמְחַת יוֹם טוֹב בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְחוּמְרָא וּבֵית הִלֵּל לְקוּלָּא, וּרְמִינְהִי: הַשּׁוֹחֵט חַיָּה וָעוֹף בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוּחְלֶפֶת הַשִּׁיטָה.
human_translation: Apparently, with regard to rejoicing on the Festival, Beit Shammai is stringent and Beit Hillel is lenient. And raises a contradiction one who slaughters an undomesticated animal or a fowl on a Festival, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The the opinions is reversed.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Regarding the joy of a festival, Beit Shammai is stringent and Beit Hillel is lenient. And they raised a dilemma: One who slaughters an animal or bird on a festival, Rabbi Yochanan said: He has violated the prohibition of "mukhlefet hashitah" (improper slaughtering).

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא לָא הִיא: עַד כָּאן לָא אָמְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, אֶלָּא הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא דָּקָר נָעוּץ
human_translation: But perhaps that is not so, Beit Shammai only state where there is an embedded shovel.
llm_translation: Perhaps it is not so: Until here Beit Shammai did not say, but where there is a thin wall pierced.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא דָּקָר נָעוּץ — לָא. אִי נָמֵי: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי בֵּית הִלֵּל הָכָא, אֶלָּא כֵּיוָן דְּמוּקְצֶה הוּא, בְּעוֹמֵד וְאוֹמֵר זֶה וְזֶה אֲנִי נוֹטֵל סַגִּי. אֲבָל הָתָם — לָא.
human_translation: However, where there is no embedded shovel, not Alternatively, Beit Hillel say only here, since is muktze , when he stands and says: I will take this and that, enough. However there, not
llm_translation: But here where there is no thin wall — no. If you wish: until here Beit Hillel did not say here, rather since it is a case of a mixture, standing and saying, "I take this and this as a pledge." But there — no.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִי קַשְׁיָא — הָא קַשְׁיָא: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין נוֹטְלִין אֶת הָעֱלִי, לְקַצֵּב עָלָיו בָּשָׂר, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין. אַלְמָא גַּבֵּי שִׂמְחַת יוֹם טוֹב בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְחוּמְרָא וּבֵית הִלֵּל לְקוּלָּא, וּרְמִינְהִי הַשּׁוֹחֵט חַיָּה וָעוֹף, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וְכוּ׳! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוּחְלֶפֶת הַשִּׁיטָה.
human_translation: Rather, if there is a difficulty this is the difficulty, Beit Shammai say: One may not take a large pestle to cut meat on it; and Beit Hillel permit Apparently, with regard to rejoicing on the Festival, Beit Shammai is stringent, and Beit Hillel is lenient. And raises a contradiction: one who slaughters an undomesticated animal or a fowl on a Festival, Beit Shammai Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The opinions is reversed.
llm_translation: Rather, if it is difficult - here is the difficulty: Beit Shammai says: One does not take the fat, to place meat upon it, and Beit Hillel permits. This implies that regarding the joy of a festival, Beit Shammai is stringent and Beit Hillel is lenient. And they asked: One who slaughters a wild animal or bird, Beit Shammai and so forth! Rabbi Yochanan said: The halacha follows the opinion of Beit Hillel.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא לָא הִיא: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הָתָם אֶלָּא הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא דָּקָר נָעוּץ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא דָּקָר נָעוּץ — לָא, אִי נָמֵי: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי בֵּית הִלֵּל הָכָא אֶלָּא, דְּאִיכָּא תּוֹרַת כְּלִי עָלָיו, אֲבָל הָתָם לָא.
human_translation: From where Perhaps it is not so. Beit Shammai say only there, where there is a shovel embedded but where there is no embedded shovel, not Alternatively, Beit Hillel say only here, which has the status of a vessel, However, there, not
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps it is not so. Until here, Beit Shammai does not say there, but where there is a thick beam, yes, but where there is no thick beam, no, if you wish: Until here, Beit Hillel does not say here, but where there is a Torah of a vessel upon it, but there, no.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִי קַשְׁיָא — הָא קַשְׁיָא: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין נוֹתְנִין אֶת הָעוֹר לִפְנֵי הַדּוֹרְסָן, וְלֹא יַגְבִּיהֶנּוּ אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן יֵשׁ עָלָיו כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר. וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין.
human_translation: Rather, if there is a difficulty, this is the difficulty: Beit Shammai say: One may not place hide before those who tread on it, And one may not lift unless there is an olive-bulk of meat on it, And Beit Hillel permit
llm_translation: Rather, if it is difficult - here is the difficulty: Beit Shammai says: One may not place the skin before the tanner, nor may he lift it up unless there is the size of an olive of flesh upon it. And Beit Hillel permits.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא, גַּבֵּי שִׂמְחַת יוֹם טוֹב בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְחוּמְרָא וּבֵית הִלֵּל לְקוּלָּא, וּרְמִינְהִי: הַשּׁוֹחֵט חַיָּה וְעוֹף בְּיוֹם טוֹב וְכוּ׳, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוּחְלֶפֶת הַשִּׁיטָה.
human_translation: Apparently, with regard to rejoicing on the Festival, Beit Shammai is stringent, and Beit Hillel is lenient. And raises a contradiction: one who slaughters an undomesticated animal or a fowl on a Festival, etc. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The opinions is reversed.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: With regard to the joy of a festival, Beit Shammai is stringent and Beit Hillel is lenient. And it was raised as a dilemma: One who slaughters an animal or bird on a festival, etc. Rabbi Yochanan said: The halachah is in accordance with the lenient opinion.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא לָא הִיא: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הָתָם אֶלָּא הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא דָּקָר נָעוּץ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא דָּקָר נָעוּץ — לָא. אִי נָמֵי: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי בֵּית הִלֵּל הָכָא, אֶלָּא דַּחֲזֵי לְמִזְגֵּא עִלָּוֵיהּ, אֲבָל הָתָם לָא.
human_translation: From where Perhaps that is not so. Beit Shammai say only there, where there is a shovel embedded but where there is no embedded shovel, not Alternatively, Beit Hillel say only here, which is suitable to recline upon, However, there, not
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps it is not so. Until here, Beit Shammai did not say there, but where there is a thick beam, yes, but where there is no thick beam, no. If you wish: Until here, Beit Hillel did not say here, but when it appears like a pouring on it, yes, but there, no.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִי קַשְׁיָא — הָא קַשְׁיָא: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מְסַלְּקִין אֶת הַתְּרִיסִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין אַף לְהַחְזִיר. אַלְמָא, גַּבֵּי שִׂמְחַת יוֹם טוֹב בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְחוּמְרָא וּבֵית הִלֵּל לְקוּלָּא, וּרְמִינְהִי: הַשּׁוֹחֵט חַיָּה וְעוֹף בְּיוֹם טוֹב וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: Rather, if there is a difficulty, this is the difficulty, Beit Shammai say: One may not remove shutters on a Festival, and Beit Hillel permit even to replace Apparently, with regard to rejoicing on the Festival, Beit Shammai is stringent, and Beit Hillel is lenient. And raises a contradiction: one who slaughters an undomesticated animal or a fowl on a Festival, etc.
llm_translation: Rather, if it is difficult - here is the difficulty: Beit Shammai says: one may not remove the entrails on a festival, and Beit Hillel permits even to return. This implies that regarding the joy of a festival, Beit Shammai is stringent and Beit Hillel is lenient. And they raised a dilemma: one who slaughters an animal or bird on a festival, etc.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אַבֵּית שַׁמַּאי לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָתָם דְּאִיכָּא דָּקָר נָעוּץ, הָכָא לֵיכָּא דָּקָר נָעוּץ. אֶלָּא בֵּית הִלֵּל אַבֵּית הִלֵּל קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: Granted, Beit Shammai Beit Shammai not difficult, There, where there is a shovel embedded here, there is no embedded shovel, However, Beit Hillel Beit Hillel difficult.
llm_translation: In truth, Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel are not in disagreement: there, where there is a thick beam, here, where there is a thick beam. Rather, Beit Hillel and Beit Hillel are in disagreement!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוּחְלֶפֶת הַשִּׁיטָה. (אִי נָמֵי:) עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי בֵּית הִלֵּל הָכָא, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין בִּנְיָן בְּכֵלִים וְאֵין סְתִירָה בְּכֵלִים. אֲבָל הָתָם — לָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The the opinions is reversed. Alternatively, Beit Hillel say only here, because that there is no building with regard to vessels and there is no dismantling with regard to vessels, However, there, not
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The interchanging of the species. (If you wish to say:) Until here, Beit Hillel did not say here, but because there is no building with vessels and no contradiction with vessels. But there — no.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יִטּוֹל אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נִעְנַע מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: עוֹמֵד וְאוֹמֵר ״זֶה וָזֶה אֲנִי נוֹטֵל״.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: One may not take unless he shook while it was still day, And Beit Hillel say: stands and says: I take this and that
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Beit Shammai say: One may only take the Lulav if it has been shaken from the day before. Beit Hillel say: One stands and says, "I take both this and that."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר אַמֵּי: מַחְלוֹקֶת בִּבְרִיכָה רִאשׁוֹנָה, דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: גָּזְרִינַן דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְאִמְּלוֹכֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanan bar Ami said: dispute to first brood, As Beit Shammai hold: We issue a decree perhaps he will come to reconsider
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Hanan bar Ammi said: The dispute in the first pool, the House of Shammai holds: We decree lest one come to wring out.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: לָא גָּזְרִינַן. אֲבָל בִּבְרִיכָה שְׁנִיָּה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל בְּעוֹמֵד וְאוֹמֵר ״זֶה וָזֶה אֲנִי נוֹטֵל״ סַגִּיא.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel hold: We do not issue a decree, However, with regard to the second brood, everyone agrees enough to stand and say: I take this and that
llm_translation: House of Hillel hold: we do not decree. But in a second pool - the words of everyone are while standing and saying "this and this I take" is significant.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל — לְמָה לֵיהּ לְמֵימַר ״זֶה וָזֶה אֲנִי נוֹטֵל״? לֵימָא: ״מִכָּאן אֲנִי נוֹטֵל לְמָחָר״?
human_translation: And Beit Hillel, why does one need to say: I take this and that Let him say: From here, I will take tomorrow.
llm_translation: House of Hillel - why does it need to say "this and this I take"? Say: "from here I take for tomorrow"?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא בֵּית הִלֵּל לֵית לְהוּ בְּרֵירָה, וְהָתְנַן: הַמֵּת בַּבַּיִת וְלוֹ פְּתָחִים הַרְבֵּה — כּוּלָּן טְמֵאִים.
human_translation: And if you say Beit Hillel do not accept designation, but didn’t we learn a corpse in a house, and has many entrances, all are ritually impure
llm_translation: And if you will say, Beit Hillel does not have free choice, and we learned: One who dies in a house and there are many openings - all of them are impure.

hebrew_text: נִפְתַּח אֶחָד מֵהֶן, הוּא טָמֵא, וְכוּלָּן טְהוֹרִין. חִשֵּׁב לְהוֹצִיאוֹ בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן, אוֹ בְּחַלּוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה — מַצֶּלֶת עַל כׇּל הַפְּתָחִים כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: one of was open is ritually impure, and all ritually pure. one decided to remove through one of or through a window that is four by four spares all the entrances
llm_translation: One of them opened, he is impure, and all of them are pure. If he intended to take it out through one of them, or through a window that has four by four — a covering over all the openings, all of them.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: וְהוּא שֶׁחִשֵּׁב לְהוֹצִיאוֹ עַד שֶׁלֹּא יָמוּת הַמֵּת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אַף מִשֶּׁיָּמוּת הַמֵּת.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: This if one had decided to remove before the person died, And Beit Hillel say: even after the person died,
llm_translation: Beit Shammai say: "And he who intends to exempt him until the dead person dies." And Beit Hillel say: "Even after the dead person dies."

hebrew_text: הָא אִתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַבָּה: לְטַהֵר אֶת הַפְּתָחִים מִכָּאן וּלְהַבָּא. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: לְטַהֵר אֶת הַפְּתָחִים מִכָּאן וּלְהַבָּא. מִכָּאן וּלְהַבָּא — אִין, לְמַפְרֵעַ — לָא.
human_translation: Wasn’t it stated with regard to this Rabba said: to purifying the entrances from that point forward. And, so too, Rav Oshaya said: to purifying the entrances from that point forward, From here onward, yes, retroactively, no,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a contradiction: Rabba said: To purify the openings, from here and onwards. And so too Rabbi Oshaya said: To purify the openings, from here and onwards. From here and onwards - yes, to retract - no.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם לְמַפְרֵעַ, וְהָכָא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא: דִּלְמָא מְטַלְטֵל וְשָׁבֵיק, מְטַלְטֵל וְשָׁבֵיק, וְקָא מְטַלְטֵל מִידֵּי דְּלָא חֲזֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava said Actually, retroactively. And here, this is the reason Perhaps one will move and put down, move and put down moving an object that is not suitable for him,
llm_translation: Rava said: Always be bold, and here is the reason: perhaps one will move away and leave, move away and leave, and he will move away before one sees him.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ — בְּעוֹמֵד וְאוֹמֵר ״זֶה וָזֶה אֲנִי נוֹטֵל״ סַגִּיא! הָנֵי מִילֵּי מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב,
human_translation: But didn’t you say it is enough one stands and says: I take this and that This applies only on the eve of the Festival.
llm_translation: And she said - when standing and saying "This and this I take" - this is a great matter! These matters are from the eve of a festival day,

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בְּיוֹם טוֹב אָסוּר, דְּזִימְנִין דְּמִשְׁתַּכְחִי שְׁמֵנִים כְּחוּשִׁים וּכְחוּשִׁים שְׁמֵנִים, וְקָמְטַלְטֵל מִידֵּי דְּלָא חֲזֵי לֵיהּ. אִי נָמֵי זִימְנִין דְּמִשְׁתַּכְחִי כֻּלְּהוּ כְּחוּשִׁים וְשָׁבֵיק לְהוּ, וְאָתֵי לְאִמְּנוֹעֵי מִשִּׂמְחַת יוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: However, on the Festival prohibited, as sometimes fat ones will be found thin, and thin ones fat, and he move an object that is not suitable for him, Alternatively, sometimes they will all be found thin, and he will leave them and he will come to neglect the rejoicing of the Festival.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But on a festival day it is forbidden, because sometimes one might mix fine oils with inferior oils, or inferior oils with fine oils, and he will remove it from where it is not seen. Or if sometimes he mixes all of them together, fine oils and he leaves them, and he comes to deny from the joy of the festival.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ זִמֵּן שְׁחוֹרִים וּמָצָא לְבָנִים, לְבָנִים וּמָצָא שְׁחוֹרִים, שְׁנַיִם וּמָצָא שְׁלֹשָׁה — אֲסוּרִים. שְׁלֹשָׁה וּמָצָא שְׁנַיִם — מוּתָּרִים.
human_translation: designated black and found white white and found black two and found three, they are prohibited, three and found two, they are permitted,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one designated black animals and found white ones, or designated white animals and found black ones, or designated two animals and found three - they are forbidden. If one designated three animals and found two, they are permitted.

hebrew_text: בְּתוֹךְ הַקֵּן וּמָצָא לִפְנֵי הַקֵּן — אֲסוּרִין, וְאִם אֵין שָׁם אֶלָּא הֵם — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מוּתָּרִים.
human_translation: inside the nest and he found before the nest, they are prohibited, But if there are only those they are permitted,
llm_translation: Within the nest and found before the nest - prohibited, but if there are only they there - behold, these are permitted.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ פְּשִׁיטָא! אָמַר רַבָּה: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן שֶׁזִּמֵּן שְׁחוֹרִים וּלְבָנִים, וְהִשְׁכִּים וּמָצָא שְׁחוֹרִים בִּמְקוֹם לְבָנִים וּלְבָנִים בִּמְקוֹם שְׁחוֹרִים. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָנֵי אִינְהוּ נִינְהוּ וְאִתְהֲפוֹכֵי אִתְהֲפוּךְ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: הָנָךְ אֲזַדוּ לְעָלְמָא, וְהָנֵי אַחֲרִינֵי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: obvious Rabba said: With what are we dealing here? where one designated black and white and he arose and found black ones in the place white ones and white ones in place black ones. Lest you say: These are those and exchanged teaches us these have gone to the world, and these are others
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, it is obvious! Rabah said: Here we are dealing with what? For example, one who hired workers, black ones and white ones, and he woke up and found black ones in the place of white ones and white ones in the place of black ones. What might you say? These are they and these are they, and they switched, you might think. It teaches us: You will depart to the world, and others will come after you."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: רוֹב וְקָרוֹב — הַלֵּךְ אַחַר הָרוֹב!
human_translation: Let us say that supports Rabbi Ḥanina, as Rabbi Ḥanina said: majority proximate follows the majority.
llm_translation: Let us say, it assists for Rabbi Chanina. For Rabbi Chanina said: Majority and proximity - follow the majority!

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי — בְּדַף, הָכָא נָמֵי — בְּדַף.
human_translation: as Abaye said on a ledge, Here too, to a ledge.
llm_translation: As Abaye said - in the page, here we say - in the page.

hebrew_text: שְׁנַיִם וּמָצָא שְׁלֹשָׁה — אֲסוּרִין. מָה נַפְשָׁךְ: אִי אַחֲרִינֵי נִינְהוּ — הָא אַחֲרִינֵי נִינְהוּ, וְאִי לָא אַחֲרִינֵי נִינְהוּ — הָא אִיכָּא חַד דִּמְעָרַב בְּהוּ.
human_translation: two and found three, they are prohibited. Whichever you If these are others, they are others And if they are not others, there is one that is mingled with them,
llm_translation: Two and found three - prohibited. What is your opinion: if they are considered others - they are considered others, and if they are not considered others - there is one that is mixed in with them.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה וּמָצָא שְׁנַיִם מוּתָּרִין. מַאי טַעְמָא? הָנֵי אִינְהוּ נִינְהוּ, וְחַד מִנַּיְיהוּ אֲזַל לְעָלְמָא.
human_translation: three and found two, they are permitted. What is the reason These are the same ones, and one of them has gone to the world,
llm_translation: Three and found two permitted. What is the reason? Those are they, and one of them went to the world.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי הִיא וְלָא רַבָּנַן, דְּתַנְיָא: הִנִּיחַ מָנֶה וּמָצָא מָאתַיִם — חוּלִּין וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי מְעוֹרָבִין זֶה בָּזֶה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הַכֹּל חוּלִּין.
human_translation: Let us say that the mishna is Rabbi and not the Rabbis, as it is taught placed one hundred dinars and found two hundred non-sacred and second-tithe mingled together. the statement of Rabbi And the Rabbis say: It is all non-sacred
llm_translation: Let us say, it is a teaching of Rabbi and not of the Rabbis, as it was taught: If one set aside a hundred and found two hundred — the ordinary and the second tithe are mixed together, according to the words of Rabbi. And the Sages say: All of it is ordinary produce.

hebrew_text: הִנִּיחַ מָאתַיִם וּמָצָא מָנֶה, מָנֶה מוּנָּח וּמָנֶה מוּטָל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הַכֹּל חוּלִּין!
human_translation: placed two hundred and found one hundred dinars, one hundred dinars has been left and one hundred dinars removed. the statement of Rabbi And the Rabbis say: It is all non-sacred
llm_translation: He placed two and found one, one placed and one found, the words of Rabbi. And the sages say: everything is permissible!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, הָא אִתְּמַר עֲלַהּ: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: שָׁאנֵי גּוֹזָלוֹת, הוֹאִיל וַעֲשׂוּיִין לְדַדּוֹת.
