human_translation: Even you say the Rabbis, it was stated with regard to this Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar both say: Fledglings are different, since they typically hop
llm_translation: Even if you say it is the opinion of the Rabbis, it was stated about it: Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar both said: The case of shearing, since they are made for their own sake.

hebrew_text: וּלְמָה לִי לְשַׁנּוֹיֵי עֲלַהּ שָׁאנֵי גּוֹזָלוֹת הוֹאִיל וַעֲשׂוּיִין לְדַדּוֹת? וְהָא אִתְּמַר עֲלַהּ דְּהַהִיא, דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, חַד אָמַר: בִּשְׁנֵי כִיסִין מַחְלוֹקֶת, אֲבָל בְּכִיס אֶחָד — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל חוּלִּין. וְחַד אָמַר: בְּכִיס אֶחָד מַחְלוֹקֶת, אֲבָל בִּשְׁנֵי כִיסִין — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מָנֶה מוּנָּח וּמָנֶה מוּטָל.
human_translation: And why do I to answer with regard to it: Fledglings are different, since they typically hop? But wasn’t it stated with regard to that that Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar One said: dispute to two pouches, However, in a single pouch, everyone agrees non-sacred And one said: dispute to one pouch, but with regard to two pouches, everyone agrees one hundred dinars is left and one hundred dinars removed.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And why do I need to differentiate regarding the leaves that are stolen, since they are fit for bundles? But it was stated regarding leaves that Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar, one said: In two pockets there is a dispute, but in one pocket - everyone agrees they are permitted. And one said: In one pocket there is a dispute, but in two pockets - everyone agrees one is set aside and one is thrown."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בִּשְׁנֵי כִיסִין מַחְלוֹקֶת, הַיְינוּ דְּאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְשַׁנּוֹיֵי הָכָא שָׁאנֵי גּוֹזָלוֹת הוֹאִיל וַעֲשׂוּיִין לְדַדּוֹת. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּכִיס אֶחָד מַחְלוֹקֶת, אֲבָל בִּשְׁנֵי כִיסִין דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מָנֶה מוּנָּח וּמָנֶה מוּטָל — הַשְׁתָּא לְמָה לִי לְשַׁנּוֹיֵי עֲלַהּ? הָא אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁנֵי כִיסִין לָא פְּלִיגִי!
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said dispute of two pouches, this is it was necessary to answer here: Fledglings are different, since they typically hop. However, according to the one who says dispute of one pouch, but with regard to two pouches everyone agrees one hundred dinars is left and one hundred dinars removed, now Why do I to answer, with regard to it, You said they do not disagree with regard to two pouches,
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says there is a dispute in two purses, this is necessary to change here, as the case of stolen items is different since they are made for their own purposes. But according to the one who says there is a dispute in one purse, but in two purses, everyone agrees that one purse is designated and one is not designated - now why do I need to change the matter? You said that in two purses they do not disagree!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הָכָא בְּגוֹזָלוֹת מְקוּשָּׁרִים וְכִיסִים מְקוּשָּׁרִים עָסְקִינַן. גּוֹזָלוֹת — מְנַתְּחִי אַהֲדָדֵי, כִּיסִין — לָא מְנַתְּחִי אַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Here we are dealing with fledglings tied and pouches tied Fledglings release themselves from each other, pouches cannot release themselves from each other.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Here we are dealing with gizalot that are tied and kisim that are tied. We are dealing with gizalot - the cutting of the sinews, kisim - we are not dealing with the cutting of the sinews.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אָמַר לָךְ: כִּיסִין נָמֵי, זִמְנִין
human_translation: But And Rabbi said to you: Pouches, too, sometimes
llm_translation: And Rabbi said to you: Kis'in namei, zimnin.

hebrew_text: דְּמִתְעַכַּל קִטְרַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: their knot becomes worn
llm_translation: Their incense became putrid.

hebrew_text: בְּתוֹךְ הַקֵּן וּמָצָא לִפְנֵי הַקֵּן — אֲסוּרִין. לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: רוֹב וְקָרוֹב — הַלֵּךְ אַחַר הָרוֹב!
human_translation: inside the nest and found before the nest, they are prohibited. Let us say that this supports Rabbi Ḥanina, as Rabbi Ḥanina said: a majority and near, follows the majority.
llm_translation: Within the nest and found before the nest - prohibited. Let us say it supports for Rabbi Chanina, for Rabbi Chanina said: Follow the majority and the near!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בְּדַף. רָבָא אָמַר: בִּשְׁנֵי קִנִּין זוֹ לְמַעְלָה מִזּוֹ עָסְקִינַן. וְלָא מִבַּעְיָא זִמֵּן בַּתַּחְתּוֹנָה וְלֹא זִמֵּן בָּעֶלְיוֹנָה, וּמָצָא בַּתַּחְתּוֹנָה וְלֹא מָצָא בָּעֶלְיוֹנָה — דַּאֲסִירָן, דְּאָמְרִינַן: הָנָךְ אֲזַלוּ לְעָלְמָא, וְהָנָךְ אִשְׁתְּרַבּוֹבֵי אִשְׁתַּרְבּוּב וּנְחוּת.
human_translation: Abaye said, with a ledge Rava said: we are dealing with two nests, one above the other, And it is not necessary one designated the lower and did not designate in the upper one, and he found in the lower one and he did not find in the upper one, that are prohibited. that we say: These went to the world, while these have dragged themselves and come down.
llm_translation: Abaye said: on page. Rava said: with two acquisitions, this one above that one we are dealing. And not required time in the lower one and not time in the upper one, and found in the lower one and not found in the upper one - it is forbidden, as we say: this one goes to the world, and this one multiplies and diminishes.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ זִמֵּן בָּעֶלְיוֹנָה וְלֹא זִמֵּן בַּתַּחְתּוֹנָה, וּבָא וּמָצָא בָּעֶלְיוֹנָה וְלֹא מָצָא בַּתַּחְתּוֹנָה — הָנָךְ נָמֵי אֲסִירִי, דְּאָמְרִינַן: הָנָךְ אֲזַלוּ לְעָלְמָא, וְהָנָךְ סָרוֹכֵי סָרוּךְ וּסְלִיקוּ.
human_translation: Rather, even if one designated in the upper and did not designate in the lower and he came and found in the upper one and did not find in the lower one, those are also prohibited, as we say: Those went to the world, and those have clutched and climbed.
llm_translation: Rather, even if he designated the upper one and did not designate the lower one, and he came and found the upper one but did not find the lower one — there, we say: there, they went to the world, and there, the locks were locked and they departed.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אֵין שָׁם אֶלָּא הֵן — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מוּתָּרִין. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא בִּמְפוֹרָחִין, אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר: הָנָךְ אֲזַלוּ לְעָלְמָא, וְהָנֵי אַחֲרִינֵי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: if there are no there apart from them, they are permitted. What are the circumstances? If we say with are able fly, it to say those went to the world, and the ones are other ones.
llm_translation: And if there are only hen there - these are permitted. How so? If you say they are in bloom, it can be said: those have gone to the world, and these are others.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּמִדַּדִּין. אִי דְּאִיכָּא קֵן בְּתוֹךְ חֲמִשִּׁים אַמָּה — אִדַּדּוֹיֵי אִדַּדּוֹ, וְאִי דְּלֵיכָּא קֵן בְּתוֹךְ חֲמִשִּׁים אַמָּה — פְּשִׁיטָא דְּמוּתָּרִין, דְּאָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא בַּר חָמָא: כׇּל הַמְדַדֶּה — אֵין מְדַדֶּה יוֹתֵר מֵחֲמִשִּׁים אַמָּה.
human_translation: Rather, to hop if where there is nest within fifty cubits, jumped and if there is no nest within fifty cubits, obvious they are permitted, As Mar Ukva bar Ḥama said: any that hops, does not hop more than fifty cubits.
llm_translation: Rather, in measurements. If there is a nest within fifty cubits - measure it, and if there is no nest within fifty cubits - it is obvious that they are permitted, as Mar Ukva bar Hama said: "Whoever measures - should not measure more than fifty cubits."

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם דְּאִיכָּא קֵן בְּתוֹךְ חֲמִשִּׁים אַמָּה, וּכְגוֹן דְּקָיְימָא בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אִדַּדּוֹיֵי אִדַּדּוֹ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּמִדַּדֵּה וַהֲדַר חָזֵי לְקִנֵּיהּ — מִדַּדֵּה, וְאִי לָא — לָא מִדַּדֵּה.
human_translation: Actually, where there is nest within fifty cubits, and where is situated around a corner Lest you say: jumped teaches us anywhere that hops and turns and sees its nest, it will hop. But if no it will not hop
llm_translation: Always there is a nest within fifty cubits, and for example, if it is established in a corner. What is the reason that you might say: "It is supported by itself, it is supported by itself," it teaches us wherever it is measured and then it looks to its nest - if it is measured, yes, if not - no.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין נוֹטְלִים אֶת הָעֱלִי לְקַצֵּב עָלָיו בָּשָׂר, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין נוֹתְנִין אֶת הָעוֹר לִפְנֵי הַדּוֹרְסָן. וְלֹא יַגְבִּיהֶנּוּ, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן יֵשׁ עִמּוֹ כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: One may not take a large pestle to cut meat on it; and Beit Hillel permit Beit Shammai say: One may not place hide before those who tread on it, And one may not lift unless there is an olive-bulk of meat on it, and Beit Hillel permit
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Beit Shammai say: One does not remove the fat from the meat to measure it against it, and Beit Hillel permit it. Beit Shammai say: One does not place the skin before the tanner, and one should not stretch it out unless there is with it an olive-bulk of meat, and Beit Hillel permit it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: וְשָׁוִין שֶׁאִם קִצֵּב עָלָיו בָּשָׂר — שֶׁאָסוּר לְטַלְטְלוֹ.
human_translation: taught And agree that if one cut meat on it is prohibited to move
llm_translation: Gemara: A Tanna taught: And it is equal that if one cut meat on it - it is forbidden to move it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בֶּעֱלִי, אֲבָל בְּתָבְרָא גַּרְמֵי — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מוּתָּר. פְּשִׁיטָא, עֱלִי תְּנַן!
human_translation: Abaye said: dispute in a pestle; however, in for breaking bones, everyone agrees it is permitted. obvious; we learned A pestle.
llm_translation: Abaye said: The dispute is regarding Ba'alei, but in the case of Tabra Garmei - everyone agrees it is permitted. It is obvious, we learned it in a Mishnah!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ תָּבְרָא גַּרְמֵי נָמֵי. וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי עֱלִי, לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחָן דְּבֵית הִלֵּל, דַּאֲפִילּוּ דָּבָר שֶׁמְּלַאכְתּוֹ לֶאֱסוֹר נָמֵי שָׁרוּ — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say: The same is true, even for breaking bones; and that which teaches: A pestle, to convey the far-reaching nature of Beit Hillel, they permitted even an object whose function for a prohibited teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? It is the same as that even if the cause of the prohibition is removed. And this that is taught regarding Eli, to inform you of the strength of the House of Hillel, that even a matter whose work is to prohibit, they permitted — this is what is implied to us.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ תָּבְרָא גַּרְמֵי חַדְתִּי, מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: מִמְּלֵךְ וְלָא תָּבַר עֲלַהּ — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Some say Abaye said: It is necessary only: Even a new for breaking bones Lest you say: one will reconsider and not break on it, teaches us
llm_translation: There are those who say, Abaye said: It is not necessary except even if new bones were created, what might you say: from a king and not from a commoner — it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי לָא חָיְישִׁי לְאִמְּלוֹכֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מוֹלִיכִין טַבָּח וְסַכִּין אֵצֶל בְּהֵמָה, וְלֹא בְּהֵמָה אֵצֶל טַבָּח וְסַכִּין. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מוֹלִיכִין זֶה אֵצֶל זֶה.
human_translation: And Are Beit Shammai not concerned that reconsider? But isn’t it taught Beit Shammai say: one may not lead a butcher with a knife to an animal nor an animal to a butcher with a knife, and Beit Hillel say: One may lead from one to the other,
llm_translation: House of Shammai not concerned for the consequences? And it was taught, House of Shammai say: One does not bring a butcher and a knife near an animal, nor an animal near a butcher and a knife. And House of Hillel say: One may bring this near that.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מוֹלִיכִין תַּבְלִין וּמָדוֹךְ אֵצֶל מְדוֹכָה, וְלֹא מְדוֹכָה אֵצֶל תַּבְלִין וּמָדוֹךְ. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מוֹלִיכִין זֶה אֵצֶל זֶה!
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: One may not bring spices or a pestle to a mortar, nor a mortar to spices and a pestle, And Beit Hillel say: One may bring one to the other,
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: One does not bring spices and grind them near the grinding stone, nor the grinding stone near the spices. And House of Hillel says: One may bring this near that!

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! בִּשְׁלָמָא בְּהֵמָה אָתֵי לְאִמְּלוֹכֵי, דְּאָמַר: נִשְׁבֹּק הַאי בְּהֵמָה כְּחוּשָׁה, וּמַיְיתֵינָא בְּהֵמָה אַחֲרִיתִי דְּשַׁמִּינָה מִינַּהּ. קְדֵרָה נָמֵי אָתֵי לְאִימְּלוֹכֵי, דְּאָמַר: נִשְׁבֹּק הַאי קְדֵרָה דְּבָעֲיָא תַּבְלִין, וּמַיְיתֵינָא אַחֲרִיתִי דְּלָא בָּעֲיָא תַּבְלִין. הָכָא מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? מִמְּלֵךְ וְלָא תָּבַר? כֵּיוָן דְּשַׁחְטַהּ — לִתְבִירָא קָיְימָא.
human_translation: How can be compared? Granted, an animal, one come to reconsider, as say: Let us leave this animal, thin, and we will bring a different animal, fatter than it. a pot, too, one to come to reconsider, as say: Let us leave this pot as requires spices and I will bring a different one that does not require spices here, what is there to say? reconsider and not break Since he has slaughtered stands to be broken,
llm_translation: So what is the comparison here?! Granted, when it comes to an animal, it is suitable for salting, as it is said: "This animal should be salted thoroughly," and we bring another animal that is similar to it. Similarly, when it comes to a pot, it is suitable for cooking spices, as it is said: "This pot requires spices," and we bring another one that does not require spices. What can be said here? From a king and not from a commoner? Once it is slaughtered, it is fit for cooking.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין נוֹתְנִין אֶת הָעוֹר. תָּנָא: וְשָׁוִין שֶׁמּוֹלְחִין עָלָיו בָּשָׂר לְצָלִי. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְצָלִי, אֲבָל לִקְדֵרָה — לֹא.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: One may not place hide taught And agree that one may salt meat for roasting on Abaye said: They taught only for roasting, However, for a pot, not
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: One does not place the skin. It was taught: And they are equal, for they spread meat on it for roasting. Abaye said: They only taught regarding roasting, but for a pot - no.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא — לְצָלִי תְּנַן! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דַּאֲפִילּוּ לְצָלִי, כְּעֵין קְדֵרָה — אָסוּר.
human_translation: obvious for we learned For roasting, This teach us that even for roasting in a manner of a pot, prohibited.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Peshita - l'tzali tenan! Ha ka mashma lan d'afilu l'tzali, ke'ein k'dera - asur. English translation: Obvious - for roasting we learned! This teaches us that even for roasting, like a pot - it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מוֹלְחִין אֶת הַחֲלָבִים וְאֵין מְהַפְּכִין בָּהֶן. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אֲמַרוּ: שׁוֹטְחָן בָּרוּחַ עַל גַּבֵּי יְתֵדוֹת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: one may not salt the fats And one may not turn them over. They said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: One may spread out in the wind on pegs
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One may not salt the fats, nor may one turn them over. In the name of Rabbi Yehoshua, they said: They spread them out in the wind on the pegs.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ — אִצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא יָחִיד וְרַבִּים הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּים, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן הֲלָכָה כְּיָחִיד.
human_translation: Rav Mattana said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua. Some say Rav Mattana said: The halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua. Granted, according to the one who said the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua, is necessary. it might enter your mind to say an individual and many, halakha is in accordance with many. teaches us halakha is in accordance with the individual.
llm_translation: Rav Matnah said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua. There are those who say, Rav Matnah said: The halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua. It is well according to the one who says the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua - it is necessary, for if your opinion were to be accepted that the halakha is in accordance with the individual against the majority, it would imply to us that the halakha is in accordance with the individual.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין הֲלָכָה — פְּשִׁיטָא, יָחִיד וְרַבִּים הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּים! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: מִסְתַּבַּר טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ דְּאִי לָא שָׁרֵית לֵיהּ מִמְּנַע וְלָא שָׁחֵיט, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: However, according to the one who said halakha is not in accordance with obvious. an individual and many, the halakha is in accordance with many. lest you say: Rabbi Yehoshua’s opinion is reasonable, for if you do not permit him he will refrain and not slaughter teaches us
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says the halakha is not like Rabbi Yehoshua — it is obvious, when there is a dispute between an individual and the majority, the halakha is like the majority! What might you say: It makes sense the reasoning of Rabbi Yehoshua, for if you would not permit it to him the individual from a prohibition and not even through ritual slaughter, it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מֵעוֹר לִפְנֵי הַדּוֹרְסָן?
human_translation: And what is different from a hide before those who will tread on it,
llm_translation: And what is the difference between "me'or" (skin) and "lifnei hadorsan"?

hebrew_text: הָתָם לָא מוֹכְחָא מִלְּתָא, מִשּׁוּם דַּחֲזֵי לְמִזְגֵּא עֲלֵיהּ. הָכָא אָתֵי לְמֵימַר: מַאי טַעְמָא שָׁרוּ לִי רַבָּנַן — כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לִסְרַח. מָה לִי לְמִשְׁטְחִינְהוּ, מָה לִי לְמִמְלְחִינְהוּ.
human_translation: There, the matter is not evident because it is fit to recline on, here, come to say: What is the reason the Sages permitted to me? So that it will not emit a foul odor. what to me spread them out, what to me salt them?
llm_translation: There, it is not a proof from the matter, because it appears like mixing on it. Here, it comes to say: What is the reason the Rabbis permitted me - so that it should not spoil. What do I need to smear them, what do I need to salt them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מוֹלֵחַ אָדָם כַּמָּה חֲתִיכוֹת בָּשָׂר בְּבַת אַחַת, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ אֶלָּא לַחֲתִיכָה אַחַת. רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה מַעֲרִים וּמָלַח גַּרְמָא גַּרְמָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: A person may salt several pieces of meat at one time, although he requires one piece, Rav Adda bar Ahava employ artifice and salt bone bone.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One may salt a person with how many pieces of meat in one bath, even though he only needs one piece. Rav Adda bar Ahava salts and salts each limb separately.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מְסַלְּקִין אֶת הַתְּרִיסִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין אַף לְהַחְזִיר.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: One may not remove shutters [ terisin ] on a Festival, And Beit Hillel permit even to replace
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Beit Shammai say: We do not remove the boards on a festival, and Beit Hillel permit even to return.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי תְּרִיסִין? אָמַר עוּלָּא: תְּרִיסֵי חֲנוּיוֹת.
human_translation: What shutters? Ulla said: shutters of shops.
llm_translation: Gemara: What are "terisin"? Ula said: Terisei chanuyot.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר עוּלָּא: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים הִתִּירוּ סוֹפָן מִשּׁוּם תְּחִלָּתָן, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: עוֹר לִפְנֵי הַדּוֹרְסָן, וּתְרִיסֵי חֲנוּיוֹת,
human_translation: And Ulla said: three matters, permitted whose result in order initial And these are hide before those tread on it, And shutters of shops
llm_translation: And Ula said: Three things were permitted at their end because of their beginning, and they are: skin before the tanner, and the straps of the shops.

hebrew_text: וַחֲזָרַת רְטִיָּה בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: And the replacement of a bandage in the Temple.
llm_translation: And the return of the retiyah in the Temple.

hebrew_text: וְרַחֲבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אַף הַפּוֹתֵחַ חָבִיתוֹ, וּמַתְחִיל בְּעִיסָּתוֹ עַל גַּב הָרֶגֶל —
human_translation: And Raḥava Rabbi Yehuda said: also who opens his barrel and begins his dough for the sake of the Festival.
llm_translation: And Rachava said Rabbi Yehuda: Also the one who opens his barrel, and begins with his dough on top of the foot —

hebrew_text: וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר יִגְמוֹר.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yehuda, who said: He may finish
llm_translation: And the statement of Rabbi Yehuda that he said: "Yigmor."

hebrew_text: עוֹר לִפְנֵי הַדּוֹרְסָן, תְּנֵינָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּבֵית הִלֵּל מִשּׁוּם דַּחֲזֵי לְמִזְגֵּא עֲלַיְיהוּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב נָמֵי — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן הִתִּירוּ סוֹפָן מִשּׁוּם תְּחִלָּתָן: דְּיוֹם טוֹב — אִין, דְּעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — לָא.
human_translation: We learned hide before those tread on it. Lest you say the reason of Beit Hillel because is fit for reclining on it, and even on the eve of the Festival, also teaches us permitted whose result in order initial on a Festival, yes, on the eve of a Festival, no,
llm_translation: Skin before the Dorsan, we have learned! What might you say, the reasons of Beit Hillel, because they see a mixture upon them, and even from the eve of a festival indeed — it is heard to us that they permitted their end because of their beginning: on a festival day — no, on the eve of a festival — yes.

hebrew_text: תְּרִיסִי חֲנוּיוֹת נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא [וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין אַף לְהַחְזִיר]! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּבֵית הִלֵּל מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין בִּנְיָן בְּכֵלִים וְאֵין סְתִירָה בְּכֵלִים, וַאֲפִילּוּ דְּבָתִּים נָמֵי — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן הִתִּירוּ סוֹפָן מִשּׁוּם תְּחִלָּתָן: דַּחֲנוּיוֹת — אִין, דְּבָתִּים — לָא.
human_translation: We learned shutters of shops as well, Beit Hillel permit even to replace them. Lest you say: Beit Hillel’s reason is that there is no building to vessels and no dismantling to vessels. and even of houses, also teaches us permitted whose result in order initial of shops, yes, of houses, no,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "T'risi chanuyot namei t'nina u'beit Hillel matirin af l'hachzir! Mahu d'teima tamaiyehu d'beit Hillel mi'shum d'ein binyan b'kelim v'ein setirah b'kelim, va'afilu d'vatim namei — ka mashma lan hitiru sofam mi'shum techilatan: d'chanuyot — ein, d'vatim — lo." English translation: "The T'risi vessels are not susceptible to impurity, and Beit Hillel permits even for returning them! What is the reason for the opinions of Beit Hillel? Because there is no construction in vessels and no contradiction in vessels, and even the T'risi vessels — it is implied to us that they permitted them ultimately due to their initial state: that chanuyot — no, vatim — yes."

hebrew_text: חֲזָרַת רְטִיָּה בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: מַחְזִירִין רְטִיָּה בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ אֲבָל לֹא בַּמְּדִינָה! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא טַעְמָא מַאי — מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין שְׁבוּת בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ, אֲפִילּוּ כֹּהֵן דְּלָאו בַּר עֲבוֹדָה הוּא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן הִתִּירוּ סוֹפָן מִשּׁוּם תְּחִלָּתָן: דְּבַר עֲבוֹדָה — אִין, דְּלָאו בַּר עֲבוֹדָה — לָא.
human_translation: We learned the replacement of a bandage in the Temple as well: One may replace a bandage in the Temple but not in the country. Lest you say: What is the reason because rabbinic decrees prohibiting labor not in the Temple. even a priest who is not a candidate service. teaches us permitted a result for the sake of an initial action: If one is a candidate for service, yes, if one is not a candidate for service, no,
llm_translation: The return of a ritually impure person to the Temple is taught: They return a ritually impure person to the Temple but not to the province! What might you say the reason is? — Because there is no dwelling in the Temple, even a non-priest who is not involved in the service, it is implied to us that they permitted their end due to their beginning: for service — yes, for one not involved in the service — no.

hebrew_text: פּוֹתֵחַ אֶת חָבִיתוֹ נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: הַפּוֹתֵחַ אֶת חָבִיתוֹ, וּמַתְחִיל בְּעִיסָּתוֹ עַל גַּב הָרֶגֶל, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: יִגְמוֹר, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יִגְמוֹר.
human_translation: We learned one who opens his barrel as well: one who opens his barrel begins his dough for the sake of the Festival, Rabbi Yehuda says: He may finish and the Rabbis say: He may not finish.
llm_translation: Opening his barrel, as we learned: One who opens his barrel, and begins kneading on top of the foot, Rabbi Yehuda says: It is finished, and the Sages say: It is not finished.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא טוּמְאַת עַם הָאָרֶץ בָּרֶגֶל כְּטׇהֳרָה שַׁוְּיוּהָ רַבָּנַן, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא הִתְחִיל נָמֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן הִתִּירוּ סוֹפָן מִשּׁוּם תְּחִלָּתָן: הִתְחִיל — אִין, לֹא הִתְחִיל — לָא.
human_translation: Lest you say: the Sages rendered the ritual impurity of an am ha’aretz on a Festival as ritually pure, and although one did not begin likewise teaches us: permitted whose result in order initial If one had begun, yes, if one had not begun, no,
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: What is the halakha with regard to the ritual impurity of an am ha'aretz on a festival, is it like purity? The Rabbis placed it on equal footing with purity. And even though they did not initially begin by stating this explicitly, they are teaching us that they permitted their conclusion because of their initial premise: if they began — no, if they did not begin — yes.

hebrew_text: וְעוּלָּא מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר הָא? בִּפְלוּגְתָּא לָא קָא מַיְירֵי. הָנָךְ נָמֵי פְּלוּגְתָּא נִינְהוּ! בֵּית שַׁמַּאי בִּמְקוֹם בֵּית הִלֵּל אֵינָהּ מִשְׁנָה.
human_translation: And Ulla, what is the reason that he did he not state this He is not dealing with dispute. These are also dispute, Beit Shammai where Beit Hillel Mishna,
llm_translation: And what is the reason that he did not say this? In a dispute he is not explaining. There too, it is a dispute! Beit Shammai in the place of Beit Hillel, it is not a Mishnah.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כִי הַאי תַּנָּא דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: מוֹדִים בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל שֶׁמְּסַלְּקִין אֶת הַתְּרִיסִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא לְהַחֲזִיר. שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מַחְזִירִין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אַף מַחְזִירִין. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּשֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן צִיר, אֲבָל אֵין לָהֶן צִיר — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מוּתָּר.
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel agree that one may remove shutters on a Festival. They disagree only to replace as Beit Shammai say: One may not replace and Beit Hillel say: One may even replace And in what is this statement said? When have a hinge However, they do not have a hinge, everyone agrees it is permitted,
llm_translation: Mishnah: That not like this Tanna who taught, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel agree that one may remove the boards on a festival only for the purpose of returning them. They only disagree regarding the returning. Beit Shammai says: One may not return them, and Beit Hillel says: One may even return them. In what case are these words said? When they have a hinge, but if they do not have a hinge, everyone agrees that it is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּשֶׁאֵין לָהֶן צִיר, אֲבָל יֵשׁ לָהֶן צִיר — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אָסוּר! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בְּשֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן צִיר מִן הַצַּד — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אָסוּר. אֵין לָהֶן צִיר כׇּל עִיקָּר — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מוּתָּר. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּשֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן צִיר בָּאֶמְצַע.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught In what is this statement said? when do not have a hinge; however, if they have a hinge, everyone agrees prohibited. Abaye said When they have a hinge on the side, everyone agrees prohibited, they have no hinge at all, everyone agrees it is permitted, When they disagree, where they have a hinge in the middle
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: In what case are these words said? When they do not have a peg, but if they have a peg - everyone agrees that it is forbidden! Abaye said: When they have a peg on the side - everyone agrees that it is forbidden. If they do not have a peg at all - everyone agrees that it is permitted. For they argue when there is a peg in the middle.

hebrew_text: מָר סָבַר: גָּזְרִינַן צִיר בָּאֶמְצַע אַטּוּ צִיר מִן הַצַּד, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא גָּזְרִינַן.
human_translation: Sage, holds we issue a decree a hinge in the middle due to a hinge on the side; and Sage, holds we do not issue decree.
llm_translation: Master says: We decree a beam in the middle, but a beam from the side we do not decree.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מוֹצִיאִין לֹא אֶת הַקָּטָן, וְלֹא אֶת הַלּוּלָב, וְלֹא אֶת סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: One may carry out neither a minor nor a lulav , nor a Torah Scroll into the public domain, and Beit Hillel permit
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Beit Shammai say: One may not carry out neither the infant, nor the lulav, nor the Torah scroll into the public domain. Beit Hillel permit it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי: הַשּׁוֹחֵט עוֹלַת נְדָבָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב — לוֹקֶה.
human_translation: The tanna teaches before Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi: One who slaughters a gift offering on a Festival is flogged
llm_translation: "Gemara: A Baraita was taught before Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avdimi: One who slaughters a voluntary burnt offering on a festival - is liable to receive lashes."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דַּאֲמַר לָךְ מַנִּי — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הִיא, דְּאָמְרִי: לָא אָמְרִינַן מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהוּתְּרָה הוֹצָאָה לְצוֹרֶךְ — הוּתְּרָה נָמֵי שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ. דְּאִי בֵּית הִלֵּל, הָא אָמְרִי: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהוּתְּרָה הוֹצָאָה לְצוֹרֶךְ — הוּתְּרָה נָמֵי שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ. הָכָא נָמֵי, מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהוּתְּרָה שְׁחִיטָה לְצוֹרֶךְ — הוּתְּרָה נָמֵי שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ.
human_translation: said to Who said to you? It is Beit Shammai, who say we do not say: Since carrying out was permitted for the purpose was also permitted not for that purpose. For if you say Beit Hillel, they say: Since carrying out was permitted for the requirements it was also permitted not for requirements. Here, too, since slaughter was permitted for the requirements it was also permitted not for requirements.
llm_translation: He said to him: that which I said to you - it is Beit Shammai, for they say: we do not say it is permitted when it is permitted for your need - rather permitted also when not for your need. For if it were Beit Hillel, they say: when it is permitted for your need - also permitted when not for your need. Here too, since the slaughtering is permitted for your need - it is permitted also when not for your need.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבָּה: מִמַּאי דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל בְּהָא פְּלִיגִי? דִּלְמָא בְּעֵרוּב וְהוֹצָאָה לְשַׁבָּת וְאֵין עֵרוּב וְהוֹצָאָה לְיוֹם טוֹב קָא מִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: Rabba strongly objects to this From where that Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel disagree over this Perhaps they disagree eiruv and carrying out to Shabbat, there are no eiruv nor carrying out
llm_translation: Rabah objects to her: From what do Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel disagree in this matter? Perhaps they argue regarding Eruv and carrying out on Shabbat, and there is no Eruv and carrying out on Yom Tov that they disagree.

hebrew_text: מָר סָבַר: עֵרוּב הוֹצָאָה לְשַׁבָּת, וְעֵרוּב הוֹצָאָה לְיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: Sage, holds eiruv carrying out to Shabbat, and eiruv carrying out to a Festival.
llm_translation: Master says: Eruv Hotsa'ah for Shabbat, and Eruv Hotsa'ah for Yom Tov.

hebrew_text: וּמַר סָבַר: עֵרוּב הוֹצָאָה לְשַׁבָּת, וְאֵין עֵרוּב הוֹצָאָה לְיוֹם טוֹב, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״וְלֹא תוֹצִיאוּ מַשָּׂא מִבָּתֵּיכֶם בְּיוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת״. בְּשַׁבָּת — אִין, בְּיוֹם טוֹב — לָא.
human_translation: And Sage, holds eiruv carrying out to Shabbat, there are no eiruv carrying out on a Festival, as it is written: “Neither carry forth a burden out of your houses on the Shabbat day” On Shabbat, yes, on a Festival, no,
llm_translation: And Mar said: An Eruv of carrying is effective for Shabbat, but an Eruv of carrying is not effective for Yom Tov, as it is written: "And you shall not carry a burden from your houses on the Sabbath day." On Shabbat - no, on Yom Tov - no.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, לִיפַּלְגוּ בַּאֲבָנִים! אֶלָּא מִדְּלָא מִפַּלְגִי בַּאֲבָנִים, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ,
human_translation: Rav Yosef strongly objects to this However, if so, let them differ with regard to stones Rather, from do not disagree with regard to stones conclude from this:
llm_translation: Challenges to him Rav Yosef: Rather from now on, let them divide with stones! Rather since they do not divide with stones, infer from it.

hebrew_text: בְּהוֹצָאָה שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ פְּלִיגִי.
human_translation: disagree with regard to carrying out not for the purpose
llm_translation: In the matter of an incidental act not for its own sake, they dispute.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סָבַר: בְּמִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהוּתְּרָה הוֹצָאָה לְצוֹרֶךְ הוּתְּרָה נָמֵי שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ פְּלִיגִי. דְּתָנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַמְבַשֵּׁל גִּיד הַנָּשֶׁה בְּחָלָב בְּיוֹם טוֹב וַאֲכָלוֹ — לוֹקֶה חָמֵשׁ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan also holds disagree with regard to Since carrying out is permitted for the purpose was also permitted not for purpose, the tanna teaches before Rabbi Yoḥanan: One who cooks the sciatic nerve in milk on a Festival and eats it is flogged five
llm_translation: And even Rabbi Yochanan holds: since it was permitted for a necessary purpose, it is also permitted for a non-necessary purpose. For it was taught in a Baraita before Rabbi Yochanan: One who cooks the sciatic nerve in milk on a festival and eats it - he receives lashes fivefold.

hebrew_text: לוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם מְבַשֵּׁל גִּיד, וְלוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם אוֹכֵל גִּיד, וְלוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם מְבַשֵּׁל בָּשָׂר בְּחָלָב, וְלוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם אוֹכֵל בָּשָׂר בְּחָלָב, וְלוֹקֶה
human_translation: He is flogged due to cooking nerve, and he is flogged due to eating nerve, and he is flogged due to cooking meat in milk; and he is flogged due to eating meat in milk; and he is flogged
llm_translation: One who is liable for cooking the sinew, and one who is liable for eating the sinew, and one who is liable for cooking meat in milk, and one who is liable for eating meat in milk, is liable.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם הַבְעָרָה.
human_translation: due to kindling
llm_translation: Because of the burning.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פּוֹק תְּנִי לְבָרָא, הַבְעָרָה וּבִשּׁוּל אֵינָהּ מִשְׁנָה. וְאִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר מִשְׁנָה — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הִיא, דְּאָמְרִי: לָא אָמְרִינַן מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהוּתְּרָה הוֹצָאָה לְצוֹרֶךְ הוּתְּרָה נָמֵי שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ. הָכָא נָמֵי, לָא אָמְרִינַן: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהוּתְּרָה הַבְעָרָה לְצוֹרֶךְ, הוּתְּרָה נָמֵי שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ.
human_translation: said to Leave and teach it outside, kindling and cooking is not a mishna And if you say it is a mishna it is Beit Shammai, who say: We do not say: Since carrying out was permitted for the purposes was also permitted not for purposes. Here, too, not Since kindling was permitted for the purposes it was also permitted not for purposes.
llm_translation: He said to him: Go, teach in the outside, burning and cooking are not the same. And if you find to say "the same" — it is the House of Shammai, for they say: We do not say it is permitted from the fact that it is permitted for a necessary purpose, but it is also permitted for a non-necessary purpose. Here, we do not say: from the fact that burning is permitted for a necessary purpose, it is also permitted for a non-necessary purpose.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי בֵּית הִלֵּל — כֵּיוָן דְּאָמְרִי מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהוּתְּרָה הוֹצָאָה לְצוֹרֶךְ הוּתְּרָה נָמֵי שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ, הָכָא נָמֵי: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהוּתְּרָה הַבְעָרָה לְצוֹרֶךְ — הוּתְּרָה נָמֵי שֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ.
human_translation: If Beit Hillel, as they say: Since carrying out was permitted for the purposes it was also permitted not for purposes. Here, too, since kindling was permitted for purposes it was also permitted not for purposes.
llm_translation: House of Hillel - since they say because it was permitted for the purpose of need, it is also permitted not for the purpose of need, here too: because it was permitted for the purpose of burning, it is also permitted not for the purpose of need.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מוֹלִיכִין חַלָּה וּמַתָּנוֹת לַכֹּהֵן בְּיוֹם טוֹב, בֵּין שֶׁהוּרְמוּ מֵאֶמֶשׁ, בֵּין שֶׁהוּרְמוּ מֵהַיּוֹם. וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: One may not bring ḥalla or gifts, to a priest on a Festival, whether they were separated last evening, or whether they were separated today. And Beit Hillel permit
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Beit Shammai say: One may not bring loaves of bread and gifts to the priest on a festival, whether they were separated from yesterday or separated from today. Beit Hillel permit it.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, גְּזֵרָה שָׁוָה: חַלָּה וּמַתָּנוֹת — מַתָּנָה לַכֹּהֵן, וּתְרוּמָה — מַתָּנָה לַכֹּהֵן. כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵין מוֹלִיכִין אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה — כָּךְ אֵין מוֹלִיכִין אֶת הַמַּתָּנוֹת.
human_translation: Beit Shammai said to an analogy: Ḥalla and gifts a gift to the priest, and teruma a gift to the priest. Just as that one may not bring teruma so too, one may not bring the gifts.
llm_translation: They said to them, the House of Shammai, a similar decree: Challah and gifts - a gift for the priest, and Terumah - a gift for the priest. Just as we do not bring the Terumah, so we do not bring the gifts.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית הִלֵּל: לֹא, אִם אֲמַרְתֶּם בִּתְרוּמָה — שֶׁאֵינוֹ זַכַּאי בַּהֲרָמָתָהּ, תֹּאמְרוּ בְּמַתָּנוֹת — שֶׁזַּכַּאי בַּהֲרָמָתָן.
human_translation: Beit Hillel said to them: No, If you said teruma , its separation is not allowed will you say with regard to the gifts which their separation is allowed
llm_translation: They said to them, Beit Hillel: No, if you say regarding Terumah — that one is not deserving in its elevation, you should say regarding gifts — that one is deserving in their elevation.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ שֶׁהוּרְמוּ מֵהַיּוֹם וְשֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטוּ מֵהַיּוֹם, וְשֶׁהוּרְמוּ מֵאֶמֶשׁ וְשֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטוּ מֵאֶמֶשׁ. מַנִּי מַתְנִיתִין? לָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְלָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אֶלָּא אֲחֵרִים. דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל הַמַּתָּנוֹת שֶׁהוּרְמוּ מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב שֶׁמּוֹלִיכִין עִם הַמַּתָּנוֹת שֶׁהוּרְמוּ מֵהַיּוֹם וְשֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטוּ מֵהַיּוֹם. לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא לְהוֹלִיכָן בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מוֹלִיכִין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מוֹלִיכִין.
human_translation: It enters your mind that They were separated today, slaughtered today. And They were separated last evening, slaughtered last evening. whose opinion is the mishna? not Rabbi Yosei nor Rabbi Yehuda, but Aḥerim , as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not dispute with regard to gifts separated on the eve of a Festival, that one may bring with gifts separated that day and those slaughtered that day. They disputed only of bringing by themselves, as Beit Shammai say: One may not bring and Beit Hillel say: One may bring
llm_translation: The text is as follows: Gemara: Your mind has gone astray, for they were designated yesterday and slaughtered yesterday, and they were designated today and slaughtered today. Who is the author of this teaching? Not Rabbi Yosei and not Rabbi Yehuda, but others. As it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree regarding the gifts designated from the eve of a festival, that they may be brought together with the gifts designated today and slaughtered today. They only disagreed regarding bringing them separately, for Beit Shammai says: They should not be brought together, and Beit Hillel says: They should be brought together.

hebrew_text: וְכָךְ הָיוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי דָּנִין: חַלָּה וּמַתָּנוֹת — מַתָּנָה לַכֹּהֵן, וּתְרוּמָה — מַתָּנָה לַכֹּהֵן. כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵין מוֹלִיכִין אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה — כָּךְ אֵין מוֹלִיכִין אֶת הַמַּתָּנוֹת. אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית הִלֵּל: לֹא, אִם אֲמַרְתֶּם בִּתְרוּמָה — שֶׁאֵינוֹ זַכַּאי בַּהֲרָמָתָהּ, תֹּאמְרוּ בְּמַתָּנוֹת — שֶׁזַּכַּאי בַּהֲרָמָתָן.
human_translation: And Beit Shammai would reason as follows: Ḥalla and gifts a gift to the priest, and teruma a gift to the priest. Just as one may not bring teruma so too, one may not bring the gifts. Beit Hillel said to them: No, if you said with regard to teruma , that separation is not allowed will you say with regard to the gifts, which separation is allowed
llm_translation: And so were the House of Shammai accustomed to rule: Challah and gifts — a gift for the priest, and Terumah — a gift for the priest. Just as we do not bring the Terumah — so too we do not bring the gifts. The House of Hillel said to them: No, if you say regarding Terumah — that one is not deserving in its elevation, you should say regarding the gifts — that one is deserving in their elevation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל הַמַּתָּנוֹת שֶׁמּוֹלִיכִין, לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא עַל הַתְּרוּמָה, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מוֹלִיכִין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מוֹלִיכִין. וְכָךְ הָיוּ בֵּית הִלֵּל דָּנִין: חַלָּה וּמַתָּנוֹת — מַתָּנָה לַכֹּהֵן, וּתְרוּמָה — מַתָּנָה לַכֹּהֵן, כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמּוֹלִיכִין אֶת הַמַּתָּנוֹת, כָּךְ מוֹלִיכִין אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה. אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: לֹא, אִם אֲמַרְתֶּם בְּמַתָּנוֹת שֶׁזַּכַּאי בַּהֲרָמָתָן — תֹּאמְרוּ בִּתְרוּמָה שֶׁאֵין זַכַּאי בַּהֲרָמָתָהּ!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not dispute about that one may bring the gifts They disputed only with regard to teruma , as Beit Shammai say: One may not bring and Beit Hillel say: One may bring And Beit Hillel would reason Ḥalla and gifts a gift to the priest, and teruma a gift to the priest. Just as one may bring the gifts so too, one may bring teruma . Beit Shammai said to them: No; if you said with regard to the gifts, which their separation is allowed will you say with regard to teruma , whose separation is not allowed?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree regarding the gifts that lead, they only disagreed regarding the terumah. Beit Shammai says: we do not lead, and Beit Hillel says: we lead. And so Beit Hillel would judge: challah and gifts — a gift for the kohen, and terumah — a gift for the kohen. Just as they lead with the gifts, so too they lead with the terumah. Beit Shammai said to them: No, if you say regarding gifts that one is deserving in its elevation — you should say regarding terumah that one is not deserving in its elevation!

hebrew_text: אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל הַתְּרוּמָה שֶׁאֵין מוֹלִיכִין, לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא עַל הַמַּתָּנוֹת, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים אֵין מוֹלִיכִין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים מוֹלִיכִין. לֵימָא אֲחֵרִים הִיא וְלָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה?
human_translation: Aḥerim say Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not dispute with regard to teruma , that one may not bring They disputed only of the gifts, as Beit Shammai say: One may not bring and Beit Hillel say: One may bring Let us say is Aḥerim , and not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Others say: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree regarding the terumah that is not brought, but they only disagreed regarding gifts. Beit Shammai says they are not brought, and Beit Hillel says they are brought. Let us say it is others and not Rabbi Yehuda?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִי קָתָנֵי שֶׁהוּרְמוּ מֵהַיּוֹם וְשֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטוּ מֵהַיּוֹם? שֶׁהוּרְמוּ קָתָנֵי, וּלְעוֹלָם: שְׁחִיטָתָן מֵאֶמֶשׁ. לֵימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא וְלֹא אֲחֵרִים! אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא אֲחֵרִים, וּבְהָנָךְ דְּנִשְׁחֲטוּ מֵאֶמֶשׁ.
human_translation: Rava said: Is it taught They were separated that day and were slaughtered that day? it teaches: They were separated, and actually They were slaughtered last evening let us say is Rabbi Yehuda and not Aḥerim ? Even you say Aḥerim , of these were slaughtered last evening,
llm_translation: Rava said: Who are the strict ones that they are designated from today and that they are slaughtered from today? That they are designated as strict ones, and forever: their slaughtering is from yesterday. Let it be said: it is Rabbi Yehuda and not others! Even if you say others, and in the case where they were slaughtered from yesterday.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי הַיְינוּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ טְפֵלָה.
human_translation: If so, this is Rabbi Yehuda. between them secondary
llm_translation: So is this Rabbi Yehuda? There is a difference between them, a secondary matter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַב טוֹבִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נְחֶמְיָה הֲוָה לֵיהּ גַּרְבָּא דְחַמְרָא דִּתְרוּמָה, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַהוּ לְאַמְטוֹיֵי לְכֹהֵן הָאִידָּנָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. Rav Tovi, son of Rabbi Neḥemya, had a bottle of wine. He came before Rav Yosef said to him: What is bringing to a priest now, said to him: That is what Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. Rav Tovi, the son of Rav Nechemyah, had a barrel of wine for terumah. He came before Rav Yosef and said to him: What is the law regarding the admixture for a priest at this time? He said to him: Thus said Rav Yehudah in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: אוּשְׁפִּיזְכָנֵיהּ דְּרָבָא בַּר רַב חָנָן הֲוָה לֵיהּ אִסּוּרְיָיתָא דְחַרְדְּלָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַהוּ לְפָרוֹכֵי וּמֵיכַל מִנַּיְיהוּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב? לָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוֹלְלִין מְלִילוֹת וּמְפָרְכִין קִטְנִיּוֹת בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: The host of Rava, son of Rav Ḥanan, had bundles of mustard, He said What is to crushing and eating from them on a Festival? did not have came before Rava said to him One may husk kernels and one may crush legumes on a Festival.
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: The officials of Rava son of Rav Hanan had a mustard seed prohibition. He said to them: What about removing the tablecloth and salt dish from before them on a festival? It was not in his power. He came before Rava. He said to him: One may remove melilot and break small fish on a festival.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: הַמּוֹלֵל מְלִילוֹת מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, לְמָחָר מְנַפֵּחַ מִיָּד לְיָד, וְאוֹכֵל. אֲבָל לֹא בַּקָּנוֹן, וְלֹא בַּתַּמְחוּי.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to one who husks kernels on Shabbat eve, on the following day, he may winnow from hand to hand and eat However, one may not neither by a basket [ kanon ] nor with a large vessel.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: Abaye raised an objection: One who kneads dough on Friday evening, the next day he may knead it from hand to hand and eat. But not with a reed, and not with a spoon.

hebrew_text: הַמּוֹלֵל מְלִילוֹת מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב, לְמָחָר מְנַפֵּחַ עַל יָד עַל יָד, וְאוֹכֵל אֲפִילּוּ בַּקָּנוֹן וַאֲפִילּוּ בַּתַּמְחוּי, אֲבָל לֹא בַּטַּבְלָא וְלֹא בַּנָּפָה וְלֹא בַּכְּבָרָה. מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — אִין, בְּיוֹם טוֹב — לָא!
human_translation: one who husks kernels on a Festival eve, on the following day, he may winnow a little at a time and eat, even with a tray or a large vessel. However, he may not with a tablet, nor with a winnow, nor with a sieve. On a Festival eve, yes, on the Festival no,
llm_translation: The one who wraps wicks from the eve of a festival, the next day he may trim them hand by hand, and he may even eat them whether in a reed or even in a garlic peel, but not in a wick, nor in a napkin, nor in a pitcher. From the eve of a festival - no, on the festival day - no!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא ״מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת״, תְּנָא סֵיפָא נָמֵי ״מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב״.
human_translation: Even you say on a Festival, Since he taught the first clause On Shabbat eve, he also taught in the latter clause: On a Festival eve.
llm_translation: Even if you say on a festival day, and the reason is that the first Tanna teaches "from Friday evening," the latter Tanna also teaches "from Friday afternoon."

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן מָצִינוּ תְּרוּמָה שֶׁזַּכַּאי בַּהֲרָמָתָהּ, וּתְנַן: לֹא, אִם אֲמַרְתֶּם בִּתְרוּמָה שֶׁאֵינוֹ זַכַּאי בַּהֲרָמָתָהּ וְכוּ׳!
human_translation: If so, we found teruma for which separation is allowed And we learned No, if you said teruma , its separation is not allowed
llm_translation: If so, we find a terumah that is deserving in its elevation, and we learned: No, if you say in a terumah that is not deserving in its elevation, etc.!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא,
human_translation: not difficult.
llm_translation: Not difficult.

hebrew_text: הָא רַבִּי, הָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּתַנְיָא: הִכְנִיס שִׁבֳּלִין לַעֲשׂוֹת מֵהֶן עִיסָּה — אוֹכֵל מֵהֶן עֲרַאי, וּפָטוּר.
human_translation: This Rabbi That Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught brought inside stalks to make dough from them, he may eat from them, as a snack, and he is exempt
llm_translation: This is Rabbi, this is Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught: If one brought stalks in to make dough from them - one may eat from them temporarily, and is exempt.

hebrew_text: לְמוֹלְלָן בִּמְלִילוֹת — רַבִּי מְחַיֵּיב וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: to husk the kernels Rabbi obligates And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, exempts
llm_translation: To circumcise with words - Rabbi Meḥayyev, and Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda exempts.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה נָמֵי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ — כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִכְנִיס שִׁבֳּלִין לַעֲשׂוֹת מֵהֶן עִיסָּה, וְנִמְלַךְ עֲלֵיהֶן לְמוֹלְלָן בְּיוֹם טוֹב, דְּטָבְלָא בְּיוֹמֵיהּ!
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, also find For example, if one brought inside stalks of grain to make dough from them, and he reconsidered to husk them on a Festival. that untithed on that day
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, it is found that she forgot - for example, that he brought stalks to make dough from them, and they became leavened to knead them on a festival day, for it is good in its days!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מַאי תְּרוּמָה — רוֹב תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: Rather, What is teruma most teruma ,
llm_translation: Rather: What is Terumah? — The majority is Terumah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּשִׁבֳּלִין. אֲבָל בְּקִטְנִיּוֹת — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אִסּוּרְיָיתָא טָבְלָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: dispute, to stalks However, legumes, everyone agrees bundles untithed produce,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Dispute regarding shibboleth. But regarding kisniyot - the words of everyone are a clear prohibition.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: מִי שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ חֲבִילֵי תִלְתָּן שֶׁל טֶבֶל — הֲרֵי זֶה כּוֹתֵשׁ, וּמְחַשֵּׁב כַּמָּה זֶרַע יֵשׁ בָּהֶם, וּמַפְרִישׁ עַל הַזֶּרַע וְאֵינוֹ מַפְרִישׁ עַל הָעֵץ. מַאי לָאו — רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: הָתָם לָא טָבְלָא הָכָא טָבְלָא!
human_translation: Let us say that supports him one who had bundles of fenugreek, of untithed produce, he may pound And he calculates how many seeds contain and separates teruma on the seeds, but does not separate on the stalks. What, is it not is Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, who said: There, not untithed produce, here, untithed produce?
llm_translation: Let it be said that assists him: one who had three bundles of tevel - this one threshes, and calculates how much seed is in them, and separates upon the seed and does not separate upon the tree. What is the reason? - Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: There, it was not tithed; here, it was tithed!

hebrew_text: לָא, רַבִּי הִיא. אִי רַבִּי הִיא, מַאי אִירְיָא תִּלְתָּן, אֲפִילּוּ שִׁבֳּלִין נָמֵי?
human_translation: No, is Rabbi If it is Rabbi Why specifically fenugreek? even to stalks as well.
llm_translation: Not so, it is Rabbi. If it is Rabbi, what is the meaning of "three," even barley also?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — לַשְׁמְעִינַן שְׁאָר מִינֵי קִטְנִיּוֹת, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן תִּלְתָּן.
human_translation: Rather, what Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? let him teach us other types of legumes, And all the more so fenugreek,
llm_translation: Rather what? Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda — to hear other types of small creatures, and all the more so three.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא תִּלְתָּן אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְטַעַם עֵצוֹ וּפִרְיוֹ שָׁוֶה, לִפְרוֹשׁ נָמֵי אַעֵצוֹ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rather, was necessary fenugreek enter your mind to say: Since the taste of its stalk and its fruit identical, also separate on stalks, teaches us
llm_translation: Rather, two reasons are necessary for it. The conclusion of your reasoning I say: Since the taste of its wood and its fruit are equal, to explain further, I will say its wood is also effective, this is implied to us.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּשִׁבֳּלִין, אֲבָל בְּקִטְנִיּוֹת דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אִסּוּרְיָיתָא לָא טָבְלָא. מֵיתִיבִי: מִי שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ חֲבִילֵי תִלְתָּן שֶׁל טֶבֶל הֲרֵי זֶה כּוֹתֵשׁ, וּמְחַשֵּׁב כַּמָּה זֶרַע יֵשׁ בָּהֶן, וּמַפְרִישׁ עַל הַזֶּרַע וְאֵינוֹ מַפְרִישׁ עַל הָעֵץ. מַאי לָאו, טֶבֶל טָבוּל שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה!
human_translation: Some say Abaye said dispute to stalks however, legumes, everyone agrees bundles not untithed produce. raises an objection one who had bundles of fenugreek of untithed produce, he may pound and calculate how many seeds they contain and separate teruma on the seeds, but he does not separate on the stalks. What, is this not untithed produce of teruma ,
llm_translation: There are those who say, Abaye said: Dispute regarding sheaves, but regarding small bundles, everyone agrees that it is not subject to immersion. It was asked: One who had three bundles of tevel, behold, he may thresh, and he calculates how much seed is in them, and separates upon the seed but does not separate upon the stalk. What is the reason? The tevel is already immersed for terumah!

hebrew_text: לָא, טֶבֶל טָבוּל שֶׁל תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: No, untithed produce, of teruma of the tithe
llm_translation: Not, tevel tabul shel terumat maaser.

hebrew_text: וְכִדְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁהִקְדִּימוֹ בְּשִׁבֳּלִין,
human_translation: And in accordance with that Rabbi Abbahu Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, as Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: first tithe before while on the stalks.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Abbahu said, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: As Rabbi Abbahu said, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: The first tithe that they separated in Shebbolet.

hebrew_text: שְׁמוֹ טוֹבְלוֹ לִתְרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: Its name, renders it untithed produce, to teruma of the tithe
llm_translation: His name is Tovlo for the terumah of maaser.

hebrew_text: כּוֹתֵשׁ לְמָה לִי? לֵימָא לֵיהּ: כִּי הֵיכִי דִּיהַבוּ לִי, הָכִי יָהֵיבְנָא לָךְ! אֲמַר רָבָא: קְנָסָא.
human_translation: why do I pounding? Let say to As they gave to me so I am giving to you Rava said: a penalty.
llm_translation: He cuts for what to me? Say to him: Just as they gave to me, so I will give to you! Rava said: A penalty.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: בֶּן לֵוִי שֶׁנָּתְנוּ לוֹ שִׁבֳּלִין בְּמַעַשְׂרוֹתָיו — עוֹשֶׂה אוֹתָן גּוֹרֶן, עֲנָבִים — עוֹשֶׂה אוֹתָן יַיִן, זֵיתִים — עוֹשֶׂה אוֹתָן שֶׁמֶן, וּמַפְרִישׁ עֲלֵיהֶם תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר, וְנוֹתְנָן לַכֹּהֵן. שֶׁכְּשֵׁם שֶׁתְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה אֵינָהּ נִיטֶּלֶת
human_translation: That is also taught a Levite who was given stalks as his tithes, he renders them a granary, grapes, he renders them wine; olives, he renders them oil; and separates teruma of the tithe for them and gives them to a priest. For just as teruma gedola , is not separated
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: The son of Levi to whom they gave shevulin in his tithes - he makes them into a winepress, grapes - he makes them into wine, olives - he makes them into oil, and separates terumat maaser for them, and gives it to the kohen. Just as a large terumah is not removed.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִן הַגּוֹרֶן וּמִן הַיֶּקֶב, כָּךְ תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר אֵינָהּ נִיטֶּלֶת אֶלָּא מִן הַגּוֹרֶן וּמִן הַיֶּקֶב.
human_translation: but only from the granary and the winepress, so too, teruma of the tithe is separated only from the granary and the winepress.
llm_translation: Rather, from the threshing floor and from the winepress, so too the tithe offering is not removed except from the threshing floor and from the winepress.

hebrew_text: מְחַשֵּׁב? הָא מְדִידָה בָּעֵי!
human_translation: Calculates? should have said: Measures.
llm_translation: One who calculates? This requires measurement!

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי אַבָּא אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן גִּימֶל הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: אַבָּא אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן גִּימֶל אוֹמֵר: ״וְנֶחְשַׁב לָכֶם תְּרוּמַתְכֶם״ — בִּשְׁתֵּי תְרוּמוֹת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, אַחַת תְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה וְאַחַת תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר. כְּשֵׁם שֶׁתְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה נִיטֶּלֶת בְּאוֹמֶד וּבְמַחְשָׁבָה — כָּךְ תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר נִיטֶּלֶת בְּאוֹמֶד וּבְמַחְשָׁבָה.
human_translation: whose is this Abba Elazar ben Gimmel, as it is taught Abba Elazar ben Gimmel says: “And your teruma shall be reckoned to you The verse speaks of two terumot . One teruma gedola , and one is teruma of the tithe. Just as teruma gedola is separated by estimation and by thought, so too, teruma of the tithe be separated by estimation and by thought.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Abba Elazar ben Gimmel is the one who taught this, as it was taught in a Baraita: Abba Elazar ben Gimmel says: "And it shall be counted to you as your tithes" - the verse speaks of two tithes, one is a great tithe and one is a tithe of the produce. Just as the great tithe is taken with estimation and calculation, so too the tithe of the produce is taken with estimation and calculation.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁהִקְדִּימוֹ בְּשִׁבֳּלִין — שְׁמוֹ טוֹבְלוֹ לִתְרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רָבָא: הוֹאִיל וְיָצָא עָלָיו שֵׁם מַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: the itself: Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: first tithe, in a case in which preceded on the stalks, its name renders it untithed produce, teruma of the tithe. What is the reason Rava said: Since the name of tithe was called upon it,
llm_translation: The body, Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: The first tithe that they set aside in Shebboleth - its name is immersed for the terumah of the tithe. What is the reason? Rava said: Since the name of the tithe has been placed upon it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁהִקְדִּימוֹ בְּשִׁבֳּלִין — פָּטוּר מִתְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: first tithe, in a case in which preceded on the stalks, exempt from teruma gedola .
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: "The first tithe that was separated in the stalks - exempt from the great heave offering."

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַהֲרֵמוֹתֶם מִמֶּנּוּ תְּרוּמַת ה׳ מַעֲשֵׂר מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר״, מַעֲשֵׂר מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר אָמַרְתִּי לְךָ, וְלֹא תְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה וּתְרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: it is stated: “And you shall set apart from it a teruma for the Lord, even a tenth part of the tithe” A tenth part of the tithe, I, said to you and not teruma gedola and teruma of the tithe from the tithe.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "And you shall lift from it a contribution to the Lord, a tithe from the tithe," I have spoken to you about a tithe from the tithe, not a large contribution and a tithe of the tithe.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ הִקְדִּימוֹ בִּכְרִי נָמֵי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עָלֶיךָ אָמַר קְרָא: ״מִכֹּל (מַעְשְׂרוֹתֵיכֶם) תָּרִימוּ אֵת כׇּל תְּרוּמַת ה׳״.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: If so, even if preceded in a pile, also be exempt said to With regard to your the verse states: “From all that is given you, you shall set apart that which is the Lord’s teruma ”
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: If so, even if they placed him in a pile of barley! He said to him: Upon you the verse said: "From all (your tithes) you shall set aside every gift of the Lord."

hebrew_text: וּמָה רָאִיתָ? הַאי אִדְּגַן, וְהַאי לָא אִדְּגַן.
human_translation: And what did you see This, has become grain, and that, has not become grain.
llm_translation: And what did you see? This one is a fish, and this one is not a fish.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הַמְקַלֵּף שְׂעוֹרִין, מְקַלֵּף אַחַת אַחַת וְאוֹכֵל. וְאִם קִלֵּף וְנָתַן לְתוֹךְ יָדוֹ — חַיָּיב. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: וְכֵן לְשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: We learned there One who peels barley may peel them one one and eat them But if he peeled and placed into his hand, he is obligated Rabbi Elazar said: And a similar to Shabbat.
llm_translation: We learned there: One who peels barley, he peels one by one and eats. And if he peeled and placed into his hand - liable. Rabbi Elazar said: And so for Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא רַב מְקַלְּפָא לֵיהּ דְּבֵיתְהוּ כָּסֵי כָּסֵי! וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא מְקַלְּפָא לֵיהּ דְּבֵיתְהוּ כָּסֵי כָּסֵי! אֶלָּא אִי אִתְּמַר, אַסֵּיפָא אִתְּמַר: הַמּוֹלֵל מְלִילוֹת שֶׁל חִטִּים, מְנַפֵּחַ עַל יָד עַל יָד וְאוֹכֵל. וְאִם נִפַּח וְנָתַן לְתוֹךְ חֵיקוֹ — חַיָּיב. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: וְכֵן לְשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rav’s wife peel for him by the cupful? And Rabbi Ḥiyya’s wife peel for him by the cupful. Rather, if was stated it was stated with regard to the latter clause one who husks kernels of wheat he may blow a little at a time and eat But if he blows and puts into his lap, obligated Rabbi Elazar said: And a similar to Shabbat.
llm_translation: I? But didn't Rav peel for him from his house, handful by handful! And Rabbi Chiya peeled for him from his house, handful by handful! Rather, if it is said, it is said in the latter part: One who rubs wheat grains, blows them off hand by hand and eats. And if he blew and placed them into his lap - he is liable. Rabbi Elazar said: And so for Shabbat.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל: וְרֵישָׁא, לְמַעֲשֵׂר אִין לְשַׁבָּת לָא? וּמִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דִּלְעִנְיַן שַׁבָּת לָא הָוֵי גְּמַר מְלָאכָה, וּלְמַעֲשֵׂר הָוֵי גְּמַר מְלָאכָה?
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Memel strongly objects to this: And the first clause Yes, with regard to tithes, no, with regard to Shabbat? But is there anything with regard to Shabbat, is not completion of the labor and with regard to tithes, it is completion of the labor?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rabbi Abba bar Memel objected to him: And the beginning, for tithing is it not permissible for Shabbat? But is there not a case where the produce is not yet fit for Shabbat, it does not constitute a completion of work, yet for tithing it does constitute a completion of work?

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: וְלָא, וְהָא גׇּרְנָן לְמַעֲשֵׂר, דִּתְנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ גׇּרְנָן לְמַעֲשֵׂר? הַקִּשּׁוּאִין וְהַדִּלּוּעִין — מִשֶּׁיְּפַקְּסוּ. וְשֶׁלֹּא פִּקְּסוּ — מִשֶּׁיַּעֲמִיד עֲרֵמָה. וּתְנַן נָמֵי גַּבֵּי בְצָלִים — מִשֶּׁיַּעֲמִיד עֲרֵמָה. וְאֵלּוּ גַּבֵּי שַׁבָּת — הַעֲמָדַת עֲרֵמָה פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, strongly objects to this And no And is their granary for tithes, as we learned What is their granary, in tithes? cucumbers and gourds, from when one trims [ misheyefaksu ], and he did not trim, from when he assembles them in a pile. And we also learned with regard to onions, from when one assembles them in a pile. Whereas with regard to Shabbat, assembles in a pile is exempt,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rav Sheshet son of Rav Idi objects to him: And no, but isn't the granary for tithing, as we learned: What is a granary for tithing? The bundles and the sheaves — once they are threshed. And if they were not threshed — once they are stacked. And we also learned regarding onions — once they are stacked. And these are regarding Shabbat — one is exempt from stacking.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר: מְלֶאכֶת מַחְשֶׁבֶת אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה, הָכָא נָמֵי: מְלֶאכֶת מַחְשֶׁבֶת אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rather, what have you to say? The Torah prohibited planned, labor Here too, the Torah prohibited creative work.
llm_translation: Rather what do you have to say: "A forbidden labor of thought the Torah prohibited," here too: "A forbidden labor of thought the Torah prohibited."

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד מוֹלֵל? אַבָּיֵי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: חֲדָא אַחֲדָא. וְרַב אַוְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: חֲדָא אַתַּרְתֵּי. רָבָא אָמַר: כֵּיוָן דִּמְשַׁנֵּי — אֲפִילּוּ חֲדָא אַכּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי.
human_translation: How may one husk Abaye said in the name of Rav Yosef: One on another, And Rav Avya said in the name of Rav Yosef: one on two, Rava said: Since he alters he may even one on all
llm_translation: How is one to circumcise? Abbaye in the name of Rav Yosef said: One cut. And Rav Avya in the name of Rav Yosef said: One place. Rava said: Once he changes it - even one eating is also considered.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד מְנַפֵּחַ? אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר רַב: מְנַפֵּחַ
human_translation: How blow Rav Adda bar Ahava said Rav said: One blows
llm_translation: How does one blow? Rav Adda bar Ahava said Rav: Blow.

hebrew_text: מִקִּשְׁרֵי אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו וּלְמַעְלָה.
human_translation: from the joints of his fingers and above,
llm_translation: The tying of his fingers and upwards.

hebrew_text: מַחֲכוּ עֲלַהּ בְּמַעְרְבָא: כֵּיוָן דִּמְשַׁנֵּי — אֲפִילּוּ בְּכוּלַּהּ יְדָא נָמֵי. אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מְנַפֵּחַ בְּיָדוֹ אַחַת, וּבְכָל כֹּחוֹ.
human_translation: They laughed at this in the West, Since he alters even with entire hand as well. Rather, Rav Elazar said: One may blow with one hand and with all his strength,
llm_translation: Wait for him in the west: since he repeats — even with all his might. Rather, Rabbi Elazar said: He blows with one hand, and with all his strength.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: תַּבְלִין נִדּוֹכִין בְּמָדוֹךְ שֶׁל עֵץ, וְהַמֶּלַח בְּפַךְ וּבְעֵץ הַפָּרוּר. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: תַּבְלִין נִדּוֹכִין כְּדַרְכָּן בְּמָדוֹךְ שֶׁל אֶבֶן, וְהַמֶּלַח בְּמָדוֹךְ שֶׁל עֵץ.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: Spices may be pounded with a wooden pestle, and salt with flask or with a wooden pot ladle, And Beit Hillel say: Spices may be pounded in their manner, with a stone pestle, and salt, with a wooden pestle
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Beit Shammai say: Spices are ground in a wooden mortar, and salt in a mortar of earthenware or of a stone. Beit Hillel say: Spices are ground in their usual manner in a mortar of stone, and salt in a mortar of wood.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהַת מֶלַח בָּעֲיָא שִׁנּוּי. מַאי טַעְמָא? רַב הוּנָא וְרַב חִסְדָּא, חַד אָמַר: כׇּל הַקְּדֵרוֹת כּוּלָּן צְרִיכוֹת מֶלַח, וְאֵין כׇּל הַקְּדֵרוֹת צְרִיכוֹת תַּבְלִין.
human_translation: In any event, everyone, agrees salt requires a change; What is the reason Rav Huna and Rav Ḥisda One said: all dishes require salt, But not all dishes require spices,
llm_translation: Gemara: Throughout the world, salt is necessary for cooking. What is the reason? Rav Huna and Rav Hisda, one said: All pots require salt, and not all pots require spices.

hebrew_text: וְחַד אָמַר: כׇּל הַתַּבְלִין מְפִיגִין טַעְמָן, וּמֶלַח אֵינָהּ מְפִיגָה טַעְמָהּ.
human_translation: And one said All spices lose their flavor and salt does not lose its flavor,
llm_translation: And one said: "All spices enhance their flavor, but salt does not enhance its flavor."

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּיָדַע מַאי קְדֵרָה בָּעֵי לְבַשּׁוֹלֵי, אִי נָמֵי בְּמוֹרִיקָא.
human_translation: What is difference between between them is where one knew which dish he wants to cook Alternatively, of saffron,
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them in that one knows what type of pot is needed for cooking, while the other is in doubt.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל הַנִּדּוֹכִין נִדּוֹכִין כְּדַרְכָּן, וַאֲפִילּוּ מֶלַח. וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ מֶלַח בָּעֲיָא שִׁנּוּי! הוּא דְּאָמַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל הַנִּדּוֹכִין שֶׁנִּדּוֹכִין כְּדַרְכָּן וּמֶלַח עִמָּהֶן,
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: All that must be pounded pounded in their manner, and even salt. But didn’t you say salt requires a change said in accordance with that tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Meir said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree in that are pounded. that they may be pounded in their manner, and salt with them.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: All pickled items are pickled in their usual manner, even salt. But didn't you say that salt requires a change? This is what he meant: as this Tanna taught in a Baraita, Rabbi Meir said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree regarding pickled items that are pickled in their usual manner, including salt.

hebrew_text: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא לְדוּכָהּ בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מֶלַח בְּפַךְ וּבְעֵץ הַפָּרוּר לְצָלִי, אֲבָל לֹא לִקְדֵרָה. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: בְּכׇל דָּבָר. בְּכׇל דָּבָר סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: לְכׇל דָּבָר.
human_translation: They disagreed only to pound by itself, as Beit Shammai say: Salt may be with a flask and with a wooden pot ladle for roasting, but not for pot. And Beit Hillel say: by anything. By anything? Can this enter your mind? Rather, say: for anything,
llm_translation: They did not disagree except regarding its surface by itself, for Beit Shammai say: salt in a dish and on a clear piece of wood for roasting, but not for a pot. And Beit Hillel say: in every matter. In every matter is it possible that your opinion arose? Rather say: for every matter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בַּרְדְּלָא לִבְרֵיהּ: כִּי דָיְיכַת אַצְלִי אַצְלוֹיֵי וְדוּךְ. רַב שֵׁשֶׁת שְׁמַע קָל בּוּכְנָא, אֲמַר: הַאי לָאו מִגַּוֵּויהּ דְּבֵיתַאי הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa Bardela said to his son: When you pound tilt it to the side and pound, Rav Sheshet heard the sound of a pestle He said This is not from inside my house,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha bar Dadla to his son: "When you have enough, have enough for yourself and your guests." Rav Sheshet heard a loud noise in the butchery, he said: "This is not the way of my household."

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא אַצְלוֹיֵי אַצְלִי? דְּשַׁמְעֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה צְלִיל קָלֵיהּ. וְדִלְמָא תַּבְלִין הֲווֹ? תַּבְלִין נַבּוֹחֵי מְנַבַּח קָלַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: But perhaps they tilted it as heard that it was a clear sound, But perhaps they were spices, The sound spices like a bark,
llm_translation: Perhaps it is near? Near? For the sound of his voice was light. And perhaps they were spices? Spices that emit a pleasant fragrance.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין עוֹשִׂין טִיסְנִי, וְאֵין כּוֹתְשִׁין בְּמַכְתֶּשֶׁת. תַּרְתֵּי?! הָכִי קָאָמַר: מַה טַּעַם אֵין עוֹשִׂין טִיסְנִי — לְפִי שֶׁאֵין כּוֹתְשִׁין בְּמַכְתֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: The Sages taught one may not prepare groats [ tisanei ], nor may one grind with a mortar and pestle. two This is what he said: What is the reason one may not prepare groats? Because one may not grind with a mortar and pestle.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One does not make a Tisni, and one does not crush with a Makteshet. Two?! This is what it means: What is the reason one does not make a Tisni? Because one does not crush with a Makteshet.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא: אֵין כּוֹתְשִׁין בְּמַכְתֶּשֶׁת! אִי תָּנֵי אֵין כּוֹתְשִׁין בְּמַכְתֶּשֶׁת, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּמַכְתֶּשֶׁת גְּדוֹלָה, אֲבָל בְּמַכְתֶּשֶׁת קְטַנָּה — אֵימָא שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And let say: One may not grind with a mortar and pestle, if he teaches One may not grind with a mortar and pestle, I would have said this applies only to a large mortar and pestle, but with a small mortar and pestle, say it seems well, teaches us
llm_translation: And say: One does not crush with a mortar! If one were to teach that one does not crush with a mortar, I would say: Those matters in a large mortar, but in a small mortar — say it is fitting, for it is logical to us.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵין כּוֹתְשִׁין בְּמַכְתֶּשֶׁת גְּדוֹלָה, אֲבָל כּוֹתְשִׁין בְּמַכְתֶּשֶׁת קְטַנָּה! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כִּי תַּנְיָא נָמֵי מַתְנִיתָא — מַכְתֶּשֶׁת גְּדוֹלָה תַּנְיָא.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught one may not grind with a large mortar and pestle, but one may grind with a small mortar and pestle? Abaye said: Also, when baraita was taught, it was taught a large mortar and pestle,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: One may not crush in a large mortar, but one may crush in a small mortar! Abaye said: For it was also taught in a Baraita — a large mortar was taught.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא לַן, וְהָא לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rava said: not difficult; This is for us, and that is for them,
llm_translation: Rava said, not difficult: this for us, and this for them.

hebrew_text: רַב פַּפֵּי אִקְּלַע לְבֵי מָר שְׁמוּאֵל. אַיְיתִי לֵיהּ דַּיְיסָא וְלָא אֲכַל. וְדִלְמָא בְּמַכְתֶּשֶׁת קְטַנָּה עַבְדוּהּ? דְּחַזְיֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה דְּיִיק טְפֵי.
human_translation: Rav Pappi happened to come to the house Mar Shmuel. He brought to him porridge, but he did not eat And perhaps they performed with a small mortar and pestle, as he observed that it was well ground,
llm_translation: Rav Pappai happened to come to the house of Mar Shmuel. They brought him a fish, but he did not eat. Perhaps it was caught with a small net? For he saw that it was very precise.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא מֵאֶתְמוֹל עַבְדוּהּ? דְּחַזְיֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה קְלִיף צַהֲרֵיהּ. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: שָׁאנֵי בֵּי מָר שְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאִיכָּא פְּרִיצוּתָא דְעַבְדֵי.
human_translation: And perhaps they prepared it the day before, as he observed that the husks were bright, And if you wish, say the house Mar Shmuel is different, as slaves lax
llm_translation: And perhaps from yesterday it was done? For he saw that there was a peel on its surface. And if you wish, say: It is different in the house of Mar Shmuel, where there is a possibility of slaves being insolent.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַבּוֹרֵר קִטְנִיּוֹת בְּיוֹם טוֹב, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: בּוֹרֵר אוֹכֶל וְאוֹכֵל. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: בּוֹרֵר כְּדַרְכּוֹ בְּחֵיקוֹ בַּקָּנוֹן וּבַתַּמְחוּי, אֲבָל לֹא בַּטַּבְלָא וְלֹא בַּנָּפָה וְלֹא בַּכְּבָרָה. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף מֵדִיחַ וְשׁוֹלֶה.
human_translation: one who selects legumes on a Festival Beit Shammai say: He may select food and eat And Beit Hillel say: He may select in his manner, in his lap, with a tray, or with a large vessel, but he may not with a tablet, nor with a winnow, nor with a sieve, Rabban Gamliel says: One may even wash and skim off
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may sift small legumes on a festival. Beit Shammai say: One may sift and eat. Beit Hillel say: One may sift in the usual manner, in his lap, with a sieve, and with a fan, but not with a winnowing shovel, nor with a winnowing fork, nor with a winnowing basket. Rabban Gamliel says: One may even rinse and shake out.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — כְּשֶׁהָאוֹכֶל מְרוּבֶּה עַל הַפְּסוֹלֶת, אֲבָל פְּסוֹלֶת מְרוּבָּה עַל הָאוֹכֶל — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל נוֹטֵל אֶת הָאוֹכֵל וּמַנִּיחַ אֶת הַפְּסוֹלֶת.
human_translation: It is taught Rabban Gamliel said: In what is this statement said? where the food is greater than the refuse. However, if refuse is greater than the food, everyone agrees one must remove the food and leave the refuse.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara Tanya, Amar Rabban Gamliel: Bameh Devarim Amurim - k'sheha'ochel merubeh al hapsolet, aval psolet merubah al ha'ochel - divrei hakol notel et ha'ochel u'mani'ach et hapsolet." English translation: "It was taught in a Baraita, Rabban Gamliel said: In what case are these matters said - when the food is more abundant than the forbidden substance, but if the forbidden substance is more abundant than the food - the words of everyone agree that one removes the food and leaves the forbidden substance."

hebrew_text: פְּסוֹלֶת מְרוּבָּה עַל הָאוֹכֶל מִי אִיכָּא מַאן דְּשָׁרֵי? לָא צְרִיכָא, דִּנְפִישׁ בְּטִרְחָא וְזוּטַר בְּשִׁיעוּרָא.
human_translation: refuse is greater than the food, is there an opinion that permits No, necessary where is greater in effort, and smaller in size.
llm_translation: Fine flour in abundance on the food, who is permitted? Not necessary, for it is more in effort and less in quantity.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף מֵדִיחַ וְשׁוֹלֶה. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק: כָּךְ הָיָה מִנְהָגָן שֶׁל בֵּית רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, שֶׁהָיוּ מְבִיאִין דְּלִי מָלֵא עֲדָשִׁים וּמְצִיפִין עָלָיו מַיִם, וְנִמְצָא אוֹכֶל לְמַטָּה וּפְסוֹלֶת לְמַעְלָה.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: One may even wash and skim off It is taught Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, said: This was the custom of the house of Rabban Gamliel, that they would bring a bucket full with lentils and pour water in it, and then food down and the refuse up,
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: Also one who rinses and soaks. It was taught: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok said: This was the custom of the household of Rabban Gamliel, that they would bring a jug filled with lentils and pour water over it, and it was found that the food below was fit and the refuse above.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא אִיפְּכָא? לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּעַפְרָא, הָא בְּגִילֵי.
human_translation: But isn’t the opposite taught not difficult. This to earth, that of straw,
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Is this not a contradiction? This one is regarding ashes, and this one is regarding logs.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מְשַׁלְּחִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב אֶלָּא מָנוֹת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מְשַׁלְּחִין בְּהֵמָה חַיָּה וָעוֹף, בֵּין חַיִּין בֵּין שְׁחוּטִין. מְשַׁלְּחִין יֵינוֹת שְׁמָנִים וּסְלָתוֹת וְקִטְנִיּוֹת, אֲבָל לֹא תְּבוּאָה. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר בִּתְבוּאָה.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: One may send only portions on a Festival, And Beit Hillel say: One may send domesticated animals, undomesticated animals, and fowl, whether alive or slaughtered. one may send wines, oils, and flour, and legumes, but not grain, And Rabbi Shimon permits of grain,
