llm_translation: The Mishnah: Beit Shammai say: One may only send gifts on a festival day in the form of portions, while Beit Hillel say: One may send live animals and birds, whether alive or slaughtered. One may send wines, oils, and fine flour, but not produce. Rabbi Shimon permits sending produce.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנֵי רַב יְחִיאֵל: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲשֶׂנּוּ בְּשׁוּרָה. תָּנָא: אֵין שׁוּרָה פְּחוּתָה מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה בְּנֵי אָדָם. בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: תְּלָתָא גַּבְרֵי וּתְלָתָא מִינֵי מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Yeḥiel teaches: And provided that he does not do it by a convoy taught A convoy no less than three people; Rav Ashi raised a dilemma: three people and three types what is shall stand
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Rav Yechiel taught: And only if he does not do it intentionally. A Tanna taught: There is no unintentional sin involving less than three people. Rav Ashi asked: Three men and three types of what? Teiku."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר בִּתְבוּאָה. תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר בִּתְבוּאָה, כְּגוֹן: חִטִּין לַעֲשׂוֹת מֵהֶן לוּדִיּוֹת, שְׂעוֹרִים לִיתֵּן לִפְנֵי בְּהֶמְתּוֹ, עֲדָשִׁים לַעֲשׂוֹת מֵהֶן רְסִיסִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon permits of grain. It is taught Rabbi Shimon permits of grain, for example: Wheat to prepare from it ludiyot , barley to place before his animal; lentils to prepare from them resisin ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon permits with tevuah. It was taught: Rabbi Shimon permits with tevuah, such as: wheat to make them into crackers, barley to give before his animal, lentils to make them into grits.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מְשַׁלְּחִין כֵּלִים בֵּין תְּפוּרִין בֵּין שֶׁאֵינָן תְּפוּרִין, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן כִּלְאַיִם וְהֵן לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד. אֲבָל לֹא סַנְדָּל הַמְסוּמָּר וְלֹא מִנְעָל שֶׁאֵינוֹ תָּפוּר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף לֹא מִנְעָל לָבָן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁצָּרִיךְ אוּמָּן. זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל שֶׁנֵּאוֹתִין בּוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב — מְשַׁלְּחִין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: One may send clothes, whether sewn or whether they are unsewn, and even if they contain diverse kinds, But they the purposes of the Festival. However, one may not a spiked sandal, nor an unsewn shoe, Rabbi Yehuda says: One may not even a white shoe, because requires an artisan This is the principle: that one may use on a Festival, one may send it.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may send vessels, whether they are sewn or not sewn, even though they contain keys and are needed for the festival. However, one may not send a nailed sandal or an unsewn shoe. Rabbi Yehuda says: One may not even send a white shoe, because it requires a craftsman. This is the principle: Anything that is worn on a festival day - one may send it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא תְּפוּרִין — חֲזוּ לְמַלְבּוּשׁ, שֶׁאֵין תְּפוּרִין נָמֵי — חֲזוּ לְכַסּוֹיֵי, אֶלָּא כִּלְאַיִם לְמַאי חֲזוּ?
human_translation: Granted, sewn suitable for wearing. that are not sewn as well, they are suitable for covering But diverse kinds, for what are they suited?
llm_translation: Gemara: "G'ma bishlama t'furin - chazu l'malbush, she'ein t'furin namei - chazu l'kassoyei, ela kil'ayim l'mai chazu?"

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵימָא חֲזוּ לְמֵימַךְ תּוּתֵיהּ, וְהָתַנְיָא: ״לֹא יַעֲלֶה עָלֶיךָ״, אֲבָל אַתָּה יָכוֹל לְהַצִּיעוֹ תַּחְתֶּיךָ. אֲבָל אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אָסוּר לַעֲשׂוֹת כֵּן, שֶׁמָּא תִּכָּרֵךְ לוֹ נִימָא עַל בְּשָׂרוֹ.
human_translation: And if you say are suited for one to place underneath himself, but isn’t it taught “Neither shall there come upon you but you may spread it beneath you. However, the Sages said: It is prohibited to do so, lest a thread [ nima ] wind itself around his flesh.
llm_translation: And if you say, "Look at your mother's teat," and it was taught: "It shall not come upon you," but you can offer it beneath you. But the sages said: It is forbidden to do so, lest you cause him to feel disgust at his own flesh.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּמַפְסֵיק מִידֵּי בֵּינֵי בֵּינֵי, וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן שָׁאוּל, אָמַר רַבִּי מִשּׁוּם קְהָלָא קַדִּישָׁא דְּבִירוּשָׁלַיִם: אֲפִילּוּ עֶשֶׂר מַצָּעוֹת זוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי זוֹ וְכִלְאַיִם תַּחְתֵּיהֶן — אָסוּר לִישַׁן עֲלֵיהֶם (מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא יַעֲלֶה עָלֶיךָ״).
human_translation: And if you say that there is something separating between them, but didn’t Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said Rabbi Yosei ben Shaul said Rabbi said, in the name of the sacred congregation in Jerusalem: Even ten mattresses one on top of the other and diverse kinds underneath them, it is prohibited to sleep on them, as it is stated: “Neither shall there come upon you”
llm_translation: And if you will say that it interrupts between them, and Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, who said in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Sha'ul, who said in the name of Rabbi in the name of the holy congregation of Jerusalem: Even if there are ten mattresses, one on top of the other, and they are doubled underneath them — it is forbidden to sleep on them (because it is said: "It shall not come upon you").

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, בְּוִילוֹן. וְהָאָמַר עוּלָּא: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ וִילוֹן טָמֵא — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַשַּׁמָּשׁ מִתְחַמֵּם כְּנֶגְדּוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, to a curtain [ vilon ] But didn’t Ulla say: For what did say a curtain is ritually impure, Because the attendant warms himself with it.
llm_translation: Rather, in Vilun. And Ulah said: Why did they say Vilun is impure? Because the sun warms opposite it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּקָשִׁין, וְכִי הָא דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הַאי נַמְטָא גַּמְדָּא דְּנַרֶשׁ — שַׁרְיָא.
human_translation: Rather, to hard And in accordance with that Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: this hard felt [ namta ] of Neresh, it is permitted
llm_translation: Rather, with difficulty. But is this not what Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: "This raised pile of coins is permitted."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: עַרְדָּלִין — אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם כִּלְאַיִם. אָמַר רָבָא: הָנֵי צְרָרֵי דִּפְשִׁיטֵי — אֵין בָּהֶם מִשּׁוּם כִּלְאַיִם, דְּבִזְרָנֵי — יֵשׁ בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם כִּלְאַיִם. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם כִּלְאַיִם, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין דֶּרֶךְ חִמּוּם בְּכָךְ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: felt socks [ ardalayin ], there is no diverse kinds regarding them, Rava said: These bundles for coins, there is no diverse kinds with regard to them. for seeds, there is diverse kinds with regard to them, Rav Ashi said: Both this and that have no diverse kinds with regard to them because these is not the manner of keeping warm.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Ardalim - they do not have the status of kilayim. Rava said: Those bundles that are spread out - they do not have the status of kilayim, but those that are tied - they have the status of kilayim. Rav Ashe said: Whether this one or that one, they do not have the status of kilayim, because it is not the way to heat them in this manner.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לֹא סַנְדָּל הַמְסוּמָּר. סַנְדָּל הַמְסוּמָּר מַאי טַעְמָא לָא? מִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה.
human_translation: However, one may not a spiked sandal A spiked sandal, what is the reason not due to an incident that occurred.
llm_translation: But not a sandal that is nailed. A sandal that is nailed, what is the reason it is not allowed? Because of an incident that occurred.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: סַנְדָּל הַמְסוּמָּר אָסוּר לְנׇעֳלוֹ וּמוּתָּר לְטַלְטְלוֹ. אָסוּר לְנׇעֳלוֹ — מִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה, וּמוּתָּר לְטַלְטְלוֹ — מִדְּקָתָנֵי: ״אֵין מְשַׁלְּחִין״, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָסוּר לְטַלְטְלוֹ, הַשְׁתָּא לְטַלְטוֹלֵי אָסוּר, מְשַׁלְּחִין מִבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: Abaye said: a spiked sandal, it is prohibited to wear it but it is permitted to move it. It is prohibited to wear due to incident that occurred. And it is permitted to move it, from that teaches: One may not send. For if it enters your mind it is prohibited to move now it were prohibited to move it, required one may send it?
llm_translation: Abaye said: A sandal that is nailed is prohibited to wear, but permitted to move. Prohibited to wear - because of an incident that occurred, and permitted to move - from the teaching: "We do not send out," for if according to your opinion it is prohibited to move it, now moving it is prohibited, do we send out from the inquiry?

hebrew_text: וְלֹא מִנְעָל שֶׁאֵינוֹ תָּפוּר. פְּשִׁיטָא! לֹא נִצְרְכָא, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּנָקֵיט בְּסִיכֵּי.
human_translation: Nor an unsewn shoe obvious, was necessary that although is attached with pins
llm_translation: "And not a sandal that is not stitched. It is obvious! It is not necessary, for even though it is tied with straps."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף לֹא מִנְעָל לָבָן. תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר בְּשָׁחוֹר, וְאוֹסֵר בְּלָבָן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁצָּרִיךְ בֵּיצַת הַגִּיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹסֵר בַּשָּׁחוֹר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁצָּרִיךְ לְצַחְצְחוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: One may not even a white shoe. It is taught Rabbi Yehuda permits of a black but prohibits of a white one because requires a lump of chalk Rabbi Yosei prohibits of a black because one needs to polish it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: Even not a white shoe. It was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Yehudah permits in black and prohibits in white, because the egg of the geir is needed. Rabbi Yosei prohibits in black, because it needs to be polished.

hebrew_text: וְלָא פְּלִיגִי. מָר כִּי אַתְרֵיהּ וּמָר כִּי אַתְרֵיהּ. בְּאַתְרֵיהּ דְּמָר — בִּשְׂרָא לְתַחַת, בְּאַתְרֵיהּ דְּמָר — בִּשְׂרָא לְעֵיל.
human_translation: And they do not disagree Sage in accordance with of his locale, and Sage in accordance with his locale. In the place of Sage, flesh underneath, in the place of Sage, flesh above,
llm_translation: They did not argue. Master when he is present, and Master when he is present. In the place where Master is - flesh below, in the place where Master is - flesh above.

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל כֹּל שֶׁנֵּאוֹתִין בּוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב. רַב שֵׁשֶׁת שְׁרָא לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן לְשַׁדּוֹרֵי תְּפִלִּין בְּיוֹמָא טָבָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן, כֹּל שֶׁנֵּאוֹתִין בּוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב — מְשַׁלְּחִין אוֹתוֹ! הָכִי קָאָמַר: כֹּל שֶׁנֵּאוֹתִין בּוֹ בְּחוֹל — מְשַׁלְּחִין אוֹתוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: this is the principle: any that one may use on a Festival, Rav Sheshet permitted the Sages to send phylacteries on a Festival. Abaye said to him: But didn’t we learn any that one may use on a Festival, one may send it? This is what is saying: any that one may use on a weekday, one may send it on a Festival.
llm_translation: This is the general rule: anything that is disliked on a festival day. Rav Sheshet permitted the Sages to inspect phylacteries on a festival day. Abaye said to him: But didn't we learn: anything that is disliked on a festival day — we send it away! This is what he meant to say: anything that is disliked on a weekday — we send it away on a festival day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תְּפִלִּין, הוֹאִיל וַאֲתוֹ לְיָדָן, נֵימָא בְּהוּ מִילְּתָא: הָיָה בָּא בַּדֶּרֶךְ וּתְפִלִּין בְּרֹאשׁוֹ, וְשָׁקְעָה עָלָיו חַמָּה — מַנִּיחַ יָדוֹ עֲלֵיהֶם עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לְבֵיתוֹ. הָיָה יוֹשֵׁב בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ וּתְפִלִּין בְּרֹאשׁוֹ וְקִדֵּשׁ עָלָיו הַיּוֹם — מַנִּיחַ יָדוֹ עֲלֵיהֶן עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לְבֵיתוֹ.
human_translation: Abaye said: phylacteries, since has come before us let us say matter about it: was coming on the road and phylacteries on his head, and the sun set he he places his hand upon them until he reaches his house, he was sitting in the study hall with phylacteries on his head, and the day was sanctified, for he he places his hand upon them until he reaches his house.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Regarding tefillin, since they came into our hands, let us say a matter: If one was walking on the road with tefillin on his head, and the sun set upon him - he places his hand upon them until he reaches his house. If one was sitting in the study hall with tefillin on his head, and the day became sanctified upon him - he places his hand upon them until he reaches his house.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: הָיָה בָּא בַּדֶּרֶךְ וּתְפִלִּין בְּרֹאשׁוֹ וְקִדֵּשׁ עָלָיו הַיּוֹם — מַנִּיחַ יָדוֹ עֲלֵיהֶן עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לְבֵית הַסָּמוּךְ לַחוֹמָה. הָיָה יוֹשֵׁב בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ וְקִדֵּשׁ עָלָיו הַיּוֹם — מַנִּיחַ יָדוֹ עֲלֵיהֶן עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לַבַּיִת הַסָּמוּךְ לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Ika, raised an objection one was coming on the road with phylacteries on his head, and the day was sanctified he he places his hand upon them until he reaches the house nearest the wall, If he was sitting in the study hall, and the day was sanctified, for he he places his hand upon them until he reaches a house that is near the study hall,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Huna, son of Rav Ika, raised a dilemma: If one was walking on the road with Tefillin on his head, and sanctified the day upon him - he places his hand upon them until he reaches the house adjacent to the wall. If one was sitting in the study hall and sanctified the day upon him - he places his hand upon them until he reaches the house adjacent to the study hall.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּמִנַּטְרָא, הָא דְּלָא מִנַּטְרָא.
human_translation: not difficult. This where safeguarded that where they are not safeguarded
llm_translation: Not difficult: this one who guards, this one who does not guard.

hebrew_text: אִי דְּלָא מִנַּטְרָא, מַאי אִירְיָא בְּרֹאשׁוֹ? אֲפִילּוּ מַחֲתָן בְּאַרְעָא נָמֵי, דְּהָא תְּנַן: הַמּוֹצֵא תְּפִלִּין — מַכְנִיסָן זוּג זוּג!
human_translation: If where not safeguarded, why specifically on his head? Even placed on the ground, also for didn’t we learn One who finds phylacteries bring them into one pair at a time?
llm_translation: If he did not guard it, what is the ruling regarding his head? Even if he is a groom in the city, for we learned: "One who finds tefillin - he should bring them in pairs!"

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דְּמִנַּטְרָא מֵחֲמַת גַּנָּבֵי וּמֵחֲמַת כַּלְבֵי. הָא — דְּמִנַּטְרָא מֵחֲמַת כַּלְבֵי וְלָא מִנַּטְרָא מֵחֲמַת גַּנָּבֵי.
human_translation: not difficult. This where they are safeguarded from thieves and from dogs. That where they are safeguarded from dogs but are not safeguarded from thieves.
llm_translation: Not difficult: this — that one guards due to thieves and due to dogs. This — that one guards due to dogs and not guards due to thieves.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: רוֹב לִסְטִים יִשְׂרָאֵל נִינְהוּ וְלָא מְזַלְזְלִי בְּהוּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Lest you say: Since most thieves [ listim ] are Jews, who would not treat with contempt, teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? Most of the bandits are Israelites, and we do not belittle them, as it is stated.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ בֵּיצָה
llm_translation: We will return to you with an egg.

hebrew_text: יוֹם טוֹב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — לֹא יְבַשֵּׁל בַּתְּחִלָּה מִיּוֹם טוֹב לְשַׁבָּת. אֲבָל מְבַשֵּׁל הוּא לְיוֹם טוֹב, וְאִם הוֹתִיר — הוֹתִיר לַשַּׁבָּת. וְעוֹשֶׂה תַּבְשִׁיל מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב, וְסוֹמֵךְ עָלָיו לַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: a Festival that occurs Shabbat eve, one may not cook on the Festival with the initial for Shabbat. However, he may cook for the Festival and if he left over he left over for Shabbat. One may prepare a cooked dish on a Festival eve and rely on it for Shabbat.
llm_translation: A good day that falls on the eve of Shabbat - one should not cook at the outset from the day of the good day to Shabbat. But if one cooked for the good day, and if there is leftover - it is left for Shabbat. And one may prepare a dish from the eve of the good day, and rely on it for Shabbat.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שְׁנֵי תַבְשִׁילִין, ובֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: תַּבְשִׁיל אֶחָד. וְשָׁוִין בְּדָג וּבֵיצָה שֶׁעָלָיו, שֶׁהֵן שְׁנֵי תַבְשִׁילִין.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: two cooked dishes, and Beit Hillel say: One dish And they agree with regard to a fish and egg that is on it that these are two dishes
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: Two cooked dishes, and House of Hillel says: One cooked dish. And they agree regarding fish and egg cooked upon it, that they are two cooked dishes.

hebrew_text: אֲכָלוֹ אוֹ שֶׁאָבַד — לֹא יְבַשֵּׁל עָלָיו בַּתְּחִלָּה. וְאִם שִׁיֵּיר מִמֶּנּוּ כׇּל שֶׁהוּא, — סוֹמֵךְ עָלָיו לַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: one ate or if it was lost, he may not on it cook with the initial If he left any part of rely on it for Shabbat.
llm_translation: He ate it or it got lost - he should not cook on it initially. And if he left over from it anything at all - he relies on it for Shabbat.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״זָכוֹר אֶת יוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת לְקַדְּשׁוֹ״, זׇכְרֵהוּ — מֵאַחֵר שֶׁבָּא לְהַשְׁכִּיחוֹ.
human_translation: From where are these matters Shmuel said as the verse states: “Remember the Shabbat day, to keep it holy” Remember it from another that comes to make it forgotten.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemar mena hanei milei? Amar Shmuel, de'amar kra: "Zachor et yom haShabbat lekadeshו", zochreihu - me'acher sheba lehashkicho. English translation: What are these matters completed with? Shmuel said, as the verse states: "Remember the Sabbath day to sanctify it," remember it - from when it comes to forget it.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רָבָא: כְּדַי שֶׁיִּבְרוֹר מָנָה יָפָה לַשַּׁבָּת וּמָנָה יָפָה לְיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: What is the reason Rava said: so that one will select a choice portion for Shabbat and a choice portion for the Festival.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Rava said: In order to set aside a beautiful portion for the Sabbath and a beautiful portion for the festival.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כְּדֵי שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ אֵין אוֹפִין מִיּוֹם טוֹב לַשַּׁבָּת, קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִיּוֹם טוֹב לְחוֹל.
human_translation: Rav Ashi stated so that will say: One may not bake on a Festival for Shabbat all the more so, on a Festival for a weekday.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: In order that they should say, "We do not bake from Yom Tov to Shabbat," an a fortiori inference from Yom Tov to a weekday.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: עוֹשֶׂה תַּבְשִׁיל מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב וְסוֹמֵךְ עָלָיו לַשַּׁבָּת. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי דְּאָמַר כְּדֵי שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ אֵין אוֹפִין מִיּוֹם טוֹב לַשַּׁבָּת, הַיְינוּ דְּמֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — אִין, בְּיוֹם טוֹב — לָא. אֶלָּא לְרָבָא, מַאי אִירְיָא מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב? אֲפִילּוּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב נָמֵי!
human_translation: We learned One may prepare a cooked dish on a Festival eve and rely on it for Shabbat. Granted, according to Rav Ashi, who said so that will say: One may not bake on a Festival for Shabbat; that is on a Festival eve, yes, on the Festival no, However, according to Rava, why specifically on a Festival eve? Even on the Festival as well,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: One may prepare a dish from Erev Yom Tov and rely on it for Shabbat. According to Rav Ashi, this is reasonable, for he said: So that people will not say, "We do not bake from Yom Tov for Shabbat." This means that from Erev Yom Tov — no, but on Yom Tov — yes. However, according to Rava, what is the difference from Erev Yom Tov? Even on Yom Tov itself!

hebrew_text: אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, אֶלָּא גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יִפְשַׁע.
human_translation: Yes, it is indeed so; However, a decree lest one be negligent
llm_translation: So it is not really so, but rather a decree lest one transgress.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא מַיְיתֵי לַהּ מֵהָכָא: ״אֵת אֲשֶׁר תֹּאפוּ אֵפוּ וְאֵת אֲשֶׁר תְּבַשְּׁלוּ בַּשֵּׁלוּ״, מִכָּאן אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: אֵין אוֹפִין אֶלָּא עַל הָאָפוּי, וְאֵין מְבַשְּׁלִין אֶלָּא עַל הַמְבוּשָּׁל. מִכָּאן סָמְכוּ חֲכָמִים לְעֵרוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין מִן הַתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: And a tanna cites from here, Bake that which you will bake and cook that which you will cook, From here Rabbi Eliezer said: One may bake only on that which was baked and one may cook only on that which was cooked. From this the Sages established to joining of cooked foods from the Torah.
llm_translation: And it was taught to her from here: "What you bake, bake; and what you cook, cook." From here Rabbi Eliezer said: One may only bake on that which is already baked, and one may only cook on that which is already cooked. From here the Sages relied on the mixture of cooked dishes from the Torah.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר שֶׁהָיָה יוֹשֵׁב וְדוֹרֵשׁ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ בְּהִלְכוֹת יוֹם טוֹב. יָצְתָה כַּת רִאשׁוֹנָה, אָמַר: הַלָּלוּ בַּעֲלֵי פִטָּסִין. כַּת שְׁנִיָּה, אָמַר: הַלָּלוּ בַּעֲלֵי חָבִיּוֹת. כַּת שְׁלִישִׁית, אָמַר: הַלָּלוּ בַּעֲלֵי כַדִּין.
human_translation: The Sages taught There was an incident involving Rabbi Eliezer, who was sitting and lecturing about the halakhot of the Festival throughout the entire day. the first group left he said: These owners of extremely large jugs [ pittasin ], a second group He said: These are owners of barrels, a third group he said: These are owners of jugs,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident involving Rabbi Eliezer, who would sit and expound the entire day on the laws of the festival. The first group of students said: These are the owners of flasks. The second group said: These are the owners of barrels. The third group said: These are the owners of jugs.

hebrew_text: כַּת רְבִיעִית, אָמַר: הַלָּלוּ בַּעֲלֵי לְגִינִין. כַּת חֲמִישִׁית, אָמַר: הַלָּלוּ בַּעֲלֵי כוֹסוֹת. הִתְחִילוּ כַּת שִׁשִּׁית לָצֵאת, אָמַר: הַלָּלוּ בַּעֲלֵי מְאֵרָה.
human_translation: A fourth group he said: These are owners of jars [ laginin ], a fifth group, he said: These are owners of cups, a sixth group began to leave, he said: These are owners of a curse;
llm_translation: Fourth category, said: These are the owners of gardens. Fifth category, said: These are the owners of cups. When they began the sixth category to exit, said: These are the owners of curses.

hebrew_text: נָתַן עֵינָיו בַּתַּלְמִידִים, הִתְחִילוּ פְּנֵיהֶם מִשְׁתַּנִּין. אָמַר לָהֶם: בָּנַי, לֹא לָכֶם אֲנִי אוֹמֵר, אֶלָּא לְהַלָּלוּ שֶׁיָּצְאוּ, שֶׁמַּנִּיחִים חַיֵּי עוֹלָם וְעוֹסְקִים בְּחַיֵּי שָׁעָה.
human_translation: He cast his eyes upon the students their faces began to change He said to them: My sons, I did not say about you but about those who left, because they abandon eternal life and engage in temporary life
llm_translation: He placed his eyes on the disciples, their faces began to change. He said to them: My sons, I am not speaking to you, but to those who have gone out to praise, who forsake eternal life and engage in temporary life.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁעַת פְּטִירָתָן, אָמַר לָהֶם: ״לְכוּ אִכְלוּ מַשְׁמַנִּים וּשְׁתוּ מַמְתַקִּים וְשִׁלְחוּ מָנוֹת לְאֵין נָכוֹן לוֹ כִּי קָדוֹשׁ הַיּוֹם לַאֲדֹנֵינוּ וְאַל תֵּעָצֵבוּ כִּי חֶדְוַת ה׳ הִיא מָעֻזְּכֶם״.
human_translation: At the time of departure he said to them “Go your way, eat the fat and drink the sweet, and send portions to him for whom nothing is prepared, for this day is holy to our Lord; and do not be grieved, for the joy of the Lord is your strength”
llm_translation: At the time of their departure, he said to them: "Go, eat rich foods and drink sweet drinks, and send portions to those for whom nothing is prepared, for this day is holy to our Lord. Do not be sad, for the joy of the Lord is your strength."

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: שֶׁמַּנִּיחִין חַיֵּי עוֹלָם וְעוֹסְקִין בְּחַיֵּי שָׁעָה — וְהָא שִׂמְחַת יוֹם טוֹב מִצְוָה הִיא! רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: שִׂמְחַת יוֹם טוֹב רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: The Master said Because they abandon eternal life and engage in temporary life. But isn’t the joy of the Festival a mitzva Rabbi Eliezer to his reasoning, he said: joy on a Festival is optional.
llm_translation: Master said: "One should leave eternal life and engage in temporary life - but isn't the joy of a festival a commandment! Rabbi Eliezer according to his reasoning, as he said: the joy of a festival is optional."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֵין לוֹ לָאָדָם בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אֶלָּא אוֹ אוֹכֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה, אוֹ יוֹשֵׁב וְשׁוֹנֶה. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר, חַלְּקֵהוּ: חֶצְיוֹ לַה׳, וְחֶצְיוֹ לָכֶם.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: A person has no a Festival apart from either eating and drinking, or sitting and studying Rabbi Yehoshua says: divide it: Half to God, and half to yourselves,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: A person should have on a festival, either eat and drink, or sit and learn. Rabbi Yehoshua says: Divide it: half for the Lord, and half for you.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ. כָּתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״עֲצֶרֶת לַה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״, וְכָתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״עֲצֶרֶת תִּהְיֶה לָכֶם״. הָא כֵּיצַד? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: אוֹ כּוּלּוֹ לַה׳, אוֹ כּוּלּוֹ לָכֶם. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סָבַר: חַלְּקֵהוּ, חֶצְיוֹ לַה׳ וְחֶצְיוֹ לָכֶם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: And both of them derived from one verse, One verse states: a solemn assembly for the Lord, your God” and one verse states: “It shall be a solemn assembly for you” How is this Rabbi Eliezer holds either entirely for God, or entirely for you, and Rabbi Yehoshua holds Split half of it for God and half of it for you.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: And both of them expounded one verse. It is written, one verse says: "A solemn assembly to the Lord your God," and another verse says: "A solemn assembly shall be for you." How so? Rabbi Eliezer holds: Either all of it is for the Lord, or all of it is for you. And Rabbi Yehoshua holds: Divide it, half for the Lord and half for you.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״לְאֵין נָכוֹן לוֹ״? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לְמִי שֶׁלֹּא הִנִּיחַ עֵירוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: מִי שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה לוֹ לְהַנִּיחַ עֵירוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין, אֲבָל מִי שֶׁהָיָה לוֹ לְהַנִּיחַ עֵירוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין וְלֹא הִנִּיחַ — פּוֹשֵׁעַ הוּא.
human_translation: What is to him for whom nothing is prepared” Rav Ḥisda said: he did not prepare a joining of cooked foods Some say one who did not have to prepare a joining of cooked foods but one who had to prepare a joining of cooked foods and did not prepare is negligent,
llm_translation: What is meant by "it is not proper for him"? Rav Ḥisda said: For one who did not set aside Eruvei Tavshilin. Some say: For one who did not have the ability to set aside Eruvei Tavshilin, but one who had the ability to set aside Eruvei Tavshilin and did not do so — he is transgressing.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״כִּי חֶדְוַת ה׳ הִיא מָעֻזְּכֶם״? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אָמַר לָהֶם הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: בָּנַי, לְווּ עָלַי, וְקַדְּשׁוּ קְדוּשַּׁת הַיּוֹם, וְהַאֲמִינוּ בִּי וַאֲנִי פּוֹרֵעַ.
human_translation: What is “For the joy of the Lord is your strength”? Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Shimon: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to the Jewish people: My children, borrow on My and sanctify the sanctity of the day and trust in Me, and I will repay
llm_translation: What is "For the delight of the Lord is your strength"? Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Shimon: The Holy One, blessed be He, said to the people of Israel: My sons, rely on Me, sanctify the sanctity of the day, believe in Me, and I will repay.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: הָרוֹצֶה שֶׁיִּתְקַיְּימוּ נְכָסָיו — יִטַּע בָּהֶן אֶדֶר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַדִּיר בַּמָּרוֹם ה׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Shimon: One who wants his properties to be preserved plant an eder among them, as it is stated: “The Lord on high is mighty [ adir ]”
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Eliezer the son of Rabbi Shimon: One who wishes his possessions to endure should plant a cedar tree among them, as it is said: "Adir in the heights of the Lord."

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי אַדְרָא כִּשְׁמֵיהּ, כִּדְאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: מַאי אַדְרָא — דְּקָיְימָא לְדָרֵי דָּרֵי. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: שָׂדֶה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ אֶדֶר אֵינָהּ נִגְזֶלֶת וְאֵינָהּ נֶחְמֶסֶת, וּפֵירוֹתֶיהָ מִשְׁתַּמְּרִין.
human_translation: Alternatively: The eder as its name, as people say: What is the eder ? that endures for many generations [ darei ]. This is also taught A field that contains an eder will be neither stolen nor forcibly removed and its fruit is preserved,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ii namei adra kishmeih, kid'amri inashei: Mai adra - dekayma ledarei darei. Tanaya namei hachi: Sadeh sheyesh bah eder einah nigzelet ve'einah nechmeset, u'peirotheha mishtamerin." English translation: "If his name is Adra, as people say: What is Adra - that it stands for generations of generations. It was taught similarly: A field that has a fence around it is not subject to theft or robbery, and its fruits are preserved."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב תַּחְלִיפָא אֲחוּהּ דְּרַבְנַאי חוֹזָאָה:
human_translation: Rav Taḥlifa, brother Ravnai Ḥoza’a, taught:
llm_translation: It was taught: Rav Tahalifa, the brother of Rabbanai, saw a vision.

hebrew_text: כׇּל מְזוֹנוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָדָם קְצוּבִים לוֹ מֵרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וְעַד יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, חוּץ מֵהוֹצָאַת שַׁבָּתוֹת וְהוֹצָאַת יוֹם טוֹב וְהוֹצָאַת בָּנָיו לְתַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה, שֶׁאִם פָּחַת — פּוֹחֲתִין לוֹ, וְאִם הוֹסִיף — מוֹסִיפִין לוֹ.
human_translation: A person’s entire livelihood is allocated to him from Rosh HaShana to Yom Kippur. except for expenditures for Shabbatot , and expenditures for Festivals, and expenditures for his sons’ Torah study. if he reduced his is reduced and if he increased his is increased
llm_translation: All sustenance of a person is decreed for him from Rosh Hashanah until Yom Kippur, except for expenses for Shabbat, expenses for festivals, and expenses for his children's Torah study. If he is lacking, they decrease for him, and if he adds, they increase for him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, מַאי קְרָאָה: ״תִּקְעוּ בַחֹדֶשׁ שׁוֹפָר (בַּכֵּסֶא) לְיוֹם חַגֵּנוּ״, אֵיזֶהוּ חַג שֶׁהַחֹדֶשׁ מִתְכַּסֶּה בּוֹ — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, וּכְתִיב: ״כִּי חֹק לְיִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא מִשְׁפָּט לֵאלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: What is the verse “Blow the shofar at the New Moon, at the concealed for our Festival day” On which Festival is the new moon concealed? must say it is Rosh HaShana, And it is written “For it is a statute [ ḥok ] for Israel, a judgment of the God of Jacob”
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said, what is the verse: "Blow the shofar on the new moon, on the appointed time for our feast," which holiday is it that the new moon is covered by it? — One would say this is Rosh Hashanah, and it is written: "For it is a statute for Israel, an ordinance of the God of Jacob."

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי ״חֹק״ לִישָּׁנָא דִּמְזוֹנֵי הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאָכְלוּ אֶת חֻקָּם אֲשֶׁר נָתַן לָהֶם פַּרְעֹה״. מָר זוּטְרָא אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״הַטְרִיפֵנִי לֶחֶם חֻקִּי״.
human_translation: From where be inferred that this “statute [ ḥok ]” is a term to food? As it is written: “And they ate their allotment [ ḥukkam ], which Pharaoh gave them” Mar Zutra said: from here: “Feed me with my allotted [ ḥukki ] bread”
llm_translation: What is the implication that this "statute" refers to sustenance, as it is written: "And they shall eat the flesh of their "statute" that Pharaoh gave them." Mar Zutra said, from here: "Sustain me with the bread of my "statute"."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל שַׁמַּאי הַזָּקֵן, כׇּל יָמָיו הָיָה אוֹכֵל לִכְבוֹד שַׁבָּת. מָצָא בְּהֵמָה נָאָה, אוֹמֵר: זוֹ לַשַּׁבָּת. מָצָא אַחֶרֶת נָאָה הֵימֶנָּה — מַנִּיחַ אֶת הַשְּׁנִיָּה וְאוֹכֵל אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה.
human_translation: It is taught They said about Shammai the Elder all his days he would eat in honor of Shabbat. he found a choice animal, he say: This is for Shabbat. he found another one choicer than it, he set aside the second and eat the first.
llm_translation: It was taught: They said of Shammai the Elder, all his days he would eat in honor of the Sabbath. If he found a nice animal, he would say: This is for the Sabbath. If he found another nicer than it, he would set aside the first and eat the second.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הִלֵּל הַזָּקֵן — מִדָּה אַחֶרֶת הָיְתָה לוֹ, שֶׁכׇּל מַעֲשָׂיו לְשֵׁם שָׁמַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּרוּךְ ה׳ יוֹם יוֹם״, תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מֵחַד שַׁבָּיךְ לְשַׁבְּתָיךְ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: ״בָּרוּךְ ה׳ יוֹם יוֹם״.
human_translation: However, Hillel the Elder had a different trait, that all his actions, were for the sake of Heaven, as it is stated: “Blessed be the Lord, day by day; That is also taught Beit Shammai say: From the first of the week, for your Shabbat. And Beit Hillel say: “Blessed be the Lord, day by day.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But Hillel the Elder — had another attribute, that all his actions were for the sake of Heaven, as it is stated: "Blessed be the Lord day by day." It was taught similarly: Beit Shammai say: From the first day of the week to the Sabbath, and Beit Hillel say: "Blessed be the Lord day by day."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: הַנּוֹתֵן מַתָּנָה לַחֲבֵרוֹ אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהוֹדִיעוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמֹשֶׁה לֹא יָדַע כִּי קָרַן עוֹר פָּנָיו״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: One who gives a gift to his friend need not inform him As it is stated: “And Moses did not know that the skin of his face was radiant”
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: One who gives a gift to his fellow does not need to inform him, as it is stated: "And Moses did not know that the skin of his face shone."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״לָדַעַת כִּי אֲנִי ה׳ מְקַדִּשְׁכֶם״, אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה: מֹשֶׁה! מַתָּנָה טוֹבָה יֵשׁ לִי בְּבֵית גְּנָזַי וְשַׁבָּת שְׁמָהּ, וַאֲנִי מְבַקֵּשׁ לִיתְּנָהּ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, לֵךְ וְהוֹדִיעַ אוֹתָם. מִכָּאן אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: הַנּוֹתֵן פַּת לְתִינוֹק, צָרִיךְ לְהוֹדִיעַ לְאִמּוֹ.
human_translation: raises an objection that you may know that I am the Lord Who sanctifies you” The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Moses: Moses, I have a good gift in My treasury, and its name is Shabbat, and I wish to give it to the Jewish people. Go and inform them And from here Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: One who gives a piece of bread to a child must inform his mother
llm_translation: The question was raised: "To know that I am the Lord who sanctifies you," the Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moses: Moses! I have a precious gift in my treasury and its name is Sabbath, and I wish to give it to Israel, go and inform them. From here Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: One who gives bread to a child, must inform his mother.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּמַתָּנָה דַּעֲבִידָא לְאִגַּלּוֹיֵי, הָא בְּמַתָּנָה דְּלָא עֲבִידָא לְאִגַּלּוֹיֵי. שַׁבָּת נָמֵי מַתָּנָה דַּעֲבִידָא לְאִגַּלּוֹיֵי! מַתַּן שְׂכָרָהּ לָא עֲבִידָא לְאִגַּלּוֹיֵי.
human_translation: not difficult; this is referring to a gift that is likely to be revealed, that is referring to a gift that is not likely to be revealed Shabbat also a gift that is likely to be revealed, its reward is not likely to be revealed.
llm_translation: Not difficult: this in a gift that is made for revealing, this in a gift that is not made for revealing. Shabbat also, a gift that is made for revealing! The reward of it is not made for revealing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר, מִכָּאן אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: הַנּוֹתֵן פַּת לְתִינוֹק צָרִיךְ לְהוֹדִיעַ לְאִמּוֹ. מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? שָׁיֵיף לֵיהּ מִשְׁחָא וּמָלֵי לֵיהּ כּוּחְלָא. וְהָאִידָּנָא דְּחָיְישִׁינַן לִכְשָׁפִים, מַאי? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: שָׁיֵיף לֵיהּ מֵאוֹתוֹ הַמִּין.
human_translation: The Master said from here Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: One who gives a piece of bread to a child must inform his mother. What does he do to him; He rubs oil on him and paints his eyes blue, And nowadays, when we are concerned about witchcraft, what Rav Pappa said: He rubs on of that same type
llm_translation: Master said, from here Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: One who gives bread to a child must inform his mother. What does he do for him? He grinds for him wheat and fills it with oil. And nowadays when we are concerned about witchcraft, what does he do? Rav Papa said: He grinds for him from that same species.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: כׇּל מִצְוֹת שֶׁנָּתַן לָהֶם הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — נָתַן לָהֶם בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא, חוּץ מִשַּׁבָּת שֶׁנָּתַן לָהֶם בְּצִנְעָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בֵּינִי וּבֵין בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אוֹת הִיא לְעוֹלָם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: All mitzvot that the Holy One, Blessed be He, gave to the Jewish people, He gave to them in public [ parhesya ] except for Shabbat, which he gave to them in private. As it is stated: “It is a sign between Me and the children of Israel forever”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: All commandments that the Holy One, blessed be He, gave to the children of Israel — He gave to them openly, except for the Sabbath which He gave to them in secret, as it is stated: "It is a sign between Me and the children of Israel forever."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, לָא לִעַנְשׁוּ גּוֹיִם עֲלַהּ? שַׁבָּת — אוֹדוֹעֵי אוֹדְעִינְהוּ, מַתַּן שְׂכָרָהּ — לָא אוֹדְעִינְהוּ. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: מַתַּן שְׂכָרָהּ נָמֵי אוֹדְעִינְהוּ, נְשָׁמָה יְתֵירָה — לָא אוֹדְעִינְהוּ.
human_translation: If so the gentiles should not be punished for it; did inform them Shabbat, did not inform them the reward And if you wish, say He also informed its reward, additional soul He did not inform them.
llm_translation: If so, are the nations not punished for it? Shabbat - it is known, it is known to them; the reward of it - it is not known. And if you wish, say: the reward of it is also known to them, the extra soul - it is not known.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: נְשָׁמָה יְתֵירָה נוֹתֵן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בָּאָדָם עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, וּלְמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת נוֹטְלִין אוֹתָהּ הֵימֶנּוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שָׁבַת וַיִּנָּפַשׁ״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁשָּׁבַת וַוי אָבְדָה נֶפֶשׁ.
human_translation: As Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, gives a person an additional soul on Shabbat eve, and at the conclusion of Shabbat removes it from him, as it is stated: “He ceased from work and was refreshed [ vayinafash ]” Since he ceased from work, woe [ vai ] soul [ nefesh ] lost.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: An additional soul the Holy One, blessed be He, gives to a person on Friday evening, and at the conclusion of the Sabbath, He takes it from him, as it is stated: "He rested on the Sabbath day and was refreshed," once the Sabbath has ended, the additional soul departs.

hebrew_text: עוֹשֶׂה אָדָם תַּבְשִׁיל מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא תַּבְשִׁיל, אֲבָל פַּת — לָא.
human_translation: a person may prepare a cooked dish on a Festival eve Abaye said: They taught only a cooked dish; however, bread no,
llm_translation: A person may prepare a dish from Friday afternoon. Abaye said: They only taught regarding a dish, but bread - no.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא פַּת דְּלָא? אִילֵּימָא מִידֵּי דִּמְלַפֵּת בָּעֵינַן, וּפַת לָא מְלַפְּתָא — וְהָא דַּיְיסָא נָמֵי דְּלָא מְלַפְּתָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: הָנֵי בַּבְלָאֵי טַפְשָׁאֵי דְּאָכְלִי נַהֲמָא בְּנַהֲמָא. וְאָמַר רַב נְחוּמִי בַּר זְכַרְיָה מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי: מְעָרְבִין בְּדַיְיסָא! אֶלָּא: מִידֵּי דְּלָא שְׁכִיחַ בָּעֵינַן, וּפַת שְׁכִיחָא, וְדַיְיסָא לָא שְׁכִיחָא.
human_translation: What is different bread that not If we say we require something that accompanies and bread does not accompany Porridge also does not accompany Rabbi Zeira said: Those foolish Babylonians eat bread with bread, and Rav Neḥumi bar Zekharya said in the name of Abaye: One may establish an eiruv with porridge. Rather, We require something that is not routine, and bread is routine, porridge is not routine.
llm_translation: What is different about bread that is not baked? If you say it is because we require something that is baked, and bread is not baked - but this fish also is not baked, as Rabbi Zeira said: Those Babylonian fools who eat fish raw. And Rav Neḥumi bar Zeḥarya said in the name of Abbaye: They mix it with fish! Rather, it is because we do not commonly need it, and bread is common, but this fish is not common.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא תַּבְשִׁיל, אֲבָל פַּת — לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא דְּמִידֵּי דְּלָא שְׁכִיחַ בָּעֵינַן, וּפַת שְׁכִיחָא — וְהָא דַּיְיסָא לָא שְׁכִיחָא, וְאָמַר רַב נְחוּמִי בַּר זְכַרְיָה מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי: אֵין מְעָרְבִין בְּדַיְיסָא! אֶלָּא: מִידֵּי דִּמְלַפֵּת בָּעֵינַן, וּפַת לָא מְלַפְּתָא, וְדַיְיסָא נָמֵי לָא מְלַפְּתָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: הָנֵי בַּבְלָאֵי טַפְשָׁאֵי דְּאָכְלִי נַהֲמָא בְּנַהֲמָא.
human_translation: Some say Abaye said: They taught only a cooked dish; however, bread, no, What is the reason If we say that we require something that is not routine, and bread is routine, Isn’t porridge not routine? And Rav Neḥumi bar Zekharya said in the name of Abaye: One may not establish an eiruv with porridge. Rather, We require something that accompanies and bread does not accompany and porridge, too, does not accompany as Rabbi Zeira said: Those foolish Babylonians eat bread with bread,
llm_translation: There are those who say, Abaye said: They only made a distinction regarding cooked food, but regarding bread — no. What is the reason? If you say because it is not common in our eyes, and bread is common — but this case is not common, and Rav Neḥumi bar Zechariah said in the name of Abaye: We do not mix with this case! Rather, because we require something that is absorbed, and bread is not absorbed, and this case is also not absorbed. As Rabbi Zeira said: These Babylonians, fools, who eat fat with fat.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: עֲדָשִׁים שֶׁבְּשׁוּלֵי קְדֵרָה סוֹמֵךְ עֲלֵיהֶן מִשּׁוּם עֵרוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי דְּאִית בְּהוּ כְּזַיִת. אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: שַׁמְנוּנִית שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי הַסַּכִּין — גּוֹרְרוֹ וְסוֹמֵךְ עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם עֵרוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי דְּאִית בְּהוּ כְּזַיִת.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: lentils that at the bottom of a pot one may rely on them for joining of cooked foods. And this applies only there is an olive-bulk Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Yehuda, said: fat that is on a knife, one may scrape it and rely on it for the joining of cooked foods; and this applies only there is an olive-bulk
llm_translation: It was taught by Rabbi Chiya: Lentils that are in the pot of a potbelly, one may rely on them for the sake of Eruvei Tavshilin. And those words that are in it like an olive. Rav Yitzchak, son of Rav Yehuda, said: The fat that is on the blade of the knife - one may scrape it off and rely on it for the sake of Eruvei Tavshilin. And those words that are in it like an olive.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַסִּי אָמַר רַב: דָּגִים קְטַנִּים מְלוּחִים אֵין בָּהֶם מִשּׁוּם בִּשּׁוּלֵי גוֹיִם. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: וְאִם צְלָאָן גּוֹי — סוֹמֵךְ עֲלֵיהֶם מִשּׁוּם עֵרוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין. וְאִי עַבְדִינְהוּ גּוֹי כָּסָא דְהַרְסָנָא — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rav Asi said Rav said: Small salted fish are not considered the cooked food of gentiles Rav Yosef said: And if a gentile roasted them, rely on them for the joining of cooked foods, if gentile made them fish fried with oil and flour [ kasa deharsena ], it is prohibited
llm_translation: Rav Assi said in the name of Rav: Small fish that are salted do not have the status of the cooked dishes of idolaters. Rav Yosef said: And if a non-Jew roasted them, one may rely on them for the mixture of cooked dishes. But if a non-Jew cooked them in a pot used for idolatry, they are prohibited.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא:
human_translation: It is obvious lest you say
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Peshita! Mahu d'teima:"

hebrew_text: הַרְסָנָא עִיקָּר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן קִמְחָא עִיקָּר.
human_translation: fish fat, essential element. teaches us the flour essential element,
llm_translation: The destruction is primary, it is heard to us that wheat is primary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: עֵרוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין צְרִיכִין כְּזַיִת. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: כְּזַיִת אֶחָד לְכֻלָּן, אוֹ דִלְמָא כְּזַיִת לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: עֵרוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין צְרִיכִין כְּזַיִת בֵּין לְאֶחָד, בֵּין לְמֵאָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said: A joining of cooked foods requires an olive-bulk A dilemma was raised before one olive-bulk for all of or perhaps olive-bulk for each and every one Come hear which Rabbi Abba said Rav said: A joining of cooked foods requires an olive-bulk, whether for a single or for one hundred
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said: Eruvei Tavshilin require like an olive. They asked him: An olive for all of them, or perhaps an olive for each and every one? Come and hear, for Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rav: Eruvei Tavshilin require like an olive, whether for one, or for a hundred.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: אֲכָלוֹ אוֹ שֶׁאָבַד — לֹא יְבַשֵּׁל עָלָיו בַּתְּחִלָּה, שִׁיֵּיר מִמֶּנּוּ כׇּל שֶׁהוּא — סוֹמֵךְ עָלָיו לְשַׁבָּת. מַאי כׇּל שֶׁהוּא? לָאו אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֵיכָּא כְּזַיִת? לָא, דְּאִית בֵּיהּ כְּזַיִת.
human_translation: We learned one ate or if it was lost, he may not on it cook with the initial he left any part of rely on it for Shabbat. What is Any part of it? Doesn’t it that although there is not an olive-bulk? No, that there is an olive-bulk
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: If one ate from it or it got lost — one should not cook on it initially, leave from it anything that exists — one may rely on it for Shabbat. What is "anything that exists"? Is it not even though there is not an amount like an olive in it? No, for it contains an amount like an olive.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: תַּבְשִׁיל — זֶה צָלִי, וַאֲפִילּוּ כָּבוּשׁ שָׁלוּק וּמְבוּשָּׁל, וְקוֹלְיָיס הָאִסְפְּנִין שֶׁנָּתַן עָלָיו חַמִּין מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — תְּחִלָּתוֹ וְסוֹפוֹ אֵין לוֹ שִׁיעוּר. מַאי לָאו, אֵין לוֹ שִׁיעוּר כְּלָל? לָא, אֵין לוֹ שִׁיעוּר לְמַעְלָה, אֲבָל יֵשׁ לוֹ שִׁיעוּר לְמַטָּה.
human_translation: Come hear: cooked dish be roasted, or even pickled, well-boiled, or boiled or Spanish soft sea fish [ koleyas ha’ispenin ] upon which one poured hot on the eve of the Festival, its beginning and end, has no measure. What, is it not it has no measure at all, No, it does not have a maximum measure, but it does have a minimum measure,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: "Tavshil" - this is roasted, and even if it is crushed, soaked, and cooked, and the "Kolayis" of the "Ispenin" that was placed on it hot from the eve of a festival - its beginning and end have no measure. What is the reason? Does it not have any measure at all? No, it does not have a measure above, but it does have a measure below.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: עֵרוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין צְרִיכִין דַּעַת. פְּשִׁיטָא, דַּעַת מַנִּיחַ בָּעֵינַן; דַּעַת מִי שֶׁהִנִּיחוּ לוֹ בָּעֵינַן, אוֹ לָא בָּעֵינַן?
human_translation: Rav Huna said Rav said: A joining of cooked foods requires knowledge, obvious we require knowledge of the one who prepares we require knowledge of the one for whom is prepared, or do we not require
llm_translation: Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: Eruvei Tavshilin require da'at. It is obvious, da'at we require; da'at of one who has it, do we require it, or do we not require it?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דַּאֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל מְעָרֵב אַכּוּלַּהּ נְהַרְדְּעָא, רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי מְעָרְבִי אַכּוּלַּהּ טְבֶרְיָא. מַכְרִיז רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי: מִי שֶׁלֹּא הִנִּיחַ עֵרוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין, יָבֹא וְיִסְמוֹךְ עַל שֶׁלִּי. וְעַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַב נְחוּמִי בַּר זְכַרְיָה מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי: עַד תְּחוּם שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Come hear Shmuel’s father prepare an eiruv for entire Neharde’a, Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi prepare an eiruv for entire Tiberias. Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi announce: who did not prepare a joining of cooked foods come and rely on mine. And up to how much Rav Neḥumi bar Zekharya said in the name of Abaye: as far as the Shabbat limit.
llm_translation: Come and hear: The father of Shmuel would mix his Eruv in Nehardea, Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi would mix their Eruv in Teverya. Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi proclaimed: One who did not set aside Eruv Tavshilin should come and rely on mine. And until when? Rav Nechumi bar Zachariah said in the name of Abbaye: Until the Shabbat boundary.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא סַמְיָא דַּהֲוָה מְסַדַּר מַתְנְיָתָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל, חַזְיֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה עֲצִיב, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי עֲצִיבַתְּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּלָא אוֹתִיבִי עֵרוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין. אָמַר לֵיהּ: סְמוֹךְ אַדִּידִי. לְשָׁנָה חַזְיֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה עֲצִיב, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי עֲצִיבַתְּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּלָא אוֹתִיבִי עֵרוּבֵי תַּבְשִׁילִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פּוֹשֵׁעַ אַתְּ. לְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא שְׁרֵי, לְדִידָךְ אֲסִיר.
human_translation: the blind person who would present mishnayot before Mar Shmuel, observed that he was sad. said to him: Why are you sad? He said to him: I did not prepare a joining of cooked foods said to him: rely on mine. In the year, he observed that he was sad. He said to him: Why are you sad? He said to him: I did not prepare a joining of cooked foods. said to him: you are negligent for the entire world, permitted for you prohibited
llm_translation: That certain Samya who was arranging Mishnayot before Mar Samuel, his face was sad. He said to him: Why is your face sad? He said to him: Because I did not set up the Eruv of cooked dishes. He said to him: Rely on me. The next year, his face was sad. He said to him: Why is your face sad? He said to him: Because I did not set up the Eruv of cooked dishes. He said to him: You are a transgressor. To everyone else it is permitted, but for you it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יוֹם טוֹב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — אֵין מְעָרְבִין לֹא עֵרוּבֵי תְחוּמִין וְלֹא עֵרוּבֵי חֲצֵרוֹת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: a Festival occurs on Shabbat eve, one may not prepare an eiruv neither a joining of boundaries [ eiruv teḥumin ] nor a joining of courtyards [ eiruv ḥatzerot ],
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: On a festival that falls on Erev Shabbat - one may not combine neither the Eruv of boundaries nor the Eruv of courtyards.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: מְעָרְבִין עֵרוּבֵי חֲצֵרוֹת, אֲבָל לֹא עֵרוּבֵי תְחוּמִין. מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאַתָּה אוֹסְרוֹ בְּדָבָר הָאָסוּר לוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה אוֹסְרוֹ בְּדָבָר הַמּוּתָּר לוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi says: one may prepare an eiruv a joining of courtyards, but not a joining of boundaries. because you may prohibit him from a matter that is prohibited to him, but you may not prohibit him from a matter that is permitted to him,
llm_translation: Rabbi says: We may combine the Eruvin of courtyards, but not the Eruvin of boundaries. Because you are restricting him with something that is forbidden to him, but you are not restricting him with something that is permissible to him.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר, רַב אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּתַנָּא קַמָּא. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי.
human_translation: It was stated Rav said: halakha is in accordance with the first tanna , and Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav said: the halakha is in accordance with the first Tanna. And Shmuel said: the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי לְקוּלָּא אוֹ לְחוּמְרָא? פְּשִׁיטָא דִּלְקוּלָּא קָאָמַר! מִשּׁוּם דְּשָׁלַח רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לַגּוֹלָה: לֹא כְּשֶׁאַתֶּם שׁוֹנִין בְּבָבֶל רַבִּי מַתִּיר וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין, אֶלָּא רַבִּי אוֹסֵר וַחֲכָמִים מַתִּירִין. מַאי?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before halakha is in accordance with Rabbi a leniency or a stringency? obvious that he stated it as a leniency. because Rabbi Elazar sent to the Diaspora: not as you teach in Babylonia, Rabbi permits and the Rabbis prohibit Rather, Rabbi prohibits and the Rabbis permit What
llm_translation: He asked them: Does the halakha follow Rabbi leniently or stringently? It is obvious that he is speaking leniently! Because Rabbi Elazar sent a message to the exile: "Not like when you differ in Babylonia, where Rabbi permits and the sages forbid, but rather Rabbi forbids and the sages permit." What is the reason?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּרַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר אַבְדִּימִי עֲבַד עוֹבָדָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, וְאָמַר רַב: תְּחִלַּת הוֹרָאָה דְּהַאי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן — לְקִלְקוּלָא. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא לְקוּלָּא קָאָמַר — הַיְינוּ קִלְקוּלָא. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לְחוּמְרָא — מַאי קִלְקוּלָא אִיכָּא?
human_translation: Come hear that Rav Taḥlifa bar Avdimi performed an action in accordance with the opinion of Shmuel, and Rav said The first ruling of this young Torah scholar is corruption Granted, if you say said it as a leniency, this the corruption However, if you say as a stringency, what corruption is there
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rav Tahalifa, son of Avdimi, performed a deed like that of Shmuel, and Rav said: The beginning of teaching from this elder student is for leniency. If you say he meant leniency — that is leniency. But if you say he meant stringency — what leniency is there?

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּמִקַּלְקְלִי בַּהּ רַבִּים,
human_translation: Since it corrupts the masses,
llm_translation: As soon as he made it blemished in it, many,

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ קִלְקוּלָא. אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי, וּלְאִסּוּר.
human_translation: this is the corruption Rava said Rav Ḥisda said Rav Huna said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi to prohibit
llm_translation: This is the kalkula. Rava said, Rav Ḥisda said, Rav Huna said: The halakha is like Rabbi, but for prohibition.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יוֹם טוֹב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מִתְפַּלֵּל שְׁמֹנֶה, [וְאוֹמֵר] שֶׁל שַׁבָּת בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ, וְשֶׁל יוֹם טוֹב בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁבַע, מַתְחִיל בְּשֶׁל שַׁבָּת וּמְסַיֵּים בְּשֶׁל שַׁבָּת, וְאוֹמֵר קְדוּשַּׁת הַיּוֹם בָּאֶמְצַע. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר, אַף חוֹתֵם בָּהּ: ״מְקַדֵּשׁ הַשַּׁבָּת, יִשְׂרָאֵל וְהַזְּמַנִּים״.
human_translation: The Sages taught a Festival that occurs on Shabbat, Beit Shammai say: One must recite prayer eight one recites for Shabbat as an independent and for the Festival as an independent And Beit Hillel say: One must pray seven blessings, One begins with Shabbat and concludes with Shabbat, and he recites the sanctity of the day in the middle. Rabbi says: He even concludes Who sanctifies Shabbat, the Jewish people, and the seasons.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: On a festival that falls on Shabbat, Beit Shammai say: one recites eight, and says the Shabbat prayer separately, and the festival prayer separately. But Beit Hillel say: one recites seven, beginning with the Shabbat prayer and concluding with the Shabbat prayer, and says the sanctity of the day in the middle. Rabbi says, one also concludes it: "Sanctifying the Sabbath, Israel, and the appointed times."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבִינָא: ״מְקַדֵּשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְהַשַּׁבָּת וְהַזְּמַנִּים״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַטּוּ שַׁבָּת יִשְׂרָאֵל מְקַדְּשִׁי לֵיהּ? וְהָא שַׁבָּת מִקַּדְּשָׁא וְקָיְימָא. אֶלָּא אֵימָא: ״מְקַדֵּשׁ הַשַּׁבָּת, יִשְׂרָאֵל וְהַזְּמַנִּים״. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי, וְכִדְתָרֵיץ רָבִינָא.
human_translation: A tanna taught before Ravina Who sanctifies the Jewish people, Shabbat, and the seasons. said to Is that to say that the Jewish people sanctify Shabbat? Isn’t Shabbat already sanctified Rather, say Who sanctifies Shabbat, the Jewish people, and the seasons, Rav Yosef said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi and as resolved Ravina.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Ravina: "Sanctifying Israel, the Sabbath, and the Festivals." He said to him: "Is the Sabbath dependent on Israel's sanctification? But rather, say: 'Sanctifying the Sabbath, Israel, and the Festivals.'" Rav Yosef said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi, and Ravina explained it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שַׁבָּת שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּרֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ אוֹ בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד, עַרְבִית וְשַׁחֲרִית וּמִנְחָה מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁבַע, וְאוֹמֵר מֵעֵין הַמְאוֹרָע בָּעֲבוֹדָה, וְאִם לֹא אָמַר — מַחְזִירִין אוֹתוֹ. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בַּהוֹדָאָה. וּבַמּוּסָפִין מַתְחִיל בְּשֶׁל שַׁבָּת וּמְסַיֵּים בְּשֶׁל שַׁבָּת, וְאוֹמֵר קְדוּשַּׁת הַיּוֹם בָּאֶמְצַע.
human_translation: The Sages taught Shabbat that occurs on a New Moon or on the intermediate days of a Festival, the evening, morning, and afternoon prayers, one prays seven and recites pertaining to the event during the Temple service, and if he did not recite he is required to return Rabbi Eliezer says: during thanksgiving, And in the additional prayer one begins with Shabbat, and concludes with Shabbat, and recites the sanctity of the day in the middle.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If Shabbat coincides with Rosh Chodesh or with the intermediate days of a festival, one prays seven blessings in the evening, morning, and afternoon services, and recites a special mention in the Amidah prayer. If one did not say it, they repeat the prayer. Rabbi Eliezer says: with a mention of thanks. In the additional prayers, one begins with the Shabbat portion and concludes with the Shabbat portion, and recites the sanctity of the day in the middle.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁהוּזְקַק לְשֶׁבַע, מַתְחִיל בְּשֶׁל שַׁבָּת וּמְסַיֵּים בְּשֶׁל שַׁבָּת וְאוֹמֵר קְדוּשַּׁת הַיּוֹם בָּאֶמְצַע. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּאוֹתוֹ הַזּוּג.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, say: Wherever required to seven he begins with Shabbat and concludes with Shabbat, and recites the sanctity of the day in the middle. Rav Huna said: halakha is not in accordance with that pair
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Broka, say: In any place where one begins with the Shabbat and concludes with the Shabbat, one recites the sanctity of the day in the middle. Rav Huna said: The halakha is not in accordance with that pair.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: מַנִּיחַ אָדָם עֵירוּבֵי תְחוּמִין מִיּוֹם טוֹב לַחֲבֵרוֹ, וּמַתְנֶה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Rav said: a person place the joining of boundaries on Festival day for the next, and stipulate
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Ashe said in the name of Rav: A person may place his Eiruv Techumin from the day of the festival for his fellow, and it is effective.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַנִּיחַ אָדָם עֵירוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין מִיּוֹם טוֹב לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וּמַתְנֶה.
human_translation: Rava said: A person may place the joining of cooked foods on Festival day for the next and stipulate
llm_translation: Rava said: A person may place his Eruv of cooked food on behalf of his fellow from the day of the festival, and it is effective.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר עֵירוּבֵי תְחוּמִין — כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן עֵירוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר עֵירוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין — אֲבָל עֵירוּבֵי תְחוּמִין לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא — דִּלְמִקְנֵי שְׁבִיתָה בְּשַׁבְּתָא לָא.
human_translation: the one who said the joining of boundaries, all the more so the joining of cooked foods. the one who said the joining of cooked foods however, the joining of boundaries, not What is the reason that not the acquisition of residence on rest,
llm_translation: The one who says Eiruvei Techumin - all the more so Eiruvei Tavshilin, and the one who says Eiruvei Tavshilin - but not Eiruvei Techumin. What is the reason? Perhaps it is because it establishes a residence on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין אוֹפִין מִיּוֹם טוֹב לַחֲבֵירוֹ. בֶּאֱמֶת אָמְרוּ: מְמַלְּאָה אִשָּׁה כׇּל הַקְּדֵרָה בָּשָׂר, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה אֶלָּא לַחֲתִיכָה אַחַת. מְמַלֵּא נַחְתּוֹם חָבִית שֶׁל מַיִם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ אֶלָּא לְקִיתוֹן אֶחָד. אֲבָל לֶאֱפוֹת — אֵינוֹ אוֹפֶה אֶלָּא מַה שֶּׁצָּרִיךְ לוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught One may not bake on Festival day for the next, actually, they said A woman may fill an entire pot meat although she requires only one piece a baker may fill barrel with water although he requires only a jug But with regard to baking, he may bake only that which he requires
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One may not bake from one festival day to another for his fellow. In truth they said: If a woman fills an entire pot with meat, even though she only needs it for one piece. If one fills a jug with water, even though he only needs it for one cup. But for baking - one may only bake what is needed.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: מְמַלְּאָה אִשָּׁה כׇּל הַתַּנּוּר פַּת, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַפַּת נֶאֱפֵת יָפֶה בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַתַּנּוּר מָלֵא. אָמַר רָבָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: A woman may fill the entire oven bread, because bread bakes well when the oven is full. Rava said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: A woman fills the entire oven with bread, because the bread bakes well when the oven is full. Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מִי שֶׁלֹּא הִנִּיחַ עֵירוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין, הוּא נֶאֱסָר וְקִמְחוֹ נֶאֱסָר, אוֹ דִלְמָא: הוּא נֶאֱסָר וְאֵין קִמְחוֹ נֶאֱסָר?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before one who did not prepare the joining of cooked foods, he prohibited his flour is prohibited, Or perhaps he is prohibited but his flour is not prohibited.
llm_translation: He asked them: One who did not place his Eruv of cooked dishes, is he prohibited and his flour prohibited, or perhaps: he is prohibited but his flour is not prohibited?

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְאַקְנוֹיֵי קִמְחוֹ לַאֲחֵרִים. אִי אָמְרַתְּ הוּא נֶאֱסָר וְקִמְחוֹ נֶאֱסָר — צָרִיךְ לְאַקְנוֹיֵי קִמְחוֹ לַאֲחֵרִים. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ הוּא נֶאֱסָר וְאֵין קִמְחוֹ נֶאֱסָר — לָא צְרִיךְ לְאַקְנוֹיֵי קִמְחוֹ לַאֲחֵרִים. מַאי?
human_translation: What is practical difference transfer his flour to others. If you say he is prohibited and his flour is prohibited, he must transfer his flour to others But if you say he is prohibited but his flour is not prohibited, he need not transfer his flour to others, What,
llm_translation: For what purpose does it come out? To acquire his flour for others. If you say he himself is forbidden and his flour is forbidden - he must acquire his flour for others. And if you say he himself is forbidden but his flour is not forbidden - he does not need to acquire his flour for others. What is the law?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מִי שֶׁלֹּא הִנִּיחַ עֵירוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין, הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יֹאפֶה וְלֹא יְבַשֵּׁל וְלֹא יַטְמִין, לֹא לוֹ וְלֹא לַאֲחֵרִים. וְלֹא אֲחֵרִים אוֹפִין וּמְבַשְּׁלִין לוֹ. כֵּיצַד הוּא עוֹשֶׂה — מַקְנֶה קִמְחוֹ לַאֲחֵרִים וְאוֹפִין לוֹ וּמְבַשְּׁלִין לוֹ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הוּא נֶאֱסָר וְקִמְחוֹ נֶאֱסָר, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear One who did not prepare the joining of cooked foods may neither bake, nor cook, nor insulate neither for himself nor for others, and others may neither bake nor cook for him. What he do He transfer his flour to others, and they may bake and cook for him. Learn from here, he is prohibited and his flour is prohibited. learn from here
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who did not place his Eruv of cooked dishes, behold, he may not bake, nor cook, nor insulate, neither for himself nor for others. And others may bake and cook for him. How does he do it? He acquires flour for others, bakes for him, and cooks for him. Learn from it: He is prohibited, and his flour is prohibited, learn from it.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: עָבַר וְאָפָה, מַאי? תָּא שְׁמַע: מִי שֶׁלֹּא הִנִּיחַ עֵירוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין, כֵּיצַד הוּא עוֹשֶׂה — מַקְנֶה קִמְחוֹ לַאֲחֵרִים, וַאֲחֵרִים אוֹפִין לוֹ וּמְבַשְּׁלִין לוֹ.
human_translation: dilemma was raised before one who transgressed and baked what Come hear one who did not prepare the joining of cooked foods, what he do He must transfer his flour to others, and they may bake and cook for him.
llm_translation: He asked them: If one passed through and baked, what is the law? Come and hear: One who did not establish an eruv for cooked dishes, how does he act? He acquires flour for others, and others bake for him and cook for him.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִיתָא, לִיתְנֵי: עָבַר וְאָפָה מוּתָּר! אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָה: תַּנָּא, תַּקַּנְתָּא דְהֶיתֵּרָא — קָתָנֵי, תַּקַּנְתָּא דְאִסּוּרָא — לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: And if it is so let teach: one who transgressed and baked, it is permitted Rav Adda bar Mattana said: tanna is teaching a remedy a permitted is not teaching a remedy a prohibited
llm_translation: And if it is said, let it be taught: One may pass and bake, it is permitted! Rav Adda bar Matna said: It was taught, the enactment of permission - it teaches, the enactment of prohibition - it does not teach.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מִי שֶׁהִנִּיחַ עֵירוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין — הֲרֵי זֶה אוֹפֶה וּמְבַשֵּׁל וּמַטְמִין, וְאִם רָצָה לֶאֱכוֹל אֶת עֵירוּבוֹ — הָרְשׁוּת בְּיָדוֹ. אֲכָלוֹ עַד שֶׁלֹּא אָפָה עַד שֶׁלֹּא הִטְמִין — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יֹאפֶה וְלֹא יְבַשֵּׁל וְלֹא יַטְמִין, לֹא לוֹ וְלֹא לַאֲחֵרִים. וְלֹא אֲחֵרִים אוֹפִין וּמְבַשְּׁלִין לוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear One who prepared the joining of cooked foods may bake and cook and insulate and if he wants to eat his eiruv he has permission he ate it before he baked before he insulated, he may neither bake, nor cook, nor insulate, neither for himself nor for others, others may neither bake nor cook for him.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who placed his Eruv Tabshilin - behold, he may bake, cook, and insulate, and if he wishes to eat his Eruv - the permission is in his hand. If he ate it before baking, before cooking, before insulating - behold, he may not bake, cook, or insulate, neither for himself nor for others. And others may not bake, cook for him.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מְבַשֵּׁל הוּא לְיוֹם טוֹב, וְאִם הוֹתִיר — הוֹתִיר לַשַּׁבָּת, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲרִים. וְאִם הֶעֱרִים — אָסוּר!
human_translation: However, may cook for the Festival and if he left over he has left over for Shabbat, provided that he does not employ artifice And if he employed artifice prohibited
llm_translation: But he may cook for the holiday, and if he left over — he left over for the Sabbath, provided that he does not mix. And if he mixed — it is prohibited!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הַעֲרָמָה קָא אָמְרַתְּ — שָׁאנֵי הַעֲרָמָה דְּאַחְמִירוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן טְפֵי מִמֵּזִיד.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: you speak of artifice, artifice is different, as the Sages were more stringent with regard to than intentionally
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: "When you said 'ha'aramah' - you are referring to the concealment that the Rabbis made more stringent than intentional concealment."

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: הָא מַנִּי — חֲנַנְיָה הִיא, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי. דְּתַנְיָא, חֲנַנְיָה אוֹמֵר, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין אוֹפִין אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן עֵרֵב בְּפַת, וְאֵין מְבַשְּׁלִין אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן עֵרֵב בְּתַבְשִׁיל, וְאֵין טוֹמְנִין אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיוּ חַמִּין טְמוּנִין מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said whose this It is Ḥananya and in accordance with Beit Shammai. As it is taught Ḥananya says Beit Shammai say: One may not bake unless he prepared an eiruv with bread; and one may not cook unless he prepared an eiruv with a cooked dish; and one may not insulate unless there was hot insulated from the eve of the Festival.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: This is Hananiah, and he is in the school of Beit Shammai. As it was taught: Hananiah says, Beit Shammai says: One may not bake unless he has mixed the dough before Shabbat, and one may not cook unless he has mixed the dish before Shabbat, and one may not insulate unless the hot dishes were insulated from the eve of Shabbat.

hebrew_text: ובֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מְעָרֵב בְּתַבְשִׁיל אֶחָד, וְעוֹשֶׂה בּוֹ כׇּל צָרְכּוֹ.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel say: One may prepare an eiruv with one cooked dish and use it for all his needs,
llm_translation: Beit Hillel says: One may mix in one dish, and use it for all his needs.

hebrew_text: (תְּנַן:) הַמְעַשֵּׂר פֵּירוֹתָיו בְּשַׁבָּת, בְּשׁוֹגֵג — יֹאכַל, בְּמֵזִיד — לֹא יֹאכַל. לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאִית לֵיהּ פֵּירֵי אַחֲרִינֵי.
human_translation: We learned one who tithed his produce on Shabbat, unwittingly, he may eat intentionally, he may not eat No, necessary where he has other produce
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: One who tithes his produce on Shabbat, if it was done unintentionally - he may eat it; if it was done intentionally - he may not eat it. This is necessary, for there are other fruits available to him.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמַּטְבִּיל כֵּלָיו בַּשַּׁבָּת, בְּשׁוֹגֵג — יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן, בְּמֵזִיד — לֹא יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן.
human_translation: Come hear one who immerses his vessels on Shabbat, unwittingly, he may use them; intentionally, he may not use them.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who immerses his utensils on Shabbat, unintentionally - may use them, intentionally - may not use them.

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאִית לֵיהּ מָאנֵי אַחֲרִינֵי. אִי נָמֵי, אֶפְשָׁר בִּשְׁאֵלָה.
human_translation: No, necessary where he has other vessels Alternatively, it is possible by borrowing
llm_translation: Not necessary, for it has others who can answer. If not, it is possible through inquiry.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמְבַשֵּׁל בְּשַׁבָּת, בְּשׁוֹגֵג — יֹאכַל, בְּמֵזִיד — לֹא יֹאכַל. אִסּוּרָא דְשַׁבָּת שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: Come hear one who cooks on Shabbat, unwittingly, he may eat intentionally, he may not eat prohibition of Shabbat is different,
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who cooks on Shabbat, unintentionally - may eat, intentionally - may not eat. The prohibition of Shabbat is different.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שְׁנֵי תַבְשִׁילִין. מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: מוֹדִים בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל שְׁנֵי תַבְשִׁילִין שֶׁצָּרִיךְ, עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — עַל דָּג וּבֵיצָה שֶׁעָלָיו, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים שְׁנֵי תַבְשִׁילִין. ובֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: תַּבְשִׁיל אֶחָד. וְשָׁוִין, שֶׁאִם פִּרְפֵּר בֵּיצָה וְנָתַן לְתוֹךְ הַדָּג, אוֹ שֶׁרִסֵּק קַפְלוֹטוֹת וְנָתַן לְתוֹךְ הַדָּג, שֶׁהֵן שְׁנֵי תַבְשִׁילִין.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say two cooked dishes, The mishna not in accordance with this tanna , who taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel agree that two dishes are necessary. With regard to what do they disagree? with regard to fish and the egg on it, as Beit Shammai say: Two dishes and Beit Hillel say: One dish And they agree that if one sliced egg and placed inside the fish, or if he mashed leeks [ kaflotot ] and placed inside the fish, they are two dishes.
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: two dishes. Mishnah: that is not as this Tanna, as it was taught, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: House of Shammai and House of Hillel agree on two dishes that are necessary, what do they dispute about? — about fish and egg upon it, House of Shammai says two dishes. And House of Hillel says: one dish. And they are equal, for if one crumbled the egg and placed it inside the fish, or squeezed capers and placed them inside the fish, these are two dishes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הִלְכְתָא כְּתַנָּא דִּידַן, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּבֵית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with the tanna our and in accordance with Beit Hillel
llm_translation: Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with our Mishna, and not in accordance with the House of Hillel.

hebrew_text: אֲכָלוֹ אוֹ שֶׁאָבַד — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יְבַשֵּׁל עָלָיו וְכוּ׳. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: נָקְטִינַן, הִתְחִיל בְּעִיסָּתוֹ וְנֶאֱכַל עֵירוּבוֹ — גּוֹמֵר.
human_translation: one ate or it was lost, he may not on it cook Abaye said: We have a tradition one began his dough and his eiruv was eaten, he may finish
llm_translation: They ate it or it got lost - this one should not cook on it, etc. Abaye said: We have learned, if one began with his dough and his Eruv was eaten - he completes.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חָל לִהְיוֹת אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מַטְבִּילִין אֶת הַכֹּל מִלִּפְנֵי הַשַּׁבָּת. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: כֵּלִים מִלִּפְנֵי הַשַּׁבָּת, וְאָדָם בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: occurs after Shabbat, Beit Shammai say: One must immerse everything before Shabbat, and Beit Hillel say: Vessels before Shabbat, but a person on Shabbat.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If it happened to be after Shabbat—Beit Shammai say: One immerses everything before Shabbat. And Beit Hillel say: Utensils before Shabbat, and a person on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: וְשָׁוִין שֶׁמַּשִּׁיקִין אֶת הַמַּיִם בִּכְלִי אֶבֶן לְטַהֲרָן, אֲבָל לֹא מַטְבִּילִין. וּמַטְבִּילִין מִגַּב לְגַב וּמֵחֲבוּרָה לַחֲבוּרָה.
human_translation: And agree that one may bring water into contact in stone vessels in order to purify However, one may not immerse one may immerse from principle to another, and from one group to another,
llm_translation: And they are equal, those who draw water in a stone vessel to purify them, but they do not immerse. And they immerse from pit to pit and from cistern to cistern.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהַת — כְּלִי בְּשַׁבָּת לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבָּה: גְּזֵרָה
human_translation: In any event, everyone agrees, may not a vessel on Shabbat. What is the reason Rabba said: a decree
llm_translation: Gemara: "The entirety of the world is from it - a vessel on Shabbat is not. What is the reason? Rabba said: a decree."

hebrew_text: שֶׁמָּא יִטְּלֶנּוּ בְּיָדוֹ, וְיַעֲבִירֶנּוּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: יֵשׁ לוֹ בּוֹר בַּחֲצֵירוֹ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גְּזֵירָה בּוֹר בַּחֲצֵרוֹ אַטּוּ בּוֹר בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: lest one pick up in his hand and carry it four cubits in the public domain Abaye said to one has a pit in his courtyard, what is there to say? said to him: a decree a pit in one’s courtyard due to a pit in the public domain.
llm_translation: Perhaps he will take it in his hand, and carry it four cubits in a public domain. Abaye said to him: If he has a pit in his courtyard, what can be said? He said to him: The decree of a pit in his courtyard is different from a pit in a public domain.

hebrew_text: הָתִינַח שַׁבָּת, בְּיוֹם טוֹב מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? גָּזְרוּ יוֹם טוֹב אַטּוּ שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: well Shabbat, with regard to a Festival, what is there to say? issued a decree a Festival, due to on Shabbat.
llm_translation: The Mishnah: If Shabbat coincides with a festival, what can be said? They decreed that the festival should take precedence over Shabbat.

hebrew_text: וּמִי גָּזְרִינַן? וְהָא תְּנַן: וְשָׁוִין שֶׁמַּשִּׁיקִין אֶת הַמַּיִם בִּכְלִי אֶבֶן לְטַהֲרָן, אֲבָל לֹא מַטְבִּילִין. וְאִי אִיתָא — נִגְזוֹר הַשָּׁקָה אַטּוּ הַטְבָּלָה!
human_translation: And do we issue a decree But didn’t we learn And agree that one may bring water into contact in stone vessels in order to purify However, one may not immerse And if it is so let us decree bringing into contact due to immersing
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And do we decree? But we learned: And similar to this case is one who pours water into a stone vessel to purify them, but they are not immersed. And if you will say - pouring is decreed, then immersion is certainly decreed!"

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא? אִי אִית לֵיהּ מַיִם יָפִים, הָנֵי לְמָה לִי לְמֶעְבַּד לְהוּ הַשָּׁקָה? אֶלָּא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ, וְכֵיוָן דְּלֵית לֵיהּ מִזְהָר זְהִיר בְּהוּ.
human_translation: And you understand If he has good, water why do I to bring this into contact Rather, that he does not have and since he does not have he is careful about
llm_translation: And was it created? If there are beautiful waters, why do I need to give them to drink? Rather, if there are none, one should be careful with them.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: מַדְלִין בִּדְלִי טָמֵא, וְהוּא טָהוֹר. וְאִי אִיתָא, נִגְזוֹר דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְאַטְבּוֹלֵיהּ בְּעֵינֵיהּ! שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁלֹּא הוּתְּרָה לוֹ אֶלָּא עַל יְדֵי דׇּלְיוֹ — זָכוּר הוּא.
human_translation: raised an objection One may draw water with a impure pail, and pure And if it is so let us decree lest one come to immerse by itself. It is different there; since it is permitted for him only by drawing he remembers
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: We immerse in a vessel that is impure, yet it remains pure. And if you say, perhaps he will come to immerse it in his eyes! It is different there, since it was not permitted to him except through his vessel - it is considered remembered.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: כְּלִי שֶׁנִּטְמָא מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — אֵין מַטְבִּילִין אוֹתוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב, בְּיוֹם טוֹב — מַטְבִּילִין אוֹתוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב. וְאִם אִיתָא, נִגְזוֹר דְּיוֹם טוֹב אַטּוּ דְּעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב! טוּמְאָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב מִלְּתָא דְּלָא שְׁכִיחָא הִיא, וּמִלְּתָא דְלָא שְׁכִיחָא לָא גְּזַרוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: raised an objection a vessel that was rendered ritually impure on the eve of a Festival, one may not immerse it on the Festival; on Festival one may immerse it on the Festival. And if it is so let us decree that a Festival due to eve of a Festival. impurity on a Festival, is an uncommon occurrence, and an uncommon occurrence, the Sages did not issue a decree
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: A vessel that became impure from the eve of a festival - one does not immerse it on the festival day; on the festival day - one immerses it on the festival day. And if you say so, it can be inferred that the festival day is more stringent than the eve of the festival! Impurity on the festival day is a rare occurrence, and regarding a rare occurrence, the Rabbis did not decree upon it.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: כְּלִי שֶׁנִּטְמָא בְּאַב הַטּוּמְאָה — אֵין מַטְבִּילִין אוֹתוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב, בִּוְלַד הַטּוּמְאָה — מַטְבִּילִין אוֹתוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב. וְאִם אִיתָא, נִגְזוֹר הָא אַטּוּ הָא!
human_translation: raised objection a vessel that was rendered impure by a primary source of impurity, one may not immerse it on a Festival. by a derivative source of impurity, one may immerse on a Festival. And if it is so let us decree this, due to that,
llm_translation: He raised an objection: A vessel that became impure through the primary source of impurity - one does not immerse it on a festival day. But if it became impure through a derivative source of impurity - one immerses it on a festival day. And if you say, this one is decreed, that one is decreed!

hebrew_text: וְלַד הַטּוּמְאָה הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? גַּבֵּי כֹהֲנִים — כֹּהֲנִים זְרִיזִין הֵם.
human_translation: Where do you find a derivative source of impurity? with regard to priests, priests are vigilant;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And a child of impurity, how does one find her? Regarding priests - they are diligent priests." English translation:
