hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: נִדָּה שֶׁאֵין לָהּ בְּגָדִים — מַעֲרֶמֶת וְטוֹבֶלֶת בִּבְגָדֶיהָ. וְאִם אִיתָא, נִגְזוֹר דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְאַטְבּוֹלֵי בְּעֵינַיְיהוּ!
human_translation: Come hear as Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Rav said: A menstruating woman who has no clothes may employ an artifice and immerse in her clothes. And if it is so let us decree lest she come to immerse themselves.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rav Chiya bar Ashey said in the name of Rav: A menstruating woman who does not have clothes - she wraps herself and immerses with her clothes. And if it is possible, it is decreed lest she come to immerse with them in their eyes!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁלֹּא הוּתְּרָה לָהּ אֶלָּא עַל יְדֵי מַלְבּוּשׁ — זְכוּרָה הִיא.
human_translation: It is different there; since it is permitted for her only by garments, she remembers
llm_translation: The matter is different there, since it was only permitted to her through clothing - she is considered remembered.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: גְּזֵרָה מִשּׁוּם סְחִיטָה.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said a decree due to wringing.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: decree because of shechitah.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: תִּינַח כֵּלִים דִּבְנֵי סְחִיטָה נִינְהוּ. כֵּלִים דְּלָאו בְּנֵי סְחִיטָה נִינְהוּ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גְּזֵרָה הָנֵי אַטּוּ הָנֵי. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ כֹּל הָנֵי תְּיוּבָתָא, וְשַׁנִּי לֵיהּ כִּדְשַׁנִּינַן.
human_translation: Abaye said to well vessels that are fit for wringing, vessels that are not fit for wringing, what is there to say? said a decree these due to those raised all of these objections and answered him as we answered
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: utensils of the sons of ritual slaughterers they are. Utensils that are not of the sons of ritual slaughterers they are, what is there to say? He said to him: a decree these and those. It was objected to him: all those are secondary, and he repeated to him as we learned.

hebrew_text: רַב בִּיבִי אָמַר: גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יְשַׁהֶא. תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב בִּיבִי: כְּלִי שֶׁנִּטְמָא מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — אֵין מַטְבִּילִין אוֹתוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב, גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יְשַׁהֶא.
human_translation: Rav Beivai said a decree lest one delay It is taught in accordance with of Rav Beivai: a vessel that became ritually impure on the eve of a Festival, one may not immerse it on a Festival, a decree lest he delay
llm_translation: Rav Beivi said: A decree lest he soak. It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rav Beivi: A vessel that became impure from the eve of a festival - one does not immerse it on the festival day, a decree lest he soak.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנִּרְאֶה כִּמְתַקֵּן כְּלִי. אִי הָכִי, אָדָם נָמֵי! אָדָם נִרְאֶה כְּמֵיקֵר.
human_translation: Rava said because it looks as if he is repairing the vessel. If so, a person likewise A person looks as if he is cooling
llm_translation: Rava said: Because it appears as if he is fixing a vessel. If not, a person is sleeping! A person appears as if he is uprooting.

hebrew_text: הָא תִּינַח מַיִם יָפִים, מַיִם רָעִים מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: פְּעָמִים שֶׁאָדָם בָּא
human_translation: well good, water, bad, water, what is there to say? Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: sometimes a person comes
llm_translation: Here are beautiful waters, what is there to say about bad waters? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "There are times when a person comes..."

hebrew_text: בַּשָּׁרָב, וְרוֹחֵץ אֲפִילּוּ בְּמֵי מִשְׁרָה.
human_translation: on a hot day and washes even in water was soaked,
llm_translation: In the heat of the day, and he washes even in water of a potion.

hebrew_text: תִּינַח בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה, בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: פְּעָמִים שֶׁאָדָם בָּא מִן הַשָּׂדֶה מְלוּכְלָךְ בְּטִיט וּבְצוֹאָה, וְרוֹחֵץ אֲפִילּוּ בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים.
human_translation: well in the summer season; in the rainy season, what is there to say? Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Sometimes a person comes from the field soiled with mud and excrement and washes even in the rainy season.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: During the days of the sun, what is there to say about the days of rain? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Sometimes a person comes from the field covered in mud and manure, and still bathes even during the days of rain.

hebrew_text: תִּינַח בְּשַׁבָּת, בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: well on Shabbat, on Yom Kippur, what is there to say?
llm_translation: "Let it be placed on Shabbat, on Yom Kippur, what is there to say?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דִּבְשַׁבָּת שְׁרֵי וּבְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אָסוּר? אֶלָּא הוֹאִיל וּבְשַׁבָּת שְׁרֵי — בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים נָמֵי שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: is there anything that is permitted on Shabbat and prohibited on Yom Kippur? Rather, since it is permitted on Shabbat, it is also permitted on Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: Rava said: Who is the one who is permitted on Shabbat but forbidden on Yom Kippur? Rather, since on Shabbat it is permitted, on Yom Kippur it is also permitted.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִית לֵיהּ לְרָבָא ״הוֹאִיל״? וְהָתְנַן: הַחוֹשֵׁשׁ בְּשִׁינָּיו — לֹא יְגַמֵּעַ בָּהֶן אֶת הַחוֹמֶץ, אֲבָל מְטַבֵּל הוּא כְּדַרְכּוֹ, וְאִם נִתְרַפֵּא — נִתְרַפֵּא. וְרָמֵינַן עֲלַהּ: לֹא יְגַמֵּעַ וּפוֹלֵט, אֲבָל מְגַמֵּעַ וּבוֹלֵעַ!
human_translation: Does Rava accept Since? But didn’t we learn One who is concerned in his teeth may not sip vinegar through them however, he may dip in his manner and if he is healed he is healed. And we raised a contradiction to this One may not sip and spit out, however, one may sip and swallow
llm_translation: And who has it according to Rava "ho'il"? And we learned: One who is concerned about his teeth - he should not soak them in vinegar, but he may dip his bread in it as usual, and if he is healed - he is healed. And we raise a contradiction on it: He should not soak and spit, but he may soak and swallow!

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: כִּי תְּנַן נָמֵי מַתְנִיתִין, מְגַמֵּעַ וּפוֹלֵט תְּנַן. וְרָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא מְגַמֵּעַ וּבוֹלֵעַ, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן קוֹדֶם טִבּוּל, כָּאן לְאַחַר טִבּוּל.
human_translation: And Abaye said: Also when we learned the mishna, we learned one who sips and spits out. Rava said: Even you say one sips and swallows not difficult: Here, before dipping There, after dipping
llm_translation: And Abaye said: When we learned in the Mishnah, we learned "Megamea and Polet." And Rava said: Even if you say "Megamea and Bolea," it is not difficult. Here, before immersion, here, after immersion.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אִיתָא, נֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וְקוֹדֶם טִבּוּל שְׁרֵי — לְאַחַר טִבּוּל נָמֵי שְׁרֵי! הֲדַר בֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵהַהִיא.
human_translation: And if it is so let him say: Since it is permitted before dipping, it is also permitted after dipping. Rava retracted that
llm_translation: And if it is stated, say: Since before immersion is permitted, after immersion is certainly permitted! Rava retracted from that.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דְּמֵהַהִיא הֲדַר בֵּיהּ, דִּלְמָא מֵהָא הֲדַר בֵּיהּ? לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דְּתַנְיָא: כׇּל חַיָּיבֵי טְבִילוֹת טוֹבְלִין כְּדַרְכָּן, בֵּין בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב בֵּין בְּיוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים.
human_translation: And from where that he retracted that Perhaps he retracted this This cannot enter your mind as it is taught All obligated in immersions immerse in their manner, both on the Ninth of Av and on Yom Kippur,
llm_translation: And from where do we derive this? Perhaps from that case, that he should adorn it? It is not as you think, for it has been taught: All those obligated in immersion immerse in their usual manner, whether on the ninth of Av or on Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: וְשָׁוִין שֶׁמַּשִּׁיקִין אֶת הַמַּיִם בִּכְלִי אֶבֶן וְכוּ׳. מַאי ״אֲבָל לֹא מַטְבִּילִין״? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין מַטְבִּילִין אֶת הַכְּלִי עַל גַּב מֵימָיו לְטַהֲרוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: And agree that one may bring water into contact in stone vessels What is However, one may not immerse Shmuel said: One may not immerse vessel on account of its water to purify it on a Festival.
llm_translation: And they are equal who rinse the water in a stone vessel, etc. What is the meaning of "but they do not immerse"? Shmuel said: They do not immerse the vessel by pouring water over it to purify it on a festival day.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי מַתְנִיתִין? לָא רַבִּי וְלָא רַבָּנַן, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין מַטְבִּילִין אֶת הַכְּלִי עַל גַּב מֵימָיו לְטַהֲרוֹ, וְאֵין מַשִּׁיקִין אֶת הַמַּיִם בִּכְלִי אֶבֶן לְטַהֲרָן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מַטְבִּילִין כְּלִי עַל גַּב מֵימָיו לְטַהֲרוֹ, וּמַשִּׁיקִין אֶת הַמַּיִם בִּכְלִי אֶבֶן לְטַהֲרָן.
human_translation: whose is the mishna? not Rabbi nor the Rabbis. As it is taught One may not immerse an vessel on account of its water to purify and one may not bring water into contact in a stone vessel to purify the statement of Rabbi And the Rabbis say: One may immerse vessel on account of its water to purify and one may bring water into contact in a stone vessel to purify
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is the Tanna of this Mishnah? Not Rabbi and not the Rabbis, as it was taught: One does not immerse a vessel in its own water to purify it, and one does not sprinkle water on vessels with a stone vessel to purify them, the words of Rabbi. And the Sages say: One does immerse a vessel in its own water to purify it, and one does sprinkle water on vessels with a stone vessel to purify them.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִי רַבִּי — קַשְׁיָא הַשָּׁקָה, אִי רַבָּנַן — קַשְׁיָא הַטְבָּלָה!
human_translation: whose If Rabbi bringing water into contact difficult, if the Rabbis, immersion difficult,
llm_translation: Who is the authority? If it is Rabbi - the difficulty is with the pouring. If it is the Rabbis - the difficulty is with immersion!

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי, אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבָּנַן. אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי: רֵישָׁא דְּבָרַיְיתָא בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְסֵיפָא בְּשַׁבָּת, וְכוּלַּהּ מַתְנִיתִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: If you wish, say Rabbi if you wish, say the Rabbis. If you wish, say Rabbi first clause of baraita , a Festival; And the latter clause, to Shabbat. And the entire mishna a Festival,
llm_translation: If you will say it was taught by Rabbi, if you will say it was taught by the Rabbis. If you say it was taught by Rabbi: the beginning of the Baraita on Yom Tov, and the end on Shabbat, and the entire Mishnah on Yom Tov.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבָּנַן, וְכוּלַּהּ מַתְנִיתִין בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: And if you wish, say the Rabbis, And the entire mishna to Shabbat,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say the Rabbis, and the entire Mishnah is regarding Shabbat.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כְּלִי שֶׁנִּטְמָא מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — אֵין מַטְבִּילִין אוֹתוֹ בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: The Sages taught a vessel that became ritually impure on the eve of a Festival, one may not immerse it during twilight,
llm_translation: The sages taught: A vessel that became impure from the eve of a festival - one does not immerse it between the suns.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי אוֹמֵר: אַף בַּחוֹל אֵין מַטְבִּילִין אוֹתוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁצָּרִיךְ הֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: Even on a weekday one may not immerse because requires sunset.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: Even on a weekday, one does not immerse him, because he needs the evening sun.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא לָא בָּעֵי הֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ? אֲמַר רָבָא: אַשְׁכַּחְתִּינְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דְּבֵי רַב דְּיָתְבִי וְקָא אָמְרִי, בְּמַחְשַׁבְתּוֹ נִכֶּרֶת מִתּוֹךְ מַעֲשָׂיו קָמִפַּלְגִי. וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי — כְּגוֹן דְּנָקֵיט מָנָא בִּידֵיהּ, וְרָהֵיט וְאָזֵיל בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת לְאַטְבּוֹלֵיהּ.
human_translation: And the first tanna not require sunset? Rava said: I found the Sages of the school of Rav sitting and saying they disagree about intention is evident from his actions. And what are the circumstances for example, where one was holding a vessel in his hand and running along at twilight to immerse it.
llm_translation: The first Tanna does not require the evening Shema? Rava said: I found them, the sages of the house of Rav who were sitting and saying, "He is cut off in his thoughts from his actions." And how is it similar? For example, when he takes money in his hand, he spits and goes between the suns to immerse himself.

hebrew_text: מָר סָבַר: הַאי דְּקָא רָהֵיט וְאָזֵיל — מִידָּע יָדַע דְּבָעֵי הֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ.
human_translation: Sage, holds that he is running along he knows that requires sunset.
llm_translation: Master says: this one who is running and going - immediately he knows that he needs the evening sun.

hebrew_text: וּמָר סָבַר: מֵחֲמַת מְלַאכְתּוֹ הוּא דְּקָרָהֵיט.
human_translation: And Sage, holds he is running due to his work
llm_translation: And Mar said: Due to his work, he is called a blacksmith.

hebrew_text: וְאָמֵינָא לְהוּ אֲנָא: בְּמַחְשַׁבְתּוֹ נִכֶּרֶת מִתּוֹךְ מַעֲשָׂיו — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי כְּגוֹן דְּאִיטַּמִּי בְּפָחוֹת מִכַּעֲדָשָׁה, וַאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּנַן לְשַׁיּוֹלֵי: בְּפָחוֹת מִכַּעֲדָשָׁה אִיטַּמִּי אִי לָא? מָר סָבַר: מִדְּהָא לָא גְּמִיר, הֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ נָמֵי לָא גְּמִיר, וּמָר סָבַר: הָא הוּא דְּלָא גְּמִיר, הָא הֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ גְּמִיר.
human_translation: And I said to them: With regard to intention is evident from his actions, everyone agrees Where they disagree for example, where became impure through less than a lentil-bulk and came before the Sages to ask becomes impure through less than a lentil-bulk or not. One Sage, holds since he does not know this he also does not know sunset; And one Sage, hold it is this he does not know, but sunset he does know,
llm_translation: I would say to them: In his thought he is cut off from his actions - for the whole world does not dispute. When do they dispute? For example, if one immersed in a vessel less than the size of a lentil, and the Sages came before him to ask: Did you immerse in a vessel less than the size of a lentil or not? One Master holds: Since he did not complete the act, he did not complete it, just as the evening sun does not complete its setting. And one Master holds: Since he did not complete it, the evening sun does complete its setting.

hebrew_text: וּמַטְבִּילִין מִגַּב לְגַב. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד מִגַּב לְגַב? הָרוֹצֶה לַעֲשׂוֹת גִּתּוֹ עַל גַּב כַּדּוֹ,
human_translation: one may immerse from principle to another The Sages taught How from principle to another? One who wishes to make his winepress, in addition to his pitcher,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And they immerse from back to back. The Rabbis taught: How is it done from back to back? One who wants to make his divorce on the back like this, English translation:

hebrew_text: וְכַדּוֹ עַל גַּב גִּתּוֹ — עוֹשֶׂה.
human_translation: his pitcher in addition to his winepress may do
llm_translation: And like his back on his winepress - he does.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד מֵחֲבוּרָה לַחֲבוּרָה? הָיָה אוֹכֵל בַּחֲבוּרָה זוֹ, וְרוֹצֶה לֶאֱכוֹל בַּחֲבוּרָה אַחֶרֶת — הָרְשׁוּת בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: how from one group to another? was eat with this group, and wishes to eat with a different group, he has permission
llm_translation: How is one group connected to another group? If one was eating in this group and wants to eat in another group - permission is in his hand.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מְבִיאִין שְׁלָמִים וְאֵין סוֹמְכִין עֲלֵיהֶן, אֲבָל לֹא עוֹלוֹת. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מְבִיאִין שְׁלָמִים וְעוֹלוֹת וְסוֹמְכִין עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: One may bring peace-offerings but one may not place hands on them, However, one may not burnt-offerings, And Beit Hillel say: One may bring peace-offerings and burnt-offerings, and one may place hands on them.
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Beit Shammai says: One brings peace offerings but does not lean on them, but not burnt offerings. And Beit Hillel says: One brings peace offerings, burnt offerings, and leans on them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר עוּלָּא: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּשַׁלְמֵי חֲגִיגָה לִסְמוֹךְ, וְעוֹלַת רְאִיָּיה לִיקְרַב. דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: ״וְחַגֹּתֶם אוֹתוֹ חַג לַה׳״, חֲגִיגָה — אִין, עוֹלַת רְאִיָּיה — לָא. וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: ״לַה׳״, כֹּל דְּלַה׳.
human_translation: Ulla said: dispute to Festival peace-offerings, with respect to placing hands and to burnt-offerings of appearance, with respect to sacrificing Beit Shammai hold “You shall observe [ vaḥaggotem ] it as a Festival to the Lord Festival peace-offerings [ ḥagiga ], yes, burnt-offerings of appearance, no, And Beit Hillel hold: “To the Lord” anything as to the Lord
llm_translation: Gemara said Ula: Dispute in peace offerings of the festival to be adjacent, and burnt offering of appearance to be brought near. Beit Shammai hold: "And you shall celebrate it as a festival to the Lord," festival offering — no, burnt offering of appearance — yes. And Beit Hillel hold: "to the Lord," everything for the sake of the Lord.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין קְרֵיבִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב. וְכֵן אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת אֵין קְרֵיבִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: But vow and gift-offerings, all agree, may not be sacrificed on a Festival. And likewise, Rav Adda bar Ahava said: Vow and gift-offerings may not be sacrificed on a Festival.
llm_translation: But vows and freewill offerings — the words of everyone are not brought on a festival day. And so said Rav Adda bar Ahava: Vows and freewill offerings are not brought on a festival day.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיבִי, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל עוֹלָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁל יוֹם טוֹב, שֶׁאֵינָהּ קְרֵבָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְעַל שְׁלָמִים שֶׁהֵן שֶׁל יוֹם טוֹב, שֶׁקְּרֵיבִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree with regard to a burnt-offering that is not of the Festival, that it may not be sacrificed on a Festival, or with regard to peace-offerings that are of the Festival that they may be sacrificed on a Festival,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Meitivi, amar Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar: Lo nechleku Beit Shammai u'Beit Hillel al olah she'einah shel yom tov, she'einah k'revah b'yom tov, ve'al shelamim shehem shel yom tov, shek'reivin b'yom tov. English translation: A contradiction was raised: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree regarding a burnt offering that is not of a festival, that is not brought on a festival, and regarding peace offerings that are of a festival, that are brought on a festival.

hebrew_text: עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — עַל עוֹלָה שֶׁהִיא שֶׁל יוֹם טוֹב, וְעַל שְׁלָמִים שֶׁאֵינָן שֶׁל יוֹם טוֹב. שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יָבִיא, ובֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: יָבִיא.
human_translation: With regard to what, did they disagree? with regard to a burnt-offering that is of the Festival and with regard to peace-offerings that are not of the Festival As Beit Shammai say: He may not bring and Beit Hillel say: He may bring
llm_translation: On what do they argue? - On the burnt offering that is of a festival day, and on the peace offerings that are not of a festival day. Beit Shammai says: He should not bring, and Beit Hillel says: He should bring.

hebrew_text: תָּרֵיץ וְאֵימָא הָכִי: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר, לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל עוֹלָה וּשְׁלָמִים שֶׁאֵינָן שֶׁל יוֹם טוֹב, שֶׁאֵין קְרֵיבִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְעַל שְׁלָמִים שֶׁהֵן שֶׁל יוֹם טוֹב, שֶׁקְּרֵיבִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב. עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — עַל עוֹלָה שֶׁהִיא שֶׁל יוֹם טוֹב, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יָבִיא, ובֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: יָבִיא.
human_translation: Resolve and say as follows: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree with regard to burnt-offerings and peace-offerings that are not of the Festival, that they are not sacrificed on a Festival, or with regard to peace-offerings that are of the Festival that they may be sacrificed on a Festival. With regard to what did they disagree? with regard to a burnt-offering that is of the Festival as Beit Shammai say: He may not bring and Beit Hillel say: He may bring
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Taritz ve'eima hachi: amar Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, lo nechleku Beit Shammai u'Beit Hillel al olah u'shelamim she'einam shel yom tov, she'ein k'reivin b'Yom Tov, ve'al shelamim she'hen shel yom tov, she'k'reivin b'Yom Tov. Al mah nechleku — al olah she'hi shel yom tov, she'Beit Shammai omerim: lo yavi, u'Beit Hillel omerim: yavi.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: תַּנָּאֵי שָׁקְלַתְּ מֵעָלְמָא?! תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: שְׁלָמִים הַבָּאִים מֵחֲמַת יוֹם טוֹב בְּיוֹם טוֹב, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: סוֹמֵךְ עֲלֵיהֶן מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב, וְשׁוֹחֲטָן בְּיוֹם טוֹב. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: סוֹמֵךְ עֲלֵיהֶן בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְשׁוֹחֲטָן בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: have you removed the tanna’im from the world? is tanna’im , As it is taught peace-offerings that come on account of a Festival on the Festival, Beit Shammai say: One places hands on them on the eve of the Festival and slaughters them on the Festival, and Beit Hillel say: One places hands on them on the Festival and slaughters them on the Festival.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "Did you learn it from the world?! It is a teaching. As it was taught: Peace-offerings that come due to a festival on the festival day, Beit Shammai says: One may rely on them from the eve of the festival, and slaughter them on the festival day. Beit Hillel says: One may rely on them on the festival day, and slaughter them on the festival day."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין קְרֵיבִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: However, vow and gift-offerings, all agree they not be sacrificed on Festival day,
llm_translation: But vows and voluntary offerings — the words of all, they do not bring near on a festival day.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי כִּי הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין מְבִיאִין תּוֹדָה בְּחַג הַמַּצּוֹת, מִפְּנֵי חָמֵץ שֶׁבָּהּ. וְלָא בָּעֲצֶרֶת — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא יוֹם טוֹב. אֲבָל מֵבִיא אָדָם תּוֹדָתוֹ בְּחַג הַסּוּכּוֹת.
human_translation: these tanna’im are like those tanna’im , as it is taught One may not bring a thanks-offering on the festival of Matzot due to the leavened bread with it, Nor on Shavuot because it is a Festival, However, a person may bring his thanks-offering on the festival of Sukkot .
llm_translation: These are the teachings, for these are the teachings, as it was taught: One does not bring a thanksgiving offering on the Festival of Matzot, because it contains leaven. And not on Shavuot - because it is a festival. But a person does bring his thanksgiving offering on the Festival of Sukkot.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״בְּחַג הַמַּצּוֹת וּבְחַג הַשָּׁבוּעוֹת וּבְחַג הַסֻּכּוֹת״, כֹּל שֶׁבָּא בְּחַג הַמַּצּוֹת — בָּא בְּחַג הַשָּׁבוּעוֹת וּבְחַג הַסּוּכּוֹת, וְכֹל שֶׁלֹּא בָּא בְּחַג הַמַּצּוֹת — אֵינוֹ בָּא בְּחַג הַשָּׁבוּעוֹת וּבְחַג הַסּוּכּוֹת. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מֵבִיא אָדָם תּוֹדָתוֹ בְּחַג הַסּוּכּוֹת, וְיוֹצֵא בָּהּ יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ מִשּׁוּם שִׂמְחָה, וְאֵין יוֹצֵא בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם חֲגִיגָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: But it says: “On the festival of Matzot , on the festival of Shavuot , and on the festival of Sukkot ” Any that comes on the festival of Matzot may come on the festival of Shavuot and on the festival of Sukkot , and any that does not come on the festival of Matzot may not come on the festival of Shavuot or on the festival of Sukkot . Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: A person may bring his thanks-offering on the festival of Sukkot and fulfill with it his obligation rejoicing. But he does not fulfill a Festival offering.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Behold, he says, "On the Festival of Matzot, and on the Festival of Weeks, and on the Festival of Sukkot," whoever comes on the Festival of Matzot - comes on the Festival of Weeks and on the Festival of Sukkot, and whoever does not come on the Festival of Matzot - does not come on the Festival of Weeks and on the Festival of Sukkot. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: A person brings his thanksgiving offering on the Festival of Sukkot, and fulfills his obligation because of joy, but does not fulfill it because of a festive offering.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אֵין מְבִיאִין תּוֹדָה בְּחַג הַמַּצּוֹת — מִפְּנֵי חָמֵץ שֶׁבָּהּ. פְּשִׁיטָא! אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יִצְחָק, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַבָּא: הָכָא בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר עָסְקִינַן, וְקָסָבַר: אֵין מְבִיאִין קָדָשִׁים לְבֵית הַפְּסוּל.
human_translation: The Master said one may not bring a thanks-offering on the festival of Matzot due to the leavened bread with it. obvious Rav Adda, son of Rav Yitzḥak, said, and some say Rav Shmuel bar Abba Here, we are dealing with the fourteenth and holds one may not bring consecrated to a situation the disqualification.
llm_translation: Master said: One does not bring a thanksgiving offering on the Festival of Matzot because of the leaven it contains. It is obvious! Rav Adda, son of Rav Yitzchak, said, and some say it was Rav Shmuel, son of Abba, who said: Here we are dealing with the fourteenth of Nisan, and he holds: One does not bring disqualified sacrifices into the Temple.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא בָּעֲצֶרֶת — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא יוֹם טוֹב. קָסָבַר: נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת אֵין קְרֵיבִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: Nor on Shavuot because it is a Festival. holds vow and gift-offerings may not be sacrificed on a Festival.
llm_translation: "And not on Shavuot — because it is a festival day. He holds: Vows and freewill offerings are not brought on a festival day."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מֵבִיא אָדָם תּוֹדָתוֹ בְּחַג הַסּוּכּוֹת. אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא בְּיוֹם טוֹב עַצְמוֹ — וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ: וְלֹא בָּעֲצֶרֶת מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא יוֹם טוֹב! אֶלָּא בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד.
human_translation: However, a person may bring his thanks-offering on the festival of Sukkot . When? If we say on the Festival day itself, as didn’t you say: Nor on Shavuot because it is a Festival, Rather, on the intermediate days of the Festival.
llm_translation: But one brings his thanksgiving offering on the Festival of Sukkot. When? If you say on the festival day itself — but didn't you say: "And not on Shemini Atzeret because it is a festival day!" Rather, on the intermediate days of the festival.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״בְּחַג הַמַּצּוֹת וּבְחַג הַשָּׁבוּעוֹת וּבְחַג הַסּוּכּוֹת״, כׇּל שֶׁבָּא בְּחַג הַמַּצּוֹת — בָּא בְּחַג הַשָּׁבוּעוֹת וּבְחַג הַסּוּכּוֹת, וְכׇל שֶׁלֹּא בָּא בְּחַג הַמַּצּוֹת — אֵינוֹ בָּא בְּחַג הַשָּׁבוּעוֹת וּבְחַג הַסּוּכּוֹת. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: הַשְׁתָּא סַלּוֹתֵי מְסַלְּתִינַן, נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת מִבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: But it says: “On the festival of Matzot , on the festival of Shavuot , and on the festival of Sukkot ,” Any that comes on the festival of Matzot may come on the festival of Shavuot and on the festival of Sukkot , and any that does not come on the festival of Matzot may not come on the festival of Shavuot or on the festival of Sukkot . Rabbi Zeira strongly objects to this: Now, we may chop is it necessary vow and gift-offerings
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Behold, he says, "On the Festival of Matzot, and on the Festival of Weeks, and on the Festival of Sukkot," whoever comes on the Festival of Matzot — comes on the Festival of Weeks and on the Festival of Sukkot, and whoever does not come on the Festival of Matzot — does not come on the Festival of Weeks and on the Festival of Sukkot. Rabbi Zeira objects to him: Now we are talking about fine flour, do we need vows and freewill offerings?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בְּהַקְרָבָה כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דִּשְׁרֵי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי, לְמֵיקַם עֲלֵיהּ בְּ״בַל תְּאַחֵר״.
human_translation: Abaye said: With regard to sacrificing everyone agrees that it is permitted. When they disagree, to determining when one is liable for You must not delay.
llm_translation: Abaye said: In the case of a forced proximity, everyone agrees that it is permissible. When do they disagree? To establish it with "do not delay" (Deuteronomy 22:3).

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: שָׁלֹשׁ רְגָלִים אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא — אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁלֹּא כְּסִדְרָן.
human_translation: The first tanna holds the Merciful One states three Festivals even not in their order,
llm_translation: Mishnah first opinion: Three festivals said the Merciful One - even if not in their proper order.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: כְּסִדְרָן — אִין, שֶׁלֹּא כְּסִדְרָן — לָא.
human_translation: But Rabbi Shimon holds in their order, yes, not in their order, not
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon holds: according to their order — yes, not according to their order — no.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מֵבִיא אָדָם תּוֹדָתוֹ בְּחַג הַסּוּכּוֹת. אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד — הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא. אֶלָּא בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְקָסָבַר נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת קְרֵיבִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: A person may bring his thanks-offering on the festival of Sukkot . When? If we say on the intermediate days of the Festival, this is the first tanna Rather, the Festival day and he holds vow and gift-offerings may be sacrificed on a Festival.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: A person brings his thanksgiving offering on the festival of Sukkot. When? If you say on the intermediate days of the festival — that is the first Tanna. Rather, on a festival day, and he holds that vows and freewill offerings are brought on a festival day.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא חַג הַסּוּכּוֹת דְּנָקֵט? רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: לֹא יֵאָמֵר ״חַג הַסּוּכּוֹת״, שֶׁבּוֹ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר — לוֹמַר שֶׁזֶּה אַחֲרוֹן.
human_translation: what is different the festival of Sukkot that he cited it Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, to his reasoning, As it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: not say “the festival of Sukkot ,” of which the verse was speaking; Why, is stated? to say that this must be the last one
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what is the difference of the Festival of Sukkot that it is singled out? Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon explains: as it was taught, Rabbi Shimon says: One should not say "Festival of Sukkot" in which the Scripture speaks. Why is it stated? To say that this is the last.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: לוֹמַר שֶׁזֶּה גּוֹרֵם.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: to say that this causes
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon says: to say that this causes.

hebrew_text: וְיוֹצֵא בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם שִׂמְחָה, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם חֲגִיגָה. פְּשִׁיטָא! דָּבָר שֶׁבְּחוֹבָה הִיא, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁבְּחוֹבָה אֵינוֹ בָּא אֶלָּא מִן הַחוּלִּין!
human_translation: and fulfill with it his obligation rejoicing, but he does not fulfill a Festival offering. obvious is an obligatory matter, anything that is an obligatory matter must come only from that which is non-sacred,
llm_translation: "And one fulfills the obligation with it the Passover sacrifice for the sake of joy, but one does not fulfill the obligation with it the Passover sacrifice for the sake of a festival offering. It is obvious! A matter that is obligatory, and anything that is obligatory only comes from non-sacred funds!"

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּפָרֵישׁ.
human_translation: No, necessary that even if one specified
llm_translation: Not necessary, for even though he separated.

hebrew_text: כְּדִבְעָא מִנֵּיהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָאוֹמֵר הֲרֵי עָלַי תּוֹדָה וְאֵצֵא בָּהּ יְדֵי חֲגִיגָה, הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר
human_translation: similar to that Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish asked of Rabbi Yoḥanan: one who says: upon me a thanks-offering, and I will fulfill a Festival offering with it; I am a nazirite,
llm_translation: As it was taught by Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish from Rabbi Yochanan: One who says, "Behold, upon me is an obligation of thanksgiving, and I will fulfill it with a festive offering," behold, I am a Nazirite.

hebrew_text: וַאֲגַלַּח מִמְּעוֹת מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נָדוּר, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא. נָזִיר, וְאֵינוֹ מְגַלֵּחַ.
human_translation: and I will shave with second-tithe money, what is said to him: he has vowed he does not fulfill a nazirite, but he may not shave
llm_translation: And he shaves from the intestines of the second tithe, what? He said to him: Nazirite, and he does not fulfill his obligation. Nazirite, and he does not shave.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לֵיהּ אַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזֵי לִפְלוֹנִי, וְלִנְסֵיב בְּרַתִּי. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אַרְבַּע מְאָה — שָׁקֵיל, וּבְרַתֵּיה — אִי בָּעֵי נָסֵיב, אִי בָּעֵי — לָא נָסֵיב.
human_translation: A certain man said to Give four hundred zuz to so-and-so, and let him marry my daughter. Rav Pappa said: four hundred he takes, but daughter, if he wishes, he may marry if he wishes, he not marry
llm_translation: That man who said to them: Give four hundred zuz to so-and-so, to marry my daughter. Rav Papa said: Four hundred - he should pay, and for his daughter - if he wants to marry, he may; if he does not want to marry, he may not marry.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּאָמַר הַבוּ לֵיהּ וְלִנְסֵיב, אֲבָל אִי אָמַר לִנְסֵיב וְהַבוּ לֵיהּ, אִי נָסֵיב — שָׁקֵיל, וְאִי לָא נָסֵיב — לָא שָׁקֵיל.
human_translation: The reason that he said Give him and let him marry However, if saying: Let him marry and give him if he marries he takes if he does not marry he may not take
llm_translation: Reason of saying give to him and marry, but if said to marry and give to him, if married - take, and if not married - do not take.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב מָרִימָר וְקָאָמַר לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְמָרִימָר: אַתּוּן הָכִי מַתְנִיתוּ לַהּ, אֲנַן כְּדִבְעָא מִינֵּיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מַתְנִינַן לַהּ.
human_translation: Mareimar sat and stated this halakha in his own name, Ravina said to Mareimar: You teach this in this manner, we teach it Reish Lakish asked of Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: Sitting Marimar and saying to him that he heard from the name of his soul. Said to him Ravina to Marimar: You thus teach him, we as a matter of fact from him Reish Lakish from Rabbi Yochanan teach him.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַבָּא: ״וַיַּקְרֵב אֶת הָעוֹלָה וַיַּעֲשֶׂהָ כַּמִּשְׁפָּט״, כְּמִשְׁפַּט עוֹלַת נְדָבָה. לִמֵּד עַל עוֹלַת חוֹבָה שֶׁטְּעוּנָה סְמִיכָה.
human_translation: A tanna taught before Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Abba: “And he brought the burnt-offering and sacrificed it according to regulation” similar to the regulation a gift burnt-offering. teaches with regard to an obligatory burnt-offering requires place hands
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rabbi Yitzchak bar Abba: "And he brought the burnt offering and performed it according to the ordinance," like the ordinance of a voluntary burnt offering. This teaches regarding an obligatory burnt offering that it requires leaning of hands.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דַּאֲמַר לָךְ מַנִּי — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הִיא, דְּלָא גָּמְרִי שַׁלְמֵי חוֹבָה מִשַּׁלְמֵי נְדָבָה. דְּאִי בֵּית הִלֵּל, כֵּיוָן דְּגָמְרִי שַׁלְמֵי חוֹבָה מִשַּׁלְמֵי נְדָבָה, עוֹלַת חוֹבָה נָמֵי לָא תִּבְעֵי קְרָא, דְּגָמְרִי מֵעוֹלַת נְדָבָה.
human_translation: said to who told you whose It is Beit Shammai, who do not learn obligatory peace-offerings from gift peace-offerings As, if Beit Hillel, since they learn obligatory peace-offerings from gift peace-offerings, an obligatory burnt-offering should also not require a verse as learn from a gift burnt-offering
llm_translation: He said to him: that which he said to you "Mani" - it is Beit Shammai, for they do not differentiate between obligatory offerings and voluntary offerings. For if it were Beit Hillel, since they differentiate between obligatory offerings and voluntary offerings, an obligatory burnt offering would not require a verse, for they learn it from a voluntary burnt offering.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דְּבֵית הִלֵּל שַׁלְמֵי חוֹבָה מִשַּׁלְמֵי נְדָבָה גָּמְרִי? דִּלְמָא מֵעוֹלַת חוֹבָה גָּמְרִי, וְעוֹלַת חוֹבָה גּוּפָא בָּעֲיָא קְרָא.
human_translation: And from where Beit Hillel learn obligatory peace-offerings from gift peace-offerings? Perhaps they learn from an obligatory burnt-offering: And an obligatory burnt-offering itself requires verse
llm_translation: And from what is it derived that the House of Hillel considers peace offerings as obligatory from the category of voluntary offerings as well? Perhaps it is derived from the burnt offering of obligation, and the burnt offering of obligation itself requires a verse.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא מִשַּׁלְמֵי נְדָבָה דְּלָא גָּמְרִי — שֶׁכֵּן מְצוּיִין. מֵעוֹלַת חוֹבָה נָמֵי לָא גָּמְרִי — שֶׁכֵּן כָּלִיל!
human_translation: What is different that do not learn from gift peace-offerings? that common, they should also not learn from an obligatory burnt-offering, as entirely burnt,
llm_translation: What is the difference between the Shelamim offerings that are not fully consumed? Because they are common. The obligatory burnt offerings that are not fully consumed? Because they are complete!

hebrew_text: (אֶלָּא) אָתְיָא מִבֵּינַיָּיא.
human_translation: Rather, is derived from between them.
llm_translation: Rather, it comes from the understanding.

hebrew_text: וְסָבְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי שַׁלְמֵי חוֹבָה לָא בָּעוּ סְמִיכָה? וְהָתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל הַסְּמִיכָה עַצְמָהּ שֶׁצָּרִיךְ. עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ, עַל תֵּכֶף לִסְמִיכָה שְׁחִיטָה. שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: צָרִיךְ!
human_translation: And do Beit Shammai hold obligatory peace-offerings do not require placing of hands But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yosei said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree with regard to the placing of hands itself that it is required With regard to what, did they disagree? immediately placing hands slaughter. As Beit Shammai say: not necessary And Beit Hillel say: necessary,
llm_translation: The House of Shammai holds that one is not obligated to have the offering close by? And it was taught: Rabbi Yosei said: The House of Shammai and the House of Hillel did not disagree regarding the requirement of the smicha itself. On what did they disagree? On the immediacy of the smicha to the slaughter. The House of Shammai says: It is not necessary. And the House of Hillel says: It is necessary!

hebrew_text: הוּא דְּאָמַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל תֵּכֶף לִסְמִיכָה שְׁחִיטָה שֶׁצָּרִיךְ, עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — עַל הַסְּמִיכָה עַצְמָהּ, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: צָרִיךְ.
human_translation: said in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree with regard to immediately placing hands slaughter, that it is necessary. With regard to what, did they disagree? the placing of hands itself Beit Shammai say: not necessary, and Beit Hillel say: necessary.
llm_translation: He who said, as it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree regarding the immediate proximity required for slaughter. What did they disagree about? — They disagreed about the proximity itself. Beit Shammai says: It is not necessary, and Beit Hillel says: It is necessary.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּהִלֵּל הַזָּקֵן שֶׁהֵבִיא עוֹלָתוֹ לָעֲזָרָה לִסְמוֹךְ עָלֶיהָ בְּיוֹם טוֹב. חָבְרוּ עָלָיו תַּלְמִידֵי שַׁמַּאי הַזָּקֵן, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מָה טִיבָהּ שֶׁל בְּהֵמָה זוֹ? אָמַר לָהֶם: נְקֵבָה הִיא, וּלְזִבְחֵי שְׁלָמִים הֲבֵאתִיהָ. כִּשְׁכֵּשׁ לָהֶם בִּזְנָבָהּ, וְהָלְכוּ לָהֶם.
human_translation: The Sages taught There was an incident involving Hillel the Elder, who brought his burnt-offering to the courtyard in order to place hands on on a Festival. The students of Shammai the Elder gathered around him said to him: What is the nature of this animal He said to them: It is a female, and I have brought it as a peace-offering, He swung its tail for them and they departed.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident involving Hillel the Elder who brought his burnt offering to the Temple to lean upon it on a festival day. The disciples of Shammai the Elder surrounded him and said to him: "What is the quality of this animal?" He said to them: "It is a female, and I brought it for peace offerings." When he showed them its tail, they went away.

hebrew_text: וְאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם גָּבְרָה יָדָם שֶׁל בֵּית שַׁמַּאי עַל בֵּית הִלֵּל, וּבִקְּשׁוּ לִקְבּוֹעַ הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתָן. וְהָיָה שָׁם זָקֵן אֶחָד מִתַּלְמִידֵי שַׁמַּאי הַזָּקֵן, וּבָבָא בֶּן בּוּטָא שְׁמוֹ, שֶׁהָיָה יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהֲלָכָה כְּבֵית הִלֵּל, וְשָׁלַח
human_translation: On that day, Beit Shammai gained the upper hand over Beit Hillel, and they sought to establish the halakha in accordance with their But a certain Elder of the disciples of Shammai the Elder was there, and Bava ben Buta his name, who knew that halakha is in accordance with Beit Hillel And he sent
llm_translation: And on that day, the hand of Beit Shammai prevailed over Beit Hillel, and they sought to establish the halakha according to their opinion. There was there an elder, one of the disciples of Beit Shammai the Elder, and his name was Baba ben Buta, who knew that the halakha was in accordance with Beit Hillel, and he sent...

hebrew_text: וְהֵבִיא כׇּל צֹאן קֵדָר שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם וְהֶעֱמִידָן בָּעֲזָרָה, וְאָמַר: כׇּל מִי שֶׁרוֹצֶה לִסְמוֹךְ — יָבֹא וְיִסְמוֹךְ, וְאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם גָּבְרָה יָדָן שֶׁל בֵּית הִלֵּל וְקָבְעוּ הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתָן, וְלֹא הָיָה שָׁם אָדָם שֶׁעִרְעֵר בַּדָּבָר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: and brought all the sheep of Kedar that in Jerusalem, and he stood them in the courtyard and said: Anyone who wishes to place hands come and place hands And that day Beit Hillel gained the upper hand and they established the halakha in accordance with their and there was no one there who disputed the matter in any way.
llm_translation: He brought all the flock of Kedar that were in Jerusalem and stood them in the Azarah, and he said: "Whoever wishes to lean on them - let him come and lean." And on that day the hand of Beit Hillel prevailed, and they established the halakha like their opinion, and there was no one there to dispute the matter at all.

hebrew_text: שׁוּב מַעֲשֶׂה בְּתַלְמִיד אֶחָד מִתַּלְמִידֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל שֶׁהֵבִיא עוֹלָתוֹ לָעֲזָרָה לִסְמוֹךְ עָלֶיהָ, מְצָאוֹ תַּלְמִיד אֶחָד מִתַּלְמִידֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, אָמַר לוֹ: מָה זוֹ סְמִיכָה? אָמַר לוֹ: מָה זוֹ שְׁתִיקָה? שִׁתְּקוֹ בִּנְזִיפָה, וְהָלַךְ לוֹ.
human_translation: And there was another incident involving a certain disciple from among the disciples of Beit Hillel who brought his burnt-offering to the courtyard in order to place hands on A certain disciple from among the disciples of Beit Shammai found him said to him: What is this placing of hands? He said to him: What is this silence? He silenced him with a rebuke, and he, departed
llm_translation: The incident occurred with one disciple from the disciples of Beit Hillel who brought his burnt offering to the Temple courtyard to lean upon it. Another disciple from the disciples of Beit Shammai found him and said to him: "What is this leaning?" He replied to him: "What is this silence?" He silenced him with a rebuke, and he went away.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הִלְכָּךְ, הַאי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ חַבְרֵיהּ מִלְּתָא, לָא לַהְדַּר לֵיהּ מִלְּתָא טְפֵי מִמַּאי דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ חַבְרֵיהּ, דְּאִיהוּ אָמַר לֵיהּ: ״מָה זוֹ סְמִיכָה״, וְקָא מַהְדַּר לֵיהּ: ״מָה זוֹ שְׁתִיקָה״.
human_translation: Abaye said: Therefore, a Torah scholar whose colleague says something to him not answer back something more than his colleague had said to him, as the one said to What is this placing of hands? and responded to What is this silence?
llm_translation: Abaye said: Therefore, this elder sage from the rabbis who said to his colleagues a matter, he did not retract the matter more than what his colleague said to him, for he said to him, "What is this leaning?" and he retracted to him, "What is this silence?"

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: וּמָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאָסוּר לַהֶדְיוֹט — מוּתָּר לַגָּבוֹהַּ, מְקוֹם שֶׁמּוּתָּר לַהֶדְיוֹט — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁמּוּתָּר לַגָּבוֹהַּ? אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת יוֹכִיחוּ, שֶׁמּוּתָּר לַהֶדְיוֹט וְאָסוּר לַגָּבוֹהַּ!
human_translation: it is taught Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: Just as in a place where it is prohibited for a common person [ hedyot ], it is permitted for the Most High, a place where it is permitted for a common person, is it not right that permitted for the Most High? Beit Shammai said to them: Vow and gift-offerings prove as permitted for a common person but prohibited for the Most High.
llm_translation: It was taught: Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: "In a place where it is forbidden for a commoner - it is permitted for a distinguished person, in a place where it is permitted for a commoner - is it not the case that it is forbidden for a distinguished person?" Beit Shammai said to them: "Vows and voluntary offerings will prove that it is permitted for a commoner and forbidden for a distinguished person!"

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית הִלֵּל: מָה לִנְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת — שֶׁאֵין קָבוּעַ לָהֶם זְמַן, תֹּאמַר בְּעוֹלַת רְאִיָּיה — שֶׁקָּבוּעַ לָהּ זְמַן. אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: אַף זוֹ אֵין קָבוּעַ לָהּ זְמַן, דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁלֹּא חָג בְּיוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג — חוֹגֵג וְהוֹלֵךְ כָּל הָרֶגֶל כּוּלּוֹ, וְיוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁל חַג.
human_translation: Beit Hillel said to them: If vow and gift-offerings because they do not have a fixed time you say with regard to a burnt-offering of appearance, which has a fixed time, Beit Shammai said to them: It too has no fixed time, as we learned One who did not bring Festival offering on the first Festival of Sukkot may bring throughout the entire Festival, including the last Festival of Sukkot ,
llm_translation: They said to the House of Hillel: What about vows and voluntary offerings - that they do not have a fixed time? You may say with regard to the burnt offering of appearance - that it has a fixed time. They said to the House of Shammai: This too does not have a fixed time, as we learned: One who did not celebrate on the first day of the festival - may celebrate and observe the entire pilgrimage, and the last day of the festival.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית הִלֵּל: אַף זוֹ קָבוּעַ לָהּ זְמַן. דִּתְנַן: עָבַר הָרֶגֶל וְלֹא חָג — אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתוֹ.
human_translation: Beit Hillel said to them: it too has a fixed time, As we learned If the Festival passed and he did not bring his Festival-offering, he is not accountable for it.
llm_translation: They said to them, Beit Hillel: This too is fixed for her a time. As we learned: If the pilgrimage festival has passed and one did not celebrate the holiday, he is not obligated to make it up.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״לָכֶם״ — וְלֹא לְגָבוֹהַּ. אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית הִלֵּל, וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״לַה׳״ — כֹּל דְּלַה׳. אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לָכֶם״, לָכֶם — וְלֹא לְגוֹיִם, לָכֶם — וְלֹא לִכְלָבִים.
human_translation: Beit Shammai said to But wasn’t it already stated for you” but not for the Most High? Beit Hillel said to them: But wasn’t it already stated to the Lord” Anything to the Lord If so, what the verse states “for you”? for you, but not for gentiles; for you, but not for dogs.
llm_translation: They said to the House of Shammai, "But hasn't it already been stated: 'For you' — and not for the tall?" They said to the House of Hillel, "But hasn't it already been stated: 'For Hashem' — everything that belongs to Hashem." If so, why does the Torah say "for you"? For you — and not for the nations, for you — and not for the dogs.

hebrew_text: אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמְרָהּ בְּלָשׁוֹן אַחֶרֶת: וּמָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁכִּירָתְךָ סְתוּמָה — כִּירַת רַבְּךָ פְּתוּחָה, בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁכִּירָתְךָ פְּתוּחָה — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁכִּירַת רַבְּךָ פְּתוּחָה? וְכֵן בְּדִין, שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא שׁוּלְחָנְךָ מָלֵא וְשׁוּלְחַן רַבְּךָ רֵיקָן.
human_translation: Abba Shaul stated in a different formulation, Just as in a place where your stove is closed, your Master’s stove is open, in a place where your stove is open, is it not right that your Master’s stove open? And likewise to reason that your table should not be full while your Master’s table, empty.
llm_translation: Abba Sha'ul says it in another language: And what in a place where your barrel is closed - your master's barrel is open, in a place where your barrel is open - is it not the law that your master's barrel should be open? And so too in judgment, your table should not be full while your master's table is empty.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת קְרֵבִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וּמַר סָבַר: אֵין קְרֵבִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree One Sage, holds vow and gift-offerings may be sacrificed on a Festival, And one Sage, holds may not be sacrificed on a Festival,
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? Master holds: Vows and freewill offerings are brought on a festival day, and Master holds: Offerings are not brought on a festival day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת אֵין קְרֵבִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, לָא תֵּימָא: מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מִחְזֵא חֲזוּ, וְרַבָּנַן הוּא דְּגָזְרִי בְּהוּ גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יְשַׁהֶה,
human_translation: Rav Huna said: According to the statement of the one who says vow and gift-offerings may not be sacrificed on a Festival, you not say that by Torah law they are fit and the Sages who issued a decree about them a preventive measure, lest one delay
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: According to the opinion that vows and voluntary offerings are not brought on a festival, do not say: From the Torah it is seen, and it is the Rabbis who decreed a decree lest one delay.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא נָמֵי לָא חָזוּ. דְּהָא שְׁתֵּי הַלֶּחֶם, דְּחוֹבַת הַיּוֹם נִינְהוּ, וְלֵיכָּא לְמִגְזַר שֶׁמָּא יְשַׁהֶה, וְאֵינוֹ דּוֹחֶה לֹא אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְלֹא אֶת יוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: rather, they are not fit even by Torah law. As the two loaves are an obligation of day, and there is no to issue a decree lest one delay override neither Shabbat nor the Festival.
llm_translation: Rather, even from the Torah itself, they did not see. For the two loaves, they are considered an obligation of the day, and there is no decree lest one delay, and it does not override neither the Sabbath nor a festival day.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת אֵין קְרֵבִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, עָבַר וְשָׁחַט מַאי? רָבָא אָמַר: זוֹרֵק אֶת הַדָּם עַל מְנָת לְהַתִּיר בָּשָׂר בַּאֲכִילָה. רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: זוֹרֵק אֶת הַדָּם עַל מְנָת לְהַקְטִיר אֵימוּרִין לָעֶרֶב.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before According to the statement of the one who says vow and gift-offerings may not be sacrificed on a Festival, one transgressed and slaughtered what is Rava said: He sprinkles the blood in order to allow the meat to be eaten Rabba bar Rav Huna, said: He sprinkles the blood in order to burn the sacrificial parts in the evening.
llm_translation: He asked them: According to the opinion that vows and voluntary offerings are not brought on a festival, if one transgressed and slaughtered, what is the ruling? Rava said: He sprinkles the blood with the intention of permitting the meat for consumption. Rabbah bar Rav Huna said: He sprinkles the blood with the intention of burning the fats on the altar.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ נִטְמָא בָּשָׂר אוֹ שֶׁאָבַד. לְרָבָא — לָא זָרֵיק, לְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא — זָרֵיק.
human_translation: What is between There is between them the meat became impure or was lost. According to Rava, one may not sprinkle according to Rabba bar Rav Huna, he does sprinkle
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them if the flesh became impure or if it was lost. According to Rava - he does not cast the item, according to Rabbah bar Rav Huna - he casts the item.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כִּבְשֵׂי עֲצֶרֶת שֶׁשְּׁחָטָן שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָן, אוֹ שֶׁשְּׁחָטָן בֵּין לִפְנֵי זְמַנָּן בֵּין לְאַחַר זְמַנָּן — הַדָּם יִזָּרֵק וְהַבָּשָׂר יֵאָכֵל. וְאִם הָיְתָה שַׁבָּת — לֹא יִזְרוֹק. וְאִם זָרַק —
human_translation: raises an objection the lambs of Shavuot , one slaughtered them not for their purpose, or he slaughtered them whether before their time or after their time, The blood be sprinkled and the meat be eaten. And if was Shabbat, he may not sprinkle And if he sprinkled
llm_translation: Challenger: If one slaughters the festival offerings not for their intended purpose, or if one slaughters them whether before their designated time or after their designated time - the blood shall be sprinkled and the flesh shall be eaten. And if it was Shabbat - it shall not be sprinkled. And if one did sprinkle -

hebrew_text: הוּרְצָה, עַל מְנָת לְהַקְטִיר אֵימוּרִין לָעֶרֶב. אִם זָרַק, דִּיעֲבַד — אִין, לְכַתְּחִלָּה — לָא! בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרָבָא נִיחָא, אֶלָּא לְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא קַשְׁיָא! קַשְׁיָא. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: שָׁאנֵי שְׁבוּת שַׁבָּת מִשְּׁבוּת יוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: is accepted on condition that burn the sacrificial parts in the evening if he sprinkled after the fact, yes, not ab initio . Granted, according to Rava well, but according to Rabba bar Rav Huna, difficult. difficult. And if you wish, say A rabbinic decree concerning Shabbat is different from a rabbinic decree concerning a Festival,
llm_translation: Willing, in order to offer sacrifices in the evening. If he threw it, it is effective - retroactively; initially - no! It is understandable according to Rava, but according to Rabbah bar Rav Huna it is difficult! Difficult. And if you wish, say: It is different, the cessation of Shabbat from the cessation of Yom Tov.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִנֵּיהּ רַב אַוְיָא סָבָא מֵרַב הוּנָא: בְּהֵמָה חֶצְיָהּ שֶׁל גּוֹי וְחֶצְיָהּ שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל, מַהוּ לְשׇׁחְטָהּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב? אָמַר לֵיהּ: מוּתָּר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְכִי מָה בֵּין זֶה לִנְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עוֹרְבָא פָּרַח!
human_translation: Rav Avya the Elder raised dilemma before Rav Huna: an animal half of it to a gentile and half of it to a Jew, what is to slaughtering it on a Festival? said to him: It is permitted. said to him: And what is between this and vow and gift-offerings? said to him: a raven flies
llm_translation: Requested from him Rav Avya the Elder from Rav Huna: An animal, half of it belonging to a gentile and half of it belonging to a Jew, what is the law regarding slaughtering it on a festival? He said to him: It is permitted. He said to him: And what is the difference between this and vows and voluntary offerings? He said to him: A crow has flown!

hebrew_text: כִּי נְפַק אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ: לָאו הַיְינוּ רַב אַוְיָא סָבָא דְּמִשְׁתַּבַּח לֵיהּ מָר בְּגַוֵּיהּ דְּגַבְרָא רַבָּה הוּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּמָה אֶעֱבֵיד לֵיהּ, אֲנִי הַיּוֹם ״סַמְּכוּנִי בָּאֲשִׁישׁוֹת רַפְּדוּנִי בַּתַּפּוּחִים״, וּבְעָא מִינַּאי מִלְּתָא דְּבָעֲיָא טַעְמָא.
human_translation: When left, Rabba, son of said to Was this not Rav Avya the Elder, whom Master would recommend to that he is a great man? said to him: What should I have done for him? Today I am “Let me lean against the stout trunks; let me couch among the apple trees” and he asked me something that requires reasoning
llm_translation: When he went out, Rabah said to his son: Is this not Rav Avya the Elder who the Master praises in his bosom, for he is a great man? He said to him: What can I do for him, today "support me with raisin cakes, refresh me with apples," and he asked me a matter that requires reasoning.

hebrew_text: וְטַעְמָא מַאי? בְּהֵמָה חֶצְיָהּ שֶׁל גּוֹי וְחֶצְיָהּ שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל מוּתָּר לְשׇׁחְטָהּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב, דְּאִי אֶפְשָׁר לִכְזַיִת בָּשָׂר בְּלֹא שְׁחִיטָה. אֲבָל נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת אָסוּר לְשׇׁחְטָן בְּיוֹם טוֹב, דְּכֹהֲנִים כִּי קָא זָכוּ — מִשֻּׁלְחַן גָּבוֹהַּ קָא זָכוּ.
human_translation: And what, is the reason? animal, half of to a gentile and half to a Jew, may be slaughtered on a Festival, as it is impossible to an olive-bulk of meat without slaughtering. However, it is prohibited to slaughter vow and gift-offerings on a Festival, as priests, when they receive they receive from the table of the Most High.
llm_translation: The reason is what? An animal, half of it belonging to a gentile and half to an Israelite, it is permitted to slaughter it on a festival day, for it is possible to cut meat without slaughtering. But vows and freewill offerings are forbidden to be slaughtered on a festival day, for the priests have acquired them — they have acquired them from a high table.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא בְּהֵמָה חֶצְיָהּ שֶׁל גּוֹי וְחֶצְיָהּ שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל — מוּתָּר לְשׇׁחְטָהּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב, דְּאִי אֶפְשָׁר לִכְזַיִת בָּשָׂר בְּלֹא שְׁחִיטָה. עִיסָּה חֶצְיָהּ שֶׁל גּוֹי וְחֶצְיָהּ שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל — אָסוּר לֶאֱפוֹתָהּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב, דְּהָא אֶפְשָׁר לֵיהּ לְמִפְלְגַהּ בְּלֵישָׁה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: A animal, half of to a gentile and half to a Jew, may be slaughtered on a Festival because it is impossible to an olive-bulk of meat without slaughtering. dough, half to a gentile and half to a Jew, it is prohibited to bake it on a Festival, as it is possible for him to divide it during the kneading
llm_translation: Rav Hisda said: An animal that is half-owned by a gentile and half-owned by a Jew - it is permitted to slaughter it on a festival, for it is possible to cut meat without slaughtering. A dough that is half-owned by a gentile and half-owned by a Jew - it is forbidden to bake it on a festival, for it is possible to divide it without baking.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב חָנָא בַּר חֲנִילַאי: עִיסַּת כְּלָבִים בִּזְמַן שֶׁהָרוֹעִין אוֹכְלִין מִמֶּנָּה — חַיֶּיבֶת בְּחַלָּה, וּמְעָרְבִין בָּהּ, וּמִשְׁתַּתְּפִין בָּהּ, וּמְבָרְכִין עָלֶיהָ, וּמְזַמְּנִין עָלֶיהָ, וְנֶאֱפֵת בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְאָדָם יוֹצֵא בָּהּ יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בַּפֶּסַח.
human_translation: Rav Ḥana bar Ḥanilai raised an objection Dough for dogs, when shepherds eat of it, is obligated ḥalla and one establish an eiruv , and to establish a merging of alleyways, and one recites a blessing it, and one invites it, and it may be baked on a Festival, and a person fulfills his obligation on Passover with it
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Ḥana bar Ḥanilai raised an objection: With regard to a dog's dough, at a time when the shepherds are eating from it - it is obligated in challah, and one may combine it with other dough, and one may participate in it, and one may recite a blessing over it, and one may invite others to join in, and it may be baked on a Festival, and one fulfills his obligation with it on Passover.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? וְהָא אֶפְשָׁר לֵיהּ לְמִפְלְגַהּ בְּלֵישָׁה! שָׁאנֵי עִיסַּת כְּלָבִים, הוֹאִיל וְאֶפְשָׁר לְפַיְּיסָן בִּנְבֵלָה.
human_translation: And why Isn’t it possible to divide it during the kneading, Dough dogs is different, since it is possible to appease them with a carcass.
llm_translation: And why? And this is possible to divide it in a way that is not smooth! It is different with dog food, since it is possible to appease them with carrion.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִית לֵיהּ לְרַב חִסְדָּא ״הוֹאִיל״? וְהָא אִתְּמַר: הָאוֹפֶה מִיּוֹם טוֹב לְחוֹל, רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: לוֹקֶה, רַבָּה אָמַר: אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה.
human_translation: Does Rav Ḥisda accept since, But wasn’t it stated who bakes on a Festival for a weekday? Rav Ḥisda said: He is flogged Rabba said: He is not flogged.
llm_translation: And who has it according to Rav Ḥisdah "ho'il"? And this was stated: One who bakes from Yom Tov to weekday, Rav Ḥisdah said: He is liable, Rabba said: He is not liable.

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: לוֹקֶה, לָא אָמְרִינַן ״הוֹאִיל וּמִקַּלְעִי לֵיהּ אוֹרְחִים חֲזֵי לֵיהּ — הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי חֲזֵי לֵיהּ״. רַבָּה אָמַר: אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה, אָמְרִינַן ״הוֹאִיל״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said he is flogged we do not say since, guests happen to him, will be fit for him now too, it is fit for him. Rabba, said: He is not flogged, we do say Since.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: If he is lashed, we do not say, "Since he is accustomed to it, let him see it coming." Rabba said: He is not lashed, we say, "Since."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: לָא תֵּימָא ״הוֹאִיל וְאֶפְשָׁר״, אֶלָּא כְּגוֹן דְּאִית לֵיהּ נְבֵלָה, דְּוַדַּאי אֶפְשָׁר לְפַיְּיסַן בִּנְבֵלָה.
human_translation: Rather, Do not say since it is possible Rather, where he has a carcass it is certainly possible to appease them with the carcass.
llm_translation: Rather, do not say "since it is possible," but rather, for example, when he has a carcass, for surely it is possible to appease them with a carcass.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִנֵּיהּ מֵרַב הוּנָא: הָנֵי בְּנֵי בָּאגָא דִּרְמוֹ עֲלַיְיהוּ קִמְחָא דִּבְנֵי חֵילָא מַהוּ לֶאֱפוֹתָהּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב? אֲמַר (לֵיהּ): חֲזֵינָא אִי יָהֲבִי לֵיהּ רִפְתָּא לְיָנוֹקָא וְלָא קָפְדִי, כׇּל חֲדָא וַחֲדָא חַזְיָא לְיָנוֹקָא, וּשְׁרֵי. וְאִי לָאו — אָסוּר.
human_translation: They raised a dilemma before Rav Huna: the residents of a village [ baga ] upon whom imposed flour to the military troops what is baking it on a Festival? said to We examine If give bread to a child and are not particular each and every one is fit for child, and it is permitted But if not it is prohibited
llm_translation: He asked from him, from Rav Huna: Those sons of Baga who spread flour of the sons of Heila over them, is it permissible to bake it on a festival day? He said to him: I see, if one gives a loaf to a child and he does not care, each and every one sees to the child, and it is permitted. But if not — it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּשִׁמְעוֹן הַתִּימְנִי שֶׁלֹּא בָּא אֶמֶשׁ לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ. בְּשַׁחֲרִית מְצָאוֹ [רַבִּי] יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא, אָמַר לוֹ: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא בָּאתָ אֶמֶשׁ לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ? אָמַר לוֹ: בַּלֶּשֶׁת בָּאָה לְעִירֵנוּ, וּבִקְּשָׁה לַחְטוֹף אֶת כָּל הָעִיר, וְשָׁחַטְנוּ לָהֶם עֵגֶל וְהֶאֱכַלְנוּם, וּפְטַרְנוּם לְשָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught There was an incident involving Shimon the Timnite, who did not come the night to the study hall. In the morning, Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava found him said to him: Why did you not come last night to the study hall? He said to him: A military unit on a search mission balleshet came to our city and wanted to pillage the entire city. We slaughtered a calf and we fed them and had them depart in peace.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita: There was an incident with Shimon the Timnite who did not come last night to the study hall. In the morning, Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava found him, and said to him: Why did you not come last night to the study hall? He said to him: A woman came to our city, and she sought to capture the entire city, and we slaughtered a calf for them and fed them, and we sent them off in peace.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: תָּמֵהַּ אֲנִי אִם לֹא יָצָא שְׂכַרְכֶם בְּהֶפְסֵדְכֶם, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: ״לָכֶם״ — וְלֹא לְגוֹיִם. וְאַמַּאי? הָא חֲזֵי לְמֵיכַל מִינֵּיהּ!
human_translation: said to him: I wonder if your gain, was not outweighed by your loss, As the Torah states: for you” but not for gentiles. But why Wasn’t fit to be eaten by them?
llm_translation: He said to him: Astonishing! I am amazed if your reward does not come out of your loss, for the Torah said: "For you" - and not for the nations. And why? Because he sees from his own kind!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: עֵגֶל טְרֵפָה הֲוַאי. וְהָא חֲזֵי לִכְלָבִים!
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: was a calf with a condition that would cause it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ], But wasn’t it fit to be eaten by dogs,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: A calf is a treifah. Yet it is fit for dogs!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: ״אַךְ אֲשֶׁר יֵאָכֵל לְכׇל נֶפֶשׁ הוּא לְבַדּוֹ יֵעָשֶׂה לָכֶם״, מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״לְכׇל נֶפֶשׁ״, שׁוֹמֵעַ אֲנִי אֲפִילּוּ נֶפֶשׁ בְּהֵמָה בַּמַּשְׁמָע, כְּעִנְיָן שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמַכֵּה נֶפֶשׁ בְּהֵמָה יְשַׁלְּמֶנָּה״, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לָכֶם״.
human_translation: is tanna’im . As it is taught “Only that which every soul must eat, that alone may be done for you.” By inference, from that which is stated: “Every soul,” I derive even the soul of an animal is included, similar to which is stated: “And he that kills the soul of an animal shall pay it” the verse states “For you,”
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: "But that alone may be eaten by every living soul, that alone may be done for you." From the explicit wording "for every living soul," I infer that even the soul of an animal is included in the implication, as it is stated: "And one who strikes the soul of an animal shall make restitution for it." The Torah teaches "for you."

hebrew_text: ״לָכֶם״ — וְלֹא לִכְלָבִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ נֶפֶשׁ בְּהֵמָה בַּמַּשְׁמָע. אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לָכֶם״ — לָכֶם וְלֹא לְגוֹיִם.
human_translation: for you, but not for dogs; the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. Rabbi Akiva says: even the soul of an animal is included. If so, what the verse states “for you”? for you, but not for gentiles.
llm_translation: "To you" — and not to dogs, the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean. Rabbi Akiva says: Even if there is a soul in an animal, by mere hearing. If so, what is the Talmud teaching by saying "to you" — to you and not to gentiles.

hebrew_text: וּמָה רָאִיתָ לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַכְּלָבִים וּלְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַגּוֹיִם? מְרַבֶּה אֲנִי אֶת הַכְּלָבִים — שֶׁמְּזוֹנוֹתָן עָלֶיךָ, וּמוֹצִיא אֲנִי אֶת הַגּוֹיִם — שֶׁאֵין מְזוֹנוֹתָן עָלֶיךָ.
human_translation: And what did you see to include dogs and to exclude gentiles? I include dogs because their sustenance is upon you, and I exclude gentiles because their sustenance is not upon you.
llm_translation: And what did you see to increase the dogs and to drive out the nations? I increase the dogs - for their sustenance is upon you, and I drive out the nations - for their sustenance is not upon you.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: וּלְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, דְּאָמַר ״לָכֶם״ וְלֹא לִכְלָבִים, הָנֵי סוּפְלֵי לְחֵיוָתָא הֵיכִי שָׁדֵינַן לְהוּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב?
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: And according to Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, who said “For you,” but not for dogs, how we cast date stones to animals on a Festival?
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Yosef: and to Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, as he said "to you" and not to dogs, how do we support those who are dependent on the living on a festival day?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הוֹאִיל וַחֲזוּ לְהַסָּקָה. תִּינַח בְּיַבִּישְׁתָּא, בְּרַטִּיבְתָּא מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזוּ לְהֶיסֵּק גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: said to him: Since they are fit for fuel, well in dry in moist ones, what is there to say? He said to him: They are fit for a large fire,
llm_translation: He said to him: Since you have seen fit to engage in reasoning. If you place it in a dry place, what is there to say in a wet place? He said to him: Engage in a great reasoning.

hebrew_text: תִּינַח בְּיוֹם טוֹב, בְּשַׁבָּת מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? מְטַלְטְלִינַן לְהוּ אַגַּב רִיפְתָּא. כְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עוֹשֶׂה אָדָם כׇּל צָרְכּוֹ בְּפַת.
human_translation: well in a Festival, in Shabbat, what is there to say? We carry them along with bread. Shmuel, as Shmuel said: A person may perform all his needs with bread;
llm_translation: On a festival, what is the law regarding Shabbat? We move it for them because of a loaf. Like Shmuel, for Shmuel said: A person may do all his needs with bread.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מְזַמְּנִין אֶת הַגּוֹי בְּשַׁבָּת, וְאֵין מְזַמְּנִין אֶת הַגּוֹי בְּיוֹם טוֹב, גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יַרְבֶּה בִּשְׁבִילוֹ.
human_translation: And differs from Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One may invite a gentile on Shabbat, But one may not invite a gentile on a Festival; a preventive measure lest he more for sake.
llm_translation: Dispute of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, for Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One may invite a gentile on Shabbat, but one may not invite a gentile on a festival, decreeing lest one come to exert oneself on his behalf.

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת נָמֵי לָא, מִשּׁוּם שִׁיּוּרֵי כוֹסוֹת. אִי הָכִי, דִּידַן נָמֵי! דִּידַן חֲזוּ לְתַרְנְגוֹלִין. דִּידְהוּ נָמֵי חֲזוּ לְתַרְנְגוֹלִין! דִּידְהוּ — אִיסּוּרֵי הֲנָאָה נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: Even on Shabbat as well, not due to the remnants in the cups. If so, our should also our are fit for chickens. their are also fit for chickens. their items prohibited benefit
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya'akov said: Even on Shabbat, truly not, because of the removal of the cups. If so, we too! We see the roosters. They too see the roosters! They — it is prohibitions of benefit.

hebrew_text: וּלְטַלְטְלִינְהוּ אַגַּב כָּסָא? מִי לָא אָמַר רָבָא: מְטַלְטְלִין כָּנוּנָא אַגַּב קִטְמֵיהּ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיכָּא עֲלֵיהּ שִׁבְרֵי עֵצִים!
human_translation: And let him move on account of the cup, Didn’t Rava say: One may move a coal pan [ kannuna ] on account of the ashes even though there are broken pieces of wood on it
llm_translation: And to move them because of a chair? Who did not say Rava: We move a nest due to its base, even though there are pieces of wood on it!

hebrew_text: הָתָם — לָאו אִיסּוּרֵי הֲנָאָה נִינְהוּ, הָכָא — אִיסּוּרֵי הֲנָאָה נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: There, are not items from which prohibited benefit here, is an item from which prohibited benefit,
llm_translation: There — not prohibitions of benefit they are, here — prohibitions of benefit they are.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: וְלֶהֱוֵי כִּגְרָף שֶׁל רְעִי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְכִי עוֹשִׂין גְּרָף שֶׁל רְעִי לְכַתְּחִלָּה?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: But let it be like a chamber pot for feces, said to him: one make a chamber pot for feces ab initio ?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, from Difti to Ravina: "And it should be like the cud of a friend!" He said to him: "Do they initially make the cud of a friend?"

hebrew_text: אַדְבְּרֵיהּ רָבָא לְמָר שְׁמוּאֵל, וּדְרַשׁ: מְזַמְּנִין אֶת הַגּוֹי בְּשַׁבָּת, וְאֵין מְזַמְּנִין אֶת הַגּוֹי בְּיוֹם טוֹב, גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יַרְבֶּה בִּשְׁבִילוֹ. מָרִימָר וּמַר זוּטְרָא, כִּי הֲוָה מִקְּלַע לְהוּ גּוֹי בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אִי נִיחָא לָךְ בְּמַאי דִּטְרִיחָא לַן מוּטָב, וְאִי לָא — טִרְחָא יַתִּירָא אַדַּעְתָּא דִּידָךְ לָא טָרְחִינַן.
human_translation: Rava authorized Mar Shmuel, and taught: One may invite a gentile on Shabbat, but one may not invite a gentile on a Festival a preventive measure, lest he more for his sake. Mareimar and Mar Zutra when a gentile would happen to their on a Festival, they would say to him: If you are satisfied with that we have prepared for ourselves, good; and if not, we will not go to extra trouble on your account.
llm_translation: Rava spoke to Master Shmuel, and expounded: "One may invite a non-Jew on Shabbat, but one may not invite a non-Jew on a festival, as a precaution lest one come to befriend him excessively." Marimar and Mar Zutra, when a non-Jew would come to them on a festival, would say to him: "If it is pleasant for you with what causes us trouble, good. And if not, the trouble is on your own conscience, for we do not need to trouble ourselves."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יָחֵם אָדָם חַמִּין לְרַגְלָיו אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן רְאוּיִין לִשְׁתִיָּה. וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין. עוֹשֶׂה אָדָם מְדוּרָה וּמִתְחַמֵּם כְּנֶגְדָּהּ.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: A person may not heat water to his feet unless it is fit for drinking, But Beit Hillel permit A person may kindle fire and warm himself at it.
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Beit Shammai say: A person should not heat water for his feet unless it is fit for drinking. Beit Hillel permit it. A person may make a fire and warm himself opposite it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הַאי מְדוּרָה מַאן קָתָנֵי לַהּ? דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל הִיא, וְשָׁנֵי לְהוּ לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי בֵּין הֲנָאַת כׇּל גּוּפוֹ לַהֲנָאַת אֵבֶר אֶחָד, אוֹ דִלְמָא בֵּית הִלֵּל קָתָנֵי לַהּ, אֲבָל בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לָא שָׁנֵי לְהוּ?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before This a fire, who taught it? it a statement all, and Beit Shammai differentiate between benefit one’s entire body and benefit a single limb, Or perhaps Beit Hillel taught it, but Beit Shammai do not differentiate
llm_translation: Gemara: He sought to ask them: Who is the author of this Mishnah? It is the words of everyone, and there is a dispute between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel whether one's entire body benefits for the benefit of one limb, or perhaps Beit Hillel is the author of it, but Beit Shammai does not dispute it?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יַעֲשֶׂה אָדָם מְדוּרָה וְיִתְחַמֵּם כְּנֶגְדָּהּ. וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין.
human_translation: Come hear Beit Shammai say: A person may not make a fire and warm himself at it, but Beit Hillel permit
llm_translation: Come and hear: Beit Shammai say: A person should not make a fire and warm himself opposite it. And Beit Hillel permit it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מַחְמִיר כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: אֵין טוֹמְנִין אֶת הַחַמִּין לְכַתְּחִלָּה בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְאֵין זוֹקְפִין אֶת הַמְּנוֹרָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְאֵין אוֹפִין פִּתִּין גְּרִיצִין אֶלָּא רְקִיקִין. אָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: מִימֵיהֶן שֶׁל בֵּית אַבָּא לֹא הָיוּ אוֹפִין פִּתִּין גְּרִיצִין אֶלָּא רְקִיקִין. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מָה נַעֲשֶׂה לְבֵית אָבִיךְ, שֶׁהָיוּ מַחְמִירִין עַל עַצְמָן וּמְקִילִּין לְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל לִהְיוֹת אוֹפִין פִּתִּין גְּרִיצִין וַחֲרָרִין.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel was stringent three things in accordance with the statement of Beit Shammai: One may not insulate hot food on a Festival ab initio , and one may not set up candelabrum on a Festival; and one may not bake thick loaves but only thin ones, Rabban Gamliel said: From the days of my father’s household they would never bake thick loaves but thin ones. said to him: What shall we do for your father’s household, who were stringent with themselves lenient with all of the Jewish people, to bake thick loaves and cakes baked on coals.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Rabban Gamliel is stringent in three matters like the words of Beit Shammai: One may not insulate the hot water pot for the beginning of the festival day, and one may not set up the menorah on the festival day, and one may only bake flat cakes, not thick loaves. Rabban Gamliel said: In the days of my father's house, they would only bake flat cakes, not thick loaves. They said to him: What was done to your father's house that they were stringent upon themselves and lenient for all of Israel to bake thick loaves and thin loaves and wafers.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּאַנַּח עֵירוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין — מַאי טַעְמָא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי? וְאִי דְּלָא אַנַּח עֵירוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין — מַאי טַעְמָא דְּבֵית הִלֵּל? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ שֶׁלֹּא הִנִּיחַ עֵירוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין, וּכְדֵי חַיָּיו שָׁרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If where he prepared a joining of cooked foods [ eiruv tavshilin ], what is the reason that Beit Shammai And if where he did not set aside an eiruv tavshilin , what is the reason for Beit Hillel? Rav Huna said: Actually, say to you where one did not prepare an eiruv tavshilin , the Sages permitted him his sustenance.
llm_translation: Gemara: How so are the cases similar? If they established an Eruv of cooked dishes - what is the reason for Beit Shammai? And if they did not establish an Eruv of cooked dishes - what is the reason for Beit Hillel? Rav Huna said: Always say to him that he did not leave an Eruv of cooked dishes, and the Sages permitted it for him for his needs.

hebrew_text: וְרַב הוּנָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מִי שֶׁלֹּא הִנִּיחַ עֵירוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין — אוֹפִין לוֹ פַּת אַחַת, וּמְבַשְּׁלִין לוֹ קְדֵרָה אַחַת,
human_translation: And Rav Huna to his reasoning, as Rav Huna said: one who did not prepare an eiruv tavshilin may bake one loaf for him, and cook one pot for him,
llm_translation: And Rav Huna according to his reasoning, for Rav Huna said: One who did not place an Eruv of cooked dishes - we bake for him one loaf, and we cook for him one pot.

hebrew_text: וּמַדְלִיקִין לוֹ אֶת הַנֵּר. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמְרוּ: אַף צוֹלִין לוֹ דָּג קָטָן. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: מִי שֶׁלֹּא הִנִּיחַ עֵירוּבֵי תַבְשִׁילִין — אוֹפִין לוֹ פַּת אַחַת, וְטוֹמְנִין לוֹ קְדֵרָה אַחַת, וּמַדְלִיקִין לוֹ אֶת הַנֵּר, וּמְחַמִּין לוֹ קִיתוֹן אֶחָד, וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף צוֹלִין לוֹ דָּג קָטָן.
human_translation: and kindle a lamp for him. They said in the name of Rabbi Yitzḥak: They may even roast a small fish for him. That is also taught one who did not prepare an eiruv tavshilin , may bake one loaf for him, and insulate one pot for him, and kindle a lamp for him, and heat one jug [ kiton ] for him. And some say: They may even roast a small fish for him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And they light for him the candle. In the name of Rabbi Yitzchak they said: Also roast for him a small fish. It was taught similarly: One who did not set aside Eruvei Tavshilin - they bake for him one loaf, and bury for him one pot, and light for him the candle, and heat for him one dish, and some say: Also roast for him a small fish."

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם שֶׁהִנִּיחַ — וְשָׁאנֵי הַטְמָנָה, דְּמוֹכְחָא מִלְּתָא דְּאַדַּעְתָּא דְשַׁבְּתָא קָעָבֵיד.
human_translation: Rava said: Actually, where one prepared insulating is different, as it is evident that he is acting with Shabbat in mind
llm_translation: Rava said: Always that he left — and different is the hiding, for it is evident from the matter that you know of the Sabbath, he is honored.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: חֲנַנְיָה אוֹמֵר: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין אוֹפִין אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן עֵרֵב בְּפַת, וְאֵין מְבַשְּׁלִין אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן עֵרֵב בְּתַבְשִׁיל, וְאֵין טוֹמְנִין אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיוּ לוֹ חַמִּין טְמוּנִין מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב. הָא הָיוּ לוֹ חַמִּין טְמוּנִין — מִיהָא עָבֵיד, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּמוֹכְחָא מִלְּתָא דְּאַדַּעְתָּא דְּשַׁבָּת קָעָבֵיד!
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to Ḥananya says Beit Shammai say: One may not bake unless he established a joining with bread, and he may not cook unless he established a joining with a cooked dish, and he may not insulate unless he had hot food insulated from the eve of the Festival. But he had hot food insulated, he may in any case act it is evident that he is acting with Shabbat in mind.
