llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: Abaye said: Hananiah says: Beit Shammai say, "One may not bake unless he has mixed the dough on the eve of the Sabbath, and one may not cook unless he has mixed the dish on the eve of the Sabbath, and one may not insulate unless he had hidden hot dishes from the eve of the Sabbath." If he had hidden hot dishes — let him do it, even though the matter of Shabbat is known!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּגוֹן שֶׁעֵרַב לָזֶה וְלֹא עֵרַב לְזֶה, וַחֲנַנְיָה הִיא, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said where he established a joining for this, but he did not establish a joining for this, And is Ḥananya, according to Beit Shammai,
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: For example, he mixed with this one but did not mix with that one, and Chananya is he, and Alibba of Beit Shammai.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין זוֹקְפִין אֶת הַמְּנוֹרָה. מַאי קָא עָבֵיד? אָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר בִּיסְנָא: הָכָא בִּמְנוֹרָה שֶׁל חֻלְיוֹת עָסְקִינַן, דְּמִחֲזֵי כְּבוֹנֶה. דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: יֵשׁ בִּנְיָן בְּכֵלִים, וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: אֵין בִּנְיָן בְּכֵלִים וְאֵין סְתִירָה בְּכֵלִים.
human_translation: one may not set up a candelabrum What does one perform Rav Ḥinnana bar Bisna said: Here, we are dealing with a candelabrum of segments because it looks like building. As Beit Shammai hold there is building with regard to vessels, Beit Hillel hold there is no building with regard to vessels, and there is no dismantling with regard to vessels.
llm_translation: They do not stand up the menorah. What is it doing? Rav Ḥinnana bar Bisna said: Here we are dealing with a menorah of hollow tubes, as it appears like its structure. Beit Shammai hold: There is building in vessels, and Beit Hillel hold: There is no building in vessels and there is no contradiction in vessels.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רַב יְהוּדָה, קָם שַׁמָּעֵיהּ זְקַף לֵהּ לִשְׁרָגָא. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לְעוּלָּא: הַנּוֹתֵן שֶׁמֶן בַּנֵּר — חַיָּיב מִשּׁוּם מַבְעִיר, וְהַמִּסְתַּפֵּק מִמֶּנּוּ — חַיָּיב מִשּׁוּם מְכַבֶּה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו אַדַּעְתַּאי.
human_translation: Ulla happened to the house of Rav Yehuda servant stood and tilted the lamp [ sheragga ], Rav Yehuda raised an objection to Ulla One who adds oil to a lamp is liable for kindling and one who supplies himself from is liable for extinguishing, said to him: without my knowledge.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Ulah ikla lebei Rav Yehuda, kam shammaei zekaf leh lishraga. Eitveih Rav Yehuda le'Ulah: Ha'noten shemen baner - chayav mishum mav'ir, vehamis'tapek mimenu - chayav mishum mekabe! Amar lei: Lav adda'tai. English translation: Ulah entered the house of Rav Yehuda, he heard him standing by the lamp. Rav Yehuda raised an objection to Ulah: One who puts oil in a lamp - is liable for kindling, and one who removes it - is liable for extinguishing! He said to him: I do not know.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: קִנְבָא שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Rav said: It is permitted to trim the end of a wick
llm_translation: Rav said: Kinva is permitted.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ אַבָּא בַּר מָרְתָא מֵאַבָּיֵי: מַהוּ לְכַבּוֹת אֶת הַנֵּר מִפְּנֵי דָּבָר אַחֵר? אָמַר לוֹ: אֶפְשָׁר בְּבַיִת אַחֵר.
human_translation: Abba bar Marta raised a dilemma before Abaye: What is extinguishing a lamp for another matter, said to him: it is possible in a different room.
llm_translation: Requested by Abba bar Marta from Abaye: What about extinguishing the lamp because of another matter? He said to him: It is possible in another house.

hebrew_text: אֵין לוֹ בַּיִת אַחֵר, מַאי? אֶפְשָׁר לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ מְחִיצָה. אֵין לוֹ לַעֲשׂוֹת מְחִיצָה, מַאי? אֶפְשָׁר לִכְפּוֹת עָלָיו אֶת הַכְּלִי. אֵין לוֹ כְּלִי, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אָסוּר.
human_translation: he does not have a different room, what It is possible to erect for oneself a partition does not have to erect a partition, what It is possible to invert a vessel over he does not have a vessel, what said to him: It is prohibited;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If he has no other house, what is the law? It is possible to make for him a partition. If he has no means to make a partition, what is the law? It is possible to place a vessel upon it. If he has no vessel, what is the law? He said to him: It is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: אֵין מְכַבִּין אֶת הַבְּקַעַת כְּדֵי לָחוּס עָלֶיהָ, וְאִם בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁלֹּא יִתְעַשֵּׁן הַבַּיִת אוֹ הַקְּדֵרָה — מוּתָּר! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָהִיא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, כִּי קָאָמֵינָא אֲנָא, לְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: raised an objection to One may not extinguish a piece of wood in order to save it but if so that the house or a pot not become smoky, it is permitted. said to him: That is Rabbi Yehuda, when I spoke, in accordance with the Rabbis,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to it: One may not extinguish a lamp to spare it, but if it is in order to prevent the house or the stove from being damaged — it is permitted! He said to him: That is Rabbi Yehuda's opinion, for I am saying it to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ אַבָּיֵי מֵרַבָּה: מַהוּ לְכַבּוֹת אֶת הַדְּלֵקָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב? הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא סַכָּנַת נְפָשׁוֹת — לָא קָא מִבַּעְיָא לִי, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת שְׁרֵי. כִּי קָמִבַּעְיָא לִי מִשּׁוּם אִבּוּד מָמוֹן, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אָסוּר.
human_translation: Abaye raised a dilemma before Rabba: What is to extinguishing a fire on a Festival? Where there is danger to life, I have no dilemma, as it is permitted even on Shabbat. When I raised the dilemma, involving monetary loss. What said to him: It is prohibited.
llm_translation: Abaye asked Rabba: What about extinguishing a flame on a festival? In a situation where there is a danger to life, I do not need it, for even on Shabbat it is permitted. But if I need it due to financial loss, what is the ruling? He said to him: It is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: אֵין מְכַבִּין אֶת הַבְּקַעַת כְּדֵי לְחוּס עָלֶיהָ, וְאִם בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁלֹּא יִתְעַשֵּׁן הַבַּיִת אוֹ הַקְּדֵרָה — מוּתָּר! הָהִיא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, כִּי קָאָמֵינָא אֲנָא, לְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: raised an objection to his One may not extinguish a piece of wood in order to save it but if so that the house or a pot not become smoky, it is permitted. That is Rabbi Yehuda; when I spoke, in accordance with the Rabbis.
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: One may not extinguish a lamp to spare it, but if it is to prevent the house or the courtyard from being damaged — it is permitted! That statement was made by Rabbi Yehuda, for I am saying it to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי מֵאַמֵּימָר: מַהוּ לִכְחוֹל אֶת הָעַיִן בְּיוֹם טוֹב? הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא סַכָּנָה, כְּגוֹן: רִירָא, דִּיצָא, דְּמָא, דִּמְעֲתָא, וְקַדַּחְתָּא, וּתְחִלַּת אוּכְלָא — לָא מִבַּעְיָא לִי, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת שְׁרֵי. כִּי קָמִבַּעְיָא לִי, סוֹף אוּכְלָא וּפַצּוֹחֵי עֵינָא, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rav Ashi raised a dilemma before Ameimar: What is painting an eye on a Festival? Where there is a danger for example, rira , ditza , dema , dimata , and kadaḥta , beginning of an inflammation, I have no dilemma, as it is permitted even on Shabbat. When I raised the dilemma, end of an inflammation, or brighten one’s eyesight. What said to him: It is prohibited.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei asked Amemar: What is the law regarding rubbing the eye on a festival? In a situation where there is danger, such as discharge, pus, blood, tears, or an eyelash, and at the beginning of a meal - I do not need it, for even on Shabbat it is permitted. But if I need it, at the end of the meal and the eyes are tearing, what is the law? He said to him: It is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: אֵין מְכַבִּין אֶת הַבְּקַעַת, וְשַׁנִּי לֵיהּ כִּדְשַׁנִּין.
human_translation: raised an objection to him One may not extinguish a piece of wood And answered him as we answered
llm_translation: He raised an objection: One does not extinguish the lamp, and he answered him: as we have learned.

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר שָׁרֵי לְמִכְחַל עֵינָא מִגּוֹי בְּשַׁבְּתָא. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אַמֵּימָר גּוּפֵיהּ כְּחַל עֵינָא מִגּוֹי בְּשַׁבְּתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר: מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ — דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב עִילַּאי כׇּל צׇרְכֵי חוֹלֶה עוֹשִׂין עַל יְדֵי גּוֹי בְּשַׁבָּת, וְאָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ סַכָּנָה — אוֹמֵר לְגוֹי וְעוֹשֶׂה.
human_translation: Ameimar permitted painting an eye on Shabbat by a gentile. Some say Ameimar himself painted eye on Shabbat by a gentile. Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: What is your reasoning Ulla, son of Rav Ilai, said: All the needs of an ill person are performed by means of a gentile on Shabbat. And Rav Hamnuna said: any matter in which there is no danger one says to the gentile and performs
llm_translation: Ammar Sharay l'michchal eina migoi b'shabta. Ika de'amrei: Ammar gufeih k'chal eina migoi b'shabta. Amar lei Rav Ashey l'Ammar: Mai datich - de'amar Ula breih d'Rav Ilai kol tzarchei choleh osin al yedei goi b'shabbat, v'amar Rav Hamnuna: Kol davar she'ein bo sakana - omer l'goi v'oseh.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי, הֵיכָא דְּלָא מְסַיַּיע בַּהֲדֵיהּ. אֲבָל מָר קָא מְסַיַּיע בַּהֲדֵיהּ, דְּקָא עָמֵיץ וּפָתַח! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיכָּא רַב זְבִיד דְּקָאֵי כְּוָתָךְ, וְשַׁנַּיי לֵיהּ: מְסַיֵּיעַ אֵין בּוֹ מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: this applies where does not assist But the Master, assists as he closes and opens eye, said to There is Rav Zevid, who holds in accordance with your And I answered him: assists is insubstantial.
llm_translation: These matters, where it does not assist him. But Mar is assisting him, for he is strong and bold! He said to him: There is Rav Zevid who stands like you, and I will say to him: He is not actually assisting.

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר שְׁרָא לְמִכְחַל עֵינָא בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֵׁנִי שֶׁל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר, וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: מֵת בְּיוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן — יִתְעַסְּקוּ בּוֹ עַמְמִין, בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֵׁנִי — יִתְעַסְּקוּ בּוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל. וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁנֵי יָמִים טוֹבִים שֶׁל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה,
human_translation: Ameimar permitted painting an eye on the second day of the festival of Rosh HaShana Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: But didn’t Rava say died on the first day of a Festival, gentiles may attend to his on the second day of a Festival Jews may attend to his And even on the second day of the festival of Rosh HaShana,
llm_translation: Ammemar permitted to bathe the eyes on the second day of Rosh Hashanah. Rav Ashe said to Ammemar, and Rava said: If one dies on the first day of a festival, the common people should deal with him; if one dies on the second day of a festival, Israel should deal with him. And even on the two good days of Rosh Hashanah,

hebrew_text: מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בְּבֵיצָה!
human_translation: which is not so with regard to an egg.
llm_translation: What is not so in an egg!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא כִּנְהַרְדָּעֵי סְבִירָא לִי, דְּאָמְרִי אַף בְּבֵיצָה. וּמַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ — דִּלְמָא מְעַבְּרִי לֵיהּ לֶאֱלוּל? הָאָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר כָּהֲנָא: מִימוֹת עֶזְרָא וְאֵילָךְ לֹא מָצִינוּ אֱלוּל מְעוּבָּר.
human_translation: said to him: I hold in accordance with of Neharde’a, who state even with regard to an egg And what is your reasoning perhaps they will extend Elul didn’t Rav Ḥinnana bar Kahana say: From the days of Ezra and onward we have not found Elul a full,
llm_translation: He said to him: I, like the residents of Nahardea, hold the opinion that one may also eat an egg. And what is your opinion - perhaps you are referring to the month of Elul? For Rav Chinana bar Kahana said: From the days of Ezra and onwards, we have not found Elul to be a pregnant month.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין אוֹפִין פִּתִּין גְּרִיצִין אֶלָּא רְקִיקִין. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין אוֹפִין פַּת עָבָה בְּפֶסַח, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין. וְכַמָּה פַּת עָבָה — אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: טֶפַח. שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בְּלֶחֶם הַפָּנִים, טֶפַח.
human_translation: And one may not bake thick loaves but only thin ones. The Sages taught Beit Shammai say one may not bake thick bread on Passover, whereas Beit Hillel permit And how much thick bread Rav Huna said: handbreadth, as we find likewise with regard to the shewbread handbreadth
llm_translation: And we do not bake thick loaves of bread except thin ones. The Rabbis taught: Beit Shammai say, "One may not bake a thick loaf of bread on Passover," and Beit Hillel permit it. And how thick is a thick loaf of bread? Rav Huna said: A handbreadth. For thus we find in the showbread, a handbreadth.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: אִם אָמְרוּ בִּזְרִיזִין — יֹאמְרוּ בְּשֶׁאֵינָן זְרִיזִין? אִם אָמְרוּ בְּפַת עֲמִלָה — יֹאמְרוּ בְּפַת שֶׁאֵינָהּ עֲמִלָה?
human_translation: Rav Yosef strongly objects to this If stated with regard to vigilant they say with regard to not vigilant? if they said with regard to well-kneaded [ amela ] bread, they say with regard to bread that is not well kneaded?
llm_translation: Rav Yosef objects to her: If they said "with the diligent ones," should they say "with those who are not diligent"? If they said "with leavened bread of toil," should they say "with unleavened bread that is not of toil"?

hebrew_text: אִם אָמְרוּ בְּעֵצִים יְבֵשִׁים — יֹאמְרוּ בְּעֵצִים לַחִים? אִם אָמְרוּ בַּתַּנּוּר חַם — יֹאמְרוּ בְּתַנּוּר צוֹנֵן? אִם אָמְרוּ בְּתַנּוּר שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת — יֹאמְרוּ בְּתַנּוּר שֶׁל חֶרֶס?
human_translation: If they stated in dry wood, they say in moist wood, if they said with regard to hot oven they say with regard to oven, cold if they said with regard to metal oven, they say with regard to earthenware oven
llm_translation: If they said regarding dry wood - shall they say regarding moist wood? If they said regarding a hot oven - shall they say regarding a cold oven? If they said regarding a metal oven - shall they say regarding an earthenware oven?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא: שְׁאֵלִית אֶת רַבִּי בְּיִחוּד, וּמַנּוּ — רַב: מַאי פַּת עָבָה? פַּת מְרוּבָּה.
human_translation: Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said: I asked my teacher in private, and who is Rav. What is thick bread? a large quantity bread,
llm_translation: Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said: I asked Rabbi in private, and he answered - Rav: What is thick bread? Bread that is mixed.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: שְׁאֵלִית אֶת רַבִּי בְּיִחוּד, וּמַנּוּ — רַבֵּינוּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ: מַאי פַּת עָבָה? פַּת מְרוּבָּה. וְאַמַּאי קָרוּ לֵיהּ פַּת עָבָה? מִשּׁוּם דִּנְפִישָׁא בְּלִישָׁה. אִי נָמֵי, בְּאַתְרֵיהּ דְּהַאי תַּנָּא, פַּת מְרוּבָּה — פַּת עָבָה קָרוּ לֵיהּ
human_translation: Some say Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said Rav said: I asked my teacher in private; and who is our holy Rabbi What is thick bread? a large quantity bread. And why do they call it thick bread? because it is expanded at the kneading Alternatively, in the place where this tanna a large quantity bread was called thick bread.
llm_translation: There is one who says, Rav Yirmiyah son of Abba said in the name of Rav: You asked Rabbi in private, and he answered - our holy Rabbi: What is thick bread? Bread that is mixed. And why is it called thick bread? Because it is thick with kneading. Alternatively, in the place of this Mishna, thick bread - they called it thick bread.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדִי מִשּׁוּם דְּקָטָרַח טִרְחָא דְּלָא צְרִיךְ הוּא, מַאי אִרְיָא פֶּסַח? אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁאָר יָמִים טוֹבִים נָמֵי! אִין הָכִי נָמֵי. וְתַנָּא, בְּיוֹם טוֹב דְּפֶסַח קָאֵי. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין אוֹפִין פַּת מְרוּבָּה בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין.
human_translation: Now, since because he exerts himself unnecessarily, why specifically Passover? with regard to the other Festivals as well. Yes, it is indeed so; But the tanna was dealing with the festival Passover this is also taught Beit Shammai say: One may not bake a large quantity of bread on Festival, whereas Beit Hillel permit
llm_translation: From the fact that the incense offering is not necessary, what is the reason for saying "Pesach lamb"? Even on other good days it is also so! It is indeed so. And it was taught, on the festival day of Pesach it stands. It was similarly taught, Beit Shammai say: One may not bake a large loaf on a festival, and Beit Hillel permit it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַף הוּא אָמַר שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים לְהָקֵל: מְכַבְּדִין בֵּית הַמִּטּוֹת, וּמַנִּיחִין אֶת הַמּוּגְמָר בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְעוֹשִׂין גְּדִי מְקוּלָּס בְּלֵילֵי פְסָחִים. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין.
human_translation: also said three things as leniencies, One may sweep the room of the couches And one may place incense on a Festival. And one may prepare a whole kid on the night of Passover, the Rabbis prohibit
llm_translation: The Mishnah also teaches: He also said three things to be lenient: One may make the bed on Shabbat eve, leave the unfinished task until the festival, and roast a kid that is partially roasted on the eve of Passover. But the Sages prohibit these practices.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: מַחְלוֹקֶת לְגַמֵּר, אֲבָל לְהָרִיחַ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rav Asi said: dispute to perfume However, to smell, all agree permitted.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rav Assi: Dispute to finish, but to smell — words of all permitted.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אֵין מְכַבְּדִין בֵּית הַמִּטּוֹת בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְשֶׁל בֵּית רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מְכַבְּדִין. אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בַּר צָדוֹק: פְּעָמִים הַרְבֵּה נִכְנַסְתִּי אַחַר אַבָּא, לְבֵית רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְלֹא הָיוּ מְכַבְּדִין בֵּית הַמִּטּוֹת בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אֶלָּא מְכַבְּדִין אוֹתָן מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב, וּפוֹרְסִין עֲלֵיהֶם סְדִינִין. לְמָחָר, כְּשֶׁאוֹרְחִים נִכְנָסִין, מְסַלְּקִין אֶת הַסְּדִינִין וְנִמְצָא הַבַּיִת מִתְכַּבֵּד מֵאֵלָיו. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִם כֵּן, אַף בַּשַּׁבָּת מוּתָּר לַעֲשׂוֹת כֵּן.
human_translation: raises an objection One may not sweep the room of the couches on a Festival but the house of Rabban Gamliel they did sweep, Rabbi Eliezer bar Tzadok said: On many occasions I followed Father, into Rabban Gamliel’s house, and they would not sweep the room of the couches on a Festival, but They sweep on the eve of the Festival and spread sheets over it on the following day, when guests entered, they removed the sheets, and it turned out that the house was cleaned on its own. said to him: If so, it is permitted to do so on Shabbat as well,
llm_translation: The opponent raises an objection: One does not honor the bed on a festival, but the household of Rabban Gamliel does honor it. Rabbi Eliezer son of Zadok said: Many times I followed after my father to the household of Rabban Gamliel, and they did not honor the bed on a festival, but rather they honored it on the eve of the festival, and spread linen sheets over it. The next day, when guests entered, they would remove the sheets, and the house would be honored in their eyes. They said to him: If so, it is also permitted to do so on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מַנִּיחִין אֶת הַמּוּגְמָר בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְשֶׁל בֵּית רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מַנִּיחִין. אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בַּר צָדוֹק: פְּעָמִים הַרְבֵּה נִכְנַסְתִּי אַחַר אַבָּא לְבֵית רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְלֹא הָיוּ מַנִּיחִין אֶת הַמּוּגְמָר בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אֶלָּא מְבִיאִין עַרְדַּסְקָאוֹת שֶׁל בַּרְזֶל וּמְעַשְּׁנִין אוֹתָן מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב, וּפוֹקְקִין נִקְבֵיהֶן מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב. לְמָחָר, כְּשֶׁאוֹרְחִים נִכְנָסִין, פּוֹתְחִין אֶת נִקְבֵיהֶן וְנִמְצָא הַבַּיִת מִתְגַּמֵּר מֵאֵלָיו.
human_translation: one may not place incense on a Festival, but the house of Rabban Gamliel they did place Rabbi Eliezer bar Tzadok said: On many occasions I followed Father into Rabban Gamliel’s house, and they would not place incense on a Festival, but bring perforated coal pans [ ardaska’ot ] made of iron, filled them with smoke on the eve of the Festival, and plugged their holes on the Festival eve On the following day, when guests entered, they opened the holes, and it turned out that the house was perfumed on its own.
llm_translation: And we do not leave the Mogmar on a festival day, but the household of Rabban Gamliel leaves it. Rabbi Eliezer son of Zadok said: Many times I entered after Abba to the household of Rabban Gamliel, and they would not leave the Mogmar on a festival day, but they would bring iron spits and change them on the eve of the festival, and they would pierce them on the eve of the festival. The next day, when guests would enter, they would open their piercings and find the meat fully cooked.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִם כֵּן, אַף בַּשַּׁבָּת מוּתָּר לַעֲשׂוֹת כֵּן.
human_translation: said to him: If so, it is permitted to do so on Shabbat as well.
llm_translation: They said to him: If so, it is permitted to do so even on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִי אִתְּמַר הָכִי אִתְּמַר, אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: מַחְלוֹקֶת לְהָרִיחַ, אֲבָל לְגַמֵּר — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rather, if this was stated, it was stated as follows: Rav Asi said dispute to smell. However, to perfume prohibited.
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus. Rav Assi said: Disagreement for smelling, but for finishing — prohibited.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַהוּ לְעַשֵּׁן? רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: אָסוּר. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מוּתָּר. רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: אָסוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמְּכַבֶּה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן: וְנֵימָא מָר — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּבְעִיר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּחִלָּתוֹ מְכַבֶּה וְסוֹפוֹ מַבְעִיר.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is smoking Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said Rav said: It is prohibited, And Shmuel said: It is permitted. Rav Huna said: It is prohibited because he extinguishes Rav Naḥman said to him: And let the Master say because he kindles said to him: Its beginning extinguishing, and its end kindling.
llm_translation: The Gemara asked: What about smoking? Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said in the name of Rav: It is prohibited. And Shmuel said: It is permitted. Rav Huna said: It is prohibited because it extinguishes. Rav Nachman said to him: And should we say, Master, because it ignites? He said to him: Its beginning is extinguishing and its end is igniting.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: עַל גַּבֵּי גַּחֶלֶת — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: on the coals is prohibited
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: On top of coals - forbidden.

hebrew_text: עַל גַּבֵּי חֶרֶס — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: on earthenware is permitted,
llm_translation: On top of a shard - permitted.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּה אָמַר: עַל גַּבֵּי חֶרֶס נָמֵי אָסוּר, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא מוֹלֵיד רֵיחָא. רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: סַחוֹפֵי כָּסָא אַשִּׁירָאֵי בְּיוֹמָא טָבָא — אָסוּר, מַאי טַעְמָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּקָמוֹלֵיד רֵיחָא.
human_translation: And Rabba said: on earthenware is also prohibited, because it produces scent Rabba and Rav Yosef both said It is prohibited to overturn a cup onto silk garments on a Festival. What is the reason because it produces scent
llm_translation: Rabba said: On top of a potsherd, it is forbidden, because it generates a smell. Rabba and Rav Yosef both said: Covering a stool with a pitcher on a good day - it is forbidden. What is the reason? Because it generates a smell.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מִמּוֹלְלוֹ וּמֵרִיחַ בּוֹ וְקוֹטְמוֹ וּמֵרֵיחַ בּוֹ? הָתָם — רֵיחָא מִיהָא אִיתָא, וְאוֹסוֹפֵי הוּא דְּקָא מוֹסִיף רֵיחָא. הָכָא — אוֹלוֹדֵי הוּא דְּקָמוֹלֵיד רֵיחָא. רָבָא אָמַר: עַל גַּבֵּי גַּחֶלֶת נָמֵי מוּתָּר, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַבִּשְׂרָא אַגּוּמְרֵי.
human_translation: And what is different from One may press and smell it, and one may snip off and smell it? There, the scent exists in any case, and he adds to the fragrance, Here, he produces scent. Rava, said: even permitted on coals just as it is meat on coals
llm_translation: And what is the difference between one who rolls it and smells it and crushes it and smells it? There — the smell comes from it, and it is the end that adds the smell. Here — it is the rollers who produce the smell. Rava said: On top of a coal it is permitted, since it becomes like glowing embers.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַב גְּבִיהָא מִבֵּי כְתִיל אַפִּתְחָא דְּבֵי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא: קִטּוּרָא שְׁרֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַמֵּימָר: מַאי ״קִטּוּרָא״? אִי קִטּוּרָא בִּידֵי — מַעֲשֵׂה אוּמָּן הוּא, וְאִי לְעַשֵּׁן — אָסוּר, דְּהָא קָא מְכַבֶּה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: לְעוֹלָם לְעַשֵּׁן, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַבִּשְׂרָא אַגּוּמְרֵי.
human_translation: Rav Geviha from Bei Katil taught at the entrance to the house of the Exilarch ketura is permitted Ameimar said to him: What is ketura ? If tying ketura by hand, act of a craftsman And to burning prohibited, as he extinguishes Rav Ashi said to him: Actually, to burning just as it is meat on coals
llm_translation: Rav Geviha expounded from the house of Ketil Apitkha in the head of the exile: "Incense is permitted." Amemar said to him: What is "incense"? If it is incense in the hands - it is a skilled craft, and if for smoking - it is prohibited, because it extinguishes! Rav Ashe said to him: It is always for smoking, for it becomes a fragrant smoke.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַמֵּימָר: מַאי ״קִטּוּרָא״? אִי קִטּוּרָא בִּידֵי — מַעֲשֵׂה אוּמָּן הוּא. אִי לְעַשֵּׁן — אָסוּר דְּקָא מוֹלֵיד רֵיחָא! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֲנָא אַמְרִיתַהּ נִהֲלֵיהּ, וּמִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּגַבְרָא רַבָּה אַמְרִיתַהּ נִהֲלֵיהּ: לְעוֹלָם לְעַשֵּׁן, וּמִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַבִּשְׂרָא אַגּוּמְרֵי.
human_translation: Some say Ameimar said to What is ketura ? If tying by hand, the act of a craftsman, If to burning as he produces a scent. Rav Ashi said: I said and I said in the name of a great man, actually to burning just as it is meat on coals
llm_translation: There are those who say. Amemar said to him: What is "kitura"? If kitura is in the hands - it is a skilled craft. If for smoking - it is prohibited because it produces a smell! Rav Ashe said: I said it should be smoked, and from the name of the great man I said it should be smoked: Always for smoking, and when it becomes ripe, it is finished.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹשִׂין גְּדִי מְקוּלָּס. תַּנְיָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: תּוֹדוֹס אִישׁ רוֹמִי הִנְהִיג אֶת בְּנֵי רוֹמִי לֶאֱכוֹל גְּדִי מְקוּלָּס בְּלֵילֵי פְּסָחִים. שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ: אִלְמָלֵא תּוֹדוֹס אַתָּה, גּוֹזְרָנוּ עָלֶיךָ נִדּוּי, שֶׁאַתָּה מַאֲכִיל אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל קָדָשִׁים בַּחוּץ.
human_translation: one may prepare a whole [ mekulas ] kid It is taught Rabbi Yosei says: Theodosius [ Todos ] of Rome, instituted the custom for the Roman to eat whole kids on the night of Passover, sent to him: Were you not Theodosius, we would have decreed ostracism upon you, as you are feeding the Jewish people consecrated outside
llm_translation: They make a kid that is roasted. It was taught: Rabbi Yosei says: Tudos, a Roman man, led the sons of Rome to eat a roasted kid on the nights of Passover. They sent to him: If not for Tudos, we would have decreed excommunication upon you, for you feed the children of Israel holy offerings outside.

hebrew_text: קָדָשִׁים סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כְּעֵין קָדָשִׁים.
human_translation: Can it enter your mind consecrated Rather, say similar to consecrated
llm_translation: "Kodashim sal'ka da'atach?! Ela eima: ke'ein kodashim."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה מַתִּיר וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִים: פָּרָתוֹ יוֹצְאָה בִּרְצוּעָה שֶׁבֵּין קַרְנֶיהָ.
human_translation: three things Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya permits and the Rabbis prohibit: His cow go out with strap between its horns.
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah permits three things, and the Sages prohibit them: If its udder protrudes between its horns.

hebrew_text: וּמְקָרְדִין אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב. וְשׁוֹחֲקִין אֶת הַפִּלְפְּלִין בָּרֵחַיִם שֶׁלָּהֶן.
human_translation: And one may comb [ mekardin ] an animal on a Festival And one may grind pepper in its mill,
llm_translation: And we slaughter the animal on the festival. And we grind the peppers in their mills.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין מְקָרְדִין אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעוֹשֶׂה חַבּוּרָה, אֲבָל מְקַרְצְפִין. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מְקָרְדִין, אַף לֹא מְקַרְצְפִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: One may not comb an animal on a Festival because creates a wound, but one may brush But the Rabbis say: One may not comb, nor may one even brush.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: We do not comb the animal on a festival, because it creates a mixture, but we may scrape it. And the sages say: We do not comb, nor do we scrape.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְמֵימְרָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה חֲדָא פָּרָה הַוְיָא לֵיהּ? וְהָאָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: תְּלֵיסַר אַלְפֵי עִגְלֵי הֲוָה מְעַשַּׂר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה מֵעֶדְרֵיהּ כׇּל שַׁתָּא וְשַׁתָּא. תָּנָא: לֹא שֶׁלּוֹ הָיְתָה, אֶלָּא שֶׁל שְׁכֶנְתּוֹ הָיְתָה, וּמִתּוֹךְ שֶׁלֹּא מִיחָה בָּהּ — נִקְרֵאת עַל שְׁמוֹ.
human_translation: Is that to say that Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya had one cow? But didn’t Rav say, and some say Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya would tithe from his herds thirteen thousand calves each and every year, it is taught was not his; rather, it was his neighbor’s. And because he did not protest her was called by his name
llm_translation: Gemara: Was there one cow for Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah? But Rav said, and some say Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Thirteen thousand calves were tithed by Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah from his herd every year. It was taught: It was not his own, but belonged to his neighbor, and because he did not protest against it, it was called by his name.

hebrew_text: וּמְקָרְדִין אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ קֵרוּד וְאֵיזֶהוּ קִרְצוּף? קֵרוּד — קְטַנִּים וְעוֹשִׂין חַבּוּרָה, קִרְצוּף — גְּדוֹלִים וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין חַבּוּרָה.
human_translation: one may comb an animal on a Festival. The Sages taught What is combing and what is brushing? Combing a small and makes a wound; brushing a large and does not make a wound.
llm_translation: And they tie up the animal on a festival. The Rabbis taught: What is a Kerud and what is a Kirzuf? Kerud - small animals that form a group, Kirzuf - large animals that do not form a group.

hebrew_text: וְשָׁלֹשׁ מַחְלוֹקוֹת בַּדָּבָר, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִתְכַּוֵּין — אָסוּר. מִיהוּ: קֵרוּד — קְטַנִּים, וְעוֹשִׂין חַבּוּרָה. קִרְצוּף — גְּדוֹלִים, וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין חַבּוּרָה. וְלָא גָּזְרִינַן קִרְצוּף אַטּוּ קֵרוּד.
human_translation: And there are three disputes with regard to matter. Rabbi Yehuda holds an unintentional act, is prohibited, However, combing a small makes a wound, brushing a large does not make a wound, and we do not issue a decree brushing due to combing,
llm_translation: And three disputes in the matter, Rabbi Yehuda holds: a matter that is not precise — forbidden. However: Kerud — small, and they make a group. Kirtzuf — large, and they do not make a group. And we do not decree Kirtzuf except for Kerud.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי נָמֵי כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִתְכַּוֵּין — אָסוּר, וְגָזְרִינַן קִרְצוּף אַטּוּ קֵרוּד. וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָמַר: דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִתְכַּוֵּין — מוּתָּר, וּבֵין קֵרוּד וּבֵין קִרְצוּף שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: And the Rabbis also hold in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda an unintentional act is prohibited. we issue a decree brushing due to combing. Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who said an unintentional act is permitted. both combing and brushing are permitted,
llm_translation: The sages hold like Rabbi Yehuda, that an unintentional act is forbidden, and we decree lashes for it. But Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah holds like Rabbi Shimon who says: an unintentional act is permitted, whether it is a mistake or a deliberate act.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן לְחוֹדֵיהּ: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, שֶׁהֲרֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה מוֹדֶה לוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: וְלֵימָא מָר, הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה שֶׁהֲרֵי חֲכָמִים מוֹדִים לוֹ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סְבִירָא לִי, וְעוֹד שֶׁהֲרֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה מוֹדֶה לוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said, and some say Rav Naḥman said himself: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, as Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya agrees with him. Rava said to Rav Naḥman: And let the Master say halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, as the Rabbis agree with him. said to him: I hold in accordance with Rabbi Shimon; another that Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya agrees with him.
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Nachman said, Shmuel said, and some say Rav Nachman said to his colleagues: The halakha is according to Rabbi Shimon, for Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah agrees with him. Rava said to Rav Nachman: And let the Master say, the halakha is according to Rabbi Yehudah, for the sages agree with him! He said to him: I hold like Rabbi Shimon, and furthermore, Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah agrees with him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָרֵחַיִם שֶׁל פִּלְפְּלִין, טְמֵאָה מִשּׁוּם שְׁלֹשָׁה כֵּלִים: מִשּׁוּם כְּלִי קִבּוּל, וּמִשּׁוּם כְּלִי מַתֶּכֶת, וּמִשּׁוּם כְּלִי כְּבָרָה.
human_translation: The pepper mill is susceptible to ritual impurity because of three vessels because receptacle, because a metal vessel, and because a sieve.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The womb of a pepper, is impure due to three vessels: due to a receiving vessel, and due to a metal vessel, and due to a lead vessel.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: תַּחְתּוֹנָה — מִשּׁוּם כְּלִי קִבּוּל, אֶמְצָעִית — מִשּׁוּם כְּלִי כְּבָרָה, עֶלְיוֹנָה — מִשּׁוּם כְּלִי מַתֶּכֶת.
human_translation: taught: lower because a receptacle, The middle because a sieve, upper because a metal vessel.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Tachtonah - mishum kli kibul, emtsa'it - mishum kli kevarah, elyonah - mishum kli matet.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עֲגָלָה שֶׁל קָטָן — טְמֵאָה מִדְרָס, וְנִטֶּלֶת בְּשַׁבָּת, וְאֵינָהּ נִגְרֶרֶת אֶלָּא עַל גַּבֵּי כֵלִים.
human_translation: A child’s wagon, is susceptible to ritual impurity treading. And may be handled on Shabbat, And it may be dragged only upon cloth,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A calf belonging to a minor - is impure due to a bed, and may be taken out on Shabbat, and it is not dragged except on the vessels.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַכֵּלִים אֵין נִגְרָרִין, חוּץ מִן הָעֲגָלָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא כּוֹבֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: no vessels may be dragged except for a wagon, because press
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: All the vessels are not dragged, except for the wagon, because it is tied.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ עֲגָלָה שֶׁל קָטָן — טְמֵאָה מִדְרָס, דְּהָא סָמֵיךְ עִלָּוַיהּ. וְנִטֶּלֶת בְּשַׁבָּת, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא תּוֹרַת כְּלִי עֲלַהּ.
human_translation: a child’s wagon is susceptible to ritual impurity treading. because he leans on it. may be handled on Shabbat. because it has the status of a vessel,
llm_translation: Gemara: A calf's wagon belonging to a minor - impure due to a cushion, for it is placed upon it. And if one removes it on Shabbat, it is because there is a law of a utensil on it.

hebrew_text: וְאֵינָהּ נִגְרֶרֶת אֶלָּא עַל גַּבֵּי כֵלִים. עַל גַּבֵּי כֵלִים — אִין, עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע — לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא, דְּקָא עָבֵיד חָרִיץ. מַנִּי? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין — אָסוּר.
human_translation: may be dragged only upon cloth. Upon cloth, yes, on the ground, no, What is the reason because he creates a furrow whose It is Rabbi Yehuda, who said: An unintentional act, is prohibited,
llm_translation: "And it is only dragged on the vessels. On the vessels - yes, on the ground - no. What is the reason? Because it is making a furrow. Who is the Tanna? It is Rabbi Yehuda, who said: An unintended action - is forbidden."

hebrew_text: דְּאִי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, הָאָמַר: דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין — מוּתָּר. (דִּתְנַן) רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: גּוֹרֵר אָדָם מִטָּה כִּסֵּא וְסַפְסָל, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִתְכַּוֵּין לַעֲשׂוֹת חָרִיץ.
human_translation: As, if Rabbi Shimon, didn’t he say: An unintentional act is permitted, As we learned Rabbi Shimon says: A person may drag a bed, a chair, or a bench provided that he does not intend to make a furrow.
llm_translation: If Rabbi Shimon says: a matter that is not intended - permitted. (As we learned) Rabbi Shimon says: one may drag a bed, chair, and stool, as long as he does not intend to make a furrow.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין הַכֹּל נִגְרָרִין בְּשַׁבָּת, חוּץ מִן הָעֲגָלָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא כּוֹבֶשֶׁת. מִפְּנֵי שֶׁכּוֹבֶשֶׁת — אִין, אֲבָל חָרִיץ — לָא עָבְדָא?
human_translation: say the latter clause Rabbi Yehuda says: No vessels may be dragged on Shabbat except for a wagon, because it presses because, yes, it presses but it does not make a furrow.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa, Rabbi Yehuda omer: ein hakol nig'arin b'Shabbat, chutz min ha'agalah, m'pnei shehi koveshet. M'pnei shekoveshet — ein, aval charitz — la'avda?" English translation: "Say the latter clause, Rabbi Yehuda says: not everything is dragged on Shabbat, except for the wagon, because it is tied. Because it is tied — no, but a plow — is it not work?"

hebrew_text: תְּרֵי תַנָּאֵי, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: two tanna’im in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda
llm_translation: Two Tannaim, and the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ יוֹם טוֹב
llm_translation: We will see you on a good day.

hebrew_text: אֵין צָדִין דָּגִים מִן הַבִּיבָרִים בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְאֵין נוֹתְנִין לִפְנֵיהֶם מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: One may not trap fish from ponds on a Festival Nor may one place food before them,
llm_translation: We do not catch fish from the fishponds on a festival day, and we do not place food before them.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל צָדִין חַיָּה וְעוֹף מִן הַבִּיבָרִין, וְנוֹתְנִין לִפְנֵיהֶם מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: However, one may trap an animal or a bird from enclosures [ beivarim ], And one may place food before them
llm_translation: But we trap a wild animal and bird from the traps, and we place food before them.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: לֹא כָּל הַבִּיבָרִין שָׁוִין. זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Not all enclosures are identical This is the principle: any
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Not all Bivarin are equal. This is the principle: all

hebrew_text: הַמְחוּסָּר צֵידָה — אָסוּר, וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ מְחוּסָּר צֵידָה — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: whose trapping is inadequate, is prohibited and whose trapping is not inadequate, is permitted
llm_translation: The one who lacks hunting - forbidden, and the one who does not lack hunting - permitted.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּרְמִינְהוּ: בֵּיבָרִין שֶׁל חַיָּה וְשֶׁל עוֹפוֹת — אֵין צָדִין מֵהֶם בְּיוֹם טוֹב וְאֵין נוֹתְנִין לִפְנֵיהֶם מְזוֹנוֹת. קַשְׁיָא חַיָּה אַחַיָּה, קַשְׁיָא עוֹפוֹת אַעוֹפוֹת!
human_translation: And raises a contradiction From enclosures of animals and of birds, one may not trap on a Festival, nor may one place food before them. difficult an animal an animal difficult birds birds
llm_translation: Gemara: And they raised a dilemma: The innards of a wild animal and of birds - one may not hunt them on a festival, and one may not place food before them. The difficulty of a wild animal is a difficulty, the difficulty of birds is a difficulty!

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא חַיָּה אַחַיָּה לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָא רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Granted, an animal an animal not difficult, this, Rabbi Yehuda, that, the Rabbis,
llm_translation: In peace, a living creature is not difficult: this is Rabbi Yehuda, this is the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הַצָּד צִפּוֹר לַמִּגְדָּל וּצְבִי לַבַּיִת — חַיָּיב. לַבַּיִת הוּא דְּמִחַיַּיב, אֲבָל לְבִיבָרִין — לָא. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: צִפּוֹר — לַמִּגְדָּל, וּצְבִי — לַגִּנָּה וְלֶחָצֵר וְלַבִּיבָרִין.
human_translation: As we learned Rabbi Yehuda says: One who traps a bird into a closet or a deer into a house is liable. It is into a house that he is liable, but into an enclosure, not And the Rabbis say: a bird into a closet, and a deer into a garden, or into a courtyard, or into an enclosure.
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda says: If a bird traps itself in a tower or a deer in a house - one is liable. It is the house that causes liability, but for a pit - no. And the Sages say: A bird - for a tower, and a deer - for a garden, courtyard, and a pit.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, עוֹפוֹת אַעוֹפוֹת קַשְׁיָא! וְכִי תֵּימָא הָא נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּבִיבָר מְקוֹרֶה, הָא בְּבִיבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְקוֹרֶה.
human_translation: However, birds birds difficult, And if you say this also not difficult, this, a roofed enclosure, that, an unroofed enclosure,
llm_translation: Rather, birds, difficult birds! And if you say, this is not difficult: this one is in a pit, this one is in a pit that is not a pit.

hebrew_text: וְהָא בַּיִת, דִּכְבִיבָר מְקוֹרֶה דָּמֵי, וּבֵין לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וּבֵין לְרַבָּנַן: צִפּוֹר לַמִּגְדָּל — אִין, לַבַּיִת — לָא!
human_translation: As a house, which is like a roofed enclosure, And according to both Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis, a bird into a closet, yes, into a house, no,
llm_translation: The text: "And this regarding a house, where its foundation is similar to blood, and there is a dispute between Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis: for a bird to a tower - no, to a house - yes!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: הָכָא בְּצִפּוֹר דְּרוֹר עָסְקִינַן, שֶׁאֵינָהּ מְקַבֶּלֶת מָרוּת. דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: לָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ צִפּוֹר דְּרוֹר — שֶׁדָּרָה בַּבַּיִת כְּבַשָּׂדֶה.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: Here, we are dealing with a free bird, which does not accept authority. As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Why is it called a free dror bird Because it dwells dara in a house as it does in a field,
llm_translation: Rabah bar Rav Huna said: Here we are dealing with the case of a wild dove, which does not accept domination. As it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Why is it called a wild dove? Because it lives in the house as in the field.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי, חַיָּה אַחַיָּה נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּבִיבָר קָטָן, הָא — בְּבִיבָר גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: Now that you have arrived at this an animal an animal also not difficult. This, a small enclosure, That, a large enclosure,
llm_translation: The question that arises in this case, "Chayyah Achayyah" is not difficult. This one - in a small pit, and this one - in a large pit.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי בִּיבָר קָטָן הֵיכִי דָּמֵי בִּיבָר גָּדוֹל? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּרָהֵיט אַבָּתְרַהּ וּמָטֵי לַהּ בְּחַד שִׁחְיָא — בִּיבָר קָטָן, וְאִידַּךְ — בִּיבָר גָּדוֹל. אִי נָמֵי: כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא עוּקְצֵי עוּקְצֵי — בִּיבָר גָּדוֹל, וְאִידַּךְ — בִּיבָר קָטָן. אִי נָמֵי: כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּנָפְלִי טוּלָּא דְכֻתְלֵי אַהֲדָדֵי — בִּיבָר קָטָן, וְאִידַּךְ — בִּיבָר גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: What are the circumstances a small enclosure, what are the circumstances a large enclosure? Rav Ashi said: Any where one can run after and reach it in one stoop a small enclosure. And other a large enclosure. Or perhaps, any that has a series of corners a large enclosure, and other a small enclosure. Or perhaps, any where the shadows from the walls fall upon each other, a small enclosure. And other, a large enclosure.
llm_translation: How are the laws of a small member compared to the laws of a large member? Rav Ashei said: In every case where the father is trembling and the mother is lying down with one thigh — it is a small member, and in the other case — it is a large member. Alternatively: In every case where there are sharp thorns — it is a large member, and in the other case — it is a small member. Alternatively: In every case where a basket of slaughtered doves falls — it is a small member, and in the other case — it is a large member.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר לֹא כָּל הַבֵּיבָרִין שָׁוִין וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: הֲלָכָה — מִכְּלָל דִּפְלִיגִי!
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Not all enclosures are identical. Rav Yosef said Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. Abaye said to halakha by inference disagree,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Not all Beibarin are equal, etc. Rav Yosef said, Rav Yehudah said, Shmuel said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel. Abbaye said to him: The halakha - from the fact that he argued!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּמַאי נָפְקָא לָךְ מִינַּהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גְּמָרָא גְּמוֹר, זְמוֹרְתָּא תְּהֵא?!
human_translation: said to him: And what difference is there to you said to him, learn the lesson; it be a song?
llm_translation: He said to him: And what do you derive from it? He said to him: A complete conclusion, should it be incomplete?!

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל כׇּל הַמְחוּסָּר צֵידָה וְכוּ׳. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי מְחוּסָּר צֵידָה? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל שֶׁאוֹמֵר הָבֵא מְצוּדָה וּנְצוּדֶנּוּ.
human_translation: This is the principle: Any whose trapping is inadequate What are the circumstances whose trapping is inadequate? Rav Yosef said Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Any with regard to which one would say: Bring a trap so that we may catch it,
llm_translation: This is the principle: All that lacks a side, etc. How so is the case of lacking a side? Rav Yosef said in the name of Rav Yehudah who said in the name of Shmuel: Anyone who says "the one who comes is trapped, and we will trap him."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא אֲווֹזִין וְתַרְנְגוֹלִין, שֶׁאוֹמְרִים הָבֵא מְצוּדָה וּנְצוּדֶנּוּ, וְתַנְיָא: הַצָּד אֲווֹזִין וְתַרְנְגוֹלִין וְיוֹנֵי הַרְדִּיסָאוֹת — פָּטוּר!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: But aren’t geese and chickens with regard to which one would say: Bring a trap so that we may catch it, And it is taught One who traps geese, chickens, or domestic doves is exempt,
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: But geese and chickens, for they say "He who comes to be trapped, let him be trapped," and it was taught: One who traps geese, chickens, and the young doves of the rafters - he is exempt!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַלָּלוּ בָּאִין לִכְלוּבָן לָעֶרֶב, וְהַלָּלוּ אֵין בָּאִין לִכְלוּבָן לָעֶרֶב.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said Shmuel said: These, enter their coop in the evening while these do not enter their coop in the evening
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said in the name of Shmuel: These come to be burned in the evening, and these do not come to be burned in the evening.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי יוֹנֵי שׁוֹבָךְ וְיוֹנֵי עֲלִיָּיה, דְּבָאִין לִכְלוּבָן לָעֶרֶב, וְתַנְיָא: הַצָּד יוֹנֵי שׁוֹבָךְ וְיוֹנֵי עֲלִיָּיה וְצִפֳּרִים שֶׁקִּנְּנוּ בִּטְפִיחִין בַּבִּירוֹת — חַיָּיב!
human_translation: But don’t doves of a dovecote and doves of a loft enter their coop in the evening, and it is taught One who traps doves of a dovecote, doves of a loft, or birds that are nesting in pitchers in buildings is liable
llm_translation: Behold, the doves of Shovakh and the doves of Aliyah, that come to their nests in the evening. And it was taught: If one traps the doves of Shovakh and the doves of Aliyah, and birds that were purchased with coins in the cities - he is liable!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַלָּלוּ בָּאִין לִכְלוּבָן לָעֶרֶב וּמְזוֹנוֹתָן עָלֶיךָ, וְהַלָּלוּ בָּאִין לִכְלוּבָן לָעֶרֶב וְאֵין מְזוֹנוֹתָן עָלֶיךָ.
human_translation: Rather, Rabba bar Rav Huna said Shmuel said: These, enter their coop in the evening, and their feed is your Whereas these, enter their coop in the evening, but feeding them is not your
llm_translation: Rather, said Rabbah bar Rav Huna said Shmuel: These people come to the innkeeper in the evening, and their sustenance is upon you, and these people come to the innkeeper in the evening, but their sustenance is not upon you.

hebrew_text: רַב מָרִי אָמַר: הָנֵי עֲבִידִי לְרַבּוֹיֵי, וְהָנֵי לָא עֲבִידִי לְרַבּוֹיֵי. כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי עֲבִידִי לְרַבּוֹיֵי! לִכְלוּבָן קָאָמְרִינַן דַּעֲבִידִי לְרַבּוֹיֵי.
human_translation: Rav Mari said These, are likely to flee while these, are not likely to flee All of them are also likely to flee We say they are likely to flee to their coop.
llm_translation: Rav Mari said: These people do work for their master, and these do not do work for their master. All of them are considered to be doing work for their master! We say this in the case of a dog that does work for its master.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מְצוּדוֹת חַיָּה וְעוֹף וְדָגִים שֶׁעֲשָׂאָן מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — לֹא יִטּוֹל מֵהֶן בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁנִּצּוֹדוּ מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב. וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּגוֹי אֶחָד שֶׁהֵבִיא דָּגִים לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְאָמַר מוּתָּרִין הֵן, אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין רְצוֹנִי לְקַבֵּל הֵימֶנּוּ.
human_translation: traps for animals, birds, and fish were set on the eve of a Festival, one may not take from them on the Festival, unless he knows that had been caught on the eve of the Festival. And an incident where a certain gentile brought fish to Rabban Gamliel, and said: are permitted, but I do not wish to accept from him,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Traps containing wild animals, birds, and fish that were set up before the onset of a festival - one may not take from them on the festival day, unless one knows that they were trapped before the festival day. There was an incident involving a certain gentile who brought fish to Rabban Gamliel, and he said, "They are permitted, but I do not wish to accept them from him."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַעֲשֶׂה לִסְתּוֹר?! חַסּוֹרֵי מְחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: סָפֵק מוּכָן — אָסוּר. וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מַתִּיר. וּמַעֲשֶׂה נָמֵי בְּגוֹי אֶחָד שֶׁהֵבִיא דָּגִים לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְאָמַר מוּתָּרִין הֵן, אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין רְצוֹנִי לְקַבֵּל הֵימֶנּוּ.
human_translation: an incident to contradict is incomplete; and it teaches the following: uncertain prepared is prohibited; and Rabban Gamliel permits And an incident also where a certain gentile brought fish to Rabban Gamliel, and said: are permitted, but I do not wish to accept from him.
llm_translation: Gemara: A story to hide?! Scarce of the scarce, and thus it was taught: If it is a doubtful prepared food - it is forbidden. And Rabban Gamliel permits. And there was a similar incident with a certain non-Jew who brought fish to Rabban Gamliel, and he said they are permitted, except that I do not wish to accept them from him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. וְאִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַהָא דְתַנְיָא: סָפֵק מוּכָן, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מַתִּיר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹסֵר. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. וְאִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַהָא דְתַנְיָא:
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is not in accordance with Rabban Gamliel. Some teach this with regard to this as it is taught: an uncertainty prepared Rabban Gamliel permits and Rabbi Yehoshua prohibits Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua. And teach it in reference to this as it is taught:
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is not like Rabban Gamliel. And there is one who teaches it in accordance with what is taught: In a case of doubt regarding a prepared item, Rabban Gamliel permits it while Rabbi Yehoshua prohibits it. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is like Rabbi Yehoshua. And there is one who teaches it in accordance with what is taught:

hebrew_text: שׁוֹחֲטִין מִן הַנְּגָרִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אֲבָל לֹא מִן הָרְשָׁתוֹת וּמִן הַמִּכְמוֹרוֹת. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: בָּא וּמְצָאָן מְקוּלְקָלִין מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁמֵּעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב נִצּוֹדוּ, וּמוּתָּרִין. בָּא וּמְצָאָן מְקוּלְקָלִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁבְּיוֹם טוֹב נִצּוֹדוּ, וַאֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: One may slaughter from pools on a Festival, but not from nets or traps, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: he came and found out of order on the eve of the Festival, it is known that were caught on the eve of the Festival, and they are permitted. he came and found them out of order on the Festival, it is known that were caught on the Festival, and they are prohibited.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: One may slaughter from the poultry on a festival, but not from the nets and traps. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: If one comes and finds them blemished from the eve of the festival - it is known that they were trapped from the eve of the festival, and they are permitted. If one comes and finds them blemished on the festival - it is known that they were trapped on the festival, and they are forbidden.

hebrew_text: הָא גּוּפַהּ קַשְׁיָא, אָמְרַתְּ: בָּא וּמְצָאָן מְקוּלְקָלִין מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁמֵּעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב נִצּוֹדוּ. טַעְמָא דְּבָא וּמְצָאָן מְקוּלְקָלִין, הָא סְפֵיקָא — אֲסוּרִין. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: בָּא וּמְצָאָן מְקוּלְקָלִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁבְּיוֹם טוֹב נִצּוֹדוּ. טַעְמָא דְּבָא וּמְצָאָן מְקוּלְקָלִין, הָא סְפֵיקָא — מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב נִצּוֹדוּ, וּמוּתָּרִין.
human_translation: itself difficult You said he came and found them out of order on the eve of the Festival, it is known that they were caught on the eve of the Festival. The reason that he came and found them out of order, but uncertainty, are prohibited. say the latter clause he came and found them out of order on the Festival, it is known that they were caught on the Festival. The reason that he came and found them out of order, but uncertainty, they were caught on the eve of the Festival and are permitted.
llm_translation: The body of the Mishnah is difficult. It says: If one comes and finds them mixed up from Erev Yom Tov - it is known that they were trapped from Erev Yom Tov. The reason that if one comes and finds them mixed up, it is a doubt - they are prohibited. Say the conclusion: If one comes and finds them mixed up on Yom Tov - it is known that they were trapped on Yom Tov. The reason that if one comes and finds them mixed up, it is a doubt - they were trapped from Erev Yom Tov, and they are permitted.

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: בָּא וּמְצָאָן מְקוּלְקָלִין מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁמֵּעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב נִצּוֹדוּ, וּמוּתָּרִין. הָא סְפֵיקָא — נַעֲשָׂה כְּמִי שֶׁנִּצּוֹדוּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וַאֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: This is what is saying: If he came and found them out of order on the eve of the Festival, it is known that they were caught on the eve of the Festival, and they are permitted. But uncertainty, it is considered as if they were caught on the Festival, and they are prohibited.
llm_translation: Thus he said: If one comes and finds them disheveled from Erev Yom Tov - it is known that they were trapped from Erev Yom Tov, and they are permitted. Here is the doubt - it is considered as if they were trapped on Yom Tov, and they are forbidden.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר מוּתָּרִין הֵם. מוּתָּרִין לְמַאי? רַב אָמַר: מוּתָּרִין לְקַבֵּל. וְלֵוִי אָמַר: מוּתָּרִין בַּאֲכִילָה.
human_translation: said are permitted. Permitted for what Rav said: They are permitted to be received Levi said: They are permitted to be eaten.
llm_translation: And he said, they are permitted. Permitted for what? Rav said: permitted for receiving. And Levi said: permitted for eating.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: לְעוֹלָם אַל יִמְנַע אָדָם עַצְמוֹ מִבֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ אֲפִילּוּ שָׁעָה אַחַת. דַּאֲנָא וְלֵוִי הֲוֵינַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי כִּי אַמְרַהּ לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא, בְּאוּרְתָּא אָמַר: מוּתָּרִין בַּאֲכִילָה, בְּצַפְרָא אָמַר: מוּתָּרִין לְקַבֵּל. אֲנָא דַּהֲוַאי בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא — הֲדַרִי בִּי. לֵוִי דְּלָא הֲוָה בִּי מִדְרְשָׁא — לָא הֲדַר בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav said: A person should never prevent himself from the study hall for even one moment, as Levi and I were before Rabbi when he stated this halakha . In the evening he said: They are permitted to be eaten, the morning he said: They are permitted to be received. I, who was in the study hall retracted Levi, who was not in the study hall did not retract
llm_translation: Rav said: Always a person should not withhold himself from the study hall, even for a single hour. For I and Levi were standing before Rabbi when she said to him, "In the city she said: they are permitted to eat, in the village she said: they are permitted to receive." I, who was in the study hall - I returned. Levi, who was not in the study hall - he did not return.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: גּוֹי שֶׁהֵבִיא דּוֹרוֹן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, אֲפִילּוּ דָּגִים הַמְפוּלָּמִין וּפֵירוֹת בְּנֵי יוֹמָן — מוּתָּרִין. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מוּתָּרִין לְקַבֵּל — שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מוּתָּרִין בַּאֲכִילָה, פֵּירוֹת בְּנֵי יוֹמָן מִי שָׁרוּ בַּאֲכִילָה?
human_translation: raises an objection a gentile brought a gift [ doron ] to a Jew even moist [ mefulamin ] fish or produce from that day, they are permitted. Granted, according to the one who said they are permitted to be received, it is well; However, according to the one who said they are permitted to be eaten, is produce from that day permitted to be eaten?
llm_translation: Challenger: A non-Jew who brought a gift to Israel, even fish that are still alive and fresh fruits of Javan - are permissible. Granted according to the one who said they are permissible to accept - it is fine. But according to the one who said they are permissible for consumption, who permitted the fresh fruits of Javan for consumption?

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ: פֵּירוֹת בְּנֵי יוֹמָן מִי שָׁרוּ בְּטִלְטוּל? אֶלָּא, בִּכְווֹרֵי דַּאֲדִימֵי וּפֵירֵי דִּכְבִישִׁי בְּיַרְקָא עָסְקִינַן, וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לְהוּ בְּנֵי יוֹמָן — שֶׁהֵן כְּעֵין בְּנֵי יוֹמָן.
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, is produce on that day permitted to be moved? Rather, we are dealing with fish whose are red and produce that is preserved in greens, Why, is it called of that day? Because it is similar to on that day.
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning: The fruits of the sons of Yoman, who permitted them to be moved? Rather, we are dealing with the early figs and the late figs in the marketplace, and why are they called the fruits of the sons of Yoman? Because they are similar to the fruits of the sons of Yoman.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הִלְכְתָא: גּוֹי שֶׁהֵבִיא דּוֹרוֹן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אִם יֵשׁ מֵאוֹתוֹ הַמִּין בִּמְחוּבָּר — אָסוּר. וְלָעֶרֶב נָמֵי אֲסוּרִין בִּכְדֵי שֶׁיֵּעָשׂוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said the halakha is a gentile who brought a gift to a Jew on a Festival, if there is of that species attached it is prohibited And in the evening as well, it is prohibited for time for its preparation,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, a halacha: A non-Jew who brings a gift to a Jew on a festival, if there are from that kind of people in the city - it is prohibited. And to the people of the evening, they are prohibited so that they will do it.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אֵין מֵאוֹתוֹ הַמִּין בִּמְחוּבָּר, תּוֹךְ הַתְּחוּם — מוּתָּר,
human_translation: And if none of that species is attached within the limit, it is permitted,
llm_translation: And if there is not from that species in the mixture, within the boundary - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: חוּץ לַתְּחוּם — אָסוּר. וְהַבָּא בִּשְׁבִיל יִשְׂרָאֵל זֶה — מוּתָּר לְיִשְׂרָאֵל אַחֵר.
human_translation: outside the limit, it is prohibited. And that came for one Jew is permitted to another Jew.
llm_translation: Outside the boundary — forbidden. And one who comes for the sake of a Jew, this — permitted for another Jew.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: הַסּוֹכֵר אַמַּת הַמַּיִם מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב, וּלְמָחָר הִשְׁכִּים וּמָצָא בָּהּ דָּגִים — מוּתָּרִין.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said Rav said: one dammed a water channel on the eve of a Festival, and the following day he arose and found fish in it, they are permitted.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: One who closes an amah of water on Erev Yom Tov, and the next day he wakes up and finds fish in it - they are permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, מִדִּבְרֵי רַבֵּינוּ נִלְמוֹד: חַיָּה שֶׁקִּנְּנָה בְּפַרְדֵּס — אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה זִמּוּן. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: נְפַל חַבְרִין, בְּרַבְרְבָתָא. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, מִדִּבְרֵי רַבֵּינוּ נִלְמוֹד: חַיָּה שֶׁקִּנְּנָה בְּפַרְדֵּס — אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה זִמּוּן. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: נְפַל בַּר חַבְרִין בְּרַבְרְבָתָא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: From statement of our teacher, we learn an undomesticated animal that nested in an orchard does not require designation Rav Naḥman said Our colleague, has fallen upon a great Some say Rabba bar Rav Huna said: From statement of our teacher, we learn an undomesticated animal that nested in an orchard does not require designation, Rav Naḥman said son of our colleague, has fallen upon a great
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said, from the words of our teacher we have learned: A wild animal that was acquired in a forest - does not require preparation. Rav Naḥman said: A colleague fell, in a large crowd. Some say: Rabba bar Rav Huna said, from the words of our teacher we have learned: A wild animal that was acquired in a forest - does not require preparation. Rav Naḥman said: A colleague's son fell in a large crowd.

hebrew_text: הָתָם לָא קָא עָבֵיד מַעֲשֶׂה, הָכָא קָא עָבֵיד מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: There, performed no action here, he performed an action
llm_translation: There, not doing an action, here, doing an action.

hebrew_text: וְלָא בָּעֲיָא זִמּוּן? וְהָתַנְיָא: חַיָּה שֶׁקִּנְּנָה בְּפַרְדֵּס — צְרִיכָה לְזַמֵּן, וְצִפּוֹר דְּרוֹר — צָרִיךְ לִקְשׁוֹר בִּכְנָפֶיהָ כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְחַלֵּף בְּאִמָּהּ. וְזוֹ עֵדוּת שֶׁהֵעִידוּ מִפִּי שְׁמַעְיָה וְאַבְטַלְיוֹן. תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: And does not require designation? Isn’t it taught An undomesticated animal that nested in an orchard requires designation. And a free bird, one is required to tie its wings so that it will not be mistaken for its mother, And this a testimony that was reported in the name of Shemaya and Avtalyon. a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: And not require preparation? And it was taught: An animal that was purchased in a marketplace - requires preparation, and a free bird - needs to be tied by its wings so it does not fly away. And this is the testimony that they testified from the mouth of Shemaiah and Avtalyon. Teyuvta.

hebrew_text: וּמִי בָּעֲיָא זִמּוּן? וְהָתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: מוֹדִים בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל שֶׁהִזְמִינָן בְּתוֹךְ הַקֵּן וּמָצָא לִפְנֵי הַקֵּן — שֶׁאֲסוּרִין. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּיוֹנֵי שׁוֹבָךְ וְיוֹנֵי עֲלִיָּה, וְצִפֳּרִים שֶׁקִּנְּנוּ בִּטְפִיחִין וּבְבִירָה. אֲבָל אֲווֹזִים וְתַרְנְגוֹלִים וְיוֹנֵי הַרְדָּסִיָּאוֹת וְחַיָּה שֶׁקִּנְּנָה בְּפַרְדֵּס — מוּתָּרִין, וְאֵין צְרִיכִין זִמּוּן. וְצִפּוֹר דְּרוֹר צְרִיכָה לְקַשֵּׁר בִּכְנָפֶיהָ, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְחַלֵּף בְּאִמָּהּ.
human_translation: Does require designation? But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel concede that one had designated inside the nest, and he found in front of the nest, that are prohibited, In what is this statement said? with regard to doves of a dovecote, doves of a loft, and birds nesting in pitchers or in a building. However, geese, chicken, domestic doves, and an undomesticated animal that nested in an orchard are permitted and they do not require designation a free bird, one is required to tie its wings so that it is not mistaken for its mother.
llm_translation: Who requires preparation? And it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel agree that if one prepared within the coop and found the egg before the coop - it is prohibited. In what case are these words said? - Regarding dove-cotes and pigeon-cotes, and birds that were purchased with a stipulation and in a pit. But geese, chickens, turtle doves, and a wild animal that was purchased in a park - are permitted, and do not require preparation. And a turtledove requires to have its wings tied, so that it does not fly away.

hebrew_text: וְהַמְקוּשָּׁרִים וְהַמְנוּעֲנָעִין, בְּבוֹרוֹת וּבְבָתִּים וּבְשִׁיחִין וּבִמְעָרוֹת — מוּתָּרִין, וּבְאִילָנוֹת — אֲסוּרִין, שֶׁמָּא יַעֲלֶה וְיִתְלוֹשׁ. וְהַמְקוּשָּׁרִין וְהַמְנוּעֲנָעִין — בְּכׇל מָקוֹם אֲסוּרִין, מִשּׁוּם גָּזֵל.
human_translation: And those whose were tied and those that were shaken in cisterns, in houses, in trenches, or in caves, they are permitted in trees, they are prohibited, lest one climb up and detach And those whose were tied and those that were shaken are prohibited in all places, due to stealing.
llm_translation: The tied and the locked, in pits and in houses and in bushes and in caves — are permitted, and in trees — they are forbidden, lest they climb and be detached. The tied and the locked — are forbidden everywhere, due to theft.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בַּהּ, הָא בְּאִמַּהּ. אִמַּהּ בְּזִמּוּן סַגִּי לַהּ? צֵידָה מְעַלְּיוּתָא בָּעֲיָא!
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: not difficult. This to it, that to its mother, designation sufficient for its mother? it require complete capture,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, it is not difficult: this one, and this one in its time. Is it necessary for it in its time? The verse seeks a hunting trap!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּדִידַהּ. הָא בְּגִנָּה הַסְּמוּכָה לָעִיר, הָא בְּגִנָּה שֶׁאֵינָהּ סְמוּכָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said both this and that to it, This to a garden near the city, That to a garden that is not nearby.
llm_translation: Rather, said Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: Each one in its own category. This one in a garden adjacent to the city, and that one in a garden that is not adjacent.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בְּהֵמָה מְסוּכֶּנֶת — לֹא יִשְׁחוֹט, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן יֵשׁ שְׁהוּת בַּיּוֹם לֶאֱכוֹל מִמֶּנָּה כְּזַיִת צָלִי. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ כְּזַיִת חַי מִבֵּית טְבִיחָתָהּ.
human_translation: an animal in danger he may not slaughter unless there is time in the day to eat an olive-bulk of roasted meat from Rabbi Akiva says: even an olive-bulk of raw from the place where is slaughtered,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: An animal designated for idolatrous worship - one may not slaughter it, unless there is a delay during the day to eat from it like a roasted olive's worth. Rabbi Akiva says: Even a live olive's worth from its slaughterhouse.

hebrew_text: שְׁחָטָהּ בַּשָּׂדֶה — לֹא יְבִיאֶנָּה בְּמוֹט וּבְמוֹטָה, אֲבָל מֵבִיא בְּיָדוֹ אֵבָרִים אֵבָרִים.
human_translation: one slaughtered in the field, he may not bring it on a pole or on a set of poles Rather, and bring by hand, limb by limb.
llm_translation: Shechatah basadeh - lo yevienah bemot uvmotah, aval meviah beyado evarim evarim.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא: הֶפְשֵׁט וְנִתּוּחַ בְּעוֹלָה, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְקַצָּבִים. מִכָּאן לִמְּדָה תּוֹרָה דֶּרֶךְ אֶרֶץ: שֶׁלֹּא יֹאכַל אָדָם בָּשָׂר קוֹדֶם הֶפְשֵׁט וְנִתּוּחַ.
human_translation: Rami bar Abba said: flaying and cutting to the burnt-offering, and the same is true for butchers. From here the Torah taught etiquette, that a person should not eat meat before flaying and cutting
llm_translation: Gemara said: Ramei bar Abba said: He spread out and dissected the burnt offering, and it is the same for the bird offerings. From here the Torah teaches proper behavior: that a person should not eat meat before spreading out and dissecting it.

hebrew_text: (לְאַפּוֹקֵי) מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? אִילֵּימָא לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: בְּהֵמָה בְּחַיֶּיהָ — בְּחֶזְקַת אִיסּוּר עוֹמֶדֶת, עַד שֶׁיִּוָּדַע לָךְ בַּמֶּה נִשְׁחֲטָה.
human_translation: What is teaching us? If we say to exclude of Rav Huna, as Rav Huna said: An animal, while alive, retains its presumptive status of prohibition until it becomes known to you how it was slaughtered.
llm_translation: To go out, what does it teach us? If you say, to go out from the ruling of Rav Huna, for Rav Huna said: An animal in its life state - it stands in a presumption of prohibition until it is known to you with what it was slaughtered.

hebrew_text: נִשְׁחֲטָה — בְּחֶזְקַת הֶיתֵּר עוֹמֶדֶת, עַד שֶׁיִּוָּדַע לָךְ בַּמֶּה נִטְרְפָה.
human_translation: slaughtered it retains its presumptive status of being permitted until it becomes known to you how it became a tereifa ,
llm_translation: It was slaughtered - in the presumption of permissibility it stands, until it is known to you in what it was invalidated.

hebrew_text: וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן מַתְנִיתִין כִּדְרַב הוּנָא! דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ כְּזַיִת חַי מִבֵּית טְבִיחָתָהּ. מַאי לָאו, מִבֵּית טְבִיחָתָהּ מַמָּשׁ?
human_translation: didn’t we learn the mishna in accordance with Rav Huna? As we learned Rabbi Akiva says: even an olive-bulk of raw from the place where is slaughtered. What, is it not from the actual place where is slaughtered,
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah according to Rav Huna! For it was taught: Rabbi Akiva says, even if the impurity is like a live olive from its slaughterhouse. What is the reason? Is it not truly from its slaughterhouse?

hebrew_text: לָא: מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁטּוֹבַחַת אֲכִילָתָהּ.
human_translation: No, From the place where slaughters its food,
llm_translation: Not from the place where its food is good.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: מְקוֹם טְבִיחָתָהּ מַמָּשׁ. אֶלָּא, רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya teach: From the actual place where is slaughtered? Rather, Rami bar Abba
llm_translation: And here it was taught by Rabbi Chiya: The place of its slaughter is literal. Rather, Ramei bar Abba raises an objection.

hebrew_text: אוֹרַח אַרְעָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: teaches us etiquette,
llm_translation: The path of the land is informing us.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: לֹא יֹאכַל אָדָם שׁוּם וּבָצָל מֵרֹאשׁוֹ, אֶלָּא מֵעָלָיו. וְאִם אָכַל — הֲרֵי זֶה רְעַבְתָּן. כַּיּוֹצֵא בוֹ: לֹא יִשְׁתֶּה אָדָם כּוֹסוֹ בְּבַת אַחַת, וְאִם שָׁתָה — הֲרֵי זֶה גַּרְגְּרָן. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַשּׁוֹתֶה כּוֹסוֹ בְּבַת אַחַת — הֲרֵי זֶה גַּרְגְּרָן, שְׁנַיִם — דֶּרֶךְ אֶרֶץ, שְׁלֹשָׁה — מִגַּסֵּי הָרוּחַ.
human_translation: as it is taught A person not eat garlic or onions its head, but from its leaves. And if he did eat he a glutton. Similarly, a person not drink his cup at once, and if he did drink he a drinker. The Sages taught One who drinks his cup at once is a drinker; in two etiquette; three of haughty spirit,
llm_translation: As it was taught: A person should not eat garlic or onion from the beginning, but rather after it. And if he ate - behold, this is a sign of hunger. For example: A person should not drink his cup in one gulp, and if he did - behold, this is a sign of greediness. The Sages taught: One who drinks his cup in one gulp - this is a sign of greediness, two - it is a matter of etiquette, three - it is from those who are arrogant.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא: חֲצוּבָא — מְקַטַּע רַגְלֵיהוֹן דְּרַשִּׁיעַיָּא.
human_translation: Rami bar Abba said: The sea squill, cut off the feet of the wicked
llm_translation: And said Ramei bar Abba: Chatzuba - cuts off their legs of the demons.

hebrew_text: נְטִיעָה — מְקַטַּע רַגְלֵיהוֹן דְּקַצָּבַיָּא וּדְבוֹעֲלֵי נִדּוֹת.
human_translation: young trees will cut off the feet of butchers and those who have relations with menstruating women.
llm_translation: Planting - cutting off their feet of the stalks and planting of the shoots.

hebrew_text: תּוֹרְמוֹסָא — מְקַטַּע רַגְלֵיהוֹן דְּשָׂנְאֵיהוֹן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיּוֹסִיפוּ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לַעֲשׂוֹת הָרַע בְּעֵינֵי ה׳ וַיַּעַבְדוּ אֶת הַבְּעָלִים וְאֶת הָעַשְׁתָּרוֹת וְאֶת אֱלֹהֵי אֲרָם וְאֶת אֱלֹהֵי צִידוֹן וְאֵת אֱלֹהֵי מוֹאָב וְאֵת אֱלֹהֵי בְנֵי עַמּוֹן וְאֵת אֱלֹהֵי פְלִשְׁתִּים וַיַּעַזְבוּ אֶת ה׳ וְלֹא עֲבָדוּהוּ״.
human_translation: The lupine [ turmus ], will cut off the feet of the enemies of the Jewish people, As it is stated: “And the children of Israel continued to do evil in the eyes of the Lord, and served the Baalim and the Ashtaroth, and the gods of Aram and the gods of Zidon and the gods of Moab and the gods of the children of Ammon and the gods of the Philistines, and they forsook the Lord and did not serve Him”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Tormosa - mekatea ragleihon deSan'eihon shel Yisrael. Shene'emar: "Vayosifu benei Yisrael la'asot hara be'einei Hashem vaya'avdu et habaalim ve'et ha'ashtarot ve'et elohei Aram ve'et elohei Tzidon ve'et elohei Moav ve'et elohei Bnei Ammon ve'et elohei Pelishtim vayaazvu et Hashem velo avaduhu." English translation: Tormosa - who cut off the legs of the Jews. As it is stated: "The children of Israel continued to do evil in the sight of the Lord, and they served the Baals, the Ashtaroth, the gods of Aram, the gods of Sidon, the gods of Moab, the gods of the Ammonites, and the gods of the Philistines; and they forsook the Lord and did not serve Him."

hebrew_text: מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וַיַּעַזְבוּ אֶת ה׳״, אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁלֹּא עֲבָדוּהוּ?! וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וְלֹא עֲבָדוּהוּ״ — אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: אֲפִילּוּ כַּתּוֹרְמוֹס הַזֶּה שֶׁשּׁוֹלְקִין אוֹתוֹ שֶׁבַע פְּעָמִים וְאוֹכְלִין אוֹתוֹ בְּקִנּוּחַ סְעוּדָה לֹא עֲשָׂאוּנִי בָּנַי.
human_translation: By inference from which is stated: “And they forsook the Lord,” do I not know that they did not serve Him? Rather, what does the verse state “and did not serve Him”? Rabbi Elazar said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: My children did not treat Me even like this lupine, which, cooked seven times and one eats it as a dessert a meal.
llm_translation: From what is implied by the verse "And they forsook the Lord," I do not know that they did not serve Him?! And what is the Talmud coming to say by stating "and did not serve Him"? — Rabbi Elazar said, the Holy One, blessed be He, said: Even this tax collector who is drenched seven times and they feed him a sumptuous meal, my children have not done to me.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר: מִפְּנֵי מָה נִתְּנָה תּוֹרָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן עַזִּין. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״מִימִינוֹ אֵשׁ דָּת לָמוֹ״. אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רְאוּיִין הַלָּלוּ שֶׁתִּנָּתֵן לָהֶם דָּת אֵשׁ. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דָּתֵיהֶם שֶׁל אֵלּוּ — אֵשׁ. שֶׁאִלְמָלֵא (לֹא) נִתְּנָה תּוֹרָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — אֵין כׇּל אוּמָּה וְלָשׁוֹן יְכוֹלִין לַעֲמוֹד בִּפְנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: It is taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: For what reason was the Torah given to the Jewish people? because they are impudent, of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught “From His right hand went a fiery law for them” The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: these fit to be given a fiery law, Some say The ways of these are fire, as, were it not for the Torah was given to the Jewish people, no nation or tongue could withstand them.
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: "For what reason was the Torah given to the Israelites? Because they are bold." It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "From His right hand, a fiery law to them." The Holy One, blessed be He, said: "These are worthy that a fiery law should be given to them." Some say: Their law is fire. If the Torah had not been given to the Israelites, no nation or tongue could withstand them.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, שְׁלֹשָׁה עַזִּין הֵן: יִשְׂרָאֵל בָּאוּמּוֹת, כֶּלֶב בַּחַיּוֹת, תַּרְנְגוֹל בָּעוֹפוֹת. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף עֵז בִּבְהֵמָה דַּקָּה. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף צָלָף בָּאִילָנוֹת.
human_translation: And this is what Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: There are three impudent ones: The Jewish people among the nations; dog among animals; rooster among birds. And some say: Also goat among small cattle. And some say: Also caper bush among trees.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And this is what Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, there are three bold creatures: Israel among the nations, a dog among the animals, a rooster among the birds. And some say: Also a goat among the small cattle. And some say: Also a weasel among the trees.

hebrew_text: שְׁחָטָהּ בַּשָּׂדֶה — לֹא יְבִיאֶנָּה בַּמּוֹט. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין הַסּוֹמֵא יוֹצֵא בְּמַקְלוֹ, וְלֹא הָרוֹעֶה בְּתַרְמִילוֹ. וְאֵין יוֹצְאִין בְּכִסֵּא — אֶחָד הָאִישׁ וְאֶחָד הָאִשָּׁה.
human_translation: one slaughtered in the field, he may not bring it on a pole, The Sages taught blind person may not go out with his cane, nor a shepherd with his satchel. And one may not go out on a chair neither a man nor a woman.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: If one slaughters it in the field — he may not bring it in a basket. The Rabbis taught: The blind person does not go out with his stick, nor the shepherd with his pouch. And they do not go out on a chair — one man and one woman.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָא שָׁלַח רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי: זָקֵן אֶחָד הָיָה בִּשְׁכוּנָתֵינוּ וְהָיָה יוֹצֵא בִּגְלוּדְקֵי שֶׁלּוֹ, וּבָאוּ וְשָׁאֲלוּ אֶת רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, וְאָמַר: אִם רַבִּים צְרִיכִין לוֹ — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi send There was an old man in our neighborhood who would go out in his litter [ gelodki ], and they came and asked Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, And said If many need it is permitted
llm_translation: I?! But didn't Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi send: "An elder was in our neighborhood and would go out with his cloak, and they came and asked Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, and he said: If many need it - it is permitted."

hebrew_text: וְסָמְכוּ רַבּוֹתֵינוּ עַל דִּבְרֵי אַחַי שָׁקְיָא, דְּאָמַר: אֲנָא אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא מֵהִינֵי לְשִׁילֵי וּמִשִּׁילֵי לְהִינֵי. וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אֲנָא אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ לְמָר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשִּׁמְשָׁא לְטוּלָּא וּמִטּוּלָּא לְשִׁמְשָׁא! הָתָם כִּדְאָמַר טַעְמָא: אִם הָיוּ רַבִּים צְרִיכִין לוֹ — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: our Sages relied on the statement of Aḥi Shakkaya, who said: I brought Rav Huna from Hinei to Shilei and from Shilei to Hinei And Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: I brought Mar Shmuel from the sun into the shade and from the shade into the sun. as there, it is in accordance with the reason that stated: If many need him, it is permitted.
llm_translation: Our Rabbis relied on the words of Achai of Shakyai, who said: "I have transferred it from Shili to Hini for Rav Huna, and from Hini to Shili." And Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "I have transferred it from Mar Shmuel from Shimsa to Tul'a, and from Tul'a to Shimsa!" There, as the reason was stated: "If many need it, it is permitted."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְחָמָא בַּר אַדָּא שְׁלִיחַ צִיּוֹן: כִּי סָלְקַתְּ לְהָתָם, אַקֵּיף וְזִיל אַסּוּלָּמָא דְצוֹר, וְזִיל לְגַבֵּי דְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי וּבְעִי מִינֵּיהּ: כִּסֵּא, מָה אַתּוּן בֵּיהּ?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to Ḥama bar Adda, emissary of Zion, When you go up there, take a roundabout and go to the Ladder of Tyre, and go to Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi, and raise dilemma before him: What do you say with regard to a chair
