llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman to Hama son of Adda, emissary of Tzion: "When you go there, stand and go to the city of Tzor, and go to Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi and ask him: 'What about the chair, what is your opinion?'"

hebrew_text: אַדַּאֲזַל לְהָתָם, נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי. כִּי סְלֵיק, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַבִּי זְרִיקָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּסֵּא מָה אַתּוּן בֵּיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְכַתֵּף. מַאי וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְכַתֵּף? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: בַּאֲלוּנְקִי.
human_translation: By the time he arrived there, Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi had passed away. when he went up he found Rabbi Zerika said to him: What do you say with regard to a chair He said to him: Rabbi Ami said as follows: provided that he is not carried on the shoulders, What is Provided that he is not carried on the shoulders? Rav Yosef, son of Rabba, said: on poles [ alunkei ]
llm_translation: He went there, the soul of Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi. When he ascended, he found Rabbi Zerika, he said to him: "What seat are you sitting on?" He said to him, thus said Rabbi Ammi: "And without leaning." What is 'and without leaning'? Rav Yosef, son of Rava, said: "On the Alunqi."

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָא רַב נַחְמָן שְׁרָא לַהּ לְיַלְתָּא לְמִיפַּק אַאֲלוּנְקִי! שָׁאנֵי יַלְתָּא דִּבְעִיתָא.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rav Naḥman permit Yalta to go out on poles Yalta is different, as she was afraid
llm_translation: I?! But didn't Rav Nachman send her to the inn to bring him some almonds? The innkeeper is different.

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר וּמָר זוּטְרָא מְכַתְּפִי לְהוּ בְּשַׁבְּתָא דְרִגְלָא מִשּׁוּם בִּיעֲתוּתָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ מִשּׁוּם דּוּחְקָא דְצִבּוּרָא.
human_translation: Ameimar and Mar Zutra would be carried on the shoulders on Shabbat of the Festival. due to fear And some say due to the pushing of the crowd,
llm_translation: Ammemar and Mar Zutra would shoulder a burden for him on Shabbat eve due to the urgency of the festival, and some say it was due to the pressing need of the community.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בְּכוֹר שֶׁנָּפַל לַבּוֹר, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: יֵרֵד מוּמְחֶה וְיִרְאֶה,
human_translation: a firstborn fell into a cistern Rabbi Yehuda says: An expert goes down and examines
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If a firstborn animal falls into a pit, Rabbi Yehuda says: The owner should lower a blemished animal and see.

hebrew_text: אִם יֵשׁ בּוֹ מוּם — יַעֲלֶה וְיִשְׁחוֹט, וְאִם לָאו — לֹא יִשְׁחוֹט. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין מוּמוֹ נִיכָּר מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם, אֵין זֶה מִן הַמּוּכָן —
human_translation: If it has blemish, he may raise it and slaughter but if not he may not slaughter Rabbi Shimon says: any whose blemish is not perceptible while it is still day, is not among prepared
llm_translation: If it has a blemish - it shall ascend and be slaughtered, and if not - it shall not be slaughtered. Rabbi Shimon says: Anything whose blemish is not recognizable from the day before, this is not considered prepared -

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי קָא מִפַּלְגִי? אִי נֵימָא בְּרוֹאִין מוּמִין קָמִפַּלְגִי, דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: רוֹאִין מוּמִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: אֵין רוֹאִין מוּמִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְלִפַּלְגוּ בְּרוֹאִין מוּמִין דְּעָלְמָא!
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? If we say they disagree one may examine blemishes on a Festival, that Rabbi Yehuda holds one may examine blemishes on a Festival, and Rabbi Shimon holds one may not examine blemishes on a Festival, let them disagree to examining blemishes in general
llm_translation: Gemara: With what do they disagree? If you say they disagree regarding inspecting blemishes, for Rabbi Yehuda holds: One may inspect blemishes on a festival, and Rabbi Shimon holds: One may not inspect blemishes on a festival, and they disagree regarding inspecting blemishes in general!

hebrew_text: בְּכוֹר שֶׁנָּפַל לַבּוֹר אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: מִשּׁוּם צַעַר בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים לַעֲרֵים וְלַסְּקֵיהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: It was necessary a firstborn that fell into a cistern, it could enter your mind to say because of the suffering of living creatures, one should employ an artifice and raise in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua, teaches us
llm_translation: Firstborn that fell into the pit requires it, it is evident in your mind, I say: because of the pain of living creatures to cities and their markets like Rabbi Yehoshua - it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, ״לֹא יִשְׁחוֹט״? ״לֹא יַעֲלֶה וְיִשְׁחוֹט״ מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! לָא צְרִיכָא — דַּעֲבַר וְאַסְּקֵיהּ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: לִשְׁחֲטֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If so, He may not slaughter should have He may not raise and slaughter No, is necessary where he transgressed raised it, it could enter your mind to say that he may slaughter it. teaches us
llm_translation: So, is it that "he shall not slaughter"? "He shall not go up and slaughter" he requires! It is not necessary — for he passed by and ascended, the conclusion of your mind I say: to slaughter it, this is what we infer.

hebrew_text: לִשְׁחֲטֵיהּ?! הָא תָּם הוּא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דִּנְפַל בֵּיהּ מוּמָא. וְהָא מוּקְצֶה הוּא!
human_translation: he may slaughter it? Isn’t unblemished? is necessary only where it developed a blemish But Doesn’t muktze ,
llm_translation: "To slaughter it?! It is unblemished! It is not necessary, for a blemish has occurred in it. And this is a case of a blemish!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: דִּנְפַל בֵּיהּ מוּם עוֹבֵר מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב, וְהַשְׁתָּא הֲוָה לֵיהּ מוּם קָבוּעַ. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: דְּדַעְתֵּיהּ עִלָּוֵיהּ, וְנִשְׁחֲטֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rather, where developed a temporary blemish, on the eve of the Festival, and now, it has a permanent blemish. Lest you say his mind was on and he should slaughter it, teaches us
llm_translation: Rather: if it fell in it a blemish passes from the evening of the day good, and now was in it a permanent blemish. What you might say: that his knowledge was upon it, and he was slaughtered, it is heard to us.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּכוֹר תָּם שֶׁנָּפַל לַבּוֹר, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא אוֹמֵר: יֵרֵד מוּמְחֶה וְיִרְאֶה, אִם יֵשׁ בּוֹ מוּם — יַעֲלֶה וְיִשְׁחוֹט, וְאִם לָאו — לֹא יִשְׁחוֹט. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא: הֲרֵי אָמְרוּ אֵין רוֹאִין מוּמִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב. כֵּיצַד? נוֹלַד בּוֹ מוּם מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב, אֵין מְבַקְּרִין אוֹתוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב. נוֹלַד בּוֹ מוּם
human_translation: The Sages taught an unblemished firstborn that fell into a cistern Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi says: An expert goes down and examines If it has a blemish he raise and slaughter but if not, he not slaughter Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya said to him: already said one not examine blemishes on a Festival. How so? a blemish came into being on the eve of a Festival, one not examine it on the Festival blemish came into being
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A blemished firstborn animal that fell into a pit, Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi says: One should inspect it, if it has a blemish - it should be brought up and slaughtered, and if not - it should not be slaughtered. Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya said to him: But didn't they say that blemishes are not inspected on a festival? How so? If a blemish was born in it from the evening of the festival, it is not inspected on the festival. If a blemish was born in it...

hebrew_text: בְּיוֹם טוֹב, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֵין זֶה מִן הַמּוּכָן. וְשָׁוִין שֶׁאִם נוֹלַד הוּא וּמוּמוֹ עִמּוֹ — שֶׁזֶּה מִן הַמּוּכָן.
human_translation: on Festival Rabbi Shimon says: It is not among the prepared And agree that if was born with its blemish, it is among the prepared
llm_translation: On a festival, Rabbi Shimon says: This is not prepared. And they are equal, that if he was born and his blemish with him - this is prepared.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: נוֹלַד הוּא וּמוּמוֹ עִמּוֹ — מְבַקְּרִין אוֹתוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב לְכַתְּחִלָּה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן, אַבָּא תָּנֵי: אִם עָבַר וּבִקְּרוֹ — מְבוּקָּר, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ מְבַקְּרִין אוֹתוֹ לְכַתְּחִלָּה!
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna taught was born with its blemish, examine it on a Festival ab initio , Rav Naḥman said to him: Father would teach if he transgressed and examined it, examined and you say one examine it ab initio ?
llm_translation: Rabah bar Rav Huna expounded: If a person and his blemish were born together - they inspect him on a festival initially. Rav Nachman said to him, Abba taught: If he transgressed and they inspected him - he is inspected, and you said they inspect him initially!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִדְּקָתָנֵי תְּלָתָא בָּבֵי: נוֹלַד בּוֹ מוּם מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — אֵין מְבַקְּרִין אוֹתוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב. לְכַתְּחִלָּה הוּא דְּלָא, הָא דִּיעֲבַד — שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Abaye said: It stands to reason in accordance with of Rabba bar Rav Huna from that is taught three parts, developed a blemish on the eve of a Festival one not examine it on Festival it is ab initio that one not but after the fact, it seems well,
llm_translation: Abaye said: The opinion of Rabba bar Rav Huna is logical, as it is taught in the Mishnah: If a blemish is born in an animal on Erev Yom Tov - it is not examined on Yom Tov. Ideally, it should not have occurred, but if it did happen - it is acceptable.

hebrew_text: נוֹלַד בּוֹ מוּם בְּיוֹם טוֹב, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֵין זֶה מִן הַמּוּכָן — דַּאֲפִילּוּ דִּיעֲבַד נָמֵי לָא. וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי: וְשָׁוִין שֶׁאִם נוֹלַד וּמוּמוֹ עִמּוֹ, שֶׁזֶּה מִן הַמּוּכָן — דַּאֲפִילּוּ לְכַתְּחִלָּה נָמֵי.
human_translation: it developed a blemish on Festival Rabbi Shimon says: It is not among prepared even after the fact, no, And then it teaches: And agree that if was born with its blemish, it is among prepared even ab initio as well,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If a blemish is born in him on a festival day, Rabbi Shimon says: This is not considered prepared - for even if it had occurred before, it would not have been. And further it teaches: And it is equal if it is born and its blemish with it, this is considered prepared - for even at the outset it would not have been.

hebrew_text: וְהָא כִּי אֲתָא רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא, אֲתָא וְאַיְיתִי מַתְנִיתָא בִּידֵיהּ: בֵּין שֶׁנּוֹלַד בּוֹ מוּם מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב, וּבֵין שֶׁנּוֹלַד בּוֹ מוּם בְּיוֹם טוֹב, חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין זֶה מִן הַמּוּכָן.
human_translation: But isn’t when Rav Oshaya came he came and brought the baraita in his hand: Whether developed a blemish on the eve of the Festival or it developed a blemish on Festival the Rabbis say: It is not among prepared
llm_translation: And this, when Rav Oshaya came, he came and brought a baraita in his hand: Whether a blemish was born in it from the eve of a festival, or whether a blemish was born in it on the festival day, the sages say: This is not considered a prepared defect.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא הָךְ! הָהִיא — אַדָּא בַּר אוּכָּמֵי הִיא, דִּמְשַׁבֵּשׁ וְתָנֵי.
human_translation: But that difficult. that was Adda bar Ukhmei, who confuse and teach
llm_translation: But rather, this is difficult! That one - Adah bar Ukamei it is, who contradicts and teaches.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְיקָא. דְּקָתָנֵי, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין מוּמוֹ נִיכָּר מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — אֵין זֶה מִן הַמּוּכָן. מַאי אֵין מוּמוֹ נִיכָּר? אִילֵּימָא שֶׁאֵין מוּמוֹ נִיכָּר כְּלָל — פְּשִׁיטָא, צְרִיכָא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: The mishna is also precise As teaches Rabbi Shimon says: any whose blemish is not perceptible on the eve of the Festival is not among prepared What is Whose blemish is not perceptible? If we say that its blemish is not perceptible at all, obvious. Need it be said
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said: The Mishnah is precise. As it teaches, Rabbi Shimon says: Anything whose blemish is not recognizable from the eve of a festival - this is not considered prepared. What does it mean that his blemish is not recognizable? If you say that his blemish is not recognizable at all - that is obvious, is there a need to say this?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דְּלָא אִתְחֲזִי לְחָכָם מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב אִם מוּם קָבוּעַ אִם מוּם עוֹבֵר. קָתָנֵי מִיהַת אֵין זֶה מִן הַמּוּכָן, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, it was not shown to a Sage on the eve of the Festival whether it is a permanent blemish or a temporary blemish. In any event, teaches: It is not among prepared learn from this
llm_translation: Rather, it is not fitting for a sage to be seen from the eve of a festival, whether with a permanent blemish or a passing blemish. The Mishnah teaches from here: this is not from the prepared list, infer from it.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי מִינֵּיהּ הִלֵּל מֵרָבָא: יֵשׁ מוּקְצֶה לַחֲצִי שַׁבָּת אוֹ אֵין מוּקְצֶה לַחֲצִי שַׁבָּת? הֵיכִי דָמֵי: אִי דְּאִחֲזִי בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת — אִחֲזִי. אִי דְּלָא אִחֲזִי — לָא אִחֲזִי?
human_translation: Hillel raised a dilemma before Rava: Is there muktze for half of Shabbat or is there no muktze for half of Shabbat? What are the circumstances If was fit at twilight be fit if it was not fit it is not fit
llm_translation: The question of Hillel from Rava: Is there muktzeh for half of Shabbat or is there no muktzeh for half of Shabbat? What is the case? If it is visible between the suns - it is visible. If it is not visible - it is not visible.

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא: דְּאִחֲזִי, וַהֲדַר אִדְּחִי, וַהֲדַר אִחֲזִי. מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יֵשׁ מוּקְצֶה.
human_translation: No, necessary where had been fit and then became disqualified and then became fit. What said to There is muktze
llm_translation: Not necessary: He sees, then he changes his mind, then he sees again. What? He said to him: There is a limit.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: וְשָׁוִין שֶׁאִם נוֹלַד וּמוּמוֹ עִמּוֹ — שֶׁזֶּה מִן הַמּוּכָן. וְאַמַּאי? נֵימָא: הַאי בְּכוֹר מֵעִיקָּרָא הֲוָה חֲזֵי אַגַּב אִמֵּיהּ, אִתְיְלִיד לֵיהּ — אִדְּחִי לֵיהּ, אַחְזְיֵיהּ לְחָכָם — אִשְׁתְּרִי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: raised an objection And agree that if was born with its blemish, it is among prepared But why Let us say This firstborn was fit at the outset on account of its mother, was born, it became disqualified, he showed it to a Sage, it became permitted to him.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to it: And they are equal, that if it is born and its blemish is with it - this is considered prepared. And why? Say: This firstborn from the outset was seen against its mother, if it is born for him - it is rejected for him, if it is seen by a wise person - it is permitted for him!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב סָפְרָא: כְּגוֹן דְּיָתְבִי דַּיָּינֵי הָתָם.
human_translation: Abaye said, and some say Rav Safra where judges were sitting there,
llm_translation: Abbaye said, and it was stated by Rav Safra: For example, when there is a gathering of wine merchants there.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין מוּקְצֶה לַחֲצִי שַׁבָּת. לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: וְשָׁוִין שֶׁאִם נוֹלַד וּמוּמוֹ עִמּוֹ — שֶׁזֶּה מִן הַמּוּכָן. וְהָא בְּכוֹר מֵעִיקָּרָא הֲוָה חֲזִי אַגַּב אִמֵּיהּ, אִתְיְלִיד לֵיהּ — אִדְּחִי לֵיהּ, אַחְזְיֵיהּ לְחָכָם — אִשְׁתְּרִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Some say said to There is no muktze for half of Shabbat, Let us say that supports And agree that if was born with its blemish, it is among prepared But wasn’t this firstborn fit at the outset on account of its mother; it was born it became disqualified; he showed it to a Sage, it became permitted to him?
llm_translation: There are those who say, he said to him: there is no muktzeh for half of Shabbat. Let us say it supports him: and equal that if it is born and its blemish is with it — this is considered prepared. And the firstborn from the outset was seen against his mother, if it is born to him — it is pushed away, if it is seen by a wise person — it is permitted to him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב סָפְרָא: כְּגוֹן דְּיָתְבִי דַּיָּינֵי הָתָם.
human_translation: Abaye said, and some say Rav Safra where judges were sitting there
llm_translation: Abbaye said, and it was stated by Rav Safra: "For example, when a judge sits there."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָיָה אוֹכֵל בַּעֲנָבִים, וְהוֹתִיר וְהֶעֱלָן לַגָּג לַעֲשׂוֹת מֵהֶן צִמּוּקִין, בִּתְאֵנִים, וְהוֹתִיר וְהֶעֱלָן לַגָּג לַעֲשׂוֹת מֵהֶן גְּרוֹגְרוֹת — לֹא יֹאכַל מֵהֶן עַד שֶׁיַּזְמִין מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם. וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בַּאֲפַרְסְקִין וּבַחֲבוּשִׁין וּבִשְׁאָר כׇּל מִינֵי פֵירוֹת.
human_translation: Come hear was eating grapes and left and took them up to the roof to make them raisins, figs and left and took them up to the roof to make them dried figs, he not eat from them unless he designates them while it is still day. And you find the same with regard to peaches, and quinces, and all other types of fruit
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one was eating grapes and left over some and brought them up to the roof to make raisins from them, or figs, and left over some and brought them up to the roof to make dried figs - he may not eat from them until he prepares them from the day before. Similarly, you will find with peaches, apricots, and all other types of fruits.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דַּחֲזוּ — לְמָה לֵיהּ הַזְמָנָה? אִי דְּלָא חֲזוּ — כִּי אַזְמֵין לְהוּ מַאי הָוֵי!
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If they are fit why does he require designation? if they are not fit if he designates them what of it?
llm_translation: How are the laws of bloodshed similar to those of monetary matters? If they saw it - why does it need a summons? If they did not see it - what is the law?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא, דְּלָא יָדַע אִי חֲזוּ אִי לָא חֲזוּ, וְהָאָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: מוּקְצֶה שֶׁיָּבַשׁ וְאֵין הַבְּעָלִים מַכִּירִין בּוֹ — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: And if you say he did not know whether they were fit or unfit, As didn’t Rav Kahana say: set aside dried but the owner did not know about it is permitted,
llm_translation: And if you will say, that he does not know whether he saw or did not see, and Rav Kahana said: A dried fig that has dried up and the owners do not recognize it - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, דִּחֲזוֹ וְאִדְּחוֹ, וַהֲדַר אִחֲזוֹ. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ אֵין מוּקְצֶה, לְמָה לְהוּ הַזְמָנָה? אֶלָּא מַאי יֵשׁ מוּקְצֶה? כִּי אַזְמֵין לְהוּ מַאי הָוֵי!
human_translation: Rather, is not where were fit, and became disqualified, and then became fit, And if you say there is no muktze why do they require designation? Rather, what there is muktze if he designates them what of it?
llm_translation: Rather, no, that he saw and he rejected, and then he saw again. And if you say there is no designated time, why do they need an appointment? Rather, what is designated time? When I appoint for them, what will be!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא: דְּאִחֲזוֹ וְלָא אִחֲזוֹ. דְּאִיכָּא אִינָשֵׁי דְּאָכְלִי, וְאִיכָּא אִינָשֵׁי דְּלָא אָכְלִי. אַזְמֵין — גַּלִּי דַּעְתֵּיהּ, לָא אַזְמֵין — לָא גַּלִּי דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: No, necessary where were fit but not fit, that there are people who eat and there are people who do not eat he designated he has revealed his intention he did not designate he has not revealed his intention.
llm_translation: Not necessary: whether he grasped or did not grasp. For there are people who ate, and there are people who did not eat. If he is silent - his mind is revealed, if he is not silent - his mind is not revealed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: תָּא שְׁמַע מִפּוֹלִין וַעֲדָשִׁים. דְּהָא פּוֹלִין וַעֲדָשִׁים מֵעִיקָּרָא חֲזוּ לָכוֹס, שְׁדִינְהוּ בִּקְדֵרָה — אִדְּחוֹ לְהוּ,
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Come hear from beans and lentils As beans and lentils at the outset, are fit to be chewed he casts them into the pot they become disqualified
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Come and hear about lentils and lentils. For lentils and lentils are visible from the outset in the cup, as they are judged in the pot - they are rejected.

hebrew_text: גָּמַר בִּשּׁוּלַיְיהוּ — חֲזוּ לְהוּ.
human_translation: their cooking is finished, they become fit
llm_translation: He completed with his prayers - they saw him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, תִּקְשֵׁי לָךְ קְדֵרוֹת דְּעָלְמָא, דְּהָא סְתָם קְדֵרוֹת דְּעָלְמָא בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת רוֹתְחוֹת הֵן, וּלְאוּרְתָּא אָכְלִינַן מִינַּיְיהוּ!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: And according to your reasoning cooked dishes in general a difficulty for you As ordinary cooked dishes in general are bubbling at twilight and we partake of them in the evening.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And according to your reasoning, you should boil pots of the world, for the majority of the pots of the world are boiling between the suns, and we do not eat from them!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא גְּמָרוֹ בִּידֵי אָדָם לָא קָא מִבַּעְיָא לַן. כִּי קָא מִבַּעְיָא לַן גְּמָרוֹ בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם.
human_translation: Rather, we have no dilemma whose completion, which is in the hands of a person, Where we have a dilemma whose completion is in the hands of Heaven,
llm_translation: Rather, the completion is in the hands of man, it is not required of us. When it is required of us, the completion is in the hands of Heaven.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה הֲוָה לֵיהּ הָהוּא בּוּכְרָא. שַׁדְּרֵיהּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, סְבַר דְּלָא לְמֶחְזְיֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זְרִיקָא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. הֲדַר שַׁדְּרֵיהּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא, סְבַר דְּלָא לְמֶחְזְיֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי זְרִיקָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda Nesia had a firstborn He sent it to before Rabbi Ami thought not examine it, Rabbi Zerika said to him, and some say Rabbi Yirmeya: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon, halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, then sent to before Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa, thought not examine it. Rabbi Yirmeya said to him, and some say Rabbi Zerika: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah, the Nasi, had a certain rooster. He sent it before Rabbi Ammi, thinking that it would not be seen. Rabbi Zerika said, and some say it was Rabbi Yirmeya: The halacha is according to Rabbi Yehudah and Rabbi Shimon. He then sent it before Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha, thinking that it would not be seen. Rabbi Yirmeya said, and some say it was Rabbi Zerika: The halacha is according to Rabbi Yehudah and Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא שְׁבַקְתִּינְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן לְמֶעְבַּד עוֹבָדָא כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְאַתְּ מָה בִּידָךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to What is the reason you did not allow the Sages to act in accordance with Rabbi Shimon? He said to him: And you, what do you have? said to him Rabbi Zeira said as follows: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Abba: What is the reason that you did not leave them for the Rabbis to perform the task like Rabbi Shimon? He said to him: And what is in your hand? He said to him, thus said Rabbi Zeira: The halakha is like Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר מַאן דְּהוּא: אֶזְכֵּי וְאֶסַּק לְהָתָם, וְאֶגְמְרַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתָּא מִפּוּמֵּיהּ דְּמָרַהּ. כִּי סָלֵיק לְהָתָם, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַבִּי זֵירָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲמַר מָר הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא, אֲנָא ״מִסְתַּבְּרָא״ אֲמַרִי.
human_translation: a certain person said: I merit to go up there and I learn teaching from the mouth of its Master; When he went up there he found Rabbi Zeira said to him: the Master say halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon? said to him: No, I said: It stands to reason
llm_translation: The one who is there said: "Remember and go there, and complete it to hear from his mouth." When he went there, he found Rabbi Zeira, he said to him: "Did Mar say the halakha like Rabbi Shimon?" He said to him: "No, I 'mista'bera' (conclude) differently."

hebrew_text: מִדְּקָתָנֵי בְּמַתְנִיתִין: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר כֹּל שֶׁאֵין מוּמוֹ נִיכָּר מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם — אֵין זֶה מִן הַמּוּכָן, וְקָתָנֵי לַהּ בְּבָרַיְיתָא בִּלְשׁוֹן חֲכָמִים — שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: From that it teaches in the mishna Rabbi Shimon says: Any whose blemish is not perceptible while it is still day is not among prepared And taught in the name of the Sages, learn from this that it stands to reason in accordance with
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From the Mishnah it is taught: Rabbi Shimon says, "Any blemish that is not recognizable from the outset - this is not considered a preexisting condition." And it is taught in a Baraita in the language of the Sages - "Hear from it, it is logical according to its reasoning."

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַלְיָא בְּאַשְׁלֵי רַבְרְבֵי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן שָׁאוּל אָמַר רַבִּי מִשּׁוּם קְהָלָא קַדִּישָׁא דְּבִירוּשָׁלַיִם: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וַחֲבֵרָיו אָמְרוּ הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: what was about Rav Yosef said: Come hear, as hangs on great trees, As Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said Rabbi Yosei ben Shaul said Rabbi said in the name of the holy community in Jerusalem: Rabbi Shimon and his colleagues said halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: What is the ruling? Rav Yosef said: Come and hear, as it is dependent on the words of the Sages. For Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, who said in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Sha'ul, who said in the name of Rabbi in the name of the holy community of Jerusalem: Rabbi Shimon and his colleagues said, the halacha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ? וְהָא אִינְהוּ קַשִּׁישֵׁי מִנֵּיהּ טוּבָא! אֶלָּא: בְּשִׁיטַת רַבִּי מֵאִיר אֲמָרוּהָ.
human_translation: said Aren’t they much older than he? Rather, spoke in the opinion of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: They said? But are they not elderly compared to him by much! Rather, in the opinion of Rabbi Meir they said it.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: הַשּׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַבְּכוֹר וְאַחַר כָּךְ הֶרְאָה אֶת מוּמוֹ — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר. וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל וְנִשְׁחַט שֶׁלֹּא עַל פִּי מוּמְחֶה — אָסוּר. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: רְאִיַּית בְּכוֹר לָאו כִּרְאִיַּית טְרֵפָה, רְאִיַּית בְּכוֹר — מֵחַיִּים, רְאִיַּית טְרֵפָה — לְאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה.
human_translation: as we learned one slaughtered a firstborn and afterward he showed its blemish Rabbi Yehuda permits And Rabbi Meir says: Since it was slaughtered without of an expert, it is prohibited. Apparently Rabbi Meir holds the examination of a firstborn is not as the examination of a tereifa , The examination of a firstborn when alive, the examination of a tereifa after slaughtering.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: One who slaughters the firstborn animal and then reveals its blemish - Rabbi Yehuda permits it. And Rabbi Meir says: Since it was slaughtered without the knowledge of the blemish, it is prohibited. This implies that Rabbi Meir holds: Seeing the firstborn is not like seeing a treifah; seeing the firstborn - while alive, seeing a treifah - after slaughter.

hebrew_text: וּמִינַּהּ: רְאִיַּית טְרֵפָה — אֲפִילּוּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב, רְאִיַּית בְּכוֹר — מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: And from this the examination of a tereifa , even on a Festival. the examination of a firstborn, on the eve of the Festival.
llm_translation: And from it: the sight of a treifah - even on a festival day, the sight of a firstborn - from the evening of the festival day.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אַטּוּ הָתָם, בְּרוֹאִין מוּמִין פְּלִיגִי? בִּקְנָסָא פְּלִיגִי. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּדוּקִּין שֶׁבָּעַיִן — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּאָסוּר, מִשּׁוּם דְּמִשְׁתַּנִּין.
human_translation: Abaye said Is that to say there, disagree examine blemishes they disagree with regard to penalty As Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: in the eyelids, everyone, agrees is prohibited, because changes
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Now there, do they argue regarding blemished animals? They argue regarding a fine. For Rabba bar bar Ḥana said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: With regard to the fine hairs of the eye, everyone agrees that they are prohibited, because they change.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּמוּמִין שֶׁבַּגּוּף, רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: גָּזְרִינַן מוּמִין שֶׁבַּגּוּף אַטּוּ מוּמִין שֶׁבָּעַיִן. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: לָא גָּזְרִינַן.
human_translation: When they disagree blemishes in the body, Rabbi Meir holds that we issue a decree blemishes in the body due to blemishes in the eye, and Rabbi Yehuda holds that we do not issue decree.
llm_translation: When they disputed regarding blemishes in the body, Rabbi Meir holds: We decree blemishes in the body, then blemishes in the eye. And Rabbi Yehuda holds: We do not decree.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל וְנִשְׁחַט שֶׁלֹּא עַל פִּי מוּמְחֶה — אָסוּר. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: קְנָסָא הוּא דְּקָא קָנֵיס, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: the mishna is also precise as it teaches Rabbi Meir says: Since it was slaughtered without an expert it is prohibited. Learn from this a penalty imposes learn from this
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said: The Mishna precisely states, as it teaches: Rabbi Meir says: Since it was slaughtered not in accordance with the opinion of the expert, it is forbidden. Learn from it: It is a penalty that he is imposing, learn from it.

hebrew_text: אַמֵּי וַרְדִּינָאָה חָזֵי בּוּכְרָא דְּבֵי נְשִׂיאָה הֲוָה. בְּיוֹמָא טָבָא לָא הֲוָה חָזֵי. אֲתוֹ וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אַמֵּי, אֲמַר לְהוּ: שַׁפִּיר קָא עָבֵיד דְּלָא חָזֵי. אִינִי? וְהָא רַבִּי אַמֵּי גּוּפֵיהּ חָזֵי! רַבִּי אַמֵּי כִּי חָזֵי — מֵאֶתְמוֹל הֲוָה חָזֵי,
human_translation: Ami of Vardina the examiner of firstborns in the household of the Nasi . On Festivals he would not examine They came and told Rabbi Ami He said to them: He does well not to examine Is that so? But didn’t Rabbi Ami himself examine When Rabbi Ami would examine on the day before he would examine
llm_translation: Ammey and Vardina'ah saw a demon in the house of the leader. On a good day, they did not see it. They came and said to Rabbi Ammey, he said to them: "He is doing well that he does not see. Am I not? But Rabbi Ammey himself saw it! When Rabbi Ammey saw it - he had been seeing it since yesterday."

hebrew_text: וּבְיוֹם טוֹב שַׁיּוֹלֵי קָא מְשַׁיֵּיל הֵיכִי הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא. כִּי הָא דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאַיְיתִי בּוּכְרָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא אַפַּנְיָא דְּמַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא טָבָא. הֲוָה יָתֵיב רָבָא וְקָא חָיֵיף רֵישֵׁיהּ. דַּלִּי עֵינֵיהּ וְחַזְיֵיהּ לְמוּמֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל הָאִידָּנָא וְתָא לִמְחַר.
human_translation: And on the Festival he would ask how the incident occurred, as in that where a certain man brought a firstborn before Rava, nightfall on a Festival eve. Rava was sitting and washing his head. He raised his eyes and saw blemish. He said to Go now, and come tomorrow.
llm_translation: On a festival day, Sha'ayolei Ka inquired how the matter was. For the man who brought a firstborn animal before Rava, the back of his neck was exposed on a good day. Rava was sitting and scratching his head. He raised his eyes and saw his blemishes. He said to him: "Go today and come tomorrow."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא לִמְחַר, אֲמַר: הֵיכִי הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲוָה שַׁדְיָין שְׂעָרֵי בְּהָךְ גִּיסָא דְּהוּצָא, וַהֲוָה אִיהוּ בְּאִידַּךְ גִּיסָא. בַּהֲדֵי דְּבָעֵי לְמֵיכַל, עַיֵּיל רֵישֵׁיהּ וּפַרְטֵיהּ הוּצָא לְשִׂפְוָתֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּלְמָא אַתְּ גְּרַמְתְּ לֵיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא.
human_translation: When he came on the following day, said to him: How did the incident occur? said to Barley were scattered on one side of a fence of thorns, while was on the other side. When it wanted to eat, it stuck its head through the fence and a thorn cut its lip. said to Perhaps you caused He said to him: No.
llm_translation: When he came the next day, he said: How was the matter? He said to him: There were hairs in that pile of flax, and he was in the other pile. While they were eating, he took his head and his limbs out to the edge. He said to him: Perhaps you caused it? He said to him: No.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא דִּגְרָמָא אָסוּר, דְּתַנְיָא: ״מוּם לֹא יִהְיֶה בּוֹ״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא יִהְיֶה בּוֹ מוּם, מִנַּיִין שֶׁלֹּא יִגְרוֹם לוֹ עַל יְדֵי דָּבָר אַחֵר, שֶׁלֹּא יָבִיא בָּצֵק אוֹ דְבֵלָה וְיַנִּיחַ לוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי הָאֹזֶן כְּדֵי שֶׁיָּבֹא הַכֶּלֶב וְיִטְּלֶנּוּ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כׇּל מוּם״. אָמַר ״מוּם״, וְאָמַר ״כׇּל מוּם״.
human_translation: And from where do you say that causing is prohibited? As it is taught “There must not be blemish in it” I have only that it may not have a blemish; from where that one may not cause to it by means of something else, that he does not bring dough or a dried fig and place it on its ear so that a dog will come and take it, the verse states “any blemish.” It says “blemish” and it says “any blemish”;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And how do you explain the case of causing a blemish, which is prohibited, as it was taught: "No blemish shall be in it"? I only know that there should not be a blemish in it, from where do we derive that one should not cause it through another object, that he should not bring dough or a clod and place it on the back of the ear so that a dog may come and remove it? The Talmud teaches: "Any blemish." It says "blemish," and it says "any blemish."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בְּהֵמָה שֶׁמֵּתָה — לֹא יְזִיזֶנָּה מִמְּקוֹמָהּ. וּמַעֲשֶׂה וְשָׁאֲלוּ אֶת רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן עָלֶיהָ וְעַל הַחַלָּה שֶׁנִּטְמֵאת, וְנִכְנַס לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ וְשָׁאַל, וְאָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא יְזִיזֵם מִמְקוֹמָם.
human_translation: an animal that died, one not move it from its place And an incident and they asked Rabbi Tarfon about it. And about ḥalla that became ritually impure entered the study hall and inquired and said to him: One not move them from their place.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: An animal that has died - one may not move it from its place. And there was an incident, and they asked Rabbi Tarfon about it and about dough that became impure, and he entered the study hall and asked, and they said to him: One may not move them from their place.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לֵימָא תְּנַן סְתָמָא דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? (דִּתְנַן) רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מְחַתְּכִין אֶת הַדִּלּוּעִין לִפְנֵי הַבְּהֵמָה, וְאֶת הַנְּבֵלָה לִפְנֵי הַכְּלָבִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם לֹא הָיְתָה נְבֵלָה מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: Let us say we learned the unattributed not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. As we learned Rabbi Shimon says: One cut up gourds for an animal an animal carcass for dogs. Rabbi Yehuda says: If it was not an animal carcass on the eve of Shabbat, it is prohibited.
llm_translation: Gemara: Let us say that we learned in a Mishnah that is anonymous, not like Rabbi Shimon? (As we learned) Rabbi Shimon says: We may cut up the entrails in front of the animal, and the carcass in front of the dogs. Rabbi Yehuda says: If the carcass was not there from before Shabbat, it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, מוֹדֶה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּבַעֲלֵי חַיִּים שֶׁמֵּתוּ, שֶׁאֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: even you say Rabbi Shimon, Rabbi Shimon concedes in animals that died that they are prohibited.
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Shimon, Rabbi Shimon agrees with regard to animals that died, that they are forbidden.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמָר בַּר אַמֵּימָר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא דְּאָמַר: מוֹדֶה הָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּבַעֲלֵי חַיִּים שֶׁמֵּתוּ שֶׁאֲסוּרִין, שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא לְמָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא דְּאָמַר: חָלוּק הָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אֲפִילּוּ בְּבַעֲלֵי חַיִּים שֶׁמֵּתוּ, שֶׁמּוּתָּרִים — מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This well according to Mar bar Ameimar in the name of Rava, who said Rabbi Shimon concedes in animals that died that they are prohibited well. However, according to Mar, son of Rav Yosef, in the name of Rava, who said Rabbi Shimon was in disagreement even in animals that died they are permitted, what is there to say?
llm_translation: The master, son of Amemar, left in the name of Rava who said: Rabbi Shimon used to agree with the owners of animals that died that they are forbidden, it is good. But the son of Rav Yosef, in the name of Rava, said: Rabbi Shimon was lenient even with the owners of animals that died, that they are permitted - what can be said about this?

hebrew_text: תַּרְגְּומַהּ זְעֵירִי, בְּבֶהֱמַת קֳדָשִׁים. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: עָלֶיהָ וְעַל הַחַלָּה שֶׁנִּטְמֵאת. מָה חַלָּה — דְּקַדִּישָׁא, אַף בְּהֵמָה — דְּקַדִּישָׁא.
human_translation: Ze’iri explained it to a sacred animal is also precise as it teaches: about it and about ḥalla that became ritually impure, Just as ḥalla is sacred, so too, animal that was sacred,
llm_translation: A minor translation, regarding consecrated animals. It is precisely stated in the Mishnah: "Upon it and upon the challah that became impure." Just as challah is sanctified, so too an animal is sanctified.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא טַעְמָא דְּקַדִּישָׁא הָא דְּחוּלִּין — שַׁרְיָא. הָנִיחָא לְמָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, דְּאָמַר: חָלוּק הָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אַף בְּבַעֲלֵי חַיִּים שֶׁמֵּתוּ שֶׁמּוּתָּרִין — שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא לְמָר בַּר אַמֵּימָר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, דְּאָמַר: מוֹדֶה הָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּבַעֲלֵי חַיִּים שֶׁמֵּתוּ שֶׁאֲסוּרִין — מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: Rather, the reason is that was sacred; but a non-sacred permitted this well according to Mar, son of Rav Yosef, in the name of Rava, who said Rabbi Shimon was in disagreement even in animals that died, they are permitted; well, However, according to Mar bar Ameimar in the name of Rava, who said Rabbi Shimon concedes in animals that died that they are prohibited, what is there to say?
llm_translation: Rather, the reason for the sanctity of the mundane — is permissible. Leave it to Mar, son of Rav Yosef, in the name of Rava, who said: Rabbi Shimon was lenient even regarding animals that died, that they are permissible — it is reasonable. But leave it to Mar, son of Amemar, in the name of Rava, who said: Rabbi Shimon used to agree that animals that died are forbidden — what can be said in response?

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בִּמְסוּכֶּנֶת, וְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? with in danger and all agree
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with - with a table, and the words of everyone.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין נִמְנִין עַל הַבְּהֵמָה לְכַתְּחִלָּה בְּיוֹם טוֹב. אֲבָל נִמְנִין עָלֶיהָ מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב, וְשׁוֹחֲטִין וּמְחַלְּקִין בֵּינֵיהֶם.
human_translation: One not register of an animal on a Festival ab initio , But one register for on the eve of the Festival, and slaughter and divide between them
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not count animals for tithing purposes at the outset on a festival day. However, one may count them from the eve of the festival, and slaughter and divide them among themselves.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי אֵין נִמְנִין? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין פּוֹסְקִין דָּמִים לְכַתְּחִלָּה עַל הַבְּהֵמָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב. הֵיכִי עָבֵיד? אָמַר רַב: מֵבִיא שְׁתֵּי בְהֵמוֹת וּמַעֲמִידָן זוֹ אֵצֶל זוֹ, וְאוֹמֵר: זוֹ כָּזוֹ?
human_translation: What is One not register? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: One not fix of money of an animal on a Festival ab initio . What one do Rav said: He bring two animals and stand them one next to the other and say: this one equal to the other one?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the meaning of "ein nimnin"? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: We do not allocate blood initially on an animal on a festival. How does one proceed? Rav said: One brings two animals and stands them next to each other, and says: "This one is like that one."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: לֹא יֹאמַר אָדָם לַחֲבֵרוֹ הֲרֵינִי עִמְּךָ בְּסֶלַע, הֲרֵינִי עִמְּךָ בִּשְׁתַּיִם, אֲבָל אוֹמֵר לוֹ: הֲרֵינִי עִמְּךָ לְמֶחֱצָה וְלִשְׁלִישׁ וְלִרְבִיעַ.
human_translation: This is also taught A person not say to another I am hereby with you for the value of a sela , I am hereby with you for two However, he say to him: I am hereby with you for half for a third or a quarter,
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: One may not say to his fellow, "Behold, I am with you in a rock," but may say to him, "Behold, I am with you in two." However, one may say to him, "Behold, I am with you for half, and for a third, and for a quarter."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שׁוֹקֵל אָדָם בָּשָׂר כְּנֶגֶד הַכְּלִי אוֹ כְּנֶגֶד הַקּוֹפִיץ. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מַשְׁגִּיחִין בְּכַף מֹאזְנַיִם כׇּל עִיקָּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: A person weigh meat against vessel or against cleaver [ kofitz ] And the Rabbis say: One not look at the pans of a scale at all,
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda says: A person weighs meat against the utensil or against the knife. And the Sages say: We do not inspect with a balance scale at all.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״כׇּל עִיקָּר״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֲפִילּוּ לְשׇׁמְרוֹ מִן הָעַכְבָּרִים. אָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין: וְהוּא דְּתַלְיָא בִּתְרִיטָא.
human_translation: What is at all? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Even to protect it from mice, Rav Idi bar Avin said: And this where is hanging on the ring
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the meaning of "all essence"? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Even to protect it from mice. Rav Idi bar Avin said: And this is dependent on a peg in the ground.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: טַבָּח אוּמָּן אָסוּר לִשְׁקוֹל בָּשָׂר בַּיָּד. וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: טַבָּח אוּמָּן אָסוּר לִשְׁקוֹל בָּשָׂר בְּמַיִם.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: It is prohibited for an expert butcher to weigh meat by hand And Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: It is prohibited for an expert butcher to weigh meat in water.
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A butcher or a craftsman is forbidden to weigh meat by hand. And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A butcher or a craftsman is forbidden to weigh meat in water.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי: אָסוּר לַעֲשׂוֹת בֵּית יָד בַּבָּשָׂר. אָמַר רָבִינָא: וּבִידָא שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said: It is prohibited to make a handle in meat Ravina said: But it is permitted by hand,
llm_translation: And Rav Chiya bar Ashe said: It is forbidden to make a house of meat. Ravina said: But with a hand, it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מוּתָּר לַעֲשׂוֹת סִימָן בַּבָּשָׂר, כִּי הָא דְּרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא מְחַתֵּךְ לַהּ אַתְּלָת קַרְנָתָא.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: It is permitted to make a sign on meat like that which Rabba bar Rav Huna cut it into triangles
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: It is permitted to make a mark on the meat, as Rabba bar Rav Huna used to cut for her a piece of the horn.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חִיָּיא וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרַבִּי שׁוֹקְלִין מָנָה כְּנֶגֶד מָנָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב. כְּמַאן? לָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְלֹא כְּרַבָּנַן! אִי כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָאָמַר: שׁוֹקֵל אָדָם בָּשָׂר כְּנֶגֶד הַכְּלִי אוֹ כְּנֶגֶד הַקּוֹפִיץ. כְּנֶגֶד הַכְּלִי — אִין, כְּנֶגֶד מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא — לָא! אִי כְּרַבָּנַן, הָא אָמְרִי: אֵין מַשְׁגִּיחִין בְּכַף מֹאזְנַיִם כׇּל עִיקָּר!
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya and Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi weigh portion against portion on a Festival In accordance with whose neither in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda nor in accordance with the Rabbis if in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, didn’t he say: A person weigh meat against a vessel or against a cleaver, Against a vessel yes, against anything else, no, if in accordance with the Rabbis, didn’t they say: One not look at the pans of a scale at all?
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya and Rabbi Shimon, the son of Rabbi Shokelin, weigh one portion against another on a festival day. According to whom? Not according to Rabbi Yehuda and not according to the Rabbis! If according to Rabbi Yehuda, who said: A person weighs meat against the vessel or against the knife. Against the vessel - no, against other utensils - yes! If according to the Rabbis, who said: We do not inspect with a balance scale at all!

hebrew_text: אִינְהוּ דַּעֲבוּד כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: שׁוֹקְלִין מָנָה כְּנֶגֶד מָנָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב. אֲמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, הוֹאִיל וּתְנַן בִּבְכוֹרוֹת כְּוָתֵיהּ.
human_translation: acted in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua. As it is taught Rabbi Yehoshua says: One may weigh portion against portion on a Festival. Rav Yosef said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua, since we learned in Bekhorot in accordance with his
llm_translation: They are like the practice of Rabbi Yehoshua. As it was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua says: We weigh one portion against another on a festival day. Rav Yosef said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua, since we learned in the Mishnah concerning firstborn animals according to his opinion.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: פְּסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין — הֲנָאָתָן לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ, וְשׁוֹקְלִין מָנָה כְּנֶגֶד מָנָה בַּבְּכוֹר.
human_translation: As we learned consecrated animals that have become disqualified the benefit from their to the consecrated And one weigh portion against portion in firstborn
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: Disqualified items of consecrated property — their benefit is given to the Temple, and they are weighed against each other in the case of a firstborn.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְדִלְמָא לָא הִיא, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הָכָא, אֶלָּא דְּלֵיכָּא בִּזְיוֹן קָדָשִׁים, אֲבָל הָתָם דְּאִיכָּא בִּזְיוֹן קֳדָשִׁים — לָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Perhaps that is not so, Rabbi Yehoshua stated only here, where not degradation of sacred but there, where degradation of sacred not
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And perhaps it is not so, until here Rabbi Yehoshua did not say, here, but that there is no disgrace in the sanctification of holy things, but there, where there is disgrace in the sanctification of holy things - no.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן הָתָם אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא מִחֲזֵי כְּעוֹבָדִין דְּחוֹל, אֲבָל הָכָא דְּמִחֲזֵי כְּעוֹבָדִין דְּחוֹל — לָא.
human_translation: Alternatively, the Rabbis stated only there, because it does not look like a weekday activity; but here, where it looks like a weekday activity, not
llm_translation: The scholars did not say this there, rather because it does not appear like weekday activities, but here, where it appears like weekday activities - no.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּקָפְדִי אַהֲדָדֵי? וְהָא הָנְהוּ שַׁב בִּנְיָתָא דַּאֲתוֹ לְבֵי רַבִּי, וְאִשְׁתַּכַּח חֲמֵשׁ מִנַּיְיהוּ בֵּי רַבִּי חִיָּיא, וְלָא קָפֵיד רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרַבִּי!
human_translation: Is this to say that they were particular with each other But wasn’t the seven fish that were brought to the house of Rabbi and five of them were found in the house Rabbi Ḥiyya, and Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi was not particular
llm_translation: In the matter of the strictness of one towards the other? But behold, these are the builders who came to the house of Rabbi, and they found five things in the house of Rabbi Chiya, and Rabbi Shimon, the son of Rabbi, did not object!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, שְׁדִי גַּבְרָא בֵּינַיְיהוּ: אִי רַבִּי חִיָּיא וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, אִי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרַבִּי וּבַר קַפָּרָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Cast a person between them. Either Rabbi Ḥiyya and Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, or Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi and bar Kappara.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, "A demon is between them: either Rabbi Chiya and Rabbi Yishmael, the son of Rabbi Yosei, or Rabbi Shimon, the son of Rabbi and Bar Kappara."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין מַשְׁחִיזִין אֶת הַסַּכִּין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אֲבָל מַשִּׂיאָהּ עַל גַּבֵּי חֲבֶרְתָּהּ.
human_translation: One not sharpen a knife on a Festival However, one run over another,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not sharpen the knife on a festival day, but one may lift it onto the back of her friend.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּמַשְׁחֶזֶת שֶׁל אֶבֶן, אֲבָל בְּמַשְׁחֶזֶת שֶׁל עֵץ — מוּתָּר. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ שֶׁל אֶבֶן אָסוּר, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא לְחַדְּדָהּ, אֲבָל לְהַעֲבִיר שַׁמְנוּנִיתָהּ — מוּתָּר. מִכְּלָל דִּבְשֶׁל עֵץ — אֲפִילּוּ לְחַדְּדָהּ, נָמֵי מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: They taught only with a stone sharpener, but with a wooden sharpener, it is permitted, Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: that which you said, a stone is prohibited, we said only where to sharpen but to remove the fat it is permitted. by inference that with of wood, even to sharpen it is permitted.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Huna said: They only prohibited with a stone sharpener, but with a wooden sharpener - it is permitted. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: This that you said that with a stone one it is forbidden, we only said it to sharpen it, but to remove its oiliness - it is permitted. From the principle of a wooden one - even to sharpen it, it is also permitted.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַסֵּיפָא: בְּשֶׁל עֵץ מוּתָּר, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ בְּשֶׁל עֵץ מוּתָּר, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא לְהַעֲבִיר שַׁמְנוּנִיתָהּ, אֲבָל לְחַדְּדָהּ — אָסוּר. מִכְּלָל דִּבְשֶׁל אֶבֶן — אֲפִילּוּ לְהַעֲבִיר שַׁמְנוּנִיתָהּ אָסוּר.
human_translation: Some teach to the latter clause of wood, it is permitted. Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: that which you said, with a wooden is permitted, we said only where to remove its fat, but to sharpen it, it is prohibited. by inference that of stone, even to remove its fat, it is prohibited.
llm_translation: There is one who teaches the following in the latter part: With regard to a metal vessel, Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: When you said that with regard to a metal vessel it is permitted, we only said this in order to move its oil, but to sharpen it - it is prohibited. By inference, with regard to a stone vessel - even to move its oil is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַמַּתְנִיתִין: אֵין מַשְׁחִיזִין אֶת הַסַּכִּין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אֲמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְחַדְּדָהּ, אֲבָל לְהַעֲבִיר שַׁמְנוּנִיתָהּ — מוּתָּר, מִכְּלָל דְּעַל גַּבֵּי חֲבֶרְתָּהּ — אֲפִילּוּ לְחַדְּדָהּ, נָמֵי מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Some teach to the mishna One not sharpen a knife on a Festival. Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: They taught only to sharpen but to remove its fat, it is permitted. by inference that over another is permitted even to sharpen
llm_translation: There is one who teaches her the traditions: One may not sharpen the knife on a festival day. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: They only taught this in order to sharpen it, but to remove its grease - it is permitted. From the principle that in the presence of her fellow - even to sharpen it, it is also permitted.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַסֵּיפָא: אֲבָל מַשִּׂיאָהּ עַל גַּבֵּי חֲבֶרְתָּהּ, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְהַעֲבִיר שַׁמְנוּנִיתָהּ, אֲבָל לְחַדְּדָהּ — אָסוּר. מִכְּלָל דִּבְמַשְׁחֶזֶת — אֲפִילּוּ לְהַעֲבִיר שַׁמְנוּנִיתָהּ אָסוּר.
human_translation: And some teach to the latter clause However, one run over another. Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: They taught only to remove its fat, but to sharpen it, it is prohibited. by inference that with a sharpener, it is prohibited even to remove its fat.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And there are those who teach the following in the latter part: But if she raises it above her friend, Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: They only permitted moving her menstrual cloth, but to sharpen it - is forbidden. From the general principle of what is visible - even moving her menstrual cloth is forbidden.

hebrew_text: מַאן תַּנָּא דִּבְמַשְׁחֶזֶת אָסוּר? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין בֵּין יוֹם טוֹב לַשַּׁבָּת אֶלָּא אוֹכֶל נֶפֶשׁ בִּלְבָד. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר אַף מַכְשִׁירֵי אוֹכֶל נֶפֶשׁ.
human_translation: Who is the tanna that with a sharpener it is prohibited? Rav Ḥisda said: not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught The between a Festival and Shabbat is only food, Rabbi Yehuda permits even facilitate preparation of food
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna that holds in Mishchatz is forbidden? Rav Chisda said: Not like Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught: There is no difference between Yom Tov and Shabbat except for food preparation only. Rabbi Yehuda permits even the utensils used for food preparation.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב חִסְדָּא: דָּרְשִׁינַן מִשְּׁמָךְ הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יְהֵא רַעֲוָא דְּכׇל כִּי הָנֵי מִילֵּי מְעַלְּיָיתָא תִּדְרְשׁוּן מִשְּׁמַאי.
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Ḥisda: We teach in your name halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. He said to him: May it be will that you teach in my name all outstanding matters like this.
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Ḥisda: We interpret the halakha according to the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda. He said to him: Let the Master of all things be pleased that you should seek the exalted matters from Shammai.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נְחֶמְיָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף: הֲוָה קָאֵימְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, וַהֲוָה קָא
human_translation: Rav Neḥemya, son of Rav Yosef, said: I was standing before Rava, and he was
llm_translation: Rav Nechemya, son of Rav Yosef, said: "I was standing before Rava, and he was saying..."

hebrew_text: מְעַבַּר לְסַכִּינָא אַפּוּמָּא דְּדִקּוּלָא, וְאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: לְחַדְּדָהּ קָא עָבֵיד מָר, אוֹ לְהַעֲבִיר שַׁמְנוּנִיתָהּ? וְאָמַר לִי: לְהַעֲבִיר שַׁמְנוּנִיתָהּ. וַחֲזֵיתִי לְדַעְתֵּיהּ דִּלְחַדְּדָהּ קָא עָבֵיד, וְקָסָבַר: הֲלָכָה, וְאֵין מוֹרִין כֵּן.
human_translation: running a knife over the rim of a basket And I said to him: the Master doing in order to sharpen it or to remove its fat? And he said to me: To remove its fat. And I perceived his intention, that he did so to sharpen it. he holds halakha but a ruling is not issued to that effect;
llm_translation: He passed by the knife of the slaughterer of the courtyard, and they said to him: "Is the Master sharpening it, or is he passing it over a smooth stone?" And he said to me: "He is passing it over a smooth stone." And I saw according to their opinion that he was sharpening it, and he holds: It is a halacha, and we do not teach this way.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הֲוָה קָאֵימְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּמָר, וַהֲוָה קָא מְעַבַּר סַכִּינָא אַשִּׂפְתָּא דְרִחְיָא. וַאֲמַרִי לֵיהּ: לְחַדְּדָהּ קָא בָּעֵי מָר, אוֹ לְהַעֲבִיר שַׁמְנוּנִיתָהּ? וְאָמַר לִי: לְהַעֲבִיר שַׁמְנוּנִיתָהּ. וַחֲזִיתִי לְדַעְתֵּיהּ דִּלְחַדְּדָהּ קָא עָבֵיד, וְקָסָבַר: הֲלָכָה, וְאֵין מוֹרִין כֵּן.
human_translation: Abaye said: I was standing before my Master and he was running a knife over the edge of a millstone And I said to him: the Master wish to sharpen it, or to remove its fat? And he said to me: To remove its fat. And I perceived his intention, that he did so to sharpen it, but he holds: halakha , but a ruling is not issued to that effect.
llm_translation: And Abaye said: I was standing before Mar, and I was passing a knife on the edge of a millstone. And they said to him: Is he seeking to sharpen it, or to remove its fatness? And he said to me: To remove its fatness. And I saw from his actions that he was seeking to sharpen it, and he holds: It is a halacha, and we do not teach it thus.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַהוּ לְהַרְאוֹת סַכִּין לְחָכָם בְּיוֹם טוֹב? רַב מָרִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב בִּיזְנָא שָׁרֵי, וְרַבָּנַן אָסְרִי. וְרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: תַּלְמִיד חָכָם רוֹאֶה לְעַצְמוֹ, וּמַשְׁאִילָהּ לַאֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is with regard to showing a knife to a Sage on a Festival Rav Mari, son of Rav Bizna, permitted whereas the Rabbis prohibited And Rav Yosef said: A Torah scholar may examine for himself and lend it to others,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a dilemma: What is the ruling regarding showing a knife to a wise person on a festival day? Rav Mari, son of Rav Bizna, permits it, while the Rabbis prohibit it. And Rav Yosef said: A Torah scholar may inspect it himself, and then pass it to others.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: סַכִּין שֶׁעָמְדָה — מוּתָּר לְחַדְּדָהּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי הוּא דְּפָסְקָא אַגַּב דּוּחְקָא.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef said: a knife that became blunt it is permitted to sharpen it on a Festival. And this applies cuts, with difficulty,
llm_translation: And Rav Yosef said: A knife that stood - it is permitted to sharpen it on a festival. And these are the words that he stated because of necessity.

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ רַב חִסְדָּא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב יוֹסֵף: אֶחָד סַכִּין שֶׁנִּפְגְּמָה, וְאֶחָד שַׁפּוּד שֶׁנִּרְצַם, וְאֶחָד גְּרִיפַת תַּנּוּר וְכִירַיִם בְּיוֹם טוֹב — בָּאנוּ לְמַחְלוֹקֶת רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבָּנַן. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין בֵּין יוֹם טוֹב לַשַּׁבָּת אֶלָּא אוֹכֶל נֶפֶשׁ בִּלְבָד. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר אַף מַכְשִׁירֵי אוֹכֶל נֶפֶשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda taught, and some say Rav Yosef A knife that became nicked a skewer [ shappud ] that was crushed and the sweeping of an oven and a stove on a Festival we have arrived at the dispute between Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis. As it is taught The between a Festival and Shabbat is only preparation of food. Rabbi Yehuda permits even facilitate preparation of food
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah expounded, and some say it was Rav Yosef: One may use a knife that was nicked, and one may use a spit that was scorched, and one may use a stove scraper and pots on a Festival — we came to the dispute of Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis. As it was taught: There is no difference between a Festival and Shabbat except for food preparation alone. Rabbi Yehuda permits even utensils used for food preparation.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא — אָמַר קְרָא: ״הוּא לְבַדּוֹ יֵעָשֶׂה לָכֶם״. ״הוּא״ — וְלֹא מַכְשִׁירָיו. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אָמַר קְרָא: ״לָכֶם״, לָכֶם — לְכׇל צׇרְכֵיכֶם.
human_translation: What is the reason of the first tanna The verse states: that alone may be done for you” “That” but not facilitate it. And Rabbi Yehuda the verse states: “For you,” For you, for all your needs,
llm_translation: What is the reason that the first Tanna taught — the verse says: "He alone shall be done for you." "He" — and not his accessories. And Rabbi Yehuda said: the verse says: "for you," for you — for all your needs.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא, הָא כְּתִיב ״לָכֶם״? אָמַר לָךְ: הַהוּא, ״לָכֶם״ — וְלֹא לְגוֹיִם.
human_translation: And the first tanna , is it not written “for you”? said to you that For you, but not for gentiles.
llm_translation: And it was taught in the first Tanna: Is it not written "for you"? He said to you: That, "for you" — and not for the nations.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, הָא כְּתִיב ״הוּא״, אָמַר לָךְ: כְּתִיב ״הוּא״, וּכְתִיב ״לָכֶם״, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּמַכְשִׁירִין שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לַעֲשׂוֹתָן מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב, כָּאן בְּמַכְשִׁירִין שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לַעֲשׂוֹתָן מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: And the other too, isn’t it written: “That,” said to you: “that” is written, and “for you,” is written but not difficult here, to facilitate that can be performed on the eve of the Festival; There, to facilitate that cannot be performed on the eve of the Festival.
llm_translation: And the other one says, "It is written 'he'." He says to you: It is written 'he', and it is written 'to you', and it is not difficult: here in cases where they can be prepared from Erev Yom Tov, here in cases where they cannot be prepared from Erev Yom Tov.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שַׁפּוּד שֶׁנִּרְצַף — אָסוּר לְתַקְּנוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּמִפְּשִׁיט בִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: skewer that became bent, it is prohibited to repair it on a Festival. obvious; No, necessary Although can be straightened by hand
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A pot that was sealed - it is forbidden to fix it on a festival. It is obvious! It is not necessary, because even though it is obvious in her hands.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שַׁפּוּד שֶׁצָּלוּ בּוֹ בָּשָׂר — אָסוּר לְטַלְטְלוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב. רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר רַב מַלְכִּיּוֹ: שׁוֹמְטוֹ וּמַנִּיחוֹ בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: a skewer upon which one roasted meat, it is prohibited to move it on a Festival, Rav Adda bar Ahava said Rav Malkiyu said: He pull out and place it in a corner
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A spit in which meat was roasted - it is forbidden to move it on a festival day. Rav Adda bar Ahava said in the name of Rav Malkiyo: Remove it and place it in a corner.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: וְהוּא שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר. רָבִינָא אָמַר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין עָלָיו בָּשָׂר — מוּתָּר לְטַלְטְלוֹ, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַקּוֹץ בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Rav Huna said: And this where has an olive-bulk of meat on it; Ravina said: Although it does not have meat on it, it is permitted to move it just as in a thorn in the public domain.
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Ashe said, Rav Huna said: And this is when there is on it like an olive's worth of meat. Ravina said: Even though there is no meat on it - it is permitted to move it, since it would be a nuisance in a public domain.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: שַׁפּוּד, שְׁפָחוֹת, וְגוּמוֹת — רַב מַלְכִּיּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥinnana, son of Rav Ika, said: a skewer maidservants, and follicles, Rav Malkiyu.
llm_translation: Rav Chinana, son of Rav Ika, said: "Shafud, Sh'fachot, and G'mot - Rav Malkiyo."

hebrew_text: בְּלוֹרִית, אֵפֶר מִקְלֶה, וּגְבִינָה — רַב מַלְכִּיָּא.
human_translation: a forelock, burnt ashes, and cheese Rav Malkiya.
llm_translation: In the BeLorit, ashes of a stick, and cheese - Rav Malkiya.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: מַתְנִיתִין וּמַתְנִיתָא — רַב מַלְכִּיָּא. שְׁמַעְתָּתָא — רַב מַלְכִּיּוֹ. וְסִימָנָיךְ: מַתְנִיתִין מַלְכְּתָא. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ שְׁפָחוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said a mishna or a baraita Rav Malkiya, halakhot Rav Malkiyu. And your mnemonic is: The mishna is a queen malketa What is between There is between them maidservants.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Matnitin and Matnita — Rav Malkiya. Shemasta — Rav Malkiyo. And your mnemonic: Matnitin Malketa. What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them in regard to maidservants.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ לֹא יֹאמַר אָדָם לַטַּבָּח: שְׁקוֹל לִי בְּדִינָר בָּשָׂר, אֲבָל שׁוֹחֵט וּמְחַלֵּק בֵּינֵיהֶם.
human_translation: A person not say to a butcher Weigh for me a dinar’s worth of meat, But slaughter and apportion it
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A person should not say to the butcher, "Weigh for me a dinar's worth of meat," but rather he should slaughter the animal and divide it between them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הֵיכִי עָבֵיד? כִּי הָא
human_translation: What do As
llm_translation: Gemara: How does Gemara do it? Like this:

hebrew_text: דִּבְסוּרָא אָמְרִי: תַּרְטָא וּפַלְגוּ תַּרְטָא. בְּנַרֶשׁ אָמְרִי: חֶלְקָא וּפַלְגוּ חֶלְקָא. בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא אָמְרִי: אוּזְיָא וּפַלְגוּ אוּזְיָא. בִּנְהַר פְּקוֹד וּבְמָתָא מַחְסֵיָא אָמְרִי: רִבְעָא וּפַלְגוּ רִבְעָא.
human_translation: they would say in Sura: a tarta or half a tarta , In Neresh they would say A part or half a part. In Pumbedita they would say: An uzya or half an uzya . In Nehar Pekod and in Mata Meḥasya they would say: a quarter or half a quarter,
llm_translation: In Dibsurah they say: Tartah and Pargu Tartah. In Nares they say: Helka and Pargu Helka. In Pumbadita they say: Uzaya and Pargu Uzaya. In the river Pekod and in the city Mahseya they say: Reva and Pargu Reva.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אוֹמֵר אָדָם לַחֲבֵרוֹ: מַלֵּא לִי כְּלִי זֶה, אֲבָל לֹא בְּמִדָּה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיָה כְּלִי שֶׁל מִדָּה — לֹא יְמַלְּאֶנּוּ. מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל בֶּן בָּטְנִית, שֶׁהָיָה מְמַלֵּא מִדּוֹתָיו מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב וְנוֹתְנָן לַלָּקוֹחוֹת בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: person say to another Fill this vessel for me, but not in a measure. Rabbi Yehuda says: If it was a measuring utensil, he may not fill it. an incident involving Abba Shaul ben Botnit, who would fill his measures on the eve of a Festival and give them to customers on the Festival.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A person says to his friend, "Fill this vessel for me, but not with a specific measure." Rabbi Yehuda says: If it is a measuring vessel, he should not fill it. There was an incident with Abba Shaul ben Batnit, who would fill his measures on Erev Yom Tov and give them to the purchasers on Yom Tov.

hebrew_text: אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: אַף בַּמּוֹעֵד עוֹשֶׂה כֵּן, מִפְּנֵי בֵּרוּרֵי הַמִּדּוֹת. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַף בַּחוֹל עוֹשֶׂה כֵּן, מִפְּנֵי מִצּוּי הַמִּדּוֹת.
human_translation: Abba Shaul, says: He would do this even on a Festival because of the clarity of the measures, And the Rabbis say: Even on a weekday do so, because of the draining of the measures.
llm_translation: Abba Shaul says: Even on the festival he does so, because of the clarification of the measures. And the sages say: Even on a weekday he does so, because of the common occurrence of the measures.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״אֲבָל לֹא בְּמִדָּה״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֲבָל לֹא בִּכְלִי הַמְיוּחָד לְמִדָּה. אֲבָל כְּלִי הָעוֹמֵד לְמִדָּה — יְמַלְּאֶנּוּ. וַאֲתָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְמֵימַר אֲפִילּוּ כְּלִי הָעוֹמֵד לְמִדָּה לֹא יְמַלְּאֶנּוּ.
human_translation: What is But not in a measure? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: But not with a vessel designated for measuring; however, a vessel that be used for measuring he fill it. Rabbi Yehuda comes to say he not fill even a vessel that be used for measuring.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the meaning of "but not with a measurement"? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: But not with a vessel designated for measurement. But with a vessel that stands for measurement - one may fill it. And Rabbi Yehudah came to say that even with a vessel that stands for measurement, one may not fill it.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא גַּבֵּי שִׂמְחַת יוֹם טוֹב רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְחוּמְרָא וְרַבָּנַן לְקוּלָּא? וְהָא אִפְּכָא שָׁמְעִינַן לְהוּ! דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שׁוֹקֵל אָדָם בָּשָׂר כְּנֶגֶד הַכְּלִי וּכְנֶגֶד הַקּוֹפִיץ, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מַשְׁגִּיחִין בְּכַף מֹאזְנַיִם כׇּל עִיקָּר. אַלְמָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְקוּלָּא וְרַבָּנַן לְחוּמְרָא. קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן!
human_translation: Apparently, Rabbi Yehuda is stringent with regard to the joy of the Festival while the Rabbis are lenient. But didn’t we hear them the opposite, as we learned Rabbi Yehuda says: A person weigh meat against a vessel or against a cleaver, and the Rabbis say: One not look at the pans of a scale at all? Apparently, Rabbi Yehuda is lenient, while the Rabbis is stringent. there is a contradiction between Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yehuda, a contradiction between the Rabbis and the Rabbis.
llm_translation: The matter of regarding the joy of a festival, Rabbi Yehuda is stringent, and the Rabbis are lenient? But behold, we have heard the opposite! For it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: One weighs meat against the utensil and against the knife, and the Sages say: We do not pay attention to the weight of the scales at all. Therefore, it is evident that Rabbi Yehuda is lenient and the Rabbis are stringent. The difficulty of Rabbi Yehuda is according to Rabbi Yehuda, and the difficulty of the Rabbis is according to the Rabbis!

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָתָם בְּשֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹמֵד לְמִדָּה, הָכָא בְּעוֹמֵד לְמִדָּה.
human_translation: between Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yehuda, not difficult. There, with that cannot be used for measuring here, can be used for measuring,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda: It is not difficult. There, when one does not stand by the measure, here, when one stands by the measure.

hebrew_text: דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָתָם קָא עָבֵיד כִּדְעָבְדִין בְּחוֹל, הָכָא לָא קָא עָבֵיד כִּדְעָבְדִין בְּחוֹל.
human_translation: between the Rabbis and the Rabbis, also not difficult. There, he is acting in a weekday manner, here, he is not acting in a weekday manner,
llm_translation: The scholars, the scholars, indeed it is not difficult: there he is doing as they do on a weekday, but here he is not doing as they do on a weekday.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: מַאי ״אֲבָל לֹא בְּמִדָּה״ — שֶׁלֹּא יִזְכּוֹר לוֹ שֵׁם מִדָּה, אֲבָל כְּלִי הַמְיוּחָד לְמִדָּה — יְמַלְּאֶנּוּ. וַאֲתָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְמֵימַר: כְּלִי הַמְיוּחָד לְמִדָּה — לֹא יְמַלְּאֶנּוּ.
human_translation: said: What is But not by measure? that he not mention to him the name of the measure. However, he fill a vessel designated for measuring. And Rabbi Yehuda comes to say: He not fill a vessel designated for measuring,
llm_translation: Rava said: What is meant by "but not with a measure"? — That his name should not be remembered with a measure, but a vessel designated for a measure — he may fill it. And Rabbi Yehuda came to say: A vessel designated for a measure — he may not fill it.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא גַּבֵּי שִׂמְחַת יוֹם טוֹב רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְחוּמְרָא וְרַבָּנַן לְקוּלָּא? וְהָא אִפְּכָא שָׁמְעִינַן לְהוּ! דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שׁוֹקֵל אָדָם בָּשָׂר כְּנֶגֶד הַכְּלִי וּכְנֶגֶד הַקּוֹפִיץ, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מַשְׁגִּיחִין בְּכַף מֹאזְנַיִם כׇּל עִיקָּר. אַלְמָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְקוּלָּא וְרַבָּנַן לְחוּמְרָא. קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן!
human_translation: Apparently, with regard to the joy of the Festival, Rabbi Yehuda is stringent, and the Rabbis are lenient. But didn’t we hear them the opposite, as we learned Rabbi Yehuda says: A person weigh meat against a vessel or against a cleaver, and the Rabbis say: One not look at the pans of a scale at all? Apparently, Rabbi Yehuda is lenient, while the Rabbis are stringent. there is a contradiction between Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yehuda, a contradiction between the Rabbis and the Rabbis.
llm_translation: The matter of regarding the joy of a festival, Rabbi Yehuda is stringent, and the Rabbis are lenient? But behold, we have heard the opposite! For it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: One weighs meat against the utensil and against the knife, and the Sages say: We do not pay attention to the weight of the scales at all. Thus, Rabbi Yehuda is lenient and the Rabbis are stringent. The difficulty of Rabbi Yehuda is according to Rabbi Yehuda, and the difficulty of the Rabbis is according to the Rabbis!

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָתָם בְּשֶׁאֵינוֹ מְיוּחָד לְמִדָּה, הָכָא מְיוּחָד לְמִדָּה. דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָתָם קָא עָבֵיד כִּדְעָבְדִין בְּחוֹל, הָכָא לָא קָעָבֵיד כִּדְעָבְדִין בְּחוֹל, דְּעָבְדִי אִינָשֵׁי דִּמְקָרְבִי חַמְרָא בְּמָנָא דְכִילָא וְשָׁתוּ.
human_translation: between Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yehuda, not difficult. There, with that is not designated for measuring, here, is designated for measuring, between the Rabbis and the Rabbis, also not difficult. There, he is acting in a weekday manner, here, he is not acting in a weekday manner, as people are accustomed to offer wine in a measuring utensil and drink.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda: It is not difficult. There, when it is not designated for a specific purpose, here it is designated for a specific purpose. The Rabbis said in the name of the Rabbis: It is also not difficult. There, he is doing as people do on a weekday, here he is not doing as people do on a weekday, for people who are accustomed to mix wine with hot water and drink.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל בֶּן בָּטְנִית. תָּנָא: אַף בַּמּוֹעֵד עוֹשֶׂה כֵּן מִפְּנֵי בִּטּוּל בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ.
human_translation: an incident involving Abba Shaul ben Botnit, taught He would do this even on a Festival, in order to dereliction the study hall.
llm_translation: The story of Abba Saul the son of Botnit. It was taught: He would even do so on a festival because of the neglect of the study hall.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הוּא כָּנַס שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת גַּרְבֵי יַיִן מִבֵּרוּרֵי הַמִּדּוֹת, וַחֲבֵרָיו כָּנְסוּ שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת גַּרְבֵי שֶׁמֶן מִמִּצּוּי הַמִּדּוֹת, וֶהֱבִיאוּם לִפְנֵי הַגִּזְבָּרִים לִירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: The Sages taught collected three hundred earthenware jugs of wine, due to the clarity of the measures, And his colleagues, collected three hundred earthenware jugs of oil, due to the draining of the measures; And they brought to Jerusalem before the treasurers,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: He brought in three hundred barrels of wine from the clarified measurements, and his companions brought in three hundred barrels of oil from the found measurements, and they brought them before the treasurers in Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם: אִי אַתֶּם זְקוּקִים לְכָךְ. אָמְרוּ לָהֶם: אַף אָנוּ אֵין רְצוֹנֵנוּ בְּכָךְ.
human_translation: said to them: You need not do this, They said to them: we too do not wish from this,
llm_translation: They said to them: "You are not needed for this." They said to them: "Even we, our will is not in this."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם: הוֹאִיל וְהֶחְמַרְתֶּם עַל עַצְמְכֶם — עֲשׂוּ מֵהֶם צׇרְכֵי רַבִּים. דְּתַנְיָא: גָּזַל וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ מִמִּי גָּזַל — יַעֲשֶׂה בָּהֶם צׇרְכֵי רַבִּים. מַאי נִינְהוּ? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בּוֹרוֹת, שִׁיחִין וּמְעָרוֹת.
human_translation: said to them: Since you are stringent with yourselves, use for communal needs. As it is taught stole and does not know from whom he stole, he use for communal needs, What are Rav Ḥisda said: cisterns, ditches, and caves,
llm_translation: They said to them: Since you have caused distress to yourselves — make from them many needs. As it was taught: One who steals and does not know from whom he stole — should make from them many needs. What are they? Rav Ḥisdah said: Wells, ditches, and caves.

hebrew_text: אַדְבְּרֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַבָּנָא עוּקְבָא, וּדְרַשׁ: לֹא יִמְדּוֹד אָדָם שְׂעוֹרִים וְיִתֵּן לִפְנֵי בְּהֶמְתּוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אֲבָל קוֹדֵר הוּא קַב אוֹ קַבִּים וְנוֹתֵן לִפְנֵי בְּהֶמְתּוֹ, וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ. וְהַנַּחְתּוֹם מוֹדֵד תַּבְלִין וְנוֹתֵן לְתוֹךְ קְדֵרָתוֹ, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יַקְדִּיחַ תַּבְשִׁילוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda authorized Rabbana Ukva and he taught A person not measure barley and place before his animal on a Festival, but he cut out [ koder ] kav or two kav , and place before his animal, and he need not be concerned And a baker measure spices and put them in his pot, so as not to spoil his dish,
llm_translation: The words of Rav Ḥisdah to Ravanna Ukva, and he expounded: A person should not sift barley and place it before his animal on a festival day, but he may measure out a kab or two kabs and place it before his animal, and he need not be concerned. And one may measure out spices and place them into his pot, so that his dish does not spoil.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: מוֹדֶדֶת אִשָּׁה קֶמַח בְּיוֹם טוֹב וְנוֹתֶנֶת לְתוֹךְ עִיסָּתָהּ כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּטּוֹל חַלָּה בְּעַיִן יָפָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אָסוּר. וְהָא תָּנָא דְּבֵי שְׁמוּאֵל, מוּתָּר!
human_translation: Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said Rav said: A woman measure flour on a Festival and put it into her dough in order to separate ḥalla generously, And Shmuel said: is prohibited, But didn’t of the school of Shmuel teach is permitted?
llm_translation: Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said in the name of Rav: A woman may measure flour on a festival and place it into her dough in order to take out a beautiful loaf. But Shmuel said: It is forbidden. And the Tanna of the school of Shmuel taught: It is permitted!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל אָסוּר, וְתָנָא דְּבֵי שְׁמוּאֵל מוּתָּר,
human_translation: Abaye said: Now that Shmuel said is prohibited and of the school of Shmuel taught is permitted,
llm_translation: Abaye said: "Now that Shmuel said it is forbidden, and the Mishnah of the school of Shmuel says it is permitted,"

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל — הֲלָכָה לְמַעֲשֶׂה אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן.
human_translation: Shmuel came to teach us the practical halakha .
llm_translation: Shmuel - halakhah lema'aseh ata le'ashmo'inan.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין שׁוֹנִין קֶמַח בְּיוֹם טוֹב. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי פַּפְּיָיס וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָא אָמְרוּ: שׁוֹנִין. וְשָׁוִין שֶׁאִם נָפַל לְתוֹכָן צְרוֹר אוֹ קֵיסָם, שֶׁשּׁוֹנִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught One not flour a second time on a Festival, They said in the name of Rabbi Papeyyas and Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira: One a second time. However, they agree that if a pebble or a wood chip fell into a second time
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One may not sift flour on a festival. Due to the opinion of Rabbi Pappayas and Rabbi Yehudah ben Betera who said: One may sift. And they agree that if a pebble or a chip fell into it, one may sift.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבִינָא: אֵין שׁוֹנִין קֶמַח בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אֲבָל נָפַל צְרוֹר אוֹ קֵיסָם — בּוֹרֵר בְּיָדוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן דְּאָסוּר, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ כְּבוֹרֵר.
human_translation: A tanna taught before Ravina: One not flour a second time on a Festival, but a pebble or a wood chip fell he remove it with his hand. said to him: All the more so prohibited, as it is similar to selecting.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Ravina: One may not sift flour on a festival, but if a clod or pebble falls in it, one may sift it with his hand. He said to him: All the more so when it is forbidden, for it becomes like sifting.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא זוּטֵי אַפִּתְחָא דִנְהַרְדְּעָא: שׁוֹנִין קֶמַח בְּיוֹם טוֹב. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב נַחְמָן: פּוּקוּ וֶאֱמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְאַבָּא: שְׁקִילָא טֵיבוּתָךְ וְשַׁדְיָ[א] אַחִזְרֵי, פּוֹק חֲזִי כַּמָּה מַהוֹלָתָא הַדְרָן בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא.
human_translation: Rava bar Rav Huna the Short taught at the entrance to Neharde’a: One flour a second time on a Festival. Rav Naḥman said to Go out and say to Abba, Your good has been removed and cast upon thorns, Go out and see how many sieves circulate in Neharde’a,
llm_translation: Rava son of Rav Huna expounded at the entrance of Nehardea: We knead dough on a festival. Rav Nachman said to them: Go out and tell it to Abba: Take your spice box and return, go out and see how many boats are returning in Nehardea.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵיתְהוּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף נָהֲלָא קִמְחָא אַגַּבָּא דְּמַהוֹלְתָּא. אֲמַר לַהּ: חֲזַי, דַּאֲנָא רִפְתָּא מְעַלַּיְתָא בָּעֵינָא. דְּבֵיתְהוּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי נָהֲלָא קִמְחָא אַגַּבָּא דְּפָתוּרָא. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הָא דִּידַן, בְּרַתֵּיה דְּרָמֵי בַּר חָמָא, וְרָמֵי בַּר חָמָא מָרָא דְעוֹבָדָא הֲוָה, וְאִי לָאו דַּחֲזַאי מִבֵּי נָשָׁא לָא הֲוָה עָבְדָא.
