human_translation: Rav Yosef’s wife was sifting flour on the reverse of a sieve. He said to her: Look, I want good-quality bread, Rav Ashi’s wife was sifting flour onto a table, Rav Ashi said: This of ours, the daughter of Rami bar Ḥama, and Rami bar Ḥama is a master of deeds Had not observed in her father’s house, she would not have acted
llm_translation: The household of Rav Yosef managed the flour in the upper chamber of the mill. He said to her: See, I need fine flour. The household of Rav Ashi managed the flour in the lower chamber of the mill. Rav Ashi said: Our daughter, the son of a hot bath attendant, and the son of a hot bath attendant was a master of the craft, and if not for the fact that he was seen by women, he would not have worked.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הוֹלֵךְ אָדָם אֵצֶל חֶנְוָנִי הָרָגִיל אֶצְלוֹ וְאוֹמֵר לוֹ: תֵּן לִי בֵּיצִים וֶאֱגוֹזִים בְּמִנְיָן, שֶׁכֵּן דֶּרֶךְ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת לִהְיוֹת מוֹנֶה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: A person go to a grocer whom he is accustomed and say to him: Give me eggs and nuts of a number, as it is the manner of a homeowner to count in his house.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A person may go to the store of Chenvani who is accustomed to him, and say to him: "Give me eggs and nuts in a specific quantity, for it is the way of the homeowner to have a store within his house."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הוֹלֵךְ אָדָם אֵצֶל רוֹעֶה הָרָגִיל אֶצְלוֹ וְאוֹמֵר לוֹ: תֵּן לִי גְּדִי אֶחָד אוֹ טָלֶה אֶחָד. אֵצֶל טַבָּח הָרָגִיל אֶצְלוֹ וְאוֹמֵר לוֹ: תֵּן לִי כַּף אַחַת אוֹ יָרֵךְ אַחַת. אֵצֶל פַּטָּם הָרָגִיל אֶצְלוֹ וְאוֹמֵר לוֹ: תֵּן לִי תּוֹר אֶחָד אוֹ גּוֹזָל אֶחָד. אֵצֶל נַחְתּוֹם הָרָגִיל אֶצְלוֹ וְאוֹמֵר לוֹ: תֵּן לִי כִּכָּר אֶחָד אוֹ גְּלוּסְקָא אַחַת.
human_translation: The Sages taught A person go to a shepherd whom he is accustomed and say to him: Give me one kid, or one lamb. to a butcher whom he is accustomed and say to him: Give me one foreleg or one thigh. one who deals in fattened whom he is accustomed and say to him: Give me one dove or one pigeon. a baker whom he is accustomed and say to him: Give me one loaf or one cake [ geluska ].
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If a person goes to a shepherd who is accustomed to him and says to him: Give me one kid or one lamb. If he goes to a butcher who is accustomed to him and says to him: Give me one handful or one thigh. If he goes to a poultry dealer who is accustomed to him and says to him: Give me one ox or one young goat. If he goes to a baker who is accustomed to him and says to him: Give me one loaf or one cake.

hebrew_text: וְאֵצֶל חֶנְוָנִי הָרָגִיל אֶצְלוֹ וְאוֹמֵר לוֹ: תֵּן לִי עֶשְׂרִים בֵּיצִים, אוֹ חֲמִשִּׁים אֱגוֹזִים, עֲשָׂרָה אֲפַרְסְקִין, וַחֲמִשָּׁה רִמּוֹנִים וְאֶתְרוֹג אֶחָד. וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַזְכִּיר לוֹ סְכוּם מִדָּה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַזְכִּיר לוֹ סְכוּם מִקָּח.
human_translation: And to a grocer whom he is accustomed and say to him: Give me twenty eggs, or fifty nuts, ten peaches, or five pomegranates, or one etrog , provided that he does not mention any measure. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: provided that he does not mention the amount of purchase,
llm_translation: And with Chenvani, the regular one by him, and says to him: Give me twenty eggs, or fifty walnuts, ten apricots, and five pomegranates and one etrog. And specifically not to mention to him a total amount. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: And specifically not to mention to him a total amount of purchase.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אֵין צָדִין
llm_translation: We will return to you, we do not judge.

hebrew_text: הַמֵּבִיא כַּדֵּי יַיִן מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם — לֹא יְבִיאֵם בְּסַל וּבְקוּפָּה, אֲבָל מֵבִיא הוּא עַל כְּתֵפוֹ אוֹ לְפָנָיו. וְכֵן הַמּוֹלִיךְ אֶת הַתֶּבֶן — לֹא יַפְשִׁיל אֶת הַקּוּפָּה לַאֲחוֹרָיו, אֲבָל מְבִיאָהּ הוּא בְּיָדוֹ. וּמַתְחִילִין
human_translation: One who brings wine jugs from place to place may not bring them in a basket or in a tub but he may bring on his shoulder or in front of himself. Similarly, one who brings straw may not place the tub behind him but he may transport it in his hand, And one may begin
llm_translation: One who brings a measure of wine from place to place - he should not bring them in a basket or in a pitcher, but he brings it on his shoulder or in front of him. And similarly, one who leads the straw - he should not drag the pitcher behind him, but he brings it in his hand. And we begin.

hebrew_text: בַּעֲרֵמַת הַתֶּבֶן, אֲבָל לֹא בָּעֵצִים שֶׁבַּמּוּקְצֶה.
human_translation: from the pile of straw, but one may not the wood in the storage,
llm_translation: In the heap of straw, but not in the wood that is designated for kindling.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: אִם אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְשַׁנּוֹת — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: taught If it is impossible to modify it is permitted
llm_translation: Gemara: Tana: If impossible to change - permitted.

hebrew_text: אַתְקִין רָבָא בְּמָחוֹזָא: דְּדָרוּ בְּדוּחְקָא — לִדְרוֹ בְּרִגְלָא. דְּדָרוּ בְּרִגְלָא — לִדְרוֹ בְּאַגְרָא. דְּדָרוּ בְּאַגְרָא — לִדְרוֹ בְּאַכְפָּא. דְּדָרוּ בְּאַכְפָּא — נִפְרוֹס סוּדָרָא עִלָּוֵיהּ, וְאִם לָא אֶפְשָׁר — שְׁרֵי. דְּאָמַר מָר: אִם אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְשַׁנּוֹת — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rava instituted in Meḥoza: who carries with difficulty should carry it on a pitchfork. who carries it on a pitchfork should carry it on a carrying pole who carries it on a carrying pole should carry it in his hands, who carries in his hands should spread a scarf [ sudara ] over it. And if it is not possible it is permitted the Master said above: If it is impossible to modify, it is permitted.
llm_translation: Rava established in his town: If one can live in a narrow place - live in a narrow place. If one can live in a large place - live in a large place. If one can live in a city - live in a city. If one can live in a village - spread out a mat for him, and if not possible - let him leave. For the Master said: If it is not possible to change, it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חָנָן בַּר רָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אֲמוּר רַבָּנַן כַּמָּה דְּאֶפְשָׁר לְשַׁנּוֹיֵי מְשַׁנֵּינַן בְּיוֹמָא טָבָא. וְהָא הָנֵי נְשֵׁי דְּקָא מָלְיָין חַצְבַיְיהוּ מַיָּא בְּיוֹמָא טָבָא, וְלָא קָא מְשַׁנְּיָין, וְלָא אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי!
human_translation: Rav Ḥanan bar Rava said to Rav Ashi: The Sages said: As much as it is possible to modify one should modify on a Festival. But don’t those women fill their jugs with water on a Festival without modifying, and we say nothing to them
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Hanan bar Rava said to Rav Ashi: Say, sages, as much as it is possible to change, we study on a good day. But those women who fill their pitchers with water on a good day, and do not study, we do not say to them, and not immediately!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר. הֵיכָא לֶיעְבַּד? דְּמָלְיָא בְּחַצְבָּא רַבָּה תִּמְלֵי בְּחַצְבָּא זוּטָא — קָא מַפְּשָׁא בְּהִלּוּכָא.
human_translation: He said to him: because it is not possible How should they act? who filling a large jug, should fill a small jug? she increases walking,
llm_translation: He said to him: Because it is not possible. Where should it be done? If the large jug is filled with a large jug and the small jug is filled with a small jug - it is evident in the walking.

hebrew_text: דְּמָלְיָא בְּחַצְבָּא זוּטָא תִּמְלֵי בְּחַצְבָּא רַבָּה — קָא מַפְּשָׁא בְּמַשּׂוֹי. תְּכַסְּיֵיהּ בְּנִכְתְּמָא — זִמְנִין דְּנָפֵיל וְאָתֵי לְאֵתוֹיֵי. תִּקְטְרֵיהּ — זִמְנִין דְּמִפְּסִיק וְאָתֵי לְמִקְטְרֵיהּ. תִּפְרוֹס סוּדָרָא עִלָּוֵיהּ — זִמְנִין דְּמִטְּמִישׁ בְּמַיָּא וְאָתֵי לִידֵי סְחִיטָה. הִלְכָּךְ לָא אֶפְשָׁר.
human_translation: that one who fills a small jug should fill a large jug, she increases load? she should cover with cover, sometimes falls and she might come to bring it Should she tie occasionally break, and she might come to tie it, should she spread a scarf over it, occasionally becomes soaked in water, and she might come to squeezing. Therefore, it is not possible
llm_translation: The basket is full of small fish, the basket is full of large fish - it is causing a disturbance in the market. Cover it with a lid - sometimes it falls and comes to be used. Burn it - sometimes it goes out and comes to be burned again. Spread a cloth over it - sometimes it gets soaked in water and comes to be used for slaughter. Therefore, it is not permissible.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא בַּר רַב חָנִין לְאַבָּיֵי, תְּנַן: אֵין מְטַפְּחִין וְאֵין מְסַפְּקִין וְאֵין מְרַקְּדִין, וְהָאִידָּנָא דְּקָא חָזֵינַן דְּעָבְדָן הָכִי, וְלָא אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי?
human_translation: Rava bar Rav Ḥanin said to Abaye: We learned one may not clap, nor strike nor dance But nowadays we see that do so, and we do not say anything to them.
llm_translation: Rava son of Rav Hanin said to Abbaye, we learned: one does not clap, one does not snap, and one does not dance. But now that we see them doing so, should we not say anything to them?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּלְטַעְמָךְ הָא דְּאָמַר (רָבָא): לָא לֵיתֵיב אִינִישׁ אַפּוּמָּא דְלִחְיָא, דִּלְמָא מִגַּנְדַּר לֵיהּ חֵפֶץ וְאָתֵי לְאֵתוֹיֵי (אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים), וְהָא הָנֵי נְשֵׁי דְּשָׁקְלָן חַצְבַיְיהוּ, וְאָזְלָן וְיָתְבָן אַפּוּמָּא דִמְבוֹאָה, וְלָא אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי!
human_translation: He said to him: And according to your reasoning, that Rava said: A person should not sit at the entrance the side post perhaps an object roll from him and he will come to carry it four cubits in the public domain, But don’t these women take their jugs, and go, and sit at the entrance to an alleyway, and we do not say anything to them?
llm_translation: He said to him: And according to your reasoning, this that Rava said: A person should not sit at the entrance of a wine shop, lest he be enticed by his desire and come to transgress (four cubits in a public domain), but these women who took their spindle rods, went and sat at the entrance of the alley, and we did not say anything to them!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הַנַּח לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, מוּטָב שֶׁיִּהְיוּ שׁוֹגְגִין וְאַל יִהְיוּ מְזִידִין. הָכָא נָמֵי: הַנַּח לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, מוּטָב שֶׁיִּהְיוּ שׁוֹגְגִין וְאַל יִהְיוּ מְזִידִין.
human_translation: Rather, Leave Jews it is better that they be unwitting sinners and not be intentional sinners. Here, too, leave Jews it is better that they be unwitting sinners and not be intentional sinners.
llm_translation: Rather: Leave for them to Israel, better that they be unintentional and not intentional. Here it is stated: Leave for them to Israel, better that they be unintentional and not intentional.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי בִּדְרַבָּנַן, אֲבָל בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא — לָא. וְלָא הִיא, לָא שְׁנָא בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא וְלָא שְׁנָא בִּדְרַבָּנַן, לָא אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי, דְּהָא תּוֹסֶפֶת יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הוּא, וְאָכְלִי וְשָׁתוּ עַד שֶׁחָשְׁכָה, וְלָא אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי.
human_translation: this applies only to rabbinic but Torah However, this is not so; no different by Torah or by rabbinic we do not say anything to them. that the extension of Yom Kippur. is by Torah and eat and drink until darkness but we do not say anything to them,
llm_translation: These are matters according to the Rabbis, but according to the Torah - no. And it is not so, it is not different in the Torah and not different in the Rabbis, we do not say to them "and not immediately," for the additional day of Yom Kippur is from the Torah, and they may eat and drink until it gets dark, and we do not say to them "and not immediately."

hebrew_text: וּמַתְחִילִין בַּעֲרֵמַת הַתֶּבֶן. אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, מַתְחִילִין בָּאוֹצָר תְּחִלָּה. מַנִּי — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּלֵית לֵיהּ מוּקְצֶה.
human_translation: And one may begin from the pile of straw. Rav Kahana said: That is to say one may begin from a storeroom ab initio . whose It is Rabbi Shimon, who is not set-aside [ muktze ].
llm_translation: And we begin with a pile of bricks. Rav Kahana said: This means, we begin with the treasury first. Who is the authority? Rabbi Shimon, for he does not hold of Muktzeh.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: אֲבָל לֹא בָּעֵצִים שֶׁבַּמּוּקְצֶה. אֲתָאן לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאִית לֵיהּ מוּקְצֶה! הָכָא בְּאַרְזֵי וְאַשּׁוּחֵי עָסְקִינַן, דְּמוּקְצֶה מֵחֲמַת חֶסְרוֹן כִּיס, וַאֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מוֹדֶה.
human_translation: Say the latter clause But not wood in the storage. we have come to Rabbi Yehuda, who is muktze . Here, we are dealing with cedars and firs, muktze due to monetary loss. even Rabbi Shimon concedes
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: aval lo ba'etzim shebamuqtzeh. Atan leRabbi Yehudah, de'it leih muqtzeh! Hacha be'arzei ve'ashuḥei askeinan, de'muqtzeh mechamat ḥesron kis, va'afilu Rabbi Shimon modeh." English translation: "The Gemara asks: But not with wood from the woodpile. The Gemara answers: We come to Rabbi Yehudah, who holds that there is a woodpile! Here we are dealing with cedar and cypress trees, which are set aside due to a loss of money, and even Rabbi Shimon agrees."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַסֵּיפָא: אֲבָל לֹא בָּעֵצִים שֶׁבַּמּוּקְצֶה. אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, אֵין מַתְחִילִין בָּאוֹצָר תְּחִלָּה. מַנִּי — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאִית לֵיהּ מוּקְצֶה. אֵימָא רֵישָׁא: מַתְחִילִין בַּעֲרֵמַת הַתֶּבֶן, אֲתָאן לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּלֵית לֵיהּ מוּקְצֶה! הָתָם בְּתִבְנָא סַרְיָא.
human_translation: There are who taught to the latter clause But not wood from the storage Rav Kahana said: That is to say one may not begin from a storeroom ab initio . whose It is Rabbi Yehuda, who muktze . Say the first clause one may begin from the pile of straw. we have come to Rabbi Shimon, who is not muktze . There, with straw and become rancid.
llm_translation: There is one who teaches her in the latter part: but not with wood from the woodpile. Rav Kahana said: this means, we do not begin with the treasury first. Who is the Tanna? It is Rabbi Yehuda, who holds of muktzeh. Let us say the beginning: we begin with a woodpile, coming to Rabbi Shimon who does not hold of muktzeh! There, it is with a pile of stones.

hebrew_text: תִּבְנָא סַרְיָא, הָא חֲזֵי לְטִינָא! דְּאִית בֵּיהּ קוֹצִים.
human_translation: Isn’t rancid straw fit for clay that has thorns,
llm_translation: The building of Sarai, behold, it is like clay! For it has thorns within it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין נוֹטְלִין עֵצִים מִן הַסּוּכָּה, אֶלָּא מִן הַסָּמוּךְ לָהּ.
human_translation: One may not take wood from a sukka but from near it.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One may not take wood from the Sukkah, but only from that which is adjacent to it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי שְׁנָא מִן הַסּוּכָּה דְּלָא — דְּקָא סָתַר אֻהְלָא, מִן הַסָּמוּךְ לָהּ נָמֵי — קָא סָתַר אֻהְלָא?
human_translation: what is different? from the sukka not one dismantles a tent, from near it, too, he dismantle a tent?
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the difference between a sukkah that is not valid because it is blocking a tent, and one that is adjacent to it - is it blocking a tent?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מַאי סָמוּךְ — סָמוּךְ לַדְּפָנוֹת. רַב מְנַשְּׁיָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בְּשֶׁאֵין סָמוּךְ לַדְּפָנוֹת, כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא — בְּאִסּוּרְיָיתָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: What is Near it? near the walls. Rav Menashya said: Even you say to where is not near the walls when that was taught, it was to bundles
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: What is "samuch" - close to the walls. Rav Menashya said: Even if you say that it is not close to the walls, for it was taught in a Mishnah - in a case of prohibition.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין נוֹטְלִין עֵצִים מִן הַסּוּכָּה אֶלָּא מִן הַסָּמוּךְ לָהּ, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר. וְשָׁוִין בְּסוּכַּת הַחַג בֶּחָג — שֶׁאֲסוּרָה. וְאִם הִתְנָה עָלֶיהָ — הַכֹּל לְפִי תְנָאוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef taught before Rabbi Yoḥanan: One may not take wood from the sukka but from the nearby And Rabbi Shimon permits And agree, to the sukka festival during the Festival it is prohibited But if one stipulated with regard to it all according to his stipulation.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef related before Rabbi Yochanan: One may not take wood from the sukkah except from that which is adjacent to it, and Rabbi Shimon permits it. And they are equal in a festival sukkah on the festival - that it is prohibited. And if one made a stipulation regarding it - everything is according to his stipulation.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר? וְהָא קָא סָתַר אֻהְלָא! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הָכָא בְּסוּכָּה נוֹפֶלֶת עָסְקִינַן, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּלֵית לֵיהּ מוּקְצֶה. דְּתַנְיָא: מוֹתַר הַשֶּׁמֶן שֶׁבַּנֵּר וְשֶׁבַּקְּעָרָה — אָסוּר. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon permit But isn’t one dismantling a tent, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Here, we are dealing with a sukka collapsed. And Rabbi Shimon to his reasoning, as he is not muktze , as it is taught the remainder of the oil in a lamp or in a bowl is prohibited And Rabbi Shimon permits
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon permits? But he is covering the tent! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Here we are dealing with a fallen sukkah, and Rabbi Shimon follows his reasoning, that there is no muktzeh. As it was taught: The oil in the lamp and in the bowl - forbidden. And Rabbi Shimon permits.

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם אָדָם יוֹשֵׁב וּמְצַפֶּה אֵימָתַי תִּכְבֶּה נֵרוֹ, הָכָא אָדָם יוֹשֵׁב וּמְצַפֶּה אֵימָתַי תִּפּוֹל סוּכָּתוֹ?
human_translation: Is it comparable? There, a person sits and anticipates when his lamp will be extinguished. Here, a person sits and anticipates when his sukka will fall?
llm_translation: Who is comparable? There, a person sits and waits for when his lamp will go out. Here, a person sits and waits for when his sukkah will fall?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הָכָא בְּסוּכָּה רְעוּעָה עָסְקִינַן, דְּמֵאֶתְמוֹל דַּעְתֵּיהּ עִלָּוַהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Here, we are dealing with a sukka not sturdy, as from yesterday, one had his mind on it.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said: Here we are dealing with a shaky sukkah, for his mind was preoccupied yesterday.

hebrew_text: וְשָׁוִין בְּסוּכַּת הֶחָג בֶּחָג שֶׁהִיא אֲסוּרָה, וְאִם הִתְנָה עָלֶיהָ — הַכֹּל לְפִי תְנָאוֹ. וּמִי מַהֲנֵי בַּהּ תְּנַאי?
human_translation: All agree with regard to the sukka festival during the Festival it is prohibited but if one stipulated with regard to it, all according to his condition. And is a condition effective with it?
llm_translation: And they are equal in the sukkah of the festival on the festival which is forbidden, and if one made a condition upon it - everything according to his stipulation. And who is the Tanna that holds by this stipulation?

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מִנַּיִן לַעֲצֵי סוּכָּה שֶׁאֲסוּרִין כׇּל שִׁבְעָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חַג הַסּוּכּוֹת שִׁבְעַת יָמִים לַה׳״, וְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָא אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁכְּשֵׁם שֶׁחָל שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם עַל הַחֲגִיגָה, כָּךְ חָל שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם עַל הַסּוּכָּה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״חַג הַסּוּכּוֹת שִׁבְעַת יָמִים לַה׳״, מָה חַג לַה׳ — אַף סוּכָּה לַה׳.
human_translation: But didn’t Rav Sheshet say in the name of Rabbi Akiva: From where that the wood of a sukka prohibited all seven as it is stated: “The festival of Sukkot to the Lord, seven days” And it is taught Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: From where that just as the name of Heaven takes effect upon the Festival peace-offering, so too, does the name of Heaven take effect upon the sukka ? The verse states: “The festival of Sukkot to the Lord, seven days” Just as the Festival to the Lord, so too, the sukka to the Lord.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: And Rav Sheshet said in the name of Rabbi Akiva: From where do we derive that the branches of a sukkah that are forbidden throughout the entire seven days of the festival? As it is stated: "The festival of Sukkot shall be for seven days to the Lord" (Leviticus 23:41). And it was taught in a baraita that Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: From where do we derive that just as the name of Heaven is pronounced over the festival offering, so too, the name of Heaven is pronounced over the sukkah? The verse states: "The festival of Sukkot shall be for seven days to the Lord" (Leviticus 23:41). Just as the festival is for the sake of the Lord, so too, the sukkah is for the sake of the Lord.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מְנַשְּׁיָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: סֵיפָא אֲתָאן לְסוּכָּה דְעָלְמָא, אֲבָל סוּכָּה דְמִצְוָה — לָא מַהֲנֵי בַּהּ תְּנָאָה.
human_translation: Rav Menashya, son of Rava, said: the latter clause, we have arrived at a regular sukka , but a sukka of mitzva, a condition is not effective with regard to it.
llm_translation: Rav Menashya, son of Rava, said: The latter part we come to a sukkah of the world, but a sukkah of mitzvah does not fulfill with it a condition.

hebrew_text: וְסוּכָּה דְּמִצְוָה לָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: סִכְּכָהּ כְּהִלְכָתָהּ וְעִטְּרָהּ בִּקְרָמִים וּבִסְדִינִין הַמְצוּיָּירִין, וְתָלָה בָּהּ אֱגוֹזִים שְׁקֵדִים אֲפַרְסְקִים וְרִמּוֹנִים וּפַרְכִּילֵי עֲנָבִים, יֵינוֹת שְׁמָנִים וּסְלָתוֹת וְעַטְרוֹת שִׁבֳּלִים — אָסוּר לְהִסְתַּפֵּק מֵהֶן עַד מוֹצָאֵי יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁל חַג. וְאִם הִתְנָה עֲלֵיהֶם — הַכֹּל לְפִי תְנָאוֹ.
human_translation: And is not a sukka of mitzva? But isn’t it taught one roofed in accordance with its halakha , and decorated it with embroidered and with patterned sheets, and hung on it nuts, almonds, peaches, pomegranates, and vines [ parkilei ], of grapes wine, oil, and flour, and wreaths of ears of corn it is prohibited to derive benefit until the conclusion of the last Festival day. But if one stipulated with regard to them all according to his condition.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is a sukkah of mitzvah not? And it was taught: One should cover it according to its law, and adorn it with vines and with colored sheets, and hang on it walnuts, almonds, pistachios, and pomegranates, and clusters of grapes, wines, oils, and fine flours, and crowns of grains — it is forbidden to benefit from them until the end of the last day of the festival. And if one made a stipulation regarding them — everything according to his stipulation.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: בְּאוֹמֵר אֵינִי בּוֹדֵל מֵהֶם כׇּל בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת, דְּלָא חָלָה קְדוּשָּׁה עֲלַיְיהוּ. אֲבָל עֲצֵי סוּכָּה, דְּחָלָה קְדוּשָּׁה עֲלַיְיהוּ — אִתַּקְצַאי לְשִׁבְעָה.
human_translation: Abaye and Rava, who both say where one says: I am not removing from them throughout twilight. no sanctity devolves upon them However, wood of a sukka , sanctity devolves upon it it set aside for seven
llm_translation: Abaye and Rava both said: When one says, "I am not separating from them at all between the suns," for holiness does not rest upon them. But with regard to the branches of a sukkah, for holiness does rest upon them — one must separate branches for seven days.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דְּאִתְּמַר: הִפְרִישׁ שִׁבְעָה אֶתְרוֹגִים לְשִׁבְעַת הַיָּמִים, אָמַר רַב: כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת יוֹצֵא בָּהּ וְאוֹכְלָהּ לְאַלְתַּר. וְרַב אַסִּי אָמַר: כׇּל אַחַת יוֹצֵא בָּהּ וְאוֹכְלָהּ לְמָחָר!
human_translation: And what different from that which was stated separated seven etrogim for the seven days, Rav said: He fulfills through each and every one and he may eat it immediately And Rav Asi said: He fulfills through each one, and he may eat it the following day,
llm_translation: And what is the difference from what was said: He designated seven etrogim for the seven days, Rav said: Each and every one goes out with it and eats it immediately. And Rav Assi said: Each one goes out with it and eats it the next day!

hebrew_text: הָתָם, דְּמַפְסְקוּ לֵילוֹת מִיָּמִים — כׇּל חַד וְחַד יוֹמָא מִצְוָה בְּאַפֵּי נַפְשֵׁיהּ הוּא. הָכָא, דְּלָא מַפְסְקוּ לֵילוֹת מִיָּמִים — כּוּלְּהוּ יוֹמֵי כַּחֲדָא יוֹמָא אֲרִיכְתָּא דָּמֵי.
human_translation: There, nights are divided from the days, each and every day is its own mitzva, here, where nights are not divided from the days, all days are considered as one long day.
llm_translation: There, that they separate nights from days - each and every day a commandment in itself. Here, that they do not separate nights from days - all of them, the days, are considered as one long day.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מְבִיאִין עֵצִים מִן הַשָּׂדֶה — מִן הַמְכוּנָּס, וּמִן הַקַּרְפֵּף — אֲפִילּוּ מִן הַמְפוּזָּר. אֵיזֶהוּ קַרְפֵּף — כׇּל שֶׁסָּמוּךְ לְעִיר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל שֶׁנִּכְנָסִין לוֹ בְּפוֹתַחַת, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּתוֹךְ תְּחוּם שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: One may bring wood from field, from that which has been gathered And from a karpef even from the scattered What is a karpef ? any that is near a city, the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: Any into which one enter with a key even within the Shabbat limit.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may bring wood from the field — from the courtyard, and from the roof — even from the scattered wood. What is considered a roof? Anything adjacent to a city, according to the words of Rabbi Yehudah. Rabbi Yosei says: Anything that people enter through an opening, even within the Sabbath boundary.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין מְבִיאִין עֵצִים אֶלָּא מִן הַמְכוּנָּסִין שֶׁבַּקַּרְפֵּף. וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: מִן הַקַּרְפֵּף — וַאֲפִילּוּ מִן הַמְפוּזָּרִים! מַתְנִיתִין יְחִידָאָה הִיא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: One may not bring wood except from gathered in a karpef . But didn’t we learn from a karpef , even from scattered The mishna an individual
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said, Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: One does not bring wood except from the prepared ones in the carpenter's shop. But didn't we learn: from the carpenter's shop — even from the scattered ones! It is a single Mishnah.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל הַמְפוּזָּרִים שֶׁבַּשָּׂדוֹת — שֶׁאֵין מְבִיאִין, וְעַל הַמְכוּנָּסִין שֶׁבַּקַּרְפֵּף — שֶׁמְּבִיאִין. עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — עַל הַמְפוּזָּרִים שֶׁבַּקַּרְפֵּף וְעַל הַמְכוּנָּסִין שֶׁבַּשָּׂדוֹת, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יָבִיא, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: יָבִיא.
human_translation: as it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree with regard to scattered in fields that one may not bring nor with regard to gathered in a karpef that one may bring With regard to what did they disagree? with regard to scattered in a karpef and gathered in fields, as Beit Shammai say: He may not bring and Beit Hillel say: He may bring
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree regarding the scattered sheaves in the fields - that they should not bring them, and regarding the gathered sheaves in the stack - that they should bring them. What did they disagree about? They disagreed about the scattered sheaves in the stack and the gathered sheaves in the fields. Beit Shammai says: Do not bring them, and Beit Hillel says: Bring them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: עֲלֵי קָנִים וַעֲלֵי גְפָנִים, אַף עַל גַּב דִּמְכַנְּפִי לְהוּ וּמוֹתְבִי, כֵּיוָן דְּאִי מִדְּלֵי זִיקָא מְבַדַּר לְהוּ — כִּמְפוּזָּרִים דָּמוּ וַאֲסוּרִין. וְאִי אַתְנַח מָנָא מֵאֶתְמוֹל עֲלַיְיהוּ — שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: reed leaves and vine leaves, although they are gathered and placed since if a wind comes it will scatter them, are considered scattered and are prohibited. if one placed a vessel on them the day before it seems well
llm_translation: Rava said: Regarding reeds and grapevines, even though they are bent over and sitting, as long as the sap is still flowing to them - their produce is scattered and forbidden. But if you leave them from yesterday on them - their produce is good.

hebrew_text: אֵיזֶהוּ קַרְפֵּף וְכוּ׳. אִבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הֵיכִי קָאָמַר, כׇּל שֶׁסָּמוּךְ לָעִיר — וְהוּא דְּאִית לֵיהּ פּוֹתַחַת, וַאֲתָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְמֵימַר: כֵּיוָן דְּאִית לֵיהּ פּוֹתַחַת — אֲפִילּוּ בְּתוֹךְ תְּחוּם שַׁבָּת נָמֵי.
human_translation: What is a karpef ? A dilemma was raised before what is speaking? any that is near a city, provided that it has a key, and Rabbi Yosei comes to say: Since it has a key, even within the Shabbat limit also
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eizehu karpaf v'chu. Ibaya lehu: heichi ka'amar, kol she'samuch la'ir — v'hu d'it leih potachat, va'ata Rabbi Yosei l'meimar: keivan d'it leih potachat — afilu b'toch techum Shabbat namei." English translation: "Which is a karpaf and so forth. They asked: What is he saying, anyone that is adjacent to the city — and it has an opening, and Rabbi Yosei came to say: since it has an opening — even within the Shabbat boundary also."

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר: כׇּל שֶׁסָּמוּךְ לָעִיר — בֵּין דְּאִית לֵיהּ פּוֹתַחַת, בֵּין דְּלֵית לֵיהּ פּוֹתַחַת, וַאֲתָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְמֵימַר: אֲפִילּוּ בְּתוֹךְ תְּחוּם שַׁבָּת, וְדַוְקָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ פּוֹתַחַת, אֲבָל לֵית לֵיהּ פּוֹתַחַת — אֲפִילּוּ סָמוּךְ לָעִיר נָמֵי לָא.
human_translation: Or perhaps this is what is saying: Any that is near a city whether it has a key or does not have a key, and Rabbi Yosei comes to say: even within the Shabbat limit, but specifically if it has a key. However, if it does not have a key, even near a city also not
llm_translation: Or perhaps this is what he meant to say: Any place that is adjacent to a city—whether it has an entrance or does not have an entrance, and Rabbi Yosei came to say: Even within the Sabbath boundary, and specifically if it has an entrance, but if it does not have an entrance—even if it is adjacent to a city, it is not considered part of it.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מִדְּקָתָנֵי, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל שֶׁנִּכְנָסִין לוֹ בְּפוֹתַחַת — וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּתוֹךְ תְּחוּם שַׁבָּת, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי תַּרְתֵּי לְקוּלָּא קָאָמַר. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ. אָמַר רַב סַלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְהָקֵל.
human_translation: Come hear from that it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: Any into which one enters with a key, even within the Shabbat limit, learn from this Rabbi Yosei stated two as leniencies. learn from here Rav Salla said Rabbi Yirmeya said: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei as a leniency;
llm_translation: Come and hear: From the Mishnah, Rabbi Yosei says: Anyone whom it is permitted for him to enter through the opening — even within the Shabbat boundary, learn from it that Rabbi Yosei is expressing two leniencies. Learn from it. Rav Sala said that Rabbi Yirmeya said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei to be lenient.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין מְבַקְּעִין עֵצִים לֹא מִן הַקּוֹרוֹת וְלֹא מִן הַקּוֹרָה שֶׁנִּשְׁבְּרָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב. וְאֵין מְבַקְּעִין לֹא בְּקַרְדּוֹם וְלֹא בִּמְגֵרָה וְלֹא בְּמַגָּל, אֶלָּא בְּקוֹפִיץ.
human_translation: One may not chop wood neither from beams nor from a beam that broke on a Festival, And one may not chop neither with an ax, nor with a saw, nor with a sickle, Rather, one may with a cleaver.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not split wood, neither from beams nor from a beam that broke on a festival. And one may not split wood, neither with an axe, nor with a saw, nor with a sickle, but only with a hatchet.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְהָאָמְרַתְּ רֵישָׁא אֵין מְבַקְּעִין כְּלָל? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חַסּוֹרֵי מְחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: אֵין מְבַקְּעִין מִן הַסְּוָאר שֶׁל קוֹרוֹת, וְלֹא מִן הַקּוֹרָה שֶׁנִּשְׁבְּרָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב. אֲבָל מְבַקְּעִין מִן הַקּוֹרָה שֶׁנִּשְׁבְּרָה מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: But didn’t you say in the first clause one may not chop at all Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: is incomplete and is teaching the following: One may not chop from the pile of beams nor from a beam that broke on the Festival However, one may chop from a beam that broke on the eve of the Festival,
llm_translation: Gemara: And the statement that initially we do not make any holes at all? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: This refers to boards that are lacking and thus it is taught: We do not make holes from the board of planks, nor from a beam that broke on a festival. But we may make holes from a beam that broke from the evening of the festival.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁהֵן מְבַקְּעִין — אֵין מְבַקְּעִין לֹא בְּקַרְדּוֹם וְלֹא בְּמַגָּל וְלֹא בִּמְגֵרָה, אֶלָּא בְּקוֹפִיץ. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אֵין מְבַקְּעִין עֵצִים לֹא מִן הַסְּוָאר שֶׁל קוֹרוֹת וְלֹא מִן הַקּוֹרָה שֶׁנִּשְׁבְּרָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב, לְפִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִן הַמּוּכָן.
human_translation: when one chops one may not chop neither with an ax, nor with a saw, nor with a sickle, but with a cleaver. This is also taught One may not chop wood, neither from the pile of beams nor from the beam that broke on the Festival as it is not considered prepared.
llm_translation: When they are splitting - they do not split with a saw, nor with a sickle, nor with a scythe, but with a hatchet. It was taught similarly: they do not split wood neither from the woodpile of beams nor from the beam that broke on a festival, because it is not prepared.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא בְּקַרְדּוֹם. אָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר שֶׁלֶמְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּנַקְבוּת שֶׁלּוֹ, אֲבָל בְּזַכְרוּת שֶׁלּוֹ — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: not with an ax. Rav Ḥinnana bar Shelemya said in the name of Rav: They taught only with its female But with its male is permitted
llm_translation: "And not in Kardom." Rav Chinana bar Shelamya said in the name of Rav: They only taught this restriction regarding its female animal, but regarding its male animal - it is permitted."

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, בְּקוֹפִיץ תְּנַן! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי קוֹפִיץ לְחוֹדֵיהּ, אֲבָל קַרְדּוֹם וְקוֹפִיץ, אֵימָא: מִגּוֹ דְּהַאי גִּיסָא אָסוּר — הַאי גִּיסָא נָמֵי אָסוּר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: It obvious we learned with a cleaver, lest you say: This applies only a cleaver, but an ax and a cleaver say: Since this side, is prohibited, the other, side, also prohibited. teaches us
llm_translation: The Gemara states: "Peshita, bekofitz tenan! Mahu d'teima: hanei milei kofitz lechodei, aval kardom vekofitz, eima: migo dehai gisa asur - hai gisa namei asur, ka mashma lan."

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַסֵּיפָא: אֶלָּא בְּקוֹפִיץ. אָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר שֶׁלֶמְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּזַכְרוּת שֶׁלּוֹ, אֲבָל בְּנַקְבוּת שֶׁלּוֹ — אָסוּר. פְּשִׁיטָא, וְלֹא בְּקַרְדּוֹם תְּנַן! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי קַרְדּוֹם, אֲבָל קוֹפִיץ וְקַרְדּוֹם, אֵימָא: מִגּוֹ דְּהַאי גִּיסָא שְׁרֵי — הַאי גִּיסָא נָמֵי שְׁרֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And some teach this to the latter clause Rather, with a cleaver. Rav Ḥinnana bar Shelemya said in the name of Rav: They taught only with its male but with its female it is prohibited. obvious. we learn not an ax? lest you say: This applies an ax, but an ax and a cleaver, say: Since this side, is permitted, the other, side also permitted. teaches us
llm_translation: There is one who teaches her in the latter part: rather with a kofitz. Rav Chinana bar Shelamya said in the name of Rav: They only taught with his male organ, but with his female organ - it is forbidden. It is obvious, and we learned not with a kardom! What might you say: those matters of kardom, but with a kofitz and kardom, say: from the fact that this case is permitted - this case is also permitted, this is what we can infer.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בַּיִת שֶׁהוּא מָלֵא פֵּירוֹת וְנִפְחַת — נוֹטֵל מִמְּקוֹם הַפְּחָת. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אַף פּוֹחֵת לְכַתְּחִלָּה וְנוֹטֵל.
human_translation: a house that is filled with produce and a hole formed one may remove through the place of the hole. Rabbi Meir says: One may even make a hole ab initio and take
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A house that is filled with produce and it bursts - one may take from the place of the burst. Rabbi Meir says: One may even initially diminish and take.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַמַּאי? וְהָא קָא סָתַר אֻהְלָא! אָמַר רַב נְחוּמִי בַּר אַדָּא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּאַוֵּירָא דְלִיבְנֵי. אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הָנֵי לִיבְנֵי דְּאִיַּיתּוּר מִבִּנְיָנָא — שְׁרֵי לְטַלְטוֹלִינְהוּ בְּשַׁבְּתָא, הוֹאִיל וַחֲזֵי לְמִזְגֵּא עֲלַיְיהוּ. שַׁרְגִינְהוּ — וַדַּאי אַקְצִינְהוּ!
human_translation: Why Isn’t dismantling a tent, Rav Naḥumi bar Adda said Shmuel said: to bricks one on top of the other [ aveira delivni ] Is that so? But didn’t Rav Naḥman say: these bricks remaining from a building, it is permitted to handle them on Shabbat, since they are fit to sit on; one arranged them he has certainly set them aside
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, why? And this is covering the tent! Rav Nachumi bar Adda said in the name of Shmuel: In the airspace of the bricks. Is it not so?! And didn't Rav Nachman say: Those bricks that are extra from the construction - it is permitted to move them on Shabbat, since it is seen as a burden on them. If they are detached - surely I will uproot them!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: בְּיוֹם טוֹב אָמְרוּ, אֲבָל לֹא בְּשַׁבָּת. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אַף פּוֹחֵת לְכַתְּחִלָּה וְנוֹטֵל. בְּיוֹם טוֹב אָמְרוּ, אֲבָל לֹא בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: On a Festival they said but not on Shabbat This was also taught Rabbi Meir says: One may even make a hole ab initio and remove they said a Festival, but not Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: On a festival they said, but not on Shabbat. It was taught similarly: Rabbi Meir says: Even less so to begin with and take. On a festival they said, but not on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חוֹתָמוֹת שֶׁבַּקַּרְקַע — מַתִּיר, אֲבָל לֹא מַפְקִיעַ וְלֹא חוֹתֵךְ. שֶׁבַּכֵּלִים — מַתִּיר וּמַפְקִיעַ וְחוֹתֵךְ, אֶחָד שַׁבָּת וְאֶחָד יוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: Shmuel said: fastenings that to the ground one may untie but one may not unravel nor cut that are on vessels, untie, or unravel, or cut both Shabbat and a Festival,
llm_translation: Samuel said: Seals in the ground - one may untie, but not cut or pierce. Seals in vessels - one may untie, untie, and cut, both on Shabbat and on a festival day.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: חוֹתָמוֹת שֶׁבַּקַּרְקַע, בְּשַׁבָּת — מַתִּיר אֲבָל לֹא מַפְקִיעַ וְלֹא חוֹתֵךְ. בְּיוֹם טוֹב — מַתִּיר וּמַפְקִיעַ וְחוֹתֵךְ!
human_translation: raises an objection fastenings that to the ground, on Shabbat one may untie but not unravel or cut on a Festival, one may untie or unravel or cut
llm_translation: Challenger: Seals in the ground, on Shabbat - permits but does not detach and does not cut. On a festival - permits, detaches, and cuts!

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אַף פּוֹחֵת לְכַתְּחִלָּה וְנוֹטֵל, וּפְלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ, וַאֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי כְּרַבָּנַן. וּמִי פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ בְּחוֹתָמוֹת שֶׁבַּקַּרְקַע? וְהָתַנְיָא: מוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּחוֹתָמוֹת שֶׁבַּקַּרְקַע, שֶׁבְּשַׁבָּת מַתִּיר — אֲבָל לֹא מַפְקִיעַ וְלֹא חוֹתֵךְ, בְּיוֹם טוֹב — מַתִּיר וּמַפְקִיעַ וְחוֹתֵךְ!
human_translation: whose is this It is Rabbi Meir, who said: One may even make a hole and remove ab initio , whereas the Rabbis disagree with him and I spoke in accordance with the Rabbis. And do the Rabbis disagree with him with regard to sealed to the ground? But isn’t it taught The Rabbis concede to Rabbi Meir with regard to sealed to the ground that one may untie on Shabbat but not unravel or cut while on a Festival one may untie or unravel or cut
llm_translation: The one who says - Rabbi Meir it is, as he said: even less initially and takes, and the Rabbis disagree with him, and I say like the Rabbis. And do the Rabbis disagree with him regarding the seals on the ground? And it was taught: the Sages agree with Rabbi Meir regarding the seals on the ground, that on Shabbat he permits - but he does not remove and does not cut, on Yom Tov - he permits and removes and cuts!

hebrew_text: הוּא דְּאָמַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: חוֹתָמוֹת שֶׁבַּקַּרְקַע — מַתִּיר, אֲבָל לֹא מַפְקִיעַ וְלֹא חוֹתֵךְ, אֶחָד שַׁבָּת וְאֶחָד יוֹם טוֹב. וְשֶׁבַּכְּלִי — בְּשַׁבָּת מַתִּיר, אֲבָל לֹא מַפְקִיעַ וְלֹא חוֹתֵךְ, בְּיוֹם טוֹב — מַתִּיר וּמַפְקִיעַ וְחוֹתֵךְ.
human_translation: he, who spoke in accordance with that tanna , as it is taught fastenings that are to the ground, one may untie but not unravel or cut both Shabbat and a Festival. And those of a vessel, on Shabbat one may untie but one may not unravel or cut on a Festival one may untie, or unravel, or cut
llm_translation: He who said, as this Tanna taught: Seals in the ground - one may untie, but not tie or cut, both on Shabbat and on Yom Tov. And in a vessel - on Shabbat one may untie, but not tie or cut, on Yom Tov - one may untie, tie, and cut.

hebrew_text: תָּרֵצְתְּ לָךְ רֵישָׁא, אֶלָּא סֵיפָא קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: You have answered the first clause However, the latter clause difficult
llm_translation: You desired the beginning, but the end is difficult!

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל הַכֵּלִים אֵין נִיטָּלִין אֶלָּא דֶּרֶךְ תַּשְׁמִישָׁן.
human_translation: whose is this It is Rabbi Neḥemya, as he said: All vessels may be handled only in the manner of their use.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Ha mani - Rabbi Nechemya hi, de'amar: Kol hakelim ein nitatin ela derech tashmishan." Translation: "This vessel - it is Rabbi Nechemya, who said: All vessels are not removed except in the manner of their use."

hebrew_text: אִי רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, מַאי אִירְיָא שַׁבָּת? אֲפִילּוּ יוֹם טוֹב נָמֵי! וְכִי תֵּימָא שַׁנְיָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה בֵּין שְׁבוּת שַׁבָּת לִשְׁבוּת יוֹם טוֹב, וּמִי שַׁנְיָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: If Rabbi Neḥemya, why particularly Shabbat? even on a Festival, And if you say a distinction to Rabbi Neḥemya between a rabbinic decree of Shabbat, and a rabbinic decree of a Festival, Does he differentiate
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah: What is the difference between Shabbat and even a festival? And if you will say that Rabbi Nechemiah differentiates between the cessation of Shabbat and the cessation of a festival, who indeed differentiates between them?

hebrew_text: וְהָתָנֵי חֲדָא: מַסִּיקִין בְּכֵלִים וְאֵין מַסִּיקִין בְּשִׁבְרֵי כֵלִים, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: מַסִּיקִין בֵּין בְּכֵלִים בֵּין בְּשִׁבְרֵי כֵּלִים, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אֵין מַסִּיקִין לֹא בְּכֵלִים וְלֹא בְּשִׁבְרֵי כֵלִים.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught one one may kindle with vessels, but one may not kindle with shards of vessels, And it is taught another One may kindle both with vessels and with shards of vessels. And it is taught another One may kindle neither with vessels nor with shards of vessels.
llm_translation: And it was taught in one Baraita: We may seal vessels with utensils, but we may not seal vessels with broken utensils. And it was taught in another Baraita: We may seal whether with utensils or with broken utensils. And it was taught in another Baraita: We may not seal neither with utensils nor with broken utensils.

hebrew_text: וּמְשַׁנֵּי, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, הָא רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה!
human_translation: And is resolved not difficult; this Rabbi Yehuda, This Rabbi Shimon, This Rabbi Neḥemya,
llm_translation: And from the Mishna, it is not difficult: this is Rabbi Yehuda, this is Rabbi Shimon, this is Rabbi Nechemiah!

hebrew_text: תְּרֵי תַנָּאֵי וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה.
human_translation: two tanna’im in accordance with Rabbi Neḥemya.
llm_translation: Two Tannaim and the statement of Rabbi Nechemiah.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין פּוֹחֲתִין אֶת הַנֵּר מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא עוֹשֶׂה כֶּלִי, וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין פֶּחָמִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְאֵין חוֹתְכִין אֶת הַפְּתִילָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חוֹתְכָהּ בָּאוּר.
human_translation: one may not hollow out a lamp because he creates a vessel. And one may not produce charcoal on a Festival And one may not cut the wick, Rabbi Yehuda says: he may cut it in a fire
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not diminish the light of the lamp because it is considered making a vessel, and one may not make charcoal on a festival, and one may not cut the wick. Rabbi Yehuda says: One may cut it in the light.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאן תְּנָא דִּפְחִיתַת נֵר מָנָא הוּא? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: כְּלִי חֶרֶס, מֵאֵימָתַי מְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה — מִשֶּׁנִּגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתּוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁיִּצְרְפוֹ בַּכִּבְשָׁן.
human_translation: Who taught hollowing out a lamp is a vessel, Rav Yosef said: It is Rabbi Meir, as it is taught From when is an earthenware vessel susceptible to ritual impurity? from when its work is completed, the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehoshua says: from when is fired in the furnace.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Maan tana d'pachitatah ner manah hu? Amar Rav Yosef: Rabbi Meir hi. Detanya: Kli cheres, meimatay mekabel tumah - mishenigmerah melachtow, divrei Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehoshua omer: mishetitzro bo bakibshan. English translation: Gemara: Who is the Tanna that holds that a clay vessel receives impurity when its work is completed? Rav Yosef said: It is Rabbi Meir. As it was taught in a Baraita: A clay vessel, from when does it become susceptible to impurity? - When its work is completed, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehoshua says: When it is fired in the kiln.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר הָתָם אֶלָּא דַּחֲזֵי לְקַבּוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ מִידֵּי, אֲבָל הָכָא לְמַאי חֲזִי? לְקַבּוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ פְּשִׁיטֵי.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: From where Perhaps Rabbi Meir stated only there, since they are fit to contain something. But here, for what is fit? to contain coins.
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: From what? Perhaps until here Rabbi Meir did not say there, except that he sees to accept it from his hands, but here, what does he see? To accept it from his hands is obvious.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק הִיא, דִּתְנַן: אִלְפָּסִין חִרָנִיּוֹת — טְהוֹרוֹת בְּאֹהֶל הַמֵּת, וּטְמֵאוֹת בְּמַשָּׂא הַזָּב.
human_translation: Some say Rav Yosef said: is Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok, as we learned: Ḥaraniyyot pots [ ilpasin ] pure of a tent over a corpse, impure by the carrying of a zav ,
llm_translation: There are some who say, Rav Yosef said: Rabbi Eliezer the son of Rabbi Tzadok is the one who taught: "Elephant tusks - pure in the tent of the dead, and impure in the carrying of the zav."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק אוֹמֵר: אַף טְהוֹרוֹת בְּמַשָּׂא הַזָּב, לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתָּן.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: even pure carrying of a zav because their labor is not completed;
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Tzadok says: Even pure animals in the carrying of the discharge are impure, because their work has not been completed.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: דִּלְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק הָתָם, אֶלָּא דַּחֲזֵי לְקַבּוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ מִידֵּי, אֲבָל הָכָא לְמַאי חָזֵי? לְקַבּוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ פְּשִׁיטֵי.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Perhaps Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok, stated only there, since they are fit to contain something. But here, for what is fit? to contain coins.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Perhaps until here not said Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Zadok there, rather he sees to accept in it immediately, but here what does he see? To accept in it is obvious.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין פּוֹחֲתִין אֶת הַנֵּר, וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין אִלְפָּסִין חִרָנִיּוֹת בְּיוֹם טוֹב. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מַתִּיר בְּאִלְפָּסִין חִרָנִיּוֹת. מַאי חִרָנִיּוֹת? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: עִרָנִיּוֹת. מַאי עִרָנִיּוֹת? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: צָעֵי חַקְלָיָיתָא.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One may not hollow out a lamp, and one may not create ḥaraniyyot pots on a Festival. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel permits ḥaraniyyot pots. What is ḥaraniyyot ? Rav Yehuda said: of a city [ iraniyyot ]. What is iraniyyot ? Abaye said: villagers’ bowls
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One may not diminish the light of the lamp, and one may not make charcoal wicks on a festival. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel permits making charcoal wicks. What are charcoal wicks? Rav Yehudah said: Charcoal wicks. What are charcoal wicks? Abaye said: Wicks made from flax fibers.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין פֶּחָמִין. פְּשִׁיטָא, לְמַאי חָזֵי? תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְמוֹסְרָן לְאוֹלְיָירִין לְבוֹ בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: And one may not produce charcoal obvious For what is fit; Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: It is necessary only handing over to bathhouse attendants [ olyarin ] for that day.
llm_translation: And they do not make charcoal. It is obvious, for what purpose? Rabbi Hiyya taught: It was only necessary for their mortar for the ovens to be in good condition during the day.

hebrew_text: וּבוֹ בַּיּוֹם מִי שְׁרֵי? כִּדְאָמַר רָבָא: לְהַזִּיעַ, וְקוֹדֶם גְּזֵרָה. הָכָא נָמֵי: לְהַזִּיעַ, וְקוֹדֶם גְּזֵרָה.
human_translation: And on that day is it permitted As Rava said to sweat, and before decree Here, too, to sweat, and before decree
llm_translation: And in it, on that day, who is permitted? As Rava said: to sweat, and before decree. Here too: to sweat, and before decree.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין חוֹתְכִין אֶת הַפְּתִילָה לִשְׁנַיִם. מַאי שְׁנָא בְּסַכִּין דְּלָא —
human_translation: And one may not cut a wick into two, What is different that one may not with a knife?
llm_translation: And one does not cut the wick into two. What is the difference with a knife that is not —

hebrew_text: דְּקָמְתַקֵּן מָנָא, בָּאוּר נָמֵי קָא מְתַקֵּן מָנָא! תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: חוֹתְכָהּ בָּאוּר בְּפִי שְׁתֵּי נֵרוֹת. אָמַר רַב נָתָן בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: מוֹחֲטִין אֶת הַפְּתִילָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב. מַאי ״מוֹחֲטִין״? אָמַר רַב חֲנִינָא בַּר שֶׁלֶמְיָא (מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב): לְעַדּוֹיֵי חוּשְׁכָא.
human_translation: he mends a vessel? in the fire, he is also preparing a vessel Rabbi Ḥiyya taught He cuts it by fire in the mouth of two candles. Rav Natan bar Abba said Rav said: One may moḥet a wick on a Festival. What is moḥet ? Rav Ḥanina bar Shelemya said in the name of Rav: To remove the dark;
llm_translation: When the Mana was being prepared, the light was being prepared! Rabbi Chiya taught: One cuts it with the light in the mouth of two candles. Rav Natan bar Abba said in the name of Rav: One trims the wick on a festival. What is "trims"? Rav Chanina bar Shelamya (from the name of Rav) said: To testify to darkness.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי בַּר קַפָּרָא: שִׁשָּׁה דְּבָרִים נֶאֶמְרוּ בִּפְתִילָה. שְׁלֹשָׁה לְהַחְמִיר, וּשְׁלֹשָׁה לְהָקֵל. לְהַחְמִיר: אֵין גּוֹדְלִין אוֹתָהּ לְכַתְּחִלָּה בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְאֵין מְהַבְהֲבִין אוֹתָהּ בָּאוּר, וְאֵין חוֹתְכִין אוֹתָהּ לִשְׁנַיִם. לְהָקֵל: מְמַעֲכָהּ בַּיָּד, וְשׁוֹרָהּ בְּשֶׁמֶן, וְחוֹתְכָהּ בָּאוּר בְּפִי שְׁתֵּי נֵרוֹת.
human_translation: Bar Kappara taught: Six matters were stated with regard to a wick three are to be stringent and three are to be lenient. to be stringent One may not spin it ab initio on a Festival, and one may not singe it in fire and one may not cut it into two. to be lenient One may crush it by hand, and one may soak it in oil and one may cut it by fire in the mouth of two candles.
llm_translation: The son of Kapara taught: Six things were said regarding a wick. Three to be stringent, and three to be lenient. To be stringent: One may not make it larger initially on a festival, and one may not ignite it from a torch, and one may not cut it into two. To be lenient: One may moisten it with the hand, and soak it in oil, and cut it with the mouth of two candles.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב נָתָן בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: עַתִּירֵי בָּבֶל, יוֹרְדֵי גֵיהִנָּם הֵם. כִּי הָא דְּשַׁבְּתַאי בַּר מָרִינוּס אִקְּלַע לְבָבֶל, בְּעָא מִנַּיְיהוּ עִסְקָא — וְלָא יְהַבוּ לֵיהּ. מְזוֹנֵי מֵיזָן — נָמֵי לָא זַיְנוּהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Natan bar Abba said Rav said: The wealthy of Babylonia will descend to Gehenna such as this: Shabbetai bar Marinus happened to come to Babylonia. He requested a business venture, and they did not give him. to sustain him with food, they likewise refused to sustain him.
llm_translation: And Rav Natan son of Abba said in the name of Rav: The merchants of Babylon are descendents of Gehenna. For this is like the case of Shabbtai bar Marinus who arrived in Babylon, he asked them a question - and they did not give him an answer. Food for the provider - they did not provide for him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר: הָנֵי מֵעֵרֶב רַב קָא אָתוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנָתַן לְךָ רַחֲמִים וְרִחַמְךָ״, כׇּל הַמְרַחֵם עַל הַבְּרִיּוֹת — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁהוּא מִזַּרְעוֹ שֶׁל אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ, וְכׇל מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְרַחֵם עַל הַבְּרִיּוֹת — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִזַּרְעוֹ שֶׁל אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ.
human_translation: He said: These but they came from the mixed multitude, as it is written: “And show you compassion, and have compassion upon you, Anyone who has compassion creatures, it is known that he is of the descendants of Abraham, our father, and anyone who does not have compassion creatures, it is known that he is not of the descendants of Abraham, our father.
llm_translation: He said: Those from the evening, Rav Ka came, as it is written: "And He will give you mercy and have mercy on you." Anyone who has mercy on creatures - it is known that he is from the seed of our father Abraham. And anyone who does not have mercy on creatures - it is known that he is not from the seed of our father Abraham.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב נָתָן בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: כׇּל הַמְצַפֶּה עַל שֻׁלְחַן אֲחֵרִים — עוֹלָם חָשַׁךְ בַּעֲדוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נוֹדֵד הוּא לַלֶּחֶם אַיֵּה יָדַע כִּי נָכוֹן בְּיָדוֹ יוֹם חֹשֶׁךְ״. רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: אַף חַיָּיו אֵינָן חַיִּים.
human_translation: Rav Natan bar Abba said Rav said: Whoever looks to the table of others the world is dark for him. for it is stated: “He wanders abroad for bread: Where is it? He knows the day of darkness is ready at his hand” Rav Ḥisda said: Even his life is no life,
llm_translation: And Rav Natan bar Abba said in the name of Rav: Anyone who waits for the table of others - darkness will befall him forever, as it is stated: "He wanders about for bread, where is it? He knows that a day of darkness is ready at his hand." Rav Chisda said: Even his life is not life.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה חַיֵּיהֶן אֵינָם חַיִּים, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: הַמְצַפֶּה לְשֻׁלְחַן חֲבֵירוֹ, וּמִי שֶׁאִשְׁתּוֹ מוֹשֶׁלֶת עָלָיו, וּמִי שֶׁיִּסּוּרִין מוֹשְׁלִין בְּגוּפוֹ. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף מִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא חָלוּק אֶחָד. וְתַנָּא קַמָּא: אֶפְשָׁר דִּמְעַיֵּין בְּמָנֵיהּ.
human_translation: the Sages taught: three lives are not lives, and they are as follows: One who looks to the table of others and one whose wife rules him; and one whose body is ruled by suffering. And some say: Even one who has only one robe. And the first tanna , It is possible to examine his clothes
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Three of their lives are not considered living, and these are they: one who waits for his fellow's table, and one whose wife rules over him, and one who suffers afflictions in his body. And some say: even one who has only one gallstone. And the first Tanna taught: It is possible that they are included in his countenance.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין שׁוֹבְרִין אֶת הַחֶרֶס, וְאֵין חוֹתְכִין הַנְּיָיר לִצְלוֹת בּוֹ מָלִיחַ.
human_translation: One may not break earthenware And one may not cut paper in order to roast salted on it.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not break the earthenware vessel, and one may not cut the paper to use it as a wick.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין גּוֹרְפִין תַּנּוּר וְכִירַיִם, אֲבָל מְכַבְּשִׁין.
human_translation: And one may not sweep out an oven or stove But one may press down
llm_translation: And we do not scrape out ovens and stoves, but we may scrub them.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מַקִּיפִין שְׁתֵּי חָבִיּוֹת לִשְׁפּוֹת עֲלֵיהֶן אֶת הַקְּדֵרָה, וְאֵין סוֹמְכִין אֶת הַקְּדֵרָה בַּבְּקַעַת, וְכֵן בַּדֶּלֶת. וְאֵין מַנְהִיגִין אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה בַּמַּקֵּל בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר.
human_translation: And one may not draw two barrels together to place a pot on them, And one may not prop a pot with a piece of wood, And similarly, with a door. And one may not lead an animal with a stick on a Festival; and Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, permits
llm_translation: And not encircle two barrels to lean them on the pot, and not support the pot in the valley, and likewise with the door. And not lead the animal with a stick on the festival, and Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon permits.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא מְתַקֵּן מָנָא.
human_translation: What is the reason Because one preparing a vessel
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? Because it is fixing the vessel.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין גּוֹרְפִין תַּנּוּר וְכִירַיִם. תָּנֵי רַב חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: וְאִם אִי אֶפְשָׁר לֶאֱפוֹת אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן גּוֹרְפוֹ — מוּתָּר. דְּבֵיתְהוּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא נְפַל לַהּ אֲרִיחָא בְּתַנּוּרָא בְּיוֹמָא טָבָא, אֲמַר לַהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא: חֲזַי, דַּאֲנָא רִפְתָּא מְעַלַּיְיתָא בָּעֵינָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: טְוִי לִי בַּר אֲווֹזָא, וְאִזְדְּהַר מֵחֲרוֹכָא.
human_translation: And one may not sweep out an oven or stove. Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef taught before Rav Naḥman: And if it is not possible to bake unless one sweeps it out, it is permitted. to the wife of Rabbi Ḥiyya: A part of a brick fell into oven on a Festival, Rav Ḥiyya said to her: See, I want good-quality bread. Rava said to his attendant: Roast for me a duck and be careful not to singe
llm_translation: And we do not scrape the oven and the stoves. It was taught: Rav Chiya bar Yosef taught before Rav Nachman: If it is impossible to bake except by scraping it, then it is permitted. In the house of Rabbi Chiya, a piece of bread fell into the oven on a good day. Rabbi Chiya said to her: See, I need the upper part of the bread. Rava said to his attendant: Bring me a piece of meat, and be careful of the thorn.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אָמַר לַן רַב אַחָא מֵהוּצָל, דְּמָר שָׁרְקִין לֵיהּ תַּנּוּרָא בְּיוֹמָא טָבָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנַן אַרַקְתָּא דִפְרָת סָמְכִינַן, וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי הוּא דְּצַיְּירֵיהּ מֵאֶתְמוֹל. אָמַר רָבִינָא: וְקִטְמָא — שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Rav Aḥa from Hutzal said to us that the master, to plaster the oven for him on a Festival. He said to him: We rely on the bank of the Euphrates And this applies only when one wrapped the day before, Ravina said: And ashes permitted,
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Rav Aḥa told us, "One who is saved, for the master of the oven whistles to him on a good day." He said to him: "We rely on the morning star, and those words are what his attendants draw for him from yesterday." Ravina said: "And the smoke - it is permitted."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מַקִּיפִין שְׁתֵּי חָבִיּוֹת. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אֲבָנִים שֶׁל בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא, מוּתָּר לְצַדְּדָן בְּיוֹם טוֹב. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבָּה לְרַב נַחְמָן: אֵין מַקִּיפִין שְׁתֵּי חָבִיּוֹת לִשְׁפּוֹת עֲלֵיהֶן אֶת הַקְּדֵרָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא עָבֵיד אֻהְלָא.
human_translation: One may not draw two barrels together Rav Naḥman said: stones of a lavatory, it is permitted to put them together on a Festival. Rabba raised an objection to Rav Naḥman: one may not draw two barrels together to place a pot on them? He said to him: There, it is different, because one makes a tent.
llm_translation: "And one does not encircle two barrels. Rav Nachman said: Stones of a privy, it is permitted to move them on a festival. Rabba raised an objection to Rav Nachman: One does not encircle two barrels to pour the pot on them! He said to him: It is different there, because he is making a tent."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה זוּטָא, לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, בָּנָה אִצְטְבָא בְּיוֹם טוֹב, דְּלָא עָבֵיד אֻהְלָא — הָכִי נָמֵי דִּשְׁרֵי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם, בִּנְיַן קֶבַע אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה, בִּנְיַן עֲרַאי לָא אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה. וּגְזַרוּ רַבָּנַן עַל בִּנְיַן עֲרַאי מִשּׁוּם בִּנְיַן קֶבַע, וְהָכָא מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹדוֹ לָא גְּזַרוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rabba the Younger, said to Rav Ashi: However, if so, on a Festival, one built bench [ itztaba ], one does not make a tent, so too, that it is permitted? He said to him: There, the Torah prohibited a permanent construction, the Torah did not prohibit a temporary construction. The Sages, decreed against a temporary construction due to a permanent construction. here, due to the dignity the Sages did not decree with regard to it.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabba Zuta, to Rav Ashi: Rather, from now on, one may build a temporary structure on a festival, as long as it is not a permanent dwelling - is this also permitted? He said to him: There, where the Torah prohibited permanent construction, temporary construction is not prohibited. And the Rabbis decreed regarding temporary construction because of permanent construction, but here, they did not decree due to his honor.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הַאי מְדוּרְתָּא, מִלְּמַעְלָה לְמַטָּה — שְׁרֵי. מִלְּמַטָּה לְמַעְלָה — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: this bonfire, from above to below it is permitted, from below to above, it is prohibited,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: This dwelling, from above downwards - permitted. From below upwards - forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בֵּיעֲתָא, וְכֵן קְדֵרָה, וְכֵן פּוּרְיָא, וְכֵן חָבִיתָא.
human_translation: And similarly, eggs And similarly, a pot And similarly, bed, And similarly, barrels
llm_translation: And so in Be'ata, and so in Kedara, and so in Purya, and so in Havita.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין סוֹמְכִין אֶת הַקְּדֵרָה בַּבְּקַעַת, וְכֵן בַּדֶּלֶת. בַּדֶּלֶת סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: וְכֵן הַדֶּלֶת. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין סוֹמְכִין אֶת הַקְּדֵרָה בַּבְּקַעַת, וְכֵן הַדֶּלֶת, לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא נִתְּנוּ עֵצִים אֶלָּא לְהַסָּקָה. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר.
human_translation: And one may not prop a pot with a piece of wood, and similarly a door. With regard to a door, enter your mind? Rather, say And similarly, a door The Sages taught: One may not prop a pot with a piece of wood, and similarly a door, as wood is only for kindling. And Rabbi Shimon, permits
llm_translation: And one does not lean the pot in the valley, and likewise with the door. With the door, is it your intention?! Rather say: and likewise with the door. The Rabbis taught: One does not lean the pot in the valley, and likewise with the door, because the wood was only placed there for support. And Rabbi Shimon permits.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מַנְהִיגִין אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה בַּמַּקֵּל בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר. לֵימָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן כַּאֲבוּהּ סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּלֵית לֵיהּ מוּקְצֶה? לָא, בְּהָא אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מוֹדֶה, מִשּׁוּם דְּמִחֲזֵי כְּמַאן דְּאָזֵיל לְחִנְגָּא.
human_translation: And one may not lead an animal with a stick on a Festival, but Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, permits Shall we say Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, holds in accordance with his father, who is not muktze , No, this even Rabbi Shimon concedes because looks like one who is going to the market [ ḥinga ]
llm_translation: And we do not lead the animal with a stick on a festival day, and Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon permits it. Let us say, Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon is like his father, does he not hold of muktzeh? No, in this case even Rabbi Shimon agrees, because it appears as if one is going to a pleasure garden.

hebrew_text: חִזְרָא, רַב נַחְמָן אָסַר, וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת שָׁרֵי. בְּרַטִּיבָא — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּאָסוּר. כִּי פְּלִיגִי — בְּיַבִּשְׁתָּא. מַאן דְּאָסַר, אָמַר לָךְ: לֹא נִתְּנוּ עֵצִים אֶלָּא לְהַסָּקָה. וּמַאן דְּשָׁרֵי, אָמַר לָךְ: מָה לִי לִצְלוֹת בּוֹ, מָה לִי לִצְלוֹת בְּגַחַלְתּוֹ?
human_translation: a bamboo Rav Naḥman prohibits it and Rav Sheshet permits it. of a wet everyone agrees prohibited; When they disagree, of a dry The one prohibits said to you: Wood is only for kindling, And the one permits said to you: what is it to me to roast with it What is it to me to roast with its coals?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Chizra, Rav Nachman asar, veRav Sheshet sharei. Bartiva - kullei olma la plegi de'asar. Ki plegi - beyabisheta. Man de'asar, amar lakh: lo nittnu etzim ela lehasaka. Uman de'sharei, amar lakh: mah li litzlot bo, mah li litzlot begachalto? English translation: Chizra, Rav Nachman prohibited, and Rav Sheshet permitted. In Bartiva - everyone agrees that it is not prohibited. When they disagree - it is in a dry place. The one who prohibited, said to you: "The wood was only given for fuel." And the one who permitted, said to you: "What do I care to roast it, what do I care to roast it in its coal?"

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: בְּיַבִּשְׁתָּא — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דִּשְׁרֵי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי — בְּרַטִּיבְתָּא. מַאן דְּאָסַר, דְּלָא חֲזֵי לְהַסָּקָה, וּמַאן דְּשָׁרֵי אָמַר לָךְ: הָא חֲזֵי לְהֶיסֵּק גָּדוֹל. וְהִלְכְתָא: יַבִּשְׁתָּא שְׁרֵי, רַטִּיבְתָּא אֲסִיר.
human_translation: Some say In the case of a dry everyone agrees permitted; when they disagree, in the case of a wet The one prohibits it is not fit for kindling. And the one permits said to you: Isn’t it fit for a large fire, And the halakha a dry is permitted a wet is prohibited.
llm_translation: There are those who say: in a dry place — everyone agrees that it is permitted. When do they disagree? In a moist place. The one who forbids it, as he does not see it fit to be removed, and the one who permits it says to you: behold, it is fit to be removed. And the halakha is: in a dry place it is permitted, in a moist place it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא: אִשָּׁה לֹא תִּכָּנֵס לְדִיר הָעֵצִים לִיטּוֹל מֵהֶן אוּד. וְאוּד שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּר — אָסוּר לְהַסִּיקוֹ בְּיוֹם טוֹב, לְפִי שֶׁמַּסִּיקִין בְּכֵלִים, וְאֵין מַסִּיקִין בְּשִׁבְרֵי כֵלִים.
human_translation: Rava taught: A woman may not enter a storehouse of wood to take from them a firebrand, And a firebrand that broke may not be kindled on a Festival, for one may kindle with vessels but one may not kindle with shards of vessels,
llm_translation: Rava expounded: A woman may not enter the woodshed to take from them a firebrand. And a firebrand that has broken — it is forbidden to kindle it on a festival, because we kindle with vessels, and we do not kindle with broken vessels.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּרָבָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּאִית לֵיהּ מוּקְצֶה? וְהָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: טְוִי לִי בַּר אֲווֹזָא וּשְׁדִי מְעֵיהּ לְשׁוּנָּרָא! הָתָם כֵּיוָן דְּמַסְרְחִי — מֵאֶתְמוֹל דַּעְתֵּיהּ עִלָּוֵיהּ.
human_translation: Is that to say that Rava holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who is muktze ? But didn’t Rava say to his attendant: Roast a duck for me, and throw its innards There, since become rancid from yesterday, his mind was on them.
llm_translation: In the matter of Rava, like Rabbi Yehuda, he holds, does he hold of muktze? But didn't Rava say to his attendant: "Bring me a duckling and place it in the oven!" There, since it was roasted - his mind was already set on it from the day before.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: נוֹטֵל אָדָם קֵיסָם מִשֶּׁלְּפָנָיו, לַחְצוֹץ בּוֹ שִׁינָּיו. וּמְגַבֵּב מִן הֶחָצֵר וּמַדְלִיק, שֶׁכׇּל מַה שֶּׁבֶּחָצֵר — מוּכָן הוּא. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מְגַבֵּב מִשֶּׁלְּפָנָיו וּמַדְלִיק.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: a person may remove a sliver that is before him, in order to clean with it his teeth. And he may collect from a courtyard and kindle for anything in a courtyard is prepared The Rabbis say: He may collect from before him and kindle
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Eliezer says: A person takes his flask from in front of him to crush his teeth on it. And he sweeps from the courtyard and lights, because everything in the courtyard is prepared. And the sages say: He sweeps from in front of him and lights.

hebrew_text: אֵין מוֹצִיאִין אֶת הָאוּר לֹא מִן הָעֵצִים, וְלֹא מִן הָאֲבָנִים, וְלֹא מִן הֶעָפָר וְלֹא מִן הָרְעָפִים, וְלֹא מִן הַמַּיִם. וְאֵין מְלַבְּנִין אֶת הָרְעָפִים לִצְלוֹת בָּהֶן.
human_translation: One may not produce fire, neither from wood, nor from stones nor from dirt; nor from tiles nor from water And one may not whiten tiles to roast upon them
llm_translation: One does not extract the light neither from the trees, nor from the stones, nor from the dust, nor from the ashes, nor from the water. And one does not whiten the ashes to use them for lighting.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה:
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said:
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said:

hebrew_text: אוֹכְלֵי בְּהֵמָה — אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם תִּקּוּן כְּלִי.
human_translation: Animal fodder, does not have due to the preparing of a vessel.
llm_translation: Eaters of animal - there is not in them of repair of vessel.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא לְרַב יְהוּדָה: מְטַלְטְלִין עֲצֵי בְּשָׂמִים לְהָרִיחַ בָּהֶן, וּלְהָנִיף בָּהֶן לַחוֹלֶה, וּמוֹלְלוֹ וּמֵרִיחַ בּוֹ. וְלֹא יִקְטְמֶנּוּ לְהָרִיחַ בּוֹ, וְאִם קְטָמוֹ — פָּטוּר אֲבָל אָסוּר. לַחְצוֹץ בּוֹ שִׁינָּיו — לָא יִקְטְמֶנּוּ, וְאִם קְטָמוֹ — חַיָּיב חַטָּאת!
human_translation: Rav Kahana raised an objection to Rav Yehuda One may handle a spice tree to smell them and to wave them before a sick person And he may crush it and he may smell it. he may not cut it to smell it; and if he did cut it, he is exempt but it is prohibited to clean his teeth with it, he may not cut it, and if he did cut it, he is liable a sin-offering
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Rav Kahana to Rav Yehudah: One may move fragrant wood to smell them, and to wave them over a sick person, and to grind them and smell them. But one may not crush it to smell it, and if he crushed it - he is exempt but it is forbidden. If he crushed his teeth with it - he may not smell it, and if he crushed it - he is liable for a sin offering!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא פָּטוּר אֲבָל אָסוּר קָא קַשְׁיָא לִי, חַיָּיב חַטָּאת מִבַּעְיָא? אֶלָּא: כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא בְּקָשִׁין. קָשִׁין בְּנֵי מְלִילָה נִינְהוּ?
human_translation: said to Now, exempt but prohibited a difficulty to my Is it required liable a sin-offering? rather, When that was taught, hard hard be crushed
llm_translation: He said to him: "Now he is exempt, but forbidden is difficult for me, is a sin offering required?" Rather, it was taught: Is that difficult? Are they not the sons of Melila?

hebrew_text: חַסּוֹרֵי מְחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: מוֹלְלוֹ וּמֵרִיחַ בּוֹ, קוֹטְמוֹ וּמֵרִיחַ בּוֹ. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּרַכִּין, אֲבָל בְּקָשִׁין — לֹא יִקְטְמֶנּוּ, וְאִם קְטָמוֹ — פָּטוּר אֲבָל אָסוּר. לַחְצוֹץ בּוֹ שִׁינָּיו — לֹא יִקְטְמֶנּוּ, וְאִם קְטָמוֹ — חַיָּיב חַטָּאת.
human_translation: is incomplete and is teaching the following: one may crush it and smell it cut it and smell it. In what is this statement said? With regard to soft but with regard to hard ones, one may not cut them. And if he did cut it he is exempt, but it is prohibited to clean his teeth with it, he may not cut it, and if he did cut it, he is liable a sin-offering.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "One who trims his mustache and thus it was taught: he may wrap it and smell it, he may trim it and smell it. In what case are these words said? In the case of a razor, but with scissors - he should not trim it, and if he did trim it - he is exempt, but it is forbidden. If one plucks out his teeth with it - he should not trim it, and if he did trim it - he is liable for a sin offering."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: קוֹטְמוֹ וּמֵרִיחַ בּוֹ, תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: לֹא יִקְטְמֶנּוּ לְהָרִיחַ בּוֹ. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּרַכִּין, הָא — בְּקָשִׁין.
human_translation: is taught one One may cut it and smell it, and is taught another One may not cut it to smell it. Rabbi Zeira said Rav Ḥisda said: is not difficult. this to soft that to hard
llm_translation: One taught: He may grind it and smell it, it was taught in another Baraita: He may not grind it in order to smell it. Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav Hisda, it is not difficult: this one refers to spices, and this one refers to herbs.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: בְּקָשִׁין אַמַּאי לָא? מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: שׁוֹבֵר אָדָם אֶת הֶחָבִית לֶאֱכוֹל מִמֶּנָּה גְּרוֹגְרוֹת, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִתְכַּוֵּין לַעֲשׂוֹת כְּלִי! וְעוֹד: הָא רָבָא בַּר רַב אַדָּא וְרָבִין בַּר רַב אַדָּא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: כִּי הֲוֵינַן בֵּי רַב יְהוּדָה, הֲוָה מְפַשַּׁח וְיָהֵיב לַן אַלְוָתָא אַלְוָתָא, אַף עַל גַּב דְּחַזְיָא לְקַתָּתָא דְּנַרְגֵי וַחֲצִינֵי.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov strongly objects to this: With hard ones, why not? what is different from that which we learned A person may break a barrel to eat dried figs from it, provided that he does not intend to make a vessel, And furthermore, Rava bar Rav Adda and Ravin bar Rav Adda, who both say: When we were at the house of Rav Yehuda, he would break and give us many sticks they were fit for handles of axes and hatchets.
llm_translation: Challenges to it, Rav Acha son of Yaakov: Difficulties why not? What is different from that which we learned: A person breaks a barrel to eat dried figs from it, provided that he does not intend to make a vessel! And furthermore: Rava son of Rav Adda and Ravin son of Rav Adda both said: When we were in the study hall of Rav Yehuda, he would distribute to us almonds, one by one, even though he saw a basket full of dinars and half-dinars.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, הָא רַבָּנַן. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: נוֹטֵל אָדָם קֵיסָם מִשֶּׁלְּפָנָיו לַחְצוֹץ בּוֹ שִׁינָּיו, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יִטּוֹל אֶלָּא מֵאֵבוּס שֶׁל בְּהֵמָה. וְשָׁוִין שֶׁלֹּא יִקְטְמֶנּוּ, וְאִם קְטָמוֹ לַחְצוֹץ בּוֹ שִׁינָּיו וְלִפְתּוֹחַ בּוֹ הַדֶּלֶת, בְּשׁוֹגֵג בְּשַׁבָּת — חַיָּיב חַטָּאת, בְּמֵזִיד בְּיוֹם טוֹב — סוֹפֵג אֶת הָאַרְבָּעִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: is not difficult; this Rabbi Eliezer, that the Rabbis. As it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: a person may take a sliver from before him to clean his teeth with it, and the Rabbis say: One may take only from an animal’s trough; And they agree that he may not pluck it. And if he did pluck it to clean his teeth with it to open a door with it, unwittingly on Shabbat, he is liable a sin-offering. intentionally on a Festival, he receives the forty the words of Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Not difficult: this is Rabbi Eliezer, this is the Rabbis. As it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: A person may take a chip from in front of him to use it to clean his teeth, and the Sages say: He may only take it from an animal's feeding trough. They agree that he should not break it, and if he broke it to clean his teeth and accidentally opened a door with it on Shabbat - he is liable for a sin offering; if intentionally on a festival - he incurs forty lashes. These are the words of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה, אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְּקָאָמַר הָתָם חַיָּיב חַטָּאת — הָכָא פָּטוּר אֲבָל אָסוּר. רַבָּנַן דְּקָא אָמְרִי הָתָם פָּטוּר אֲבָל אָסוּר — הָכָא מוּתָּר לְכַתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Both this and this, it is only due to a rabbinic decree. Rabbi Eliezer, who states there liable a sin-offering, here, exempt, but it is prohibited. the Rabbis who state there, exempt but it is prohibited, here, permitted ab initio .
llm_translation: The Sages say: "One this and one this, is only due to a Rabbinic decree." Rabbi Eliezer, who said there one is liable for a sin offering, here one is exempt but it is forbidden. The Rabbis, who said there one is exempt but it is forbidden, here it is permitted initially.

hebrew_text: וְלֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הָא דִּתְנַן: שׁוֹבֵר אָדָם אֶת הֶחָבִית לֶאֱכוֹל מִמֶּנָּה גְּרוֹגְרוֹת, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִתְכַּוֵּין לַעֲשׂוֹת כְּלִי? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא, בְּמוּסְתָּקִי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer not accept this that we learned A person may break a barrel to eat dried figs from it, provided that he does not intend to make a vessel? Rav Ashi said: When that was taught, with regard to a vessel patched with pitch [ mustaki ],
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And there is no such case for Rabbi Eliezer, as we learned: If a person breaks a barrel to eat dried figs from it, provided that he does not intend to make a vessel? Rav Ashe said: For it was taught in a Baraita, in private.

hebrew_text: וּמְגַבֵּב מִן הֶחָצֵר. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מְגַבֵּב מִן הֶחָצֵר וּמַדְלִיק, שֶׁכׇּל מַה שֶּׁבֶּחָצֵר מוּכָן הוּא, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲשֶׂה צִבּוּרִין צִבּוּרִין. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר. בְּמַאי קָא מִפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: מִחֲזֵי דְּקָא מְכַנֵּיף לִמְחַר וּלְיוֹמָא אַחֲרִינָא. וּמָר סָבַר: קְדֵרָתוֹ מוֹכַחַת עָלָיו.
human_translation: And one may collect from the courtyard The Sages taught: One may collect from a courtyard and kindle everything in a courtyard is prepared, provided he does not arrange it in piles, and Rabbi Shimon permits With regard to what do they disagree; One Sage, holds: It looks as though he is collecting for tomorrow and another day, And one Sage, holds: His pot proves his
llm_translation: And he raises from the courtyard. The Rabbis taught: One who raises from the courtyard and lights, because everything in the courtyard is prepared, as long as he does not make separate groups. And Rabbi Shimon permits. With what is he disagreeing? One Master holds: He sees that he is preparing for tomorrow and for the next day. And one Master holds: His pot is established for him.

hebrew_text: אֵין מוֹצִיאִין אֶת הָאוּר וְכוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא? מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא מוֹלֵיד בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: one may not produce fire What is the reason Because he creates on a Festival.
llm_translation: They do not bring out the light, etc. What is the reason? Because it generates on a festival day.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מְלַבְּנִין אֶת הָרְעָפִים. מַאי קָא עָבֵיד? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָכָא בִּרְעָפִים חֲדָשִׁים עָסְקִינַן, מִפְּנֵי
human_translation: one may not whiten tiles What does one do; Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Here we are dealing with new tiles, because
llm_translation: "And one does not whitewash the rafters. What is he doing? Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Here we are dealing with new rafters, because..."

hebrew_text: שֶׁצָּרִיךְ לְבׇדְקָן. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁצָּרִיךְ לְחׇסְמָן.
human_translation: it is necessary to test them And some say: Because it is necessary to harden them
llm_translation: That one must examine them. And some say: Because one must seal them.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: דְּרָסָהּ אוֹ שֶׁטְּרָפָהּ בַּכּוֹתֶל, אוֹ שֶׁרְצָצַתָּה בְּהֵמָה וּמְפַרְכֶּסֶת, וְשָׁהֲתָה מֵעֵת לְעֵת וּשְׁחָטָהּ — כְּשֵׁרָה. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר יַנַּאי מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס: צְרִיכָה בְּדִיקָה.
human_translation: We learned there: trampled or threw it wall, or if an animal crushed it, twitching if waited, from time until time and he slaughtered it, it is kosher, Rabbi Elazar bar Yannai said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Antigonus: It requires examination
