llm_translation: We learned there: If one crushed it or tore it in the wall, or if it was punctured by an animal and it convulsed, and it remained from time to time and was slaughtered - it is valid. Rabbi Elazar bar Yannai said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Antigonus: It requires examination.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מֵרַבִּי זֵירָא: מַהוּ לְשׇׁחְטָהּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב? מִי מַחְזְקִינַן רֵעוּתָא בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya inquired of Rabbi Zeira: What is with regard to slaughtering it on a Festival? Do we assume on a Festival a flaw or not?
llm_translation: Requested of him Rabbi Yirmeya from Rabbi Zeira: What about slaughtering it on a festival? Do we establish friendship on a festival, or not?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵינָא: אֵין מְלַבְּנִין אֶת הָרְעָפִים לִצְלוֹת בָּהֶן. וַהֲוֵינַן בַּהּ: מַאי קָא עָבֵיד? וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָכָא בִּרְעָפִים חֲדָשִׁים עָסְקִינַן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁצָּרִיךְ לְבׇדְקָן.
human_translation: He said to him We learned one may not whiten tiles roast on them. And we discussed it: What does he do? And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Here we are dealing with new tiles, because needs to test them,
llm_translation: He said to him, "We have learned: One may not whitewash the rafters to use them for roasting." And we were in it: What is he doing? And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Here we are dealing with new rafters, because one needs to inspect them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנַן מִפְּנֵי שֶׁצָּרִיךְ לְחׇסְמָן מַתְנִינַן לַהּ.
human_translation: He said to him: we learned that because it is necessary to harden them
llm_translation: He said to him: We, because we need to seal it, we teach it to him.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: אֶחָד מֵבִיא אֶת הָאוּר, וְאֶחָד מֵבִיא אֶת הָעֵצִים, וְאֶחָד שׁוֹפֵת אֶת הַקְּדֵרָה, וְאֶחָד מֵבִיא אֶת הַמַּיִם, וְאֶחָד נוֹתֵן בְּתוֹכוֹ תַּבְלִין, וְאֶחָד מֵגִיס — כּוּלָּן חַיָּיבִין. וְהָתַנְיָא: אַחֲרוֹן חַיָּיב וְכוּלָּן פְּטוּרִין! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּאַיְיתִי אוּר מֵעִיקָּרָא, הָא דְּאַיְיתִי אוּר לְבַסּוֹף.
human_translation: is taught One brings the fire, and one brings the wood, and one places the pot and one brings the water and one puts spices into and one stirs they are all liable But wasn’t it taught the last one is liable and all are exempt? is not difficult. This in which he brought fire at the outset, that in which he brought fire at the end.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One brings the fire, and one brings the wood, and one cleans the pot, and one brings the water, and one puts spices in it, and one stirs - all of them are liable. And it was taught: The last one is liable, and all the others are exempt! This is not difficult: the one who brings the fire initially, and the one who brings the fire at the end.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא כּוּלְּהוּ קָא עָבְדִי מַעֲשֶׂה, אֶלָּא שׁוֹפֵת אֶת הַקְּדֵרָה מַאי קָא עָבֵיד? אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: הָכָא בִּקְדֵרָה חֲדָשָׁה עָסְקִינַן, וּמִשּׁוּם לִבּוּן רְעָפִים נָגְעוּ בָּהּ.
human_translation: Granted, all of them performed an action But one who places the pot what has he performed? Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Here we are dealing with a new pot, and due to whitening tiles they applied it.
llm_translation: In truth, all of them were involved in the matter, but what is he doing by inspecting the pot? Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Here we are dealing with a new pot, and due to the soot, ashes touched it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: תַּנּוּר וְכִירַיִם חֲדָשִׁים — הֲרֵי הֵן כְּכׇל הַכֵּלִים הַנִּטָּלִין בֶּחָצֵר. אֲבָל אֵין סָכִין אוֹתָם שֶׁמֶן, וְאֵין טָשִׁין אוֹתָן בְּמַטְלִית, וְאֵין מְפִיגִין אוֹתָן בְּצוֹנֵן כְּדֵי לְחׇסְמָן, וְאִם בִּשְׁבִיל לֶאֱפוֹת — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּתָּר.
human_translation: The Sages taught New ovens and stoves are similar to all vessels that carried in a courtyard However, one may not anoint them with oil, nor rub them with a rag, nor cool them with cold harden them And if in order to bake this is permitted.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: New ovens and stoves - behold they are like all utensils that are placed in the courtyard. But one may not smear them with oil, nor wrap them in a cloth, nor seal them with clay in order to insulate them, and if it is for baking - this is permitted.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מוֹלְגִין אֶת הָרֹאשׁ וְאֶת הָרַגְלַיִם וּמְהַבְהֲבִין אוֹתָן בָּאוּר, אֲבָל אֵין טוֹפְלִין אוֹתָם בְּחַרְסִית, וְלֹא בַּאֲדָמָה, וְלֹא בְּסִיד. וְאֵין גּוֹזְזִין אוֹתָן בְּמִסְפָּרַיִם.
human_translation: The Sages taught one may scald the head and the feet and one may singe them in fire but one may not smear them with clay, nor earth, nor lime And one may not shear with scissors,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One may shave the head and the legs and burn them in the light, but one may not wrap them in pottery, nor in earth, nor in lime. And one may not cut them with scissors.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין גּוֹזְזִין אֶת הַיָּרָק בַּתִּסְפּוֹרֶת שֶׁלּוֹ. אֲבָל מְתַקְּנִין אֶת הַקּוּנְדָּס וְאֶת הָעַכָּבִיּוֹת, וּמַסִּיקִין וְאוֹפִין בְּפוּרְנִי, וּמְחַמִּין חַמִּין בְּאַנְטִיכִי, וְאֵין אוֹפִין בְּפוּרְנִי חֲדָשָׁה שֶׁמָּא תִּפָּחֵת.
human_translation: one may not trim the vegetable with its shears, but one may prepare kundas and akaviyot , And one may kindle and bake in a large baker’s oven [ purnei ], and one may heat water in an antikhi , but one may not bake in a new baker’s oven lest it break.
llm_translation: And one does not cut the vegetable with its knife. But they fix the gourd and the cucumbers, and they boil and bake in a furnace, and they heat hot water in an antique vessel, and they do not bake in a new furnace lest it diminish.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין נוֹפְחִין בְּמַפּוּחַ, אֲבָל נוֹפְחִין בִּשְׁפוֹפֶרֶת. וְאֵין מְתַקְּנִין אֶת הַשַּׁפּוּד, וְאֵין מְחַדְּדִין אוֹתוֹ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מְפַצְּעִין אֶת הַקָּנֶה לִצְלוֹת בּוֹ מָלִיחַ, אֲבָל מְפַצְּעִין אֶת הָאֱגוֹז בְּמַטְלִית, וְאֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין שֶׁמָּא תִּקָּרַע.
human_translation: The Sages taught One may not blow with bellows, but one may blow with a tube, And one may not mend a skewer nor sharpen it. The Sages taught One may not break a reed to roast salted but one may crack a nut with a rag, and there is no concern lest it tear,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One may not blow into a bellows, but one may blow into a pipe. And one may not fix the wick, nor may one sharpen it. The Rabbis taught: One may not injure a reed to use it for salting, but one may injure a nut with a cloth, and there is no concern that it may tear.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: עוֹמֵד אָדָם עַל הַמּוּקְצֶה
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer further stated A person may stand over storage,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And furthermore, Rabbi Eliezer said: A person stands at the edge.

hebrew_text: עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת בַּשְּׁבִיעִית, וְאוֹמֵר: מִכָּאן אֲנִי אוֹכֵל לְמָחָר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עַד שֶׁיִּרְשׁוֹם וְיֹאמַר מִכָּאן וְעַד כָּאן.
human_translation: on Shabbat eve during the Sabbatical Year, and say: From here, I will eat tomorrow. And the Rabbis say: unless he marks and says: From here to there
llm_translation: On the eve of Shabbat during the seventh year, and one says: "From here I will eat tomorrow." And the sages say: "Until they inherit it and say from here to here."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תְּנַן הָתָם: תִּינוֹקוֹת שֶׁטָּמְנוּ תְּאֵנִים מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת וְשָׁכְחוּ וְלֹא עִשְּׂרוּ — לְמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת לֹא יֹאכְלוּ אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן עִשְּׂרוּ. וּתְנַן נָמֵי: הַמַּעֲבִיר תְּאֵנִים בַּחֲצֵרוֹ לְקַצּוֹת — בָּנָיו וּבְנֵי בֵּיתוֹ אוֹכְלִין מֵהֶן עֲרַאי וּפְטוּרִים.
human_translation: We learned there: Children who hid figs on Shabbat eve and they forgot and did not separate tithes, after the conclusion of Shabbat, they may not eat until they have separated tithes. And we also learned One who transfers figs in his courtyard in order to dry his children and the members of his household may partake of them a casual and they are exempt
llm_translation: We learned there: Infants who hid figs on Friday evening and forgot, and did not tithe - on the conclusion of Shabbat they may not eat them unless they tithe. And we also learned: One who transfers figs in his courtyard to dry them - his sons and the members of his household may eat from them temporarily and are exempt.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִנֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: שַׁבָּת, מַהוּ שֶׁתִּקְבַּע מוּקְצֶה לְמַעֲשֵׂר בְּדָבָר שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתּוֹ? מִי אָמְרִינַן, כֵּיוָן דִּכְתִיב: ״וְקָרָאתָ לַשַּׁבָּת עוֹנֶג״, קָבְעָה וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּדָבָר שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתּוֹ, אוֹ דִלְמָא: בְּדָבָר שֶׁנִּגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתּוֹ — קָבְעָה, בְּדָבָר שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתּוֹ — לָא קָבְעָה?
human_translation: Rava inquired of Rav Naḥman: Shabbat, what is whether it establish to tithe muktze an item whose labor has not been completed, Do we say since it is written: “And call Shabbat a delight” establishes even for an item that has not labor completed? Or perhaps establishes an item whose labor is completed, an item whose labor is not completed it does not establish
llm_translation: Rava asked Rav Nachman: Shabbat, what is the law regarding establishing a boundary for tithing in a matter whose work has not been completed? Do we say, since it is written: "And you shall call the Sabbath a delight," that one may establish it even in a matter whose work has not been completed, or perhaps: in a matter whose work has been completed, one may establish it, but in a matter whose work has not been completed, one may not establish it?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שַׁבָּת קוֹבַעַת, בֵּין בְּדָבָר שֶׁנִּגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתּוֹ, בֵּין בְּדָבָר שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתּוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְאֵימָא שַׁבָּת דּוּמְיָא דְחָצֵר, מָה חָצֵר — אֵינָהּ קוֹבַעַת אֶלָּא בְּדָבָר שֶׁנִּגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתּוֹ, אַף שַׁבָּת — לֹא תִּקְבַּע אֶלָּא בְּדָבָר שֶׁנִּגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתּוֹ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תַּלְמוּד עָרוּךְ הוּא בְּיָדֵינוּ שֶׁהַשַּׁבָּת קוֹבַעַת, בֵּין בְּדָבָר שֶׁנִּגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתּוֹ, בֵּין בְּדָבָר שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתּוֹ.
human_translation: said to Shabbat establishes both an item whose work is completed and things whose work is not completed. said to But say Shabbat similar a courtyard: Just as a courtyard establishes only the work on an item is completed, so too, Shabbat establish only an item whose work is completed said to we have it as an ordered teaching that Shabbat establishes both things whose work is completed and things whose work is not completed.
llm_translation: He said to him: Shabbat establishes, whether in a matter that its work has been completed, or in a matter that its work has not been completed. He said to him: And why not say that Shabbat is similar to a courtyard, just as a courtyard only establishes in a matter that its work has been completed, so too Shabbat - it only establishes in a matter that its work has been completed! He said to him: The Talmud is arranged in our hands that Shabbat establishes, whether in a matter that its work has been completed, or in a matter that its work has not been completed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא, וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: עוֹמֵד אָדָם עַל הַמּוּקְצֶה עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת בַּשְּׁבִיעִית וְכוּ׳. טַעְמָא דִּשְׁבִיעִית — דְּלָאו בַּר עַשּׂוֹרֵי הוּא, הָא בִּשְׁאָר שְׁנֵי שָׁבוּעַ — הָכִי נָמֵי דְּאָסוּר, מַאי טַעְמָא — לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּשַׁבָּת קָבְעָה?
human_translation: Mar Zutra, son of Rav Naḥman, said: We, too, have learned And Rabbi Eliezer further stated a person may stand over storage on Shabbat eve during the Sabbatical Year The reason is that Sabbatical Year, which is not obligated to tithes. However, if in the other years of the Sabbatical so too, prohibited What is the reason Is it not because Shabbat establishes
llm_translation: Master Zutra, son of Rav Nachman, said: We also learned this, and Rabbi Eliezer further said: A person may stand at the edge of the boundary on Erev Shabbat of the seventh year, etc. The reason for the seventh year - because it is not a fixed time, but in the other two weeks - it is thus said that it is forbidden. What is the reason? Not because Shabbat has established it?

hebrew_text: לָא, שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר: ״מִכָּאן אֲנִי אוֹכֵל לְמָחָר״ — קָבַע לֵיהּ עִלָּוֵיהּ. אִי הָכִי מַאי אִרְיָא שַׁבָּת, אֲפִילּוּ בְּחוֹל נָמֵי! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּטֶבֶל מוּכָן הוּא אֵצֶל שַׁבָּת, שֶׁאִם עָבַר וְתִקְּנוֹ — מְתוּקָּן.
human_translation: there it is different: Since he said: From here I will eat tomorrow, he has established for himself with them, If so, why particularly Shabbat? Even on a weekday also This teach us that untithed produce it is prepared with regard to Shabbat, in that if one transgressed and corrected it it is corrected.
llm_translation: Not so, it is different there, since he said: "From here I will eat tomorrow" - he has established it upon him. If so, what is the difference with Shabbat, even on a weekday also! This teaches us that if it was immersed and prepared for Shabbat, if it broke and he fixed it - it is considered fixed.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא מוֹתָרוֹ חוֹזֵר, וְשָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְּאָמַר: כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּמוֹתָרוֹ חוֹזֵר — לָא קָבַע!
human_translation: But isn’t it the remaining is restored And we have heard Rabbi Eliezer said: Anywhere that its leftovers are restored, it is not established
llm_translation: And isn't it permitted to return, and we heard from Rabbi Eliezer who said: "Wherever it is permitted to return - it is not established!"

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: הַנּוֹטֵל זֵיתִים מִן הַמַּעֲטָן — טוֹבֵל אַחַת אַחַת בְּמֶלַח וְאוֹכֵל. וְאִם טָבַל וְנָתַן לְפָנָיו עֲשָׂרָה — חַיָּיב. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִן הַמַּעֲטָן טָהוֹר — חַיָּיב, מִן הַמַּעֲטָן טָמֵא — פָּטוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מַחֲזִיר אֶת הַמּוֹתָר.
human_translation: as we learned One who removes olives from a vat [ ma’atan ] may dip one by one in salt and eat And if he dipped and placed before him, ten, liable Rabbi Eliezer says: from a ritually pure vat is liable from a ritually impure vat is exempt because he returns the surplus
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: One who takes olives from a vat - dips each one in salt and eats. And if he dipped and placed before him ten - he is liable. Rabbi Eliezer says: If it is pure from the vat - he is liable, if it is impure from the vat - he is exempt, because he is returning what is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא? וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: רֵישָׁא בְּמַעֲטָן טָהוֹר וְגַבְרָא טָמֵא, דְּלָא מָצֵי מַהְדַּר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And we discussed it: What is different the first clause and what is different the latter clause; And Rabbi Abbahu said: The first case to a ritually pure vat and a ritually impure person, He may not return
llm_translation: We were in it: What is the difference between the beginning and the end? And Rabbi Avahu said: The beginning is with a small amount pure and a large amount impure, for one cannot return it.

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא בְּמַעֲטָן טָמֵא וְגַבְרָא טָמֵא, דְּמָצֵי מַהְדַּר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: the latter clause to a ritually impure vat and a person ritually impure, who may return
llm_translation: The latter part: with a small quantity impure and a large quantity impure, for it is found that he returns it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי בְּמוּקְצֶה טָהוֹר וְגַבְרָא טָמֵא, דְּלָא מָצֵי מַהְדַּר לֵיהּ. וַהֲלֹא מוּחְזָרִין וְעוֹמְדִין הֵן!
human_translation: The mishna also with a ritually pure storage and a ritually impure person, who may not return them But aren’t they already returned?
llm_translation: Mishna: In a case where the object is pure and the person is impure, he cannot find someone to return it to him. But they are turning around and standing!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר קָא אָמְרַתְּ? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: תְּרוּמָה קָבְעָה, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן שַׁבָּת. דִּתְנַן: פֵּירוֹת שֶׁתְּרָמָן עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתָּן, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹסֵר לֶאֱכוֹל מֵהֶן עֲרַאי, וַחֲכָמִים מַתִּירִין.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: Rabbi Eliezer, you said? Rabbi Eliezer to his reasoning, as he said teruma establishes And, all the more so, Shabbat as we learned Fruits from which teruma has been separated before their work was completed, Rabbi Eliezer prohibits eating from them a casual but the Rabbis permit
llm_translation: Rather, said Rav Shimi bar Ashi: Did you say this, Rabbi Eliezer? Rabbi Eliezer according to his reasoning, for he said: A fixed contribution is established, and all the more so Shabbat. For it was taught: Regarding fruits that were tithed before their work was completed, Rabbi Eliezer prohibits eating from them temporarily, while the Sages permit it.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע מִסֵּיפָא, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עַד שֶׁיִּרְשׁוֹם וְיֹאמַר ״מִכָּאן וְעַד כָּאן״. טַעְמָא דְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת בַּשְּׁבִיעִית — דְּלָאו בַּר עַשּׂוֹרֵי הוּא, הָא בִּשְׁאָר שְׁנֵי שָׁבוּעַ, דִּבְנֵי עַשּׂוֹרֵי נִינְהוּ — אֲסוּרִים. מַאי טַעְמָא, לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּשַׁבָּת קָבְעָה?
human_translation: Come hear from the latter clause And the Rabbis say: unless one marks and says From here to there. The reason is that the eve of Shabbat the Sabbatical Year is not fit for tithes; but during other years of the Sabbatical are fit for tithes, are prohibited. What is the reason? Is it not because Shabbat establishes
llm_translation: Come and hear from the latter part, and the sages say: Until they inherit it and say, "From here to here." The reason for Erev Shabbat on the seventh day - because it is not on the tenth day, but on the rest of the two weeks, for they are considered as the sons of the tenth day - they are forbidden. What is the reason? Is it not because Shabbat is established?

hebrew_text: לָא, שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר: ״מִכָּאן וְעַד כָּאן אֲנִי אוֹכֵל לְמָחָר״ — קָבַע לֵיהּ. אִי הָכִי, מַאי אִרְיָא שַׁבָּת? אֲפִילּוּ בְּחוֹל נָמֵי! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּטֶבֶל מוּכָן הוּא אֵצֶל שַׁבָּת, שֶׁאִם עָבַר וְתִקְּנוֹ — מְתוּקָּן.
human_translation: No, there it is different. Since he said: From here to there I will eat tomorrow, he has established If so, why discuss Shabbat; even on a weekday as well This teach us, that untithed produce it is prepared with regard to Shabbat, in that if one transgressed and tithed it, it is tithed.
llm_translation: Not so, it is different there, since he said: "From here until here I will eat for tomorrow" — he established it. If so, what is the difference with regard to Shabbat? Even on a weekday as well! This teaches us that if it was prepared before Shabbat, if he transgressed and fixed it — it is considered fixed.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: הָיָה אוֹכֵל בָּאֶשְׁכּוֹל, וְנִכְנַס מִגִּנָּה לֶחָצֵר, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יִגְמוֹר, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: לֹא יִגְמוֹר.
human_translation: And we raise a contradiction If one was eating from a cluster and came in from a garden, to a courtyard, Rabbi Eliezer says: He may finish Rabbi Yehoshua says: He may not finish.
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: If one was eating in the vineyard and entered from the garden into the courtyard, Rabbi Eliezer says: Let him finish, Rabbi Yehoshua says: Let him not finish.

hebrew_text: חָשְׁכָה בְּלֵילֵי שַׁבָּת, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יִגְמוֹר, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: לֹא יִגְמוֹר!
human_translation: if it grew dark on the night of Shabbat, Rabbi Eliezer says: He may finish, And Rabbi Yehoshua says: He may not finish.
llm_translation: Darkness on the nights of Shabbat, Rabbi Eliezer says: Let it finish, Rabbi Yehoshua says: Let it not finish!

hebrew_text: הָתָם כִּדְקָתָנֵי טַעְמָא, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: לֹא כְּשֶׁאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר ״יִגְמוֹר״ — בֶּחָצֵר יִגְמוֹר, אֶלָּא: יוֹצֵא חוּץ לֶחָצֵר וְיִגְמוֹר. וְלֹא כְּשֶׁאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר ״יִגְמוֹר״ — בְּשַׁבָּת יִגְמוֹר, אֶלָּא מַמְתִּין לְמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת וְיִגְמוֹר.
human_translation: There, the reason is as he taught Rabbi Natan says: not that when Rabbi Eliezer said: He may finish, he may finish in the courtyard but rather He may exit the courtyard and finish. And not that when Rabbi Eliezer said: He may finish, he may finish on Shabbat but rather, he may wait until the conclusion of Shabbat and finish.
llm_translation: There, as it was taught the reason, Rabbi Natan says: Not like when Rabbi Eliezer said "finish" — in the courtyard one should finish, rather: go out beyond the courtyard and finish. And not like when Rabbi Eliezer said "finish" — on Shabbat one should finish, rather wait until after Shabbat and then finish.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֶחָד שַׁבָּת, וְאֶחָד תְּרוּמָה, וְאֶחָד חָצֵר, וְאֶחָד מִקָּח — כּוּלָּן אֵין קוֹבְעִין, אֶלָּא בְּדָבָר שֶׁנִּגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתָּן.
human_translation: when Ravin came he said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Whether Shabbat; or teruma or a courtyard or a transaction; all of these establish only items whose labor is completed.
llm_translation: When Rabbin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: One regarding Shabbat, and one regarding Terumah, and one regarding a courtyard, and one regarding a purchase - all of them do not establish, except in a matter that their work has been completed.

hebrew_text: שַׁבָּת — לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּהִלֵּל, דְּתַנְיָא: הַמְעַמֵּר פֵּירוֹת מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם לִקְצוֹר, וְקִדֵּשׁ עֲלֵיהֶן הַיּוֹם, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: הִלֵּל לְעַצְמוֹ אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: Shabbat to exclude Hillel, as it is taught One who gathers fruits from one place to another to reap and the day sanctified upon them, Rabbi Yehuda said: Hillel prohibits himself.
llm_translation: Shabbat - to dispute with Hillel, as it was taught: One who ties fruits from place to place in order to harvest them, and sanctifies them on that day, Rabbi Yehuda said: Hillel himself prohibits.

hebrew_text: חָצֵר — לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב. דִּתְנַן: הַמַּעֲבִיר תְּאֵנִים בַּחֲצֵרוֹ לְקַצּוֹת — בָּנָיו וּבְנֵי בֵּיתוֹ אוֹכְלִין מֵהֶן עֲרַאי, וּפְטוּרִים מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר. וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב מְחַיֵּיב, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: a courtyard to exclude of Rabbi Ya’akov. As we learned One who was transporting figs in his courtyard to make them into dried figs, his children and the members of his household may eat from them a casual and they are exempt from tithes. And is taught in that regard: Rabbi Ya’akov obligates and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, exempts
llm_translation: Courtyard - to exempt from the teachings of Rabbi Yaakov. For it was taught: One who transfers figs in his courtyard to dry them out - his sons and the members of his household may eat from them temporarily, and they are exempt from tithing. And it was taught further: Rabbi Yaakov obligates them to tithe, while Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, exempts them.

hebrew_text: תְּרוּמָה — לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. דִּתְנַן: פֵּירוֹת שֶׁתְּרָמָן עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתָּן, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹסֵר לֶאֱכוֹל מֵהֶן עֲרַאי, וַחֲכָמִים מַתִּירִין.
human_translation: teruma to exclude of Rabbi Eliezer. As we learned Fruits from which teruma had been separated before their work was completed, Rabbi Eliezer prohibits eating from them a casual and the Rabbis permit
llm_translation: Trumah - to the emissaries of Rabbi Eliezer. As we learned: The fruits that have been designated as trumah before their work is completed, Rabbi Eliezer prohibits eating from them temporarily, while the sages permit it.

hebrew_text: מִקָּח — (כְּדִתְנַן) הַלּוֹקֵחַ תְּאֵנִים מֵעַם הָאָרֶץ, בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁרוֹב בְּנֵי אָדָם דּוֹרְסִין, אוֹכֵל מֵהֶן עֲרַאי, וּמְעַשְּׂרָן דְּמַאי.
human_translation: a transaction as we learned one who acquires figs from an am ha’aretz in a place where most people press he may partake of them a casual And he tithe them as doubtfully tithed produce,
llm_translation: Acquisition — (as we have learned) one who acquires figs from an am ha'aretz, in a place where the majority of people trample, may eat them temporarily, and must tithe them for demai.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תְּלָת. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מִקָּח אֵינָהּ קוֹבַעַת אֶלָּא בְּדָבָר שֶׁנִּגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתּוֹ, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: רוֹב עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ מְעַשְּׂרִין הֵן, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מְעַשְּׂרִין דְּמַאי מֵעַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ אֲפִילּוּ בְּדָבָר שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתּוֹ.
human_translation: learn from three Learn from here a transaction establishes only with regard to an item whose work is completed, And learn from here most am ha’aretz separate tithes, And learn from here One may tithe doubtfully tithed produce from an am ha’aretz , even with regard to something whose work is not completed.
llm_translation: Listen, infer three. Listen, infer: A purchase does not establish except in a matter that its work has been completed, and listen, infer: Most common people tithe, and listen, infer: They tithe produce of uncertain tithing status even in a matter that its work has not been completed.

hebrew_text: וּלְאַפּוֹקֵי מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: הַמַּחֲלִיף פֵּירוֹת עִם חֲבֵירוֹ, זֶה לֶאֱכוֹל וְזֶה לֶאֱכוֹל, זֶה לְקַצּוֹת וְזֶה לְקַצּוֹת, זֶה לֶאֱכוֹל וְזֶה לְקַצּוֹת — חַיָּיב. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֶאֱכוֹל — חַיָּיב, לְקַצּוֹת — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: to exclude that which we learned One who exchanges fruits with his friend, this one to eat and that one to eat, this one to make them into dried fruit and for that one to make them into dried fruit, this one to eat and that one to make them into dried fruit, obligated Rabbi Yehuda, says: to eat is obligated, to make them into dried fruit is exempt
llm_translation: To go out from that which we learned: One who exchanges fruits with his fellow, this one to eat and this one to eat, this one to cut and this one to cut, this one to eat and this one to cut - is liable. Rabbi Yehuda says: To eat - liable, to cut - exempt.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַמֵּבִיא
llm_translation: We will return to you, the one who brings.

hebrew_text: מַשִּׁילִין פֵּירוֹת דֶּרֶךְ אֲרוּבָּה בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אֲבָל לֹא בְּשַׁבָּת. וּמְכַסִּים פֵּירוֹת בְּכֵלִים מִפְּנֵי הַדֶּלֶף, וְכֵן כַּדֵּי יַיִן וְכַדֵּי שֶׁמֶן. וְנוֹתְנִין כְּלִי תַּחַת הַדֶּלֶף בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: One may lower produce, through a skylight on a Festival, however, not on Shabbat. And one may cover produce with cloths due to a leak and similarly jugs of wine and jugs of oil And one may place a vessel beneath a leak on Shabbat,
llm_translation: We place fruits through an eruv on a festival, but not on Shabbat. And we cover fruits in vessels because of dripping, and likewise for wine and oil. And we place a vessel underneath the drip on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִתְּמַר: רַב יְהוּדָה וְרַב נָתָן, חַד תָּנֵי ״מַשִּׁילִין״, וְחַד תָּנֵי ״מַשְׁחִילִין״.
human_translation: It was said: Rav Yehuda and Rav Natan One taught mashilin , and one taught mashḥilin .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara itmar: Rav Yehudah veRav Natan, chad tanay "mashilin", veChad tanay "mashchilin". English translation: It was stated in the Gemara: Rav Yehudah and Rav Natan, one taught "mashilin", and one taught "mashchilin".

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: מַאן דְּתָנֵי ״מַשִּׁילִין״ לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ, וּמַאן דְּתָנֵי ״מַשְׁחִילִין״ לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ. מַאן דְּתָנֵי ״מַשִּׁילִין״ לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי יִשַּׁל זֵיתֶךָ״. וּמַאן דְּתָנֵי ״מַשְׁחִילִין״ לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ, דִּתְנַן: הַשָּׁחוּל וְהַכָּסוּל. שָׁחוּל — שֶׁנִּשְׁמְטָה יְרֵכוֹ, כָּסוּל — שֶׁאֶחָד מִיַּרְכוֹתָיו גְּבוֹהָה מֵחֲבֶרְתָּהּ.
human_translation: Mar Zutra said: The one who teaches mashilin is not mistaken, and the one who teaches mashḥilin is not mistaken, The one who teaches mashilin is not mistaken, as it is written: “For your olives will fall [ yishal ]” And he who teaches mashḥilin is not mistaken, as we learned The shaḥul and the kasul . Shaḥul whose thigh is dislocated, kasul one of whose thighs is higher than the other.
llm_translation: Master Zutra said: One who teaches "mashilin" does not become confused, and one who teaches "mashchilin" does not become confused. One who teaches "mashilin" does not become confused, as it is written: "When your olive tree sheds its fruit." And one who teaches "mashchilin" does not become confused, as we learned: the "shachul" and the "kasul." Shachul - when its thigh slipped out, kasul - when one of its thighs is higher than the other.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַאן דְּתָנֵי ״מַשִּׁירִין״ לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ, וּמַאן דְּתָנֵי ״מַשְׁחִירִין״ לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ, וּמַאן דְּתָנֵי ״מַנְשִׁירִין״ לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said One who teaches mashirin is not mistaken, and one who teaches mashḥirin is not mistaken, and one who teaches manshirin is not mistaken.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: One who teaches "mashirin" does not become wealthy, and one who teaches "mashchirin" does not become wealthy, and one who teaches "manshirin" does not become wealthy.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּתָנֵי ״מַשִּׁירִין״ לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ, דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: נָזִיר לֹא יָחוֹף רֹאשׁוֹ בַּאֲדָמָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּשִּׁיר אֶת הַשֵּׂעָר. וּמַאן דְּתָנֵי ״מַשְׁחִירִין״ לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ, דִּתְנַן: הַשְּׁחוֹר וְהַזּוּג שֶׁל סַפָּרִים, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנֶּחְלְקוּ — טְמֵאִין.
human_translation: One who teaches mashirin is not mistaken, as we learned Rabbi Yishmael says: A nazirite may not wash his head with clay because it causes hair to fall off [ mashir ], And one who teaches mashḥirin is not mistaken, as we learned The sheḥor , and a barber’s scissors, even if are detached, are subject to ritual impurity.
llm_translation: One who teaches "mashirin" does not become ritually impure, as we learned: Rabbi Yishmael says: A Nazirite should not rub his head on the ground, because he makes his hair unkempt. And one who teaches "mashchirin" does not become ritually impure, as we learned: The black and white threads of books, even though they are separated - they are impure.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּתָנֵי ״מַנְשִׁירִין״ לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ, דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁנָּשְׁרוּ כֵּלָיו בַּמַּיִם — מְהַלֵּךְ בָּהֶם וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ. אִי נָמֵי מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ לֶקֶט — הַנּוֹשֵׁר בִּשְׁעַת קְצִירָה.
human_translation: And one who teaches manshirin is not mistaken as we learned One whose clothes fell down [ nashru ] into water may walk in them and he need not be concerned Alternatively, from that which we learned What is gleaning [ leket ], That which falls [ nosher ] during reaping.
llm_translation: The one who teaches "man'shirin" does not become impure, as we learned: "One whose clothes became wet with water - he may walk in them and is not concerned." Alternatively, from what we learned: "What is considered gleanings? - That which is gleaned at the time of harvest."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: מַשִּׁילִין פֵּירוֹת דֶּרֶךְ אֲרוּבָּה בְּיוֹם טוֹב. עַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּאוֹתָהּ שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ: מְפַנִּין אַרְבַּע וְחָמֵשׁ קוּפּוֹת שֶׁל תֶּבֶן וְשֶׁל תְּבוּאָה מִפְּנֵי הָאוֹרְחִים, וּמִפְּנֵי בִּטּוּל בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ.
human_translation: We learned one may lower produce through a skylight on a Festival. Up to how much Rabbi Zeira said Rav Asi said, and some say Rav Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: like that which we learned One may clear out four or five sacks of hay or grain due to visitors, or due to suspension of the study hall,
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: One may spread out fruits in the path of an eruv on a festival. Until when? Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rabbi Assi, and some say he said in the name of Rabbi Assi in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Just as we learned: They remove four or five bundles of straw and produce from the path of travelers, and due to the neglect of the study hall.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאִיכָּא בִּטּוּל בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, אֲבָל הָכָא דְּלֵיכָּא בִּטּוּל בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ — לָא. אִי נָמֵי: הָתָם הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא, דְּאַרְבַּע וְחָמֵשׁ קוּפּוֹת שְׁרֵי מִשּׁוּם שַׁבָּת דַּחֲמִירָא וְלָא אָתֵי לְזַלְזוֹלֵי בַּיהּ, אֲבָל יוֹם טוֹב דְּקִיל וְאָתֵי לְזַלְזוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ — כְּלָל כְּלָל לָא.
human_translation: But perhaps there it is different, since there is suspension of the study hall But here, where there is no suspension of the study hall, not Alternatively: There, this is the reasoning that four or five sacks are permitted: Because Shabbat is severe and they will not come to belittle it; but a Festival, which is lightly and which might come to belittle, not at all.
llm_translation: And perhaps it is different there, because there is nullification in the study hall, but here where there is no nullification in the study hall - no. If you wish: there, that is the reason, that four or five cups are permitted because of the stringency of Shabbat, and it does not come to treat it lightly, but on a festival where it is lenient and it comes to treat it lightly - absolutely not.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי לְאִידַּךְ גִּיסָא: הָתָם הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא, דְּלֵיכָּא הֶפְסֵד מָמוֹן, אֲבָל הָכָא דְּאִיכָּא הֶפְסֵד מָמוֹן, אֲפִילּוּ טוּבָא נָמֵי.
human_translation: Alternatively, from the other perspective: There, this is the reasoning Because there is no monetary loss But here, where there is monetary loss even a larger amount
llm_translation: If so, according to your reasoning, there is a difference: There, that is the reason, because there is no financial loss, but here, where there is financial loss, even a greater amount.

hebrew_text: הָתָם תְּנַן ״אֲבָל לֹא אֶת הָאוֹצָר״, וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מַאי ״אֲבָל לֹא אֶת הָאוֹצָר״ — אֲבָל לֹא יִגְמוֹר אֶת הָאוֹצָר כּוּלּוֹ, דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְאַשְׁוֹיֵי גּוּמּוֹת. הָכָא מַאי?
human_translation: We learned elsewhere, But may not a storeroom. And Shmuel said: What is But not a storeroom? But one may not finish the entire storeroom lest he come to level out depressions What would be here,
llm_translation: There, we learned, "But not the treasure," and Shmuel said: What is "But not the treasure"? - But not to finish the entire treasure, perhaps one will come to mix the types. What is the case here?

hebrew_text: הָתָם הוּא בְּשַׁבָּת דְּאָסוּר — מִשּׁוּם דַּחֲמִיר, אֲבָל יוֹם טוֹב דְּקִיל — שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי. אוֹ דִלְמָא: הָתָם דְּאִיכָּא בִּטּוּל בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ — אָמְרַתְּ לָא, הָכָא דְּלֵיכָּא בִּטּוּל בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן.
human_translation: it is there, on Shabbat, that it is prohibited, because severe, but a Festival, which lighter it is acceptable. Or perhaps There, there is suspension of the study hall, you say not Here, where there is no suspension of the study hall, not all the more so
llm_translation: There, it is on Shabbat that it is forbidden — because it is stringent, but on Yom Tov that it is lenient — it is fine. Or perhaps: there, where there is a cessation of study in the study hall — you say no, but here, where there is no cessation of study in the study hall — not at all.

hebrew_text: וְהָכָא תְּנַן: מַשִּׁילִין פֵּירוֹת דֶּרֶךְ אֲרוּבָּה בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּאוֹתוֹ הַגָּג, אֲבָל מִגַּג לְגַג — לָא. וְתַנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אֵין מְטַלְטְלִין מִגַּג לְגַג אֲפִילּוּ כְּשֶׁגַּגּוֹתֵיהֶן שָׁוִין.
human_translation: And here we learned One may lower produce through a skylight on a Festival, and Rav Naḥman said: They taught only with regard to the same roof, but from roof to roof not And is also taught One may not carry from roof to roof, even when roofs are on the same level
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: And here we learned in a Mishnah: One may transfer fruits through an eruv on a festival day, and Rav Nachman said: They only taught this regarding that roof, but from one roof to another - no. And it was also taught likewise in a Baraita: One may not transfer from roof to roof even if their roofs are equal.

hebrew_text: הָתָם מַאי? (כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן שַׁבָּת דַּחֲמִירָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא:) הָכָא הוּא דְּאָסוּר — מִשּׁוּם יוֹם טוֹב דְּקִיל, וְאָתֵי לְזַלְזוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ, אֲבָל שַׁבָּת דַּחֲמִירָא, וְלָא אָתֵי לְזַלְזוֹלֵי בַּהּ — שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: There, what is all the more so Shabbat, severe Or perhaps It is here, that prohibited because a Festival lightly and they might come to belittle it; but Shabbat, which is severe and they will not come to belittle it, it is acceptable
llm_translation: There, what is it? (All the more so Shabbat, which is stringent, or perhaps:) Here is where it is forbidden — because of Yom Tov, which is lenient, and one might come to treat it lightly, but Shabbat, which is stringent, and one does not come to treat it lightly — it is proper.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא: מָה הָכָא דְּאִיכָּא הֶפְסֵד פֵּירוֹת — אָמְרַתְּ לָא, הָתָם דְּלֵיכָּא הֶפְסֵד פֵּירוֹת — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן.
human_translation: Or perhaps If here, when there is loss of produce, you say not there, when there is no loss of produce, not all the more so
llm_translation: Or perhaps: What is the case here where there is a loss of produce? You say no, there where there is no loss of produce, certainly not.

hebrew_text: הָכָא (תְּנַן): לֹא יְשַׁלְשְׁלֵם בְּחֶבֶל בְּחַלּוֹנוֹת, וְלֹא יוֹרִידֵם דֶּרֶךְ סוּלָּמוֹת, הָתָם מַאי? הָכָא בְּיוֹם טוֹב הוּא דְּאָסוּר — דְּלֵיכָּא בִּטּוּל בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, אֲבָל שַׁבָּת, דְּאִיכָּא בִּטּוּל בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ — שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Here, we learned he may not lower them by a rope through the windows, nor may he take them down by way of ladders. There, what is here, on a Festival, that prohibited, does not suspension of the study hall; but Shabbat, when there is suspension of the study hall, it is acceptable
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: Here (it was taught): One may not swing them (the shutters) with a rope on the windows, nor lower them by way of ladders. What is the reason there (in the Mishnah)? Here (in our case), it is on a festival day that it is prohibited — because there is no neglect of the study hall. But on Shabbat, where there is neglect of the study hall — it is fine.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא: הָכָא דְּאִיכָּא הֶפְסֵד פֵּירוֹת — אָמְרַתְּ לָא, הָתָם דְּלֵיכָּא הֶפְסֵד פֵּירוֹת — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן. תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Or perhaps Here, when there is loss of produce, you say not There, where there is no loss of produce, not all the more so shall stand
llm_translation: Or perhaps: here where there is a loss of fruits - you say no, there where there is no loss of fruits - certainly not. Teiku.

hebrew_text: וּמְכַסִּין אֶת הַפֵּירוֹת. אָמַר עוּלָּא: וַאֲפִילּוּ אַוֵּירָא דְלִבְנֵי. רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר: פֵּירוֹת הָרְאוּיִן. וְאַזְדָּא רַבִּי יִצְחָק לְטַעְמֵיהּ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אֵין כְּלִי נִיטָּל אֶלָּא לְדָבָר הַנִּיטָּל בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: And one may cover produce Ulla said: And even a row of bricks Rabbi Yitzḥak said: produce, which is fit And Rabbi Yitzḥak follows reasoning as Rabbi Yitzḥak said: A vessel, may be handled only for something that may be handled on Shabbat,
llm_translation: And covering the fruits. Ulla said: Even the air of Libnei. Rabbi Yitzchak said: Suitable fruits. And Rabbi Yitzchak was strengthened in his reasoning. For Rabbi Yitzchak said: A vessel is only removed for the item removed on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: מְכַסִּין אֶת הַפֵּירוֹת בְּכֵלִים. פֵּירוֹת — אִין, אַוֵּירָא דְלִבְנֵי — לָא! הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ אַוֵּירָא דְלִבְנֵי, וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא מַשִּׁילִין פֵּירוֹת — תְּנָא סֵיפָא נָמֵי מְכַסִּין אֶת הַפֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: We learned One may cover produce with cloths, Produce, yes, a row of bricks, no. the same is true even a row of bricks, since taught in the first clause One may lower produce, he taught also in the latter clause: One may cover produce.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: One may cover fruits with vessels. Fruits - yes, the air of Libnei - no! It is the same whether it is the air of Libnei, and since the first Tanna teaches that one may remove fruits, the latter Tanna similarly teaches that one may cover fruits.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: וְכֵן כַּדֵּי יַיִן וְכֵן כַּדֵּי שֶׁמֶן! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, בְּטִיבְלָא.
human_translation: We learned And similarly jugs of wine and jugs of oil With what are we dealing here? With that are untithed,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: "And similarly the measure for wine, and similarly the measure for oil!" Here, what are we dealing with? With regard to a ritual immersion.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ כַּדֵּי יַיִן וְכַדֵּי שֶׁמֶן דְּהֶתֵּירָא, הָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ רֵישָׁא פֵּירוֹת?
human_translation: So, too, it is reasonable as if it enters your mind jugs of wine and jugs of oil permitted didn’t teach in the first clause produce?
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: for if it were to enter your mind that the quantity of wine and the quantity of oil that is permitted, should be permitted, should the first fruits be given to him?

hebrew_text: כַּדֵּי יַיִן וְכַדֵּי שֶׁמֶן אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: לְהֶפְסֵד מְרוּבֶּה — חָשְׁשׁוּ, לְהֶפְסֵד מוּעָט — לֹא חָשְׁשׁוּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: it was necessary for jugs of wine and jugs of oil, it could enter your mind to say were concerned over a substantial loss, with regard to a minor loss, they were not concerned, teaches us
llm_translation: As much as the measure of wine and as much as the measure of oil is required, I would say: for a significant loss - they were concerned, for a minor loss - they were not concerned, this is what is implied to us.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: נוֹתְנִין כְּלִי תַּחַת הַדֶּלֶף בְּשַׁבָּת. בְּדֶלֶף הָרָאוּי.
human_translation: We learned One may place a vessel beneath a leak on Shabbat. leakage that fit
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: One may place a vessel under a leak on Shabbat. In the case of a leak that is expected.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: פּוֹרְסִין מַחְצֶלֶת עַל גַּבֵּי לְבֵנִים בְּשַׁבָּת! דְּאִיַּיתּוּר מִבִּנְיָנָא, דַּחֲזֵי לְמִזְגֵּא עֲלַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Come hear One may spread a mat over bricks on Shabbat that were left over from building which are fit for sitting on
llm_translation: Come and hear: One may spread a cucumber on top of bricks on Shabbat! For it is considered a temporary structure, as it appears to be a covering over them.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: פּוֹרְסִין מַחְצֶלֶת עַל גַּבֵּי אֲבָנִים בְּשַׁבָּת! בַּאֲבָנִים מְקוּרְזָלוֹת, דְּחַזְיָין לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא.
human_translation: Come hear One may spread a mat over stones on Shabbat, of rounded mekurzalot stones, which fit for in the lavatory
llm_translation: "Come and hear: One may spread a cucumber on top of stones on Shabbat! With stones that are smooth, for they are considered like a stool."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: פּוֹרְסִין מַחְצֶלֶת עַל גַּבֵּי כַּוֶּרֶת דְּבוֹרִים בְּשַׁבָּת, בַּחַמָּה — מִפְּנֵי הַחַמָּה, וּבַגְּשָׁמִים — מִפְּנֵי הַגְּשָׁמִים, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִתְכַּוֵּין לָצוּד! הָתָם נָמֵי, דְּאִיכָּא דְּבַשׁ.
human_translation: Come hear One may spread a mat over a beehive on Shabbat in the sun due to the sun, and in the rain due to the rain, provided he does not have the intent to trap There, too, when there is honey
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shma: porsin machzelet al gabbei kaveret devorim b'Shabbat, bachamah - mipnei hachamah, u'vagshamim - mipnei hagshamim, u'vilvad shelo yitkavein latsud! Hatam namei, de'ika devash." English translation: "Come and hear: One may spread a cucumber over a beehive on Shabbat, in the sun - because of the sun, and in the rain - because of the rain, as long as one does not intend to trap! There, too, there is honey."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב עוּקְבָא מִמֵּישָׁן לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הָתִינַח בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה, דְּאִיכָּא דְּבַשׁ. בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לְאוֹתָן שְׁתֵּי חַלּוֹת. אוֹתָן שְׁתֵּי חַלּוֹת מוּקְצוֹת הֵן! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — שֶׁחִשֵּׁב עֲלֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Rav Ukva from Meishan said to Rav Ashi: well with the summer, when there is honey, in the rainy season, what can be said? is necessary only for those two honeycombs Are those two honeycombs muktze , With what are we dealing here? when had in mind them
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ukva from Meishan to Rav Ashi: "It is beneficial in the days of the sun, when there is honey. In the days of rain, what is there to say? It is necessary only for those two loaves. Those two loaves are designated! What are we dealing with here - that he thought about them."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לֹא חִשֵּׁב עֲלֵיהֶם מַאי — אָסוּר? אַדְּתָנֵי וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִתְכַּוֵּין לָצוּד, לִפְלוֹג וְלִתְנֵי בְּדִידַהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — שֶׁחִשֵּׁב עֲלֵיהֶן, אֲבָל לֹא חִשֵּׁב עֲלֵיהֶם — אָסוּר!
human_translation: But if he did not have in mind them what prohibited rather than teaching: As long as he does not have the intent to trap let it make a distinction within the case itself In what is this statement said, When he had in mind but he did not have in mind them, it is prohibited.
llm_translation: But he did not intend for them, what - forbidden? It was taught: And only if he did not intend to trap, to differentiate and to say in its own right: In what case are these words said - that he intended for them, but if he did not intend for them - it is forbidden!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁחִשֵּׁב עֲלֵיהֶן — וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִתְכַּוֵּין לָצוּד.
human_translation: This is what is saying: Even if he had in mind provided he does not have intent to trap
llm_translation: So it is stated: Even though one intends for them - provided that he does not intend to trap.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי אוֹקֵימְתָּא — כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאִית לֵיהּ מוּקְצֶה? אֵימָא סֵיפָא: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִתְכַּוֵּין לָצוּד — אֲתָאן לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר: דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין מוּתָּר!
human_translation: In what did you establish In accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who, holds muktze say the latter clause Provided he does not have the intent to trap. we have come to Rabbi Shimon, said: An unintentional act is permitted
llm_translation: With what may one establish a vessel — like Rabbi Yehuda, who holds that it has a designated purpose? Say the latter part: "And as long as one does not intend to trap an animal — it is permitted," which comes according to Rabbi Shimon, who said: "An unintended act is permitted!"

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? וְהָא אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בִּפְסִיק רֵישֵׁיהּ וְלָא יְמוּת!
human_translation: And you understand of Rabbi Shimon But didn’t Abaye and Rava both say: Rabbi Shimon concedes in Cut off its head and will it not die?
llm_translation: And was it thought by Rabbi Shimon? But Abaye and Rava both said: Rabbi Shimon concedes in a case of p'sik reishei, and he will not die!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם כּוּלַּהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — דְּאִית בֵּיהּ כַּוֵּי. וְלָא תֵּימָא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִתְכַּוֵּין לָצוּד,
human_translation: actually all of Rabbi Yehuda, and with what are we dealing here? that has windows, And you not say, according to Rabbi Yehuda: Provided he does not have intent to trap
llm_translation: Always the entirety Rabbi Yehuda she, and here with what we are dealing — that there is in it a flaw. And do not say to Rabbi Yehuda, and only that he did not intend to hunt.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲשֶׂנָּה מְצוּדָה. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: בְּמִינוֹ נִצּוֹד — אָסוּר, שֶׁלֹּא בְּמִינוֹ נִצּוֹד — מוּתָּר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: but rather say Provided he does not make it a trap obvious Lest you say: whose type is trapped prohibited whose type is not trapped, permitted teaches us
llm_translation: Rather say: And only that he shall not make it into a trap. Obvious! What might you say: If he traps it with its own species — forbidden, if he traps it not with its own species — permitted, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מִי קָתָנֵי בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה וּבִימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים? בַּחַמָּה מִפְּנֵי הַחַמָּה וּבַגְּשָׁמִים מִפְּנֵי הַגְּשָׁמִים קָתָנֵי — בְּיוֹמֵי נִיסָן וּבְיוֹמֵי תִשְׁרֵי, דְּאִיכָּא חַמָּה, וְאִיכָּא גְּשָׁמִים, וְאִיכָּא דְּבַשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said Is it taught In the summer, and: In the rainy season? it is taught: In the sun due to the sun and in the rain due to the rain. of the days of Nisan and the days of Tishrei, when there is sun and there is rain, and there is honey
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Who is the one who is small in the days of the sun and in the days of the rain? In the sun, because of the sun, and in the rain, because of the rain, he is small - in the days of Nissan and in the days of Tishrei, where there is sun, and there is rain, and there is honey.

hebrew_text: וְנוֹתְנִין כְּלִי תַּחַת הַדֶּלֶף בְּשַׁבָּת. תָּנָא: אִם נִתְמַלֵּא הַכְּלִי — שׁוֹפֵךְ וְשׁוֹנֶה, וְאֵינוֹ נִמְנָע.
human_translation: And one may place a vessel beneath a leak on Shabbat. taught If the vessel became full he may pour out and repeat and not refrain
llm_translation: And we place a vessel underneath the drip on Shabbat. It was taught: If the vessel becomes filled - one may pour out and use, and it does not prevent one from doing so.

hebrew_text: בֵּי רִחְיָא דְּאַבָּיֵי דְּלוּף. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּה, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל עַיְּילֵיהּ לְפוּרְיָךְ לְהָתָם, דְּלֶהֱוֵי כִּגְרָף שֶׁל רְעִי, וְאַפְּקֵיהּ.
human_translation: Abaye’s millhouse developed a leak came before Rabba said to him: Go bring your bed into so that will be like a container of excrement, and remove
llm_translation: House of Rechya of Abbaye of Luf. Came before Rabba, said to him: Go take for yourself a shovel to go there, that it should be like the foot of a shepherd, and dig it up.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב אַבָּיֵי וְקָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ: וְכִי עוֹשִׂין גְּרָף שֶׁל רְעִי לְכַתְּחִלָּה? אַדְּהָכִי נְפַל בֵּי רִחְיָא דְאַבָּיֵי. אָמַר: תֵּיתֵי לִי דַּעֲבַרִי אַדְּמַר.
human_translation: Abaye sat and posed a difficulty: And may one initiate a container of excrement, ab initio ? In the meantime, Abaye’s millhouse collapsed. He said: I had coming to me for having gone against the words of my master,
llm_translation: Abbaye was sitting and he asked a question: "Do we make a 'geraf' of a friend initially?" Meanwhile, the house of Rechaya, Abbaye's father, collapsed. He said: "Bring me the 'daavari' that I said."

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: גְּרָף שֶׁל רְעִי וְעָבִיט שֶׁל מֵימֵי רַגְלַיִם — מוּתָּר לְהוֹצִיאָן לָאַשְׁפָּה, וּכְשֶׁהוּא מַחְזִירוֹ — נוֹתֵן בּוֹ מַיִם וּמַחְזִירוֹ.
human_translation: Shmuel said: a container of excrement and a container of urine, it is permitted to remove them to a garbage heap. And when he returns he must place water in it and return it,
llm_translation: Samuel said: A clod of dirt from a friend and a clod of dirt from the waters of the feet - it is permitted to take them out to the garbage dump, and when one returns it - one should put water in it and return it.

hebrew_text: סְבוּר מִינַּהּ: גְּרָף שֶׁל רְעִי, אַגַּב מָנָא — אִין, בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ — לָא. תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּהָהוּא עַכְבַּרְתָּא דְּאִשְׁתְּכַח בֵּי אִסְפַּרְמָקֵי דְּרַב אָשֵׁי. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב אָשֵׁי: נִקְטֻהּ בְּצוּצִיתֵהּ וְאַפְּקוּהּ.
human_translation: understood from a container of excrement on account of the vessel, Yes, by itself, No, Come hear that a certain mouse was discovered in Rav Ashi’s storeroom spices isparmekei Rav Ashi said to them: Take hold of it by its tail and remove it.
llm_translation: He thought from it: a claw of a lion, according to Mana — no, by itself — yes. Come and hear: that mouse that was found in the granary of Rav Ashi. Rav Ashi said to them: take it by its tail and remove it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת, מִשּׁוּם רְשׁוּת, מִשּׁוּם מִצְוָה, בְּשַׁבָּת — חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: Any act for which one is liable due to a rabbinic decree rest [ shevut ]; because it is optional, because it is mitzva, on Shabbat, one is liable for it on a Festival
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Anyone who is obligated due to a prohibition, due to permission, due to a commandment, on Shabbat - they are obligated on a festival.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת: לֹא עוֹלִין בָּאִילָן, וְלֹא רוֹכְבִין עַל גַּבֵּי בְּהֵמָה, וְלֹא שָׁטִין עַל פְּנֵי הַמַּיִם, וְלֹא מְטַפְּחִין וְלֹא מְסַפְּקִין וְלֹא מְרַקְּדִין.
human_translation: And these are as shevut : One may not climb a tree nor ride on an animal, nor swim in the water, nor clap nor clap thigh, nor dance.
llm_translation: And these are the things prohibited due to the Rabbinic decree: one may not ascend a tree, nor ride on the back of an animal, nor swim in the water, nor clap, nor snap, nor dance.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן מִשּׁוּם רְשׁוּת: לֹא דָּנִין, וְלֹא מְקַדְּשִׁין, וְלֹא חוֹלְצִין, וְלֹא מְיַבְּמִין.
human_translation: And the following because they are optional, One may not judge, nor betroth nor perform ḥalitza , nor perform levirate marriage.
llm_translation: And these are the things that are considered as a matter of permission: they do not judge, and they do not sanctify, and they do not divorce, and they do not perform levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן מִשּׁוּם מִצְוָה: לֹא מַקְדִּישִׁין, וְלֹא מַעֲרִיכִין, וְלֹא מַחֲרִימִין, וְלֹא מַגְבִּיהִין תְּרוּמָה וּמַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: And the following because of the mitzva One may not consecrate, nor take a valuation vow nor consecrate nor separate teruma and tithes
llm_translation: And these are the things that are prohibited because of a commandment: not sanctifying, not appraising, not anathematizing, not elevating terumah and tithes.

hebrew_text: כׇּל אֵלּוּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב אָמְרוּ, קַל וָחוֹמֶר בַּשַּׁבָּת. אֵין בֵּין יוֹם טוֹב לַשַּׁבָּת אֶלָּא אוֹכֶל נֶפֶשׁ בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: spoke all these with regard to a Festival; all the more so on Shabbat. There is no between a Festival and Shabbat, except for food alone,
llm_translation: All these on a festival they said, a fortiori on Shabbat. There is no difference between a festival and Shabbat except for food preparation alone.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לֹא עוֹלִין בָּאִילָן — גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יִתְלוֹשׁ.
human_translation: One may not climb a tree. a decree lest one detach
llm_translation: "Gema' do not ascend the tree - a decree lest it be uprooted."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא רוֹכְבִין עַל גַּבֵּי בְּהֵמָה — גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יֵצֵא חוּץ לַתְּחוּם. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תְּחוּמִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא! אֶלָּא: גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יַחְתּוֹךְ זְמוֹרָה.
human_translation: Nor ride on an animal: a decree lest one go beyond the limit learn from here the limits, is by Torah law? Rather, a decree lest one cut off a branch
llm_translation: And not riding on the back of an animal — a decree lest one go outside the boundary. Hear from it the boundary of the Torah! Rather: a decree lest the strap tear.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא שָׁטִין עַל פְּנֵי הַמַּיִם — גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יַעֲשֶׂה חָבִית שֶׁל שַׁיָּיטִין.
human_translation: Nor swim in the water: a decree lest one make a swimmer’s barrel,
llm_translation: "And one may not swim on the surface of the water - this is a decree lest one make a raft of reeds."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא מְטַפְּחִין וְלֹא מְסַפְּקִין וְלֹא מְרַקְּדִין — גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יְתַקֵּן כְּלֵי שִׁיר.
human_translation: Nor clap nor clap his hand on the thigh, nor dance: a decree lest one fashion a musical instrument
llm_translation: "And not clap, and not strike, and not dance - a decree lest one might come to fix musical instruments."

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן מִשּׁוּם רְשׁוּת: לֹא דָּנִין. וְהָא מִצְוָה קָעָבֵיד! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאִיכָּא דַּעֲדִיף מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And the following because they are optional, One may not judge. But doesn’t one perform mitzva No, necessary where there is who is more than he.
llm_translation: And these are the cases of Reshut: they do not judge. But isn't there a mitzvah that is highly esteemed! It is not necessary, for there is one that is superior to it.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא מְקַדְּשִׁין. וְהָא מִצְוָה קָעָבֵיד! לָא צְרִיכָא,
human_translation: Nor betroth But doesn’t one perform a mitzva No, necessary
llm_translation: "And not sanctifying. And this, the commandment is honored! Not necessary,"

hebrew_text: דְּאִית לֵיהּ אִשָּׁה וּבָנִים.
human_translation: because he has a wife and children,
llm_translation: There is to him a wife and children.

hebrew_text: לֹא חוֹלְצִין וְלֹא מְיַבְּמִין. וְהָא מִצְוָה קָא עָבֵיד! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאִיכָּא גָּדוֹל, וּמִצְוָה בַּגָּדוֹל לְיַבֵּם.
human_translation: Nor perform ḥalitza , nor perform levirate marriage: But doesn’t one perform a mitzva No, necessary when there is an older the mitzva is for the oldest to perform levirate marriage,
llm_translation: Not divorce and not perform levirate marriage. But isn't he fulfilling a commandment! It is not necessary, because there is an adult, and the commandment is incumbent upon the adult to perform levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: וְכֻלְּהוּ טַעְמָא מַאי — גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא יִכְתּוֹב.
human_translation: And all these what is the reason a decree lest one write
llm_translation: And all of them, what is the reason? — A decree lest it be written.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן מִשּׁוּם מִצְוָה: לֹא מַקְדִּישִׁין וְלֹא מַעֲרִיכִין וְלֹא מַחֲרִימִין — גְּזֵרָה מִשּׁוּם מִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר.
human_translation: And the following because of the mitzva One may not consecrate, nor take a valuation vow, nor consecrate a decree due to commerce.
llm_translation: And these are cases due to fulfilling a commandment: when they do not sanctify, and they do not appraise, and they do not place under a ban — this is a decree due to the laws of buying and selling.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא מַגְבִּיהִין תְּרוּמוֹת וּמַעַשְׂרוֹת. פְּשִׁיטָא! תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לִיתְּנָהּ לְכֹהֵן בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: And one may not separate terumot and tithes. obvious Rav Yosef taught: It is necessary only to give it to a priest on the same day.
llm_translation: And not they lift up tithes and tithes. Obviously! It was taught by Rav Yosef: It is only necessary to give it to the priest in it on the day.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי פֵּירֵי דִּטְבִילִי מֵאֶתְמוֹל, אֲבָל פֵּירֵי דִּטְבִילִי הָאִידָּנָא, כְּגוֹן עִיסָּה לְאַפְרוֹשֵׁי מִינַּהּ חַלָּה — מַפְרְשִׁינַן וְיָהֲבִינַן לְכֹהֵן.
human_translation: And this applies only to produce that untithed produce, the day before However, produce that became untithed now such as dough separating ḥalla from it, one may separate and give to a priest
llm_translation: These are the matters of produce that were immersed from yesterday, but produce that was immersed today, such as dough for separating its tithe - we explain and give to the priest.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי, מִשּׁוּם רְשׁוּת אִיכָּא, מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת לֵיכָּא? וְהָנֵי, מִשּׁוּם מִצְוָה אִיכָּא, מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת לֵיכָּא?
human_translation: those because they are optional, not because rabbinic decree rest [ shevut ]? those because they are mitzvot, not because of shevut ?
llm_translation: These, because of permission, is there, because of prohibition, is there? And these, because of commandment, is there, because of prohibition, is there?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק, לָא מִבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִבַּעְיָא שְׁבוּת גְּרֵידְתָּא דְּאָסוּר, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ שְׁבוּת דִּרְשׁוּת נָמֵי אָסוּר. וְלָא מִבַּעְיָא שְׁבוּת דִּרְשׁוּת דְּאָסוּר, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ שְׁבוּת דְּמִצְוָה נָמֵי אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: is speaking There is no need, there is no need plain shevut , is prohibited, but even shevut of an optional act, is also prohibited. And there is no need shevut of an optional act is prohibited, but even shevut of mitzva is also prohibited.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said, not from a question is he saying: not from a question is the rest of a roof of a fence forbidden, rather even the rest of a proper fence is also forbidden. And not from a question is the rest of a proper fence forbidden, rather even the rest of a commandment fence is also forbidden.

hebrew_text: כׇּל אֵלּוּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב אָמְרוּ, וּרְמִינְהוּ: מַשִּׁילִין דֶּרֶךְ אֲרוּבָּה בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אֲבָל לֹא בְּשַׁבָּת!
human_translation: spoke all these with regard to a Festival; raises a contradiction One may lower through a skylight on a Festival, but not on Shabbat.
llm_translation: All these laws were said on a festival day, and they raised a contradiction: We may spread a path with an eruv on a festival day, but not on Shabbat!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, הָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: not difficult, this Rabbi Eliezer, that Rabbi Yehoshua.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said, not difficult: this is Rabbi Eliezer, this is Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לְבוֹר — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מַעֲלֶה אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן עַל מְנָת לְשׁוֹחְטוֹ וְשׁוֹחֲטוֹ, וְהַשֵּׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה לוֹ פַּרְנָסָה בִּמְקוֹמוֹ כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יָמוּת.
human_translation: As it is taught it and its offspring fell into a pit Rabbi Eliezer says: One may raise the first in order to slaughter it and slaughter it, and the second, he provides it sustenance in its place so that it will not die
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: That one and his son who fell into a pit - Rabbi Eliezer says: He should raise the first one in order to slaughter him, and slaughter him, and the second one should provide him with sustenance in his place so that he does not die.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: מַעֲלֶה אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹן עַל מְנָת לְשׁוֹחְטוֹ וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹחֲטוֹ, וְחוֹזֵר וּמַעֲרִים וּמַעֲלֶה הַשֵּׁנִי. רָצָה — זֶה שׁוֹחֵט, רָצָה — זֶה שׁוֹחֵט.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua, says: One may raise the first with the intent of slaughtering it and not slaughter it. Then he may go back and employ artifice and he raises the second. if he desires he may slaughter this if he desires he may slaughter that
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: One raises the first in order to slaughter it and does not slaughter it, then goes back and raises the second. If he wishes - this one slaughters, if he wishes - this one slaughters.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִמַּאי? דִּילְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הָתָם, אֶלָּא דְּאֶפְשָׁר בְּפַרְנָסָה, אֲבָל הָכָא דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר בְּפַרְנָסָה — לָא!
human_translation: Abaye said to From where Perhaps Rabbi Eliezer stated only thus far, there where it is possible to sustain But here, no possibility through providing sustenance, not
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: From what? Perhaps until here Rabbi Eliezer did not say, but that it is possible with sustenance, but here where it is not possible with sustenance - no!

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הָתָם, אֶלָּא דְּאֶפְשָׁר לְאַעֲרוֹמֵי. אֲבָל הָכָא דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר לְאַעֲרוֹמֵי — לָא.
human_translation: Alternatively, Rabbi Yehoshua stated only thus far, there because it is possible to employ artifice But here, where it is not possible to employ artifice, not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Iy nama: ad kan lo ka'amar Rabbi Yehoshua hataam, ela de'afshar le'a'aromei. Aval hacha de'lo efshar le'a'aromei - lo." English translation: "If you say 'perhaps,' Rabbi Yehoshua did not say that there, but rather that it is possible to be naked. But here, where it is not possible to be naked - no."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, הָא בֵּית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa said: not difficult, this Beit Shammai, that Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Papa said, it is not difficult: this is the House of Shammai, and this is the House of Hillel.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מוֹצִיאִין לֹא אֶת הַקָּטָן וְלֹא אֶת הַלּוּלָב וְלֹא אֶת סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין.
human_translation: As we learned Beit Shammai say: one may not take out a child nor a lulav , nor a Torah scroll and Beit Hillel permit
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Beit Shammai say: One may not carry out neither the minor child, nor the lulav, nor the Torah scroll into the public domain, and Beit Hillel permit it.

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא לָא הִיא, עַד כָּאן לָא קָא אָמְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הָתָם, אֶלָּא אַהוֹצָאָה, אֲבָל אַטִּלְטוּל — לָא. אַטּוּ טִלְטוּל לָאו צוֹרֶךְ הוֹצָאָה הוּא?
human_translation: Perhaps that is not so, Beit Shammai stated only thus far, there transferring but not moving Is that to say moving is not for the sake of taking out
llm_translation: Perhaps it is not so, until here not did say Beit Shammai there, but ahotza'ah, but tiltiltul - no. Tiltiltul is not necessary for ahotza'ah?

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַבְּהֵמָה וְהַכֵּלִים כְּרַגְלֵי הַבְּעָלִים. הַמּוֹסֵר בְּהֶמְתּוֹ לִבְנוֹ אוֹ לָרוֹעֶה — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ כְּרַגְלֵי הַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: animals and vessels is as the feet of owner, one who delivers his animal to his son or to a shepherd these are as the feet of the owner,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: An animal and utensils are like the feet of their owner. One who entrusts his animal to his son or shepherd - these are like the feet of the owner.

hebrew_text: כֵּלִים הַמְיוּחָדִין לְאֶחָד מִן הָאַחִין שֶׁבַּבַּיִת — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ כְּרַגְלָיו. וְשֶׁאֵין מְיוּחָדִין — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ כִּמְקוֹם שֶׁהוֹלְכִין.
human_translation: Vessels that are designated for one of the brothers in the house these are as his feet, And that are not designated these are as a place where may go.
llm_translation: Utensils designated for one of the brothers in the house - these are like his feet. And if they are not designated - these are like a place where one walks.

hebrew_text: הַשּׁוֹאֵל כְּלִי מֵחֲבֵירוֹ מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — כְּרַגְלֵי הַשּׁוֹאֵל. בְּיוֹם טוֹב — כְּרַגְלֵי הַמַּשְׁאִיל. וְכֵן הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁשָּׁאֲלָה מֵחֲבֶרְתָּהּ תַּבְלִין וּמַיִם וָמֶלַח לְעִיסָּתָהּ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ כְּרַגְלֵי שְׁתֵּיהֶן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה פּוֹטֵר בַּמַּיִם, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: One who borrows a vessel from another on the eve of a Festival, as the feet of the borrower on the Festival as the feet of the lender, And similarly, a woman who borrowed spices from another or water and salt her dough, these are as the feet of both of them; Rabbi Yehuda exempts in the water, because it no substance
llm_translation: The one who borrows a utensil from his fellow on Erev Yom Tov — is like the one who borrows. On Yom Tov — is like the one who lowers. And so too, a woman who borrows from her friend spices, water, and salt for her dough — these are like the feet of both of them. Rabbi Yehuda exempts her in the case of water, because they do not contain substance.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַתְנִיתִין
human_translation: The mishna
llm_translation: Tractate: Gemara Masechet Matnitin

hebrew_text: דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי דּוֹסָא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי דּוֹסָא אוֹמֵר, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר, הַלּוֹקֵחַ בְּהֵמָה מֵחֲבֵרוֹ מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא מְסָרָהּ לוֹ אֶלָּא בְּיוֹם טוֹב — הֲרֵי הִיא כְּרַגְלֵי הַלּוֹקֵחַ. וְהַמּוֹסֵר בְּהֵמָה לָרוֹעֶה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא מְסָרָהּ לוֹ אֶלָּא בְּיוֹם טוֹב — הֲרֵי הִיא כְּרַגְלֵי הָרוֹעֶה.
human_translation: not in accordance with Rabbi Dosa. As it is taught Rabbi Dosa says, and some say Abba Shaul says: One who purchases an animal from another on the eve of a Festival, even if he did not deliver it to him until the Festival it is as the feet of the purchaser. And one who delivers his animal to a shepherd, even if he did not deliver it to him until the Festival it is as the feet of the shepherd.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Not like Rabbi Dosa, as it was taught: Rabbi Dosa says, and some say it was Abba Shaul who says, one who acquires an animal from his fellow on Erev Yom Tov, even though he did not hand it over to him except on Yom Tov, it is considered as if he acquired it with the feet of the seller. And one who hands over an animal to a shepherd on Yom Tov, even though he did not hand it over to him except on Yom Tov, it is considered as if he handed it over with the feet of the shepherd.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי דּוֹסָא, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּרוֹעֶה אֶחָד, כָּאן בִּשְׁנֵי רוֹעִים. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי דְּקָתָנֵי: לִבְנוֹ אוֹ לָרוֹעֶה, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: You even say Rabbi Dosa, and not difficult. Here, to one shepherd. There, to two shepherds. is also precise as it teaches: To his son or to a shepherd, learn from this
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Dosa, and it is not difficult: here with one shepherd, here with two shepherds. It is precisely as it was taught: whether to the builder or to the shepherd, the ruling is the same.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי דּוֹסָא. וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כִּסְתַם מִשְׁנָה, וּתְנַן: הַבְּהֵמָה וְהַכֵּלִים כְּרַגְלֵי הַבְּעָלִים!
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Dosa, And did Rabbi Yoḥanan say this? But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say the halakha follows an unattributed a mishna? And we learned Animals and vessels are as the feet of the owner.
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Dosa. And who said so? Didn't Rabbi Yoḥanan say: The halakha is in accordance with the anonymous Mishnah, and we learned: The animal and the vessels are like the feet of their owner!

hebrew_text: וְלָאו אוֹקֵימְנָא — כָּאן בְּרוֹעֶה אֶחָד, כָּאן בִּשְׁנֵי רוֹעִים!
human_translation: And did we not establish here with one shepherd, there with two shepherds?
llm_translation: "And not established - here with one shepherd, here with two shepherds!"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁשָּׁאֲלוּ חָלוּק אֶחָד בְּשׁוּתָּפוּת, זֶה לֵילֵךְ בּוֹ שַׁחֲרִית לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, וְזֶה לִיכָּנֵס בּוֹ עַרְבִית לְבֵית הַמִּשְׁתֶּה. זֶה עֵרַב עָלָיו לַצָּפוֹן, וְזֶה עֵרַב עָלָיו לַדָּרוֹם. זֶה שֶׁעֵרַב עָלָיו לַצָּפוֹן — מְהַלֵּךְ לַצָּפוֹן כְּרַגְלֵי מִי שֶׁעֵרַב עָלָיו לַדָּרוֹם.
human_translation: The Sages taught: two who borrowed one robe in partnership this to go to the study hall with it morning and that to enter feast with it evening, this one made a joining for himself to the north and that made an eiruv for himself to the south the one who made an eiruv for himself to the north may walk to the north as the feet of the one who made an eiruv for himself to the south,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Two individuals who jointly hired a worker, one of them to accompany him in the morning to the study hall, and the other to escort him in the evening to a banquet. One of them pledged for him to the north, and the other pledged for him to the south. One who pledged for him to the north - he walks to the north like the feet of one who pledged for him to the south.

hebrew_text: וָזֶה שֶׁעֵרַב עָלָיו לַדָּרוֹם — מְהַלֵּךְ לַדָּרוֹם כְּרַגְלֵי מִי שֶׁעֵרַב עָלָיו לַצָּפוֹן.
human_translation: And the one who made an eiruv for himself to the south may walk to the south as feet of the one who made an eiruv for himself to the north,
llm_translation: And this is the one that the south wind has mixed in with it - he walks to the south like the feet of the one that the north wind has mixed in with it.

hebrew_text: וְאִם מִצְּעוּ אֶת הַתְּחוּם — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יְזִיזֶנָּה מִמְּקוֹמָהּ.
human_translation: And if they made limits in the center, then each may not move from its place
llm_translation: And if they encroach upon the boundary - behold, this one shall not move it from its place.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁלָּקְחוּ חָבִית וּבְהֵמָה בְּשׁוּתָּפוּת, רַב אָמַר: חָבִית מוּתֶּרֶת וּבְהֵמָה אֲסוּרָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: חָבִית נָמֵי אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: It was said: two who purchased a barrel or an animal in partnership Rav said: barrel is permitted but animal is prohibited, And Shmuel said: barrel is also prohibited
llm_translation: It was stated: Two people who jointly took a barrel and an animal for use in partnership, Rav said: The barrel is permitted and the animal is forbidden. And Shmuel said: The barrel is also forbidden.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָסָבַר רַב? אִי קָא סָבַר יֵשׁ בְּרֵירָה — אֲפִילּוּ בְּהֵמָה תִּשְׁתְּרֵי! וְאִי קָסָבַר אֵין בְּרֵירָה — אֲפִילּוּ חָבִית נָמֵי אֲסוּרָה!
human_translation: What does Rav hold? If he holds there is designation, even animal should be permitted. And if he holds there is no designation, even barrel should be prohibited.
llm_translation: What does Rav hold? If he holds there is free choice - even an animal can be relied upon! And if he holds there is no free choice - even a barrel of water is also prohibited!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם קָסָבַר יֵשׁ בְּרֵירָה, וְשַׁנְיָא בְּהֵמָה — דְּקָא יָנְקִי תְּחוּמִין מֵהֲדָדֵי. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא וְרַב אַסִּי לְרַב: לְאִיסּוּר מוּקְצֶה לֹא חָשְׁשׁוּ, לְאִיסּוּר תְּחוּמִין חָשְׁשׁוּ?! שָׁתֵיק רַב.
human_translation: Actually, he holds there is designation, an animal is different, as limits absorb from each other. Rav Kahana and Rav Asi said to Rav: were not concerned about the prohibition of muktze , they were concerned about the prohibition of limits. Rav was silent
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Always he holds there is free choice, and a difference with an animal — for it sucks the boundaries from Hadadei. Rav Kahana and Rav Asi said to Rav: For a prohibition of a rejected item they did not worry, for a prohibition of boundaries they worried?! Rav remained silent."

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא אָמַר: יֵשׁ בְּרֵירָה. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵין בְּרֵירָה.
human_translation: What was about Rabbi Hoshaya said: there is designation, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: There is no designation,
llm_translation: What is the ruling? Rabbi Hoshaya said: There is free will. And Rabbi Yochanan said: There is no free will.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא יֵשׁ בְּרֵירָה? וְהָתְנַן: הַמֵּת בְּבַיִת, וְלוֹ פְּתָחִים הַרְבֵּה — כּוּלָּן טְמֵאִים. נִפְתַּח אֶחָד מֵהֶן — הוּא טָמֵא, וְכוּלָּן טְהוֹרִים. חִשֵּׁב לְהוֹצִיאוֹ בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן, אוֹ בַּחַלּוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ אַרְבָּעָה עַל אַרְבָּעָה — מַצֶּלֶת עַל הַפְּתָחִים כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: And does Rabbi Hoshaya hold there is designation? But didn’t we learn a corpse in a house that has many entrances, all are ritually impure, if one of them was opened, that is impure, while all the others are pure, one intended to remove through one of or through a window that is four by four saves all the entrances
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Hoshaya thought, is there free choice? And it was taught: If a dead body is in a house, and there are many doors – all of them are unclean. If one of them is opened – it is unclean, and all the others are clean. If he intended to take it out through one of them, or through a window that is four by four handbreadths – he covers all the doors.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: וְהוּא שֶׁחִשֵּׁב עָלָיו עַד שֶׁלֹּא יָמוּת הַמֵּת. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אַף מִשֶּׁיָּמוּת הַמֵּת.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: And this if he had this intention before the dead person died, And Beit Hillel say: even after the dead person died.
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: "And he the deceased is considered upon him the husband until the dead person does not die." And House of Hillel says: "Even after the dead person dies."

hebrew_text: וְאִתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא: לְטַהֵר אֶת הַפְּתָחִים מִכָּאן וּלְהַבָּא. מִכָּאן וּלְהַבָּא — אִין, לְמַפְרֵעַ — לָא.
human_translation: And it is stated with regard to this Rabbi Hoshaya said: to purify the entrances from that point and onward; From here and onward: Yes, retroactively: No.
llm_translation: "And it was taught: He ascended upon it, Rabbi Hoshaya said: to purify the entrances from here and onwards. From here and onwards - yes, to retract - no."

hebrew_text: אֵפוֹךְ, רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא אָמַר: אֵין בְּרֵירָה, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: יֵשׁ בְּרֵירָה.
human_translation: Reverse Rabbi Hoshaya said: There is no designation, and Rabbi Yoḥanan said: There is designation.
llm_translation: אֵפוֹךְ, Rabbi Hoshaya said: there is no free will, and Rabbi Yochanan said: there is free will.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בְּרֵירָה? וְהָאָמַר רַב אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָאַחִין שֶׁחָלְקוּ — לָקוֹחוֹת הֵן, וּמַחְזִירִין זֶה לָזֶה בַּיּוֹבֵל.
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yoḥanan accept designation? But didn’t Rav Asi say Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Brothers who divided are purchasers and they must return to each other in the Jubilee
llm_translation: "And is there for Rabbi Yochanan a choice? And Rav Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The brothers who divided - they are considered purchasers, and they return to each other in the Jubilee."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: כִּי לֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בְּרֵירָה — בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא, אֲבָל בִּדְרַבָּנַן — אִית לֵיהּ,
human_translation: And if you should say: When does Rabbi Yoḥanan not accept designation? in Torah law, he does hold in rabbinic law,
llm_translation: And if you will say: "Does Rabbi Yochanan hold of retroactive stipulation in matters of Torah law? But in matters of Rabbinic law, he does hold of it."

hebrew_text: וּבִדְרַבָּנַן מִי אִית לֵיהּ? וְהָתָנֵי אַיּוֹ —
human_translation: But does he accept in rabbinic law? Didn’t Ayo teach
llm_translation: And in the school of Rabbanan, who has it? And it was taught: Where is it?

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין אָדָם מַתְנֶה עַל שְׁנֵי דְּבָרִים כְּאֶחָד, אֶלָּא: אִם בָּא חָכָם לַמִּזְרָח — עֵירוּבוֹ לַמִּזְרָח, לַמַּעֲרָב — עֵירוּבוֹ לַמַּעֲרָב, וְאִילּוּ לְכָאן וּלְכָאן — לָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: A person may not make a stipulation with regard to two things at once, Rather, if the rabbi comes from the east his eiruv in the east from the west, his eiruv in the west However, here and there, not
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: A person cannot make an eruv for two things as one, rather: if a wise person comes to the east - his eruv is for the east, to the west - his eruv is for the west, but if for both here and there - no.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: מַאי שְׁנָא לְכָאן וּלְכָאן דְּלָא — דְּאֵין בְּרֵירָה, מִזְרָח וּמַעֲרָב נָמֵי אֵין בְּרֵירָה!
human_translation: And we discussed with regard to this What is different here and there, there is no designation. as well, east and west, there is no designation.
llm_translation: And we ask about it: What is the difference here and there that there is no - for there is no free choice, from east and west there is no free choice!

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וּכְבָר בָּא חָכָם. אַלְמָא: לֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בְּרֵירָה!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said rabbi had already arrived Apparently, Rabbi Yoḥanan does not accept designation
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: "And already a sage has come." This implies: Rabbi Yochanan does not have free choice!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: לְעוֹלָם לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ, וְכִי לֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא בְּרֵירָה — בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא, אֲבָל בִּדְרַבָּנַן — אִית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Actually, do not reverse And when does Rabbi Oshaya not hold designation? Torah But with regard to rabbinic he does accept
llm_translation: Rather: Always not overturn, and when not to Rabbi Oshaya son of Rava - in the Torah, but in the Rabbinic - has.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ מָר זוּטְרָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא.
human_translation: Mar Zutra taught in lesson: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Oshaya
llm_translation: Mar Zutra expounded: The halakha follows Rabbi Oshaya.
