hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שׁוֹר שֶׁל פַּטָּם — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּרַגְלֵי כׇּל אָדָם. שׁוֹר שֶׁל רוֹעֶה — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּרַגְלֵי אוֹתָהּ הָעִיר.
human_translation: Shmuel said: An ox of a fattener, is as the feet of all people. an ox of a shepherd, is as the feet of that city,
llm_translation: Samuel said: An ox of a butcher - behold it is like the feet of all people. An ox of a shepherd - behold it is like the feet of that city.

hebrew_text: הַשּׁוֹאֵל כְּלִי מֵחֲבֵירוֹ מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, שֶׁלֹּא מְסָרוֹ לוֹ אֶלָּא בְּיוֹם טוֹב. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לָאו בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ אוֹקְמֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: one who borrows a vessel from another on the eve of a Festival, obvious No, necessary where one did not deliver to him until the Festival Lest you say: did not establish it in possession teaches us
llm_translation: The one who borrows a utensil from his fellow on Erev Yom Tov. Obvious! Not necessary, for he only entrusted it to him on Yom Tov. What might you say: Isn't it without his permission that he established it? It is evident to us.

hebrew_text: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַשּׁוֹאֵל כְּלִי מֵחֲבֵירוֹ מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נְתָנוֹ לוֹ אֶלָּא בְּיוֹם טוֹב — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּרַגְלֵי הַשּׁוֹאֵל.
human_translation: supports Rabbi Yoḥanan, as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One who borrows a vessel from another on the eve of a Festival, even if he did not give it to him until the Festival it is as the feet of the borrower.
llm_translation: Assisting him to Rabbi Yochanan, as Rabbi Yochanan said: One who borrows a vessel from his fellow on Erev Yom Tov, even though it was given to him only on Yom Tov, is like the borrower's own feet.

hebrew_text: בְּיוֹם טוֹב — כְּרַגְלֵי הַמַּשְׁאִיל. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דִּרְגִיל וְשָׁאֵיל מִינֵּיהּ, מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ קָא מוֹקֵים לֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, מֵימָר אָמַר: דִּלְמָא מַשְׁכַּח אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא וְאָזֵיל וְשָׁאֵיל מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: on the Festival it is as the feet of the lender. obvious. No, necessary is accustomed to borrowing from Lest you say establishes it in his possession teaches us certainly says Perhaps he will find someone else and he will go and borrow from him.
llm_translation: On a festival day — like the feet of one who lends. It is obvious! It is not necessary, for he is accustomed to lend and borrow from him. What might you say: He establishes it in his domain, he is establishing it for us, as the saying goes: perhaps someone else will come and take it and go and borrow from him.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁשָּׁאֲלָה מֵחֲבֶרְתָּהּ. כִּי סְלֵיק רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר: יְהֵא רַעֲוָא דְּאֵימָא מִלְּתָא דְּתִתְקַבַּל. כִּי סְלֵיק, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פַּפִּי וְרַבִּי זֵירָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא, וְיָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי: אַמַּאי? וְלִבְטִיל מַיִם וָמֶלַח לְגַבֵּי עִיסָּה! אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי אַבָּא:
human_translation: And similarly, a woman who borrowed from another When Rabbi Abba ascended he said: May it be will that I say a statement that will be accepted When he ascended, Rabbi Yoḥanan, Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappi, and Rabbi Zeira, and some say Rabbi Abbahu, Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, and Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa, and were sitting and saying Why But let water and salt be nullified in the dough, Rabbi Abba said to them:
llm_translation: The woman who asked her friend. When Rabbi Abba went out, he said: Let the remedy that I will say be accepted. When he went out, he found it to Rabbi Yochanan, Rabbi Chanina bar Papi, and Rabbi Zeira, and they said to him: to Rabbi Avahu, Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, and Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha, and they were sitting and saying: Why? To nullify water and salt in dough! Rabbi Abba said to them:

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי שֶׁנִּתְעָרֵב לוֹ קַב חִטִּין בַּעֲשָׂרָה קַבִּין חִטִּין שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, יֹאכַל הַלָּה וְחָדֵי?! אַחִיכוּ עֲלֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: גּוּלְּתַיְכוּ שְׁקַלִי? הֲדוּר אַחִיכוּ עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: If kav of wheat became mingled with ten kav of another’s wheat, the latter eat and rejoice? laughed at him. He said to them: I take your cloaks They again laughed at him.
llm_translation: Behold, if he mixed in for himself a kab of wheat among ten kabs of wheat belonging to his friend, shall he eat the mixture and be exempt?! Your brother should be upon it. He said to them: Have you taken my portion? Your brother should dwell upon it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: שַׁפִּיר עֲבוּד דְּאַחִיכוּ עֲלֵיהּ. מַאי שְׁנָא חִטִּין בִּשְׂעוֹרִים דְּלָא קָאָמַר לְהוּ — דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ מִין בְּשֶׁאֵינוֹ מִינוֹ, וּמִין בְּשֶׁאֵינוֹ מִינוֹ — בָּטֵיל. חִטִּין בְּחִטִּין נָמֵי, נְהִי דִּלְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לֹא בָּטֵיל, לְרַבָּנַן מִבְטָל בָּטֵיל.
human_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said: They did well to laugh at him. What is different wheat with barley did not say to them because that is type with that is not its type. A type with not type becomes nullified, wheat with wheat as well. Although, according to Rabbi Yehuda, is not nullified, according to the Rabbis is certainly nullified.
llm_translation: Rav Oshaya said: The work of one's brother is pleasing to him. What is the difference between wheat in barley that he did not say to them? — Because it is a different species mixed with what is not its species, and a species mixed with what is not its species is nullified. Wheat in wheat, however, even according to Rabbi Yehuda is not nullified, but according to the Rabbis, it is nullified.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב סָפְרָא: מֹשֶׁה! שַׁפִּיר קָאָמְרַתְּ?! וְלָא שְׁמִיעַ לְהוּ הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא קְטוֹסְפָאָה מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: הַבּוֹרֵר צְרוֹרוֹת מִגׇּרְנוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵרוֹ — חַיָּיב לְשַׁלֵּם לוֹ דְּמֵי חִטִּים.
human_translation: Rav Safra said Moses! spoken well But, did not hear this that Rabbi Ḥiyya of Ketosfa’a said in the name of Rav: One who removes pebbles from another’s granary is obligated pay him the value of wheat
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Safra: Moses! You are saying well?! But did they not hear this that Rabbi Hiyya of Kafriah said in the name of Rav: One who sifts his friend's grain from his own throat - he is obligated to pay him the value of the wheat.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא: כַּיְלָא חַסְּרֵיהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי — כַּיְלָא חַסְּרֵיהּ.
human_translation: Apparently, he has reduced his measure Here, too, one has reduced his measure,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Alma: kayla chasreih. Hacha namei - kayla chasreih." English translation: "The world: its destruction. Here too - its destruction."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְלָא שָׁנֵי לֵיהּ לְמָר בֵּין מָמוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ תּוֹבְעִין לְמָמוֹן שֶׁאֵין לוֹ תּוֹבְעִין?
human_translation: Abaye said to And the master not differentiate between money that has claimants, and money that does not have claimants,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And not two to him to the master between money that there is to him they claim to money that there is not to him they claim?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, הָא דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: נְבֵלָה בְּטֵלָה בִּשְׁחוּטָה, לְפִי שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לַשְּׁחוּטָה שֶׁתֵּעָשֶׂה נְבֵלָה.
human_translation: said to him: And according to your reasoning, this Rav Ḥisda said: animal carcass can be nullified in a slaughtered because a slaughtered cannot attain the status of carcass,
llm_translation: He said to him: And according to your reasoning, this that Rav Ḥisda said: A carcass is annulled in its slaughter, because it is impossible for the slaughter to render it a carcass.

hebrew_text: שְׁחוּטָה אֵינָהּ בְּטֵלָה בִּנְבֵלָה, לְפִי שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לַנְּבֵלָה שֶׁתֵּעָשֶׂה שְׁחוּטָה.
human_translation: slaughtered is not nullified by the carcass, as it is possible for a carcass to attain the status of a slaughtered
llm_translation: Slaughter is not nullified in a carcass, because it is possible for the carcass to become slaughtered.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי דְּכִי אִית לַהּ בְּעָלִים — לָא בָּטְלָה? וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי — וְהָא תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי: חֶפְצֵי הֶפְקֵר קוֹנִין שְׁבִיתָה. אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם בְּעָלִים — דּוֹמִין כְּמִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם בְּעָלִים.
human_translation: Here, too, that if has owners it is not nullified And if you say: it is indeed so, but isn’t it taught: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said: Ownerless objects acquire residence although they have no owner, it is as though they have an owner?
llm_translation: Thus it was said: If it has owners — is it not nullified? And if you say thus it was said — but it was taught: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri said: Items of hefker acquire ownership through being placed under watch. Even though they have no owners — they are treated as if they have owners.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי קָא מְדַמֵּית אִיסּוּרָא לְמָמוֹנָא? אִיסּוּרָא — בָּטֵיל, מָמוֹנָא — לֹא בָּטֵיל.
human_translation: said to Are you comparing prohibitions, to monetary a prohibition, can be nullified, money cannot be nullified.
llm_translation: He said to him: Who equates prohibition with monetary matters? Prohibition - nullified, monetary matters - not nullified.

hebrew_text: וְטַעְמָא מַאי?
human_translation: And what is the reason
llm_translation: And the reason, what is it?

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא תַּעֲשֶׂה עִיסָּה בְּשׁוּתָּפוּת.
human_translation: Abaye said: a decree lest make dough in partnership
llm_translation: Abbaye said: A decree lest one come to make dough with a shutfut.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: תַּבְלִין לְטַעְמָא עֲבִידִי, וְטַעְמָא לָא בָּטֵיל.
human_translation: Rava said Spices are made to taste taste is not nullified,
llm_translation: Rava said: spices for taste are effective, and taste is not nullified.

hebrew_text: וְרַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי לֵיהּ דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין — אֲפִילּוּ בְּאֶלֶף לֹא בָּטֵיל.
human_translation: And Rav Ashi said because is an object whose prohibition is temporary, and anything whose prohibition is temporary cannot become nullified, even in one thousand.
llm_translation: And Rav Ashe said: Because it is a matter that has leniencies, and any matter that has leniencies - even with a thousand, it is not nullified.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה פּוֹטֵר בַּמַּיִם. מַיִם אִין, מֶלַח לָא? וְהָא תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מַיִם וָמֶלַח בְּטֵלִין בֵּין בָּעִיסָּה בֵּין בַּקְּדֵרָה! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּמֶלַח סְדוֹמִית, הָא — בְּמֶלַח אִסְתְּרוֹקָנִית.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda exempts in water. water, yes, salt, no, But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: Water and salt are nullified, whether in a dough or in a pot not difficult. this salt of Sodom, that to isterokanit salt.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda permits with water. If there is no water, is there not salt? But it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: Water and salt are nullified whether in the dough or in the pot! It is not difficult: here — with Sodomite salt, there — with Isteroqanite salt.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מַיִם וָמֶלַח בְּטֵלִין בָּעִיסָּה, וְאֵין בְּטֵלִין בַּקְּדֵרָה מִפְּנֵי רוֹטְבָּהּ! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּעָבָה, הָא — בְּרַכָּה.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: Water and salt are nullified in dough but not in a pot, due to its sauce. not difficult. This to a thick That to a thin
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: Water and salt nullify in a mixture, but they do not nullify in a pot because of its moisture! This is not difficult: here — in a thick mixture, here — in a thin mixture.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַגַּחֶלֶת כְּרַגְלֵי הַבְּעָלִים, וְשַׁלְהֶבֶת בְּכׇל מָקוֹם. גַּחֶלֶת שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ — מוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ, וְשַׁלְהֶבֶת — לֹא נֶהֱנִין, וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין. הַמּוֹצִיא גַּחֶלֶת לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — חַיָּיב, וְשַׁלְהֶבֶת — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: A coal as the feet of the owner, But a flame anywhere, a coal of consecrated property misuse But flame, one may not benefit he is not misuse, one who takes out a coal to the public domain liable a flame is exempt.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A coal is like the feet of its owner, and a flame is in every place. The coal of the Temple — one may benefit from it, but not from the flame. One who takes out a coal to a public domain is liable, but for a flame, one is exempt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים נֶאֶמְרוּ בַּגַּחֶלֶת: הַגַּחֶלֶת כְּרַגְלֵי הַבְּעָלִים, וְשַׁלְהֶבֶת בְּכׇל מָקוֹם. גַּחֶלֶת שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ — מוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ, וְשַׁלְהֶבֶת — לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין. גַּחֶלֶת שֶׁל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה — אֲסוּרָה, וְשַׁלְהֶבֶת — מוּתֶּרֶת. הַמּוֹצִיא גַּחֶלֶת לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — חַיָּיב, וְשַׁלְהֶבֶת — פָּטוּר. הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ — אָסוּר בְּגַחַלְתּוֹ, וּמוּתָּר בְּשַׁלְהַבְתּוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught Five things were stated with regard to a coal, (1) Coal is as the feet of the owner whereas a flame anywhere. (2) One misusing with a consecrated coal, whereas a flame, one may not benefit but he is not misusing (3) Coal idol worship is prohibited whereas a flame is permitted (4) One who carries out a coal to the public domain is liable, whereas a flame is exempt. (5) One who is prohibited by a vow benefit from another is prohibited from his coal, but permitted from his flame.
llm_translation: The sages taught: Five things were stated regarding a coal: The coal is like the feet of its owner, and the flame is in every place. A coal of the Temple — benefit is derived from it, and the flame — neither benefit nor detriment. A coal of idol worship — it is forbidden, and the flame — it is permitted. One who takes out a coal to a public domain — is liable, and the flame — is exempt. One who is prohibited benefit from his fellow — is forbidden with his coal, and permitted with his flame.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא שַׁלְהֶבֶת עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה דְּשַׁרְיָא, וּמַאי שְׁנָא דְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ דַּאֲסִירָא? עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, דִּמְאִיסָה וּבְדִילִי אִינָשֵׁי מִינַּהּ — לָא גְּזַרוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן. הֶקְדֵּשׁ, דְּלָא מְאִיס וְלָא בְּדִילִי אִינָשֵׁי מִינֵּיהּ — גְּזַרוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: What is different a flame idol worship, that permitted and what is different consecrated that prohibited idol worship, which is repulsive and from which people maintain separation, the Sages did not decree with regard to it. consecrated property, which is not repulsive and from which people do not maintain separation, the Sages did decree with regard to it
llm_translation: What is the difference between a flame of foreign worship that is permitted, and what is the difference with a consecrated item that is prohibited? A flame of foreign worship, because people despise it and separate themselves from it - the Rabbis did not decree against it. Consecrated items, because people do not despise it and do not separate themselves from it - the Rabbis decreed against it.

hebrew_text: הַמּוֹצִיא גַּחֶלֶת לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — חַיָּיב, וְשַׁלְהֶבֶת — פָּטוּר. וְהָא תַּנְיָא: הַמּוֹצִיא שַׁלְהֶבֶת כׇּל שֶׁהוּא — חַיָּיב! אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהוֹצִיאוֹ בְּקֵיסָם.
human_translation: one who carries out a coal to the public domain liable, whereas a flame is exempt. But isn’t taught One who carries out a flame of any size is liable? Rav Sheshet said: where one carried out with a wooden chip.
llm_translation: The one who takes out a coal to a public domain - liable, and a flame - exempt. And this was taught: the one who takes out a flame of any size - liable! Rav Sheshet said: for example, if he took it out in a spoon.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם קֵיסָם! בִּדְלֵית לֵיהּ שִׁעוּרָא. דִּתְנַן: הַמּוֹצִיא עֵצִים — כְּדֵי לְבַשֵּׁל בֵּיצָה קַלָּה.
human_translation: But let it derive due to wooden chip, that does not have the measure as we learned one who carries out wood enough to cook an egg easiest
llm_translation: And let it come out because of its hardness! You have separated from it the measure. For we learned: One who takes out wood — enough to cook a light egg.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: כְּגוֹן דְּשַׁיְיפֵיהּ [לְ]מָנָא מִשְׁחָא וְאַתְלִי בֵּיהּ נוּרָא. וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם מָנָא? בְּחַסְפָּא.
human_translation: Abaye said where one smeared a vessel with oil, and lit a fire on it, let it derive due to vessel to an earthenware
llm_translation: Abaye said: For example, if one dilutes wine with water and throws in some fire. And why does he do this with wine? Because of the heat.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם חַסְפָּא! בִּדְלֵית לֵיהּ שִׁעוּרָא. דִּתְנַן: חֶרֶס — כְּדֵי לִיתֵּן בֵּין פַּצִּים לַחֲבֵירוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And let it derive due to earthenware with that is not of measure as we learned earthenware enough to place between one frame and another, the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: And it should come out for him from the matter of Haspa! Because you did not separate for him a measurement. As we learned: A shard - in order to place between pieces for his fellow, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דִּתְנַן: הַמּוֹצִיא שַׁלְהֶבֶת פָּטוּר, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? כְּגוֹן דְּאַדְּיֵיהּ אַדּוֹיֵי לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: But that which we learned One who carries out a flame is exempt, what circumstances be found? where one fanned with his hand into the public domain
llm_translation: Rather, this that we learned: One who extinguishes a flame is exempt, how does one find support for this? For example, when he extinguishes it to a public domain.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בּוֹר שֶׁל יָחִיד — כְּרַגְלֵי הַיָּחִיד, וְשֶׁל אַנְשֵׁי אוֹתָהּ הָעִיר — כְּרַגְלֵי אַנְשֵׁי אוֹתָהּ הָעִיר, וְשֶׁל עוֹלֵי בָבֶל — כְּרַגְלֵי הַמְמַלֵּא.
human_translation: a cistern of an individual, is as the feet of the individual And the people a particular town is as the feet of the people of that town. And of those who come up from Babylonia, as the feet of whoever fills
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A pit belonging to an individual — like the feet of the individual; and one belonging to the people of that city — like the feet of the people of that city; and one belonging to the residents of Babylon — like the feet of those who fill it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רָמֵי לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן, תְּנַן: בּוֹר שֶׁל יָחִיד — כְּרַגְלֵי הַיָּחִיד, וּרְמִינְהוּ: נְהָרוֹת הַמּוֹשְׁכִין וּמַעֲיָנוֹת הַנּוֹבְעִין — הֲרֵי הֵן כְּרַגְלֵי כׇּל אָדָם! אָמַר (רָבָא): הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בִּמְכוּנָּסִין. וְאִתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בִּמְכוּנָּסִין.
human_translation: Rava raised a contradiction to Rav Naḥman: We learned a cistern of an individual is as the feet of the individual; and raised a contradiction flowing rivers and flowing springs are as the feet of all people. Rava said: With what are we dealing here With collected And it was also said Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin said Shmuel said: to collected
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara. Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: We learned in a Mishnah: A pit belonging to an individual — like the footprints of the individual. And we raised a dilemma: Rivers that flow and springs that bubble — behold, they are like the footprints of every person! Rava said: What are we dealing with here — with gatherings. And it was stated similarly, Rabbi Chiya bar Avin said in the name of Shmuel: With gatherings.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁל עוֹלֵי בָבֶל — כְּרַגְלֵי הַמְמַלֵּא. אִתְּמַר: מִילֵּא וְנָתַן לַחֲבֵירוֹ, רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: כְּרַגְלֵי מִי שֶׁנִּתְמַלְּאוּ לוֹ, רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: כְּרַגְלֵי הַמְמַלֵּא.
human_translation: And of those who come up from Babylonia, as the feet of whoever fills It was stated filled another and gave to Rav Naḥman said: as the feet of the one for whom they were filled; Rav Sheshet said: as the feet of the one who filled
llm_translation: And of the inhabitants of Babylon — like the feet of those who are full. It was stated: If one filled and gave to his fellow, Rav Nachman said: Like the feet of one who have been filled, Rav Sheshet said: Like the feet of those who are full.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: בֵּירָא דְהֶפְקֵרָא הוּא, וּמָר סָבַר: בֵּירָא דְשׁוּתָּפֵי הוּא.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? One Sage, holds cistern is ownerless, And one Sage, holds is by partners,
llm_translation: With what do they argue? One Master holds: it is a pit of hefker, and the other Master holds: it is a pit of partnership.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: הֲרֵינִי עָלֶיךָ חֵרֶם — הַמּוּדָּר אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rava raised a challenge to Rav Naḥman I am hereby to you ḥerem , the one prohibited by the vow, is prohibited
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: "Behold, I am upon you a ban - one who is vowed is forbidden."

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי אַתָּה עָלַי חֵרֶם — הַנּוֹדֵר אָסוּר. הֲרֵינִי עָלֶיךָ וְאַתָּה עָלַי — שְׁנֵיהֶם אֲסוּרִים זֶה בָּזֶה, וּמוּתָּרִין בְּשֶׁל עוֹלֵי בָבֶל, וַאֲסוּרִין בְּשֶׁל אוֹתָהּ הָעִיר.
human_translation: You are hereby to me ḥerem , the one making the vow is prohibited I am hereby to you you to me they are both prohibited from one another. And they are permitted to those who come up from Babylonia, but they are prohibited of that city,
llm_translation: Behold, you are under a ban upon me - one who vows is forbidden. Behold, I am upon you and you are upon me - both are forbidden to each other, and permitted to the rest of the Babylonians, and forbidden to the inhabitants of that city.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן דְּבָרִים שֶׁל עוֹלֵי בָבֶל: הַר הַבַּיִת, הַלְּשָׁכוֹת וְהָעֲזָרוֹת, וּבוֹר שֶׁל אֶמְצַע הַדֶּרֶךְ. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן שֶׁל אוֹתָהּ הָעִיר: הָרְחוֹב, וּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, וּבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ.
human_translation: And the following are items of those coming up from Babylonia, The Temple Mount, the chambers, and the courtyards and a cistern in the middle of the road. And these are of that city: The street, and the synagogue, and the bathhouse.
llm_translation: These are the matters of the Babylonians: the Temple Mount, the chambers and the courtyards, and the pit of the middle of the road. And these are the matters of that city: the square, the synagogue, and the bathhouse.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ בֵּירָא דְשׁוּתָּפֵי הוּא, אַמַּאי מוּתָּר? וְהָתְנַן: הַשּׁוּתָּפִין שֶׁנָּדְרוּ הֲנָאָה זֶה מִזֶּה — אֲסוּרִים לִיכָּנֵס לֶחָצֵר לִרְחוֹץ בַּבּוֹר!
human_translation: And if you say a cistern is by partners, why permitted But didn’t we learn partners who took a vow benefit from one another are prohibited to enter courtyard to wash in a cistern
llm_translation: If you say it is the pit of Shutfay, why is it permitted? But we learned: Shutfayim who took pleasure from one another - they are forbidden to enter the courtyard to bathe in the pit!

hebrew_text: לִרְחוֹץ הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — לְמַלּאוֹת, מָר מִדִּידֵיהּ קָא מְמַלֵּא וּמַר מִדִּידֵיהּ קָא מְמַלֵּא.
human_translation: So too, to wash But with what are we dealing here? to filling this one fills from his and that one fills from his
llm_translation: To wash, thus it is stated, and here with what are we dealing? - To fill it, the master is filling from his own, and the master is filling from his own.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַב נַחְמָן יֵשׁ בְּרֵירָה? וְהָתְנַן: הָאַחִין הַשּׁוּתָּפִין, כְּשֶׁחַיָּיבִין בַּקָּלְבּוֹן — פְּטוּרִין מִמַּעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: And does Rav Naḥman hold there is designation? But didn’t we learn brothers partners, they are obligated to a kalbon , are exempt from animal tithe,
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman thought: Is there free choice? And it was taught: Brothers who are partners, when they are obligated in the calf - they are exempt from tithing on livestock.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁחַיָּיבִין בְּמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה — פְּטוּרִין מִן הַקָּלְבּוֹן.
human_translation: And liable for the animal tithe, they are exempt from the kalbon ,
llm_translation: And when obligated in tithe in animal - exempt from the penalty.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב עָנָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁחָלְקוּ גְּדָיִם כְּנֶגֶד טְלָאִים וּטְלָאִים כְּנֶגֶד גְּדָיִם.
human_translation: And Rav Anan said: taught only when they divided kids against lambs or lambs against kids,
llm_translation: And Rav Anan said: They only taught that they divided the kid goats opposite the lambs, and the lambs opposite the kid goats.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל חָלְקוּ גְּדָיִם כְּנֶגֶד גְּדָיִם וּטְלָאִים כְּנֶגֶד טְלָאִים, אוֹמֵר: זֶהוּ חֶלְקוֹ הַמַּגִּיעוֹ מִשָּׁעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה לְכָךְ.
human_translation: However, they divided kids against kids and lambs against lambs, say This is his portion reach him from the first moment,
llm_translation: But divided goats against goats and lambs against lambs, says: this is his portion who arrives from the first hour for this.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ חָלְקוּ גְּדָיִם כְּנֶגֶד גְּדָיִם וּטְלָאִים כְּנֶגֶד טְלָאִים — אֵין אוֹמֵר: זֶה חֶלְקוֹ הַמַּגִּיעוֹ מִשָּׁעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה לְכָךְ.
human_translation: But Rav Naḥman said: Even if they divided kids against kids and lambs against lambs, not say this is his portion reach him from the first moment.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Even if they divided the goats corresponding to goats and the lambs corresponding to lambs - one does not say: this is his portion that arrived from the first hour for this.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בֵּירָא דְהֶפְקֵרָא הִיא, אֶלָּא הָכָא בְּמַגְבִּיהַּ מְצִיאָה לַחֲבֵירוֹ קָא מִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: קָנָה, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא קָנָה.
human_translation: Rather, everyone agrees is an ownerless cistern, but here they disagree over One who picks up a found article on behalf of his friend. Sage, holds acquires And Sage, holds does not acquire it.
llm_translation: Rather, the entire world is like a courtyard that is ownerless, but here in the case of one who finds an object and gives it to his fellow, they are in disagreement. One Master holds: he acquired it, and the other Master holds: he did not acquire it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁהָיוּ פֵּירוֹתָיו בְּעִיר אַחֶרֶת וְעֵרְבוּ בְּנֵי אוֹתָהּ הָעִיר לְהָבִיא אֶצְלוֹ מִפֵּירוֹתָיו — לֹא יָבִיאוּ לוֹ. וְאִם עֵרַב הוּא — פֵּירוֹתָיו כָּמוֹהוּ.
human_translation: one who had produce in a different city and the residents of that city to bring him some of his produce, they may not bring to him. However, if placed an eiruv his produce is like his
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One whose fruits are in another city, and the residents of that city mixed in with his fruits, they should not bring them to him. But if he is a guarantor, his fruits are like his own.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁזִּמֵּן אֶצְלוֹ אוֹרְחִים — לֹא יוֹלִיכוּ בְּיָדָם מָנוֹת, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן זִכָּה לָהֶם מָנוֹתֵיהֶם מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: one who invited guests to him they may not carry in their hands portions unless he transferred ownership of their portions to them on the eve of the Festival,
llm_translation: One who appointed guests with him - they shall not bring in their hands portions, unless they merited their portions from the eve of the festival.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִתְּמַר: הַמַּפְקִיד פֵּירוֹת אֵצֶל חֲבֵירוֹ — רַב אָמַר: כְּרַגְלֵי מִי שֶׁהִפְקִידוּ לוֹ, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: כְּרַגְלֵי הַמַּפְקִיד. לֵימָא רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָזְדוּ לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ, דִּתְנַן: אִם הִכְנִיס בִּרְשׁוּת — בַּעַל הֶחָצֵר חַיָּיב. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיְּקַבֵּל עָלָיו בַּעַל הַבַּיִת לִשְׁמוֹר.
human_translation: It is stated one who deposits produce with another Rav said: as the feet of the one with whom they were deposited. And Shmuel said: as the feet of the owner. Let us say Rav and Shmuel follow their reasoning, as we learned If brought in with permission, the owner of the courtyard is liable And Rabbi said: is never liable unless the homeowner accepts upon himself to watch
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara itmar: hamafkid peirot etzel chaveiro - Rav amar: ke'raglei mi shehipkidu lo, uShmuel amar: ke'raglei hamafkid. Leima Rav uShmuel de'azdu le'taamayehu, ditnan: im hichnis bireshut - baal hechatzer chayav. Rabbi omer: le'olam einu chayav ad sheyekabel alav baal habayit lishmor. English translation: It was stated in the Gemara: One who entrusts produce to his fellow - Rav said: Like the feet of the one to whom they were entrusted, and Shmuel said: Like the feet of the entruster. Let us say that Rav and Shmuel agreed to their reasoning, as we learned in a Mishnah: If one brought produce into a courtyard - the owner of the courtyard is liable. Rabbi says: One is not liable until the homeowner accepts upon himself to guard the produce.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי. לֵימָא רַב דְּאָמַר כְּרַבָּנַן וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי?
human_translation: And Rav Huna said Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis, that Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi let us say Rav spoke in accordance with the Rabbis, And Shmuel spoke in accordance with Rabbi
llm_translation: And Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: The halakha follows the words of the Sages, and Shmuel said: The halakha follows Rabbi. Let Rav be said, who said like Rabbanan, and Shmuel who said like Rabbi?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי — עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי הָתָם, אֶלָּא דְּבִסְתָמָא לָא קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ נְטִירוּתָא, אֲבָל הָכָא — הָא קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ נְטִירוּתָא.
human_translation: Rav said to you: I said even in accordance with Rabbi Rabbi stated only there, because in ordinary does not accept upon himself watching But here, has accepted upon himself of watching
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav: I, who said even to Rabbi - until here Rabbi did not say there, rather in general he did not accept upon himself the vow, but here - he did accept upon himself the vow.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבָּנַן — עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן הָתָם, אֶלָּא דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ לְאִינִישׁ דְּנֵיקוּם תּוֹרֵיהּ בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ דְּבַעַל חָצֵר, דְּאִי מַזֵּיק לֵיהּ — לָא מִיחַיַּיב. אֲבָל הָכָא — מִי נִיחָא לֵיהּ לְאִינִישׁ דְּלֵיקוּם פֵּירֵיהּ בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ דְּחַבְרֵיהּ?!
human_translation: And Shmuel said: I said even in accordance with the Rabbis, the Rabbis stated only there, because it is a person’s, preference that his ox be established in the jurisdiction of the owner of the courtyard, that if does damage will not be liable. But here, is it a person’s preference for his produce to be in another’s jurisdiction
llm_translation: Samuel said: I say, even according to the Rabbis — until here the Rabbis did not say there, rather it is preferable for a person to place his Torah in the possession of the owner of the courtyard, for if it causes damage to him, he is not liable. But here — is it preferable for a person to place his fruit in the possession of his friend?!

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: וְאִם עֵרַב הוּא — פֵּירוֹתָיו כָּמוֹהוּ. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ כְּרַגְלֵי מִי שֶׁהִפְקִידוּ אֶצְלוֹ, כִּי עֵרַב הוּא מַאי הָוֵי? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב: כְּגוֹן שֶׁיִּחֵד לוֹ קֶרֶן זָוִית.
human_translation: We learned However, if placed an eiruv , his produce is like his And if you say as the feet of the one with whom they were deposited, if placed an eiruv , what of it? Rav Huna said the school of Rav said where designated a corner for
llm_translation: We learned: And if it is a guarantor — its fruits are like it. And if you say, "Like the feet of the one they appointed with him," for what is it considered a guarantor? Rav Huna said, the students of Rav said: For example, when he designated for him a corner horn.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מִי שֶׁזִּמֵּן אֶצְלוֹ אוֹרְחִים — לֹא יוֹלִיכוּ בְּיָדָם מָנוֹת, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן זִכָּה לָהֶם מָנוֹתֵיהֶם מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ כְּרַגְלֵי מִי שֶׁהִפְקִידוֹ אֶצְלוֹ, כִּי זִכָּה לָהֶם עַל יְדֵי אַחֵר מַאי הָוֵי? הָכִי נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן שֶׁזִּכָּה לָהֶם עַל יְדֵי אַחֵר — כְּמִי שֶׁיִּחֵד לוֹ קֶרֶן זָוִית דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Come hear one who invited guests to him, they may not carry in their hands portions unless he transferred ownership of their portions to them on the eve of the Festival. And if you say as the feet of the one with whom they were deposited, if he transferred ownership to them by means of another what of it? Here too, since he transferred ownership to them by means of another it is considered as one who designated a corner for him,
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who appointed guests with him - they should not bring gifts in their hands, unless their gifts were prepared for them from the eve of a festival. And if you say, "Like the feet of one who was appointed with him, for if he prepared for them through someone else, what is the difference?" It is thus said: Since he prepared for them through someone else - it is like he united a corner of the altar with him.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: זִכָּה שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say transferring ownership is different
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "He acquired both."

hebrew_text: רַב חָנָא בַּר חֲנִילַאי תְּלָא בִּשְׂרָא בְּעִבְרָא דְּדַשָּׁא. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי אַתְּ תְּלֵית — זִיל שְׁקֵיל, וְאִי אִינְהוּ תְּלוֹ לָךְ — לָא תִּשְׁקוֹל.
human_translation: Rav Ḥana bar Ḥanilai hung meat on the bar of the door He came before Rav Huna said to him: If you hung go take it, but if hung for you, you may not take it.
llm_translation: Rav Hanah bar Hanilai hung meat in the courtyard of Dasha. He came before Rav Huna, who said to him: If you hung it, go take it down, but if they hung it for you, do not take it down.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִיהוּ תְּלָא מִי שָׁקֵיל? וְהָא רַב הוּנָא תַּלְמִיד דְּרַב הֲוָה, וְאָמַר רַב: כְּרַגְלֵי מִי שֶׁהִפְקִידוּ אֶצְלוֹ! שָׁאנֵי עִבְרָא דְּדָשָׁא, דִּכְמִי שֶׁיִּחֵד לוֹ קֶרֶן זָוִית דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And if he hung may he take But wasn’t Rav Huna Rav, and Rav said as the feet of the one with whom it was deposited, it is different, the bar of the door, is considered similar to one who designated a corner for him.
llm_translation: And if he is hanged, who takes him down? But Rav Huna was a disciple of Rav, and Rav said: Like the feet of one who has been entrusted to him! The case is different with a bundle of grass, for it is like one who has tied a corner of a horn for himself.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הִלֵּל לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְאִי אִינְהוּ תָּלוּ לֵיהּ לָא שָׁקֵיל? וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שׁוֹר שֶׁל פַּטָּם — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּרַגְלֵי כׇּל אָדָם.
human_translation: Rav Hillel said to Rav Ashi: And if they hung for him, may he not take But didn’t Shmuel say: An ox of a fattener, is as the feet of all people,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Hillel said to Rav Ashi: "And if they are not hanging it for him, does he not take it?" And Shmuel said: "An ox of a deaf-mute - behold, it is like the feet of all people."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְאִי אִינְהוּ תָּלוּ לֵיהּ לָא שָׁקֵיל? וְהָאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי דּוֹסָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב כָּהֲנָא: וְאִי אִינְהוּ תָּלוּ לֵיהּ לָא שָׁקֵיל? וְהָתְנַן: הַבְּהֵמָה וְהַכֵּלִים כְּרַגְלֵי הַבְּעָלִים!
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: And if hung for him, may he not take But didn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Dosa, Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana: And if they hung for him, may he not take But didn’t we learn animals and vessels is as the feet of owner?
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: "And if they do not hang it for him, does he not take it?" And didn't Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah say in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: The halakha is in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Dosa? Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana: "And if they do not hang it for him, does he not take it?" And as we learned in a Mishnah: "An animal and vessels are like the feet of their owner!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, שָׁאנֵי רַב חָנָא בַּר חֲנִילַאי — דְּגַבְרָא רַבָּה הוּא וּטְרִיד בִּשְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִי אַתְּ תְּלֵית, אִית לָךְ סִימָנָא בְּגַוֵּויהּ וְלָא מַסְּחַתְּ דַּעְתָּךְ מִנֵּיהּ, זִיל שְׁקוֹל. וְאִי אִינְהוּ תָּלוּ לָךְ, מַסְּחַתְּ דַּעְתָּךְ, וְלָא תִּשְׁקוֹל.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ḥana bar Ḥanilai is different as he is a great man and occupied with his studies, and this is what said to him: If you hung you mark on and your attention was not diverted from it, may go take However, if hung for you, you diverted your attention and you may not take
llm_translation: Rather, the case is different, as Rav Ḥana bar Ḥanilai is different— for he is a great man and he troubled himself with his studies, and thus he said to him: If you do not hang it, you have a distinguishing mark on your body, and your mind will not be distracted from it, go and weigh it. But if they hang it for you, your mind will be distracted, and you will not weigh it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין מַשְׁקִין וְשׁוֹחֲטִין אֶת הַמִּדְבָּרִיּוֹת, אֲבָל מַשְׁקִין וְשׁוֹחֲטִין אֶת הַבַּיָּיתוֹת. אֵלּוּ הֵן בַּיָּיתוֹת — הַלָּנוֹת בָּעִיר. מִדְבָּרִיּוֹת — הַלָּנוֹת בָּאֲפָר.
human_translation: one may not water and slaughter desert However, one may water and slaughter domestic These are domestic that sleep in the city Desert that sleep in the pasture
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not water or slaughter the desert animals, but one may water and slaughter the domestic animals. These are the domestic animals - those that graze in the city. Desert animals - those that graze in the wilderness.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְמָה לִי לְמֵימַר מַשְׁקִין וְשׁוֹחֲטִין? מִילְּתָא אַגַּב אוֹרְחֵיהּ קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּלַשְׁקֵי אִינָשׁ בְּהֶמְתּוֹ וַהֲדַר לִשְׁחוֹט, מִשּׁוּם סִרְכָא דְמַשְׁכָּא.
human_translation: Why, do I to say: One may water and slaughter? teaches us matter incidentally: That a person should water his animal and afterward slaughter due to the adhesion of the skin
llm_translation: Gemara: Why do I need to say that one may give water to drink and then slaughter? The matter is clear from his behavior, as people give water to their animal and then proceed to slaughter, due to the contraction of the windpipe.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵלּוּ הֵן מִדְבָּרִיּוֹת וְאֵלּוּ הֵן בַּיָּיתוֹת. מִדְבָּרִיּוֹת — כֹּל שֶׁיּוֹצְאוֹת בַּפֶּסַח וְרוֹעוֹת בָּאֲפָר, וְנִכְנָסוֹת בִּרְבִיעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן בַּיָּיתוֹת — כֹּל שֶׁיּוֹצְאוֹת וְרוֹעוֹת חוּץ לַתְּחוּם, וּבָאוֹת וְלָנוֹת בְּתוֹךְ הַתְּחוּם. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אֵלּוּ וְאֵלּוּ בַּיָּיתוֹת הֵן. אֶלָּא אֵלּוּ הֵן מִדְבָּרִיּוֹת  — כֹּל שֶׁיּוֹצְאוֹת וְרוֹעוֹת בָּאֲפָר, וְאֵין נִכְנָסוֹת לַיִּשּׁוּב, לֹא בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה וְלֹא בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught Which are desert and which are domestic ones? Desert all those that go out at Passover and graze in the pasture and enter at the first rainfall, And these are domestic All that go out and graze outside the boundary but come and sleep within the boundary Rabbi says: Both these and those are domestic Rather, these are desert animals All those that go out and graze in the pasture and do not enter the settled area, neither in the summer nor in the rainy season.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: These are the Midbariyot and these are the Bayitot. Midbariyot - anything that goes out on Passover and is grazed in the ashes, and enters the first quarter. And these are the Bayitot - anything that goes out and is grazed outside the boundary, and comes in and grazes within the boundary. Rabbi says: These and these are Bayitot. Rather, these are the Midbariyot - anything that goes out and is grazed in the ashes, and does not enter for return, neither in the days of the sun nor in the days of rain.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מוּקְצֶה? וְהָא בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר רַבִּי מֵרַבִּי: פַּצְעִילֵי תְמָרָה — לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין מוּקְצֶה לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן
human_translation: And does Rabbi accept muktze ? But didn’t Rabbi Shimon, son Rabbi inquire of Rabbi Unripe dates to ripen what is according to Rabbi Shimon He said to him There is no muktze according to Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And does Rabbi Muktzeh have it? And this, Rabbi Shimon the son of Rabbi from Rabbi asked him: 'Patzilei Temarha - to Rabbi Shimon, what is it?' He said to him: 'There is no Muktzeh for Rabbi Shimon.'"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא גְּרוֹגְרוֹת וְצִמּוּקִין בִּלְבַד!
human_translation: except for dried figs and raisins alone. These
llm_translation: Rather, g'rog'rot and zimmukin alone!

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָנֵי נָמֵי כִּגְרוֹגְרוֹת וְצִמּוּקִין דָּמֵי, וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לִדְבָרָיו דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן קָאָמַר, וְלֵיהּ לָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: If you wish, say these are also considered similar to dried figs and raisins, And if you wish, say he stated in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Shimon, he himself does not hold accordingly.
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Those coins are like dried figs and raisins, and if you wish, say: According to the words of Rabbi Shimon he said, but he does not agree with him.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְדִבְרֵיהֶם דְּרַבָּנַן קָאָמַר לְהוּ. לְדִידִי אֵין מוּקְצֶה, אֶלָּא לְדִידְכוּ: אוֹדוֹ לִי מִיהַת הֵיכָא דְּיוֹצְאוֹת וְרוֹעוֹת בַּפֶּסַח וְנִכְנָסוֹת בִּרְבִיעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה דְּבַיָּיתוֹת הֵן. וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: לָא, מִדְבָּרִיּוֹת הֵן.
human_translation: And if you wish, say he was speaking, in accordance with the words the Rabbis According to my there is no muktze But according to your approach, agree with me, in any event, where they go out and graze on Passover and enter again at the first rainfall, they are domestic animals But the Rabbis said to him: No, are desert animals.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In their words the Rabbis are saying to them. According to me, it is not a matter of Muktzeh, but according to you: Acknowledge to me from where do they go out and graze on Passover and enter the first quarter of the courtyards. And the Rabbis said to him: No, they are matters of words.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ מַשִּׁילִין פֵּירוֹת וּסְלִיקָא מַסֶּכֶת בֵּיצָה
llm_translation: We will return to you, we shall ask questions regarding the fruits and the upper part of the tractate Beitzah.
